Sense.DEF: the 12th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十二个字母

Sense.DEF: the number 50 in the system of roman numerals

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=large, used on clothes to show the size 大号〔服装尺码〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=lake, used on maps 湖〔用于地图〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=learner, used on cars to show that the driver is a learner 实习驾驶员〔用于汽车上〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=litre or 或 litres 升
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=line 行

Sense.DEF: the sixth note in a musical scale,according to the sol-fa system
a laboratory
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school science lab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的科学实验室

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Labour, in British politics〔英国〕工党

PIC.HEADING: LABELS 标签
PIC.PICCONTENT: label 地址标签；care label 洗涤标签；bar code label 条形码标签；luggage label 行李标签；label 产品标签；label 包裹标签

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a luggage label
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行李标签

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It says ‘Dry clean’ on the label.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 标签上写着“干洗”。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase which is used to describe a person, group, or thing, but which is unfair or not correct
Sense.TRAN: 〔不公平或不正确的〕称呼﹐叫法﹔外号﹐绰号
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men these days have to avoid attracting the ‘sexist’ label.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的男人得小心避免被扣上“性别歧视”的帽子。

Sense.DEF: a record company
Sense.EXAMPLE: their new release on the Ace Sounds label
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由Ace Sounds唱片公司为他们发行的新唱片

Sense.DEF: clothes made by fashionable companies
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fancy designer labels tend to come with fancy price tags to match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级的名牌服饰往往都挂着定价昂贵的价格标牌。

Sense.DEF: to attach a label onto something or write information on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Label the diagram clearly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把图表标示清楚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The file was labelled ‘Top Secret’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件上标明“绝密”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each bag of seeds is labelled with the grower’s name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每袋种子上都标明栽培者的姓名。

Sense.DEF: to use a word or phrase to describe someone or something, but often unfairly or incorrectly
Sense.TRAN: 把…不公正地称为﹐给…扣帽子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The newspapers had unjustly labelled him a troublemaker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报界不公正地给他扣上了闹事者的帽子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The unemployed are often unfairly labelled as lazy or unreliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业者常被不公正地扣上懒惰或不可信赖的帽子。

Sense.DEF: the outer parts of the female sex organ
a speech sound made using one or both lips
the American spelling of labour

PIC.HEADING: LABORATORY 实验室
PIC.PICCONTENT: pipette 移液管；stand 铁架台；microscope 显微镜；funnel 漏斗；flask 烧瓶；test tube rack 试管架；test tube 试管；dropper 滴管；syringe 注射器；plunger 活塞；tongs 钳；flame 火焰；Bunsen burner 本生灯；Petri dish 皮氏培养皿；mortar 研磨钵；pestle 研磨棒；beaker 烧杯

Sense.DEF: a special room or building in which a scientist does tests or prepares substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: a research laboratory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究实验室
Sense.EXAMPLE: tests on laboratory animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在实验室动物身上做的试验

Sense.DEF: a public holiday in the US on the first Monday in September
Sense.TRAN: 劳工节〔9月的第一个星期一﹐为美国的公众假日〕

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of laboured
the American spelling of labourer
taking a lot of time and effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Collecting the raw materials proved a long and laborious task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果证实采集原料是一项耗时费力的任务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the laborious business of drying the crops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A beetle began to crawl laboriously up his leg.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只甲虫开始费劲地顺着他的腿往上爬。

Sense.DEF: an organization that represents the ordinary workers in a particular trade or profession, especially in meetings with employers
the British labour party

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people will pay higher taxes under Labour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党执政时﹐大多数人都要缴纳更多的税。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They always vote Labour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直投工党的票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Labour government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党政府

Sense.DEF: work, especially physical work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women do hard manual labourwork with their hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers withdrew their labour protested by stopping work for twenty-four hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人罢工24小时。

Sense.DEF: all the people who work for a company or in a country
Sense.TRAN: 〔一公司或一国的全体〕劳工﹐工人﹔劳动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shortage of skilled labor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟练工人短缺
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to reduce our labour costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要降低劳动力成本。

Sense.DEF: the process of giving birth to a baby

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meg was in labour for ten hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格分娩用了十小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Diane went into labour at 2 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜两点钟开始分娩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The labour pains were unbearable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分娩时的阵痛难以忍受。

GramExa.GLOSS: a room in a hospital where women give birth

Sense.DEF: something that is hard work but that you do because you want to
a period of hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: After several hours’ gardening, we sat down to admire the results of our labours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在花园里干了几个小时以后﹐我们坐下来欣赏自己的劳动成果。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Employers want to keep skilled labour because of the cost of training.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到培训成本﹐雇主希望把熟练工人留下来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: workers who have low wages
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Women and children were used as cheap labour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女儿童被用作廉价劳动力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: workers who do jobs that are not permanent
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The industry makes use of a large supply of casual labour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业雇用大量临时工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the people who work in a country or for a company
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need an educated labour force.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要受过教育的劳动力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the people available to work
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What was the effect of the war on the labour supply?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场战争对劳动力供应有何影响？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people looking for work and the jobs available
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the percentage of women in the labour market
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女在劳动力市场中的百分比

Sense.DEF: to work hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: They laboured all day in the mills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一整天都在磨坊里辛勤工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been labouring over this report all morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个上午我都在埋头写这份报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray had little talent but labored to acquire the skills of a writer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷没有什么天赋﹐但仍努力想要掌握一名作家应具备的技巧。

Sense.DEF: to believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had laboured under the misconception that Bella liked her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她误以为贝拉喜欢她。

Sense.DEF: to describe or explain something in too much detail or when people have already understood it
Sense.TRAN: 一再阐述﹐反复解释〔对方已懂的事〕

Sense.DEF: to move slowly and with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see the bus labouring up the steep, windy road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到公共汽车迎着大风在陡峭的道路上艰难行驶。

Sense.DEF: a prison camp where prisoners have to do hard physical work
if someone’s breathing is laboured, it is difficult for them to breathe
if writing or speaking is laboured, it takes a lot of effort and is not good
Sense.TRAN: 〔写作或演说〕矫揉造作的﹐不自然的﹔不流畅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the episodes are very laboured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几集剧情很牵强。

Sense.DEF: someone whose work needs physical strength, for example building work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a farm labourer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场工人

Sense.DEF: a British government office where people went to find jobs in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时英国政府的〕职业介绍所

Sense.DEF: all the people who work for a company or in a country
people who do hard physical work and who do not have a lot of money or power, considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 劳动阶层/劳动阶层家庭等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They wanted to provide education for the labouring classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想为劳动阶层提供教育。

Sense.DEF: involving hard physical work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a labouring job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体力劳动工作

Sense.DEF: an industry or type of work that is labour-intensive needs a lot of workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: labour-intensive farming methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳动密集型耕作法

Sense.DEF: the people looking for work and the jobs that are available at that time
Sense.EXAMPLE: married women re-entering the labour market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重返劳动力市场的已婚妇女

Sense.DEF: the organizations, political parties etc that represent working people
the relationship between employers and workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company with good labour relations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资关系和谐的公司

Sense.DEF: making it easier for you to do a particular job

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 节省劳力的装置/器具/设备等

Sense.DEF: a large dog with fairly short yellow or black hair
Sense.TRAN: 拉布拉多猎犬﹐纽芬兰拾獚

Sense.DEF: a small tree with long hanging stems of yellow flowers and poisonous seeds
a large network of paths or passages which cross each other, making it very difficult to find your way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a labyrinth of underground tunnels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷宫似的地道

Sense.DEF: something that is very complicated and difficult to understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Decisions are frequently delayed in the labyrinth of Whitehall committees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白厅各委员会关系错综复杂﹐决策经常一拖再拖。

Sense.DEF: a fine cloth made with patterns of many very small holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handkerchief trimmed with lace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有蕾丝花边的手绢
Sense.EXAMPLE: lace curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网眼窗帘

Sense.DEF: a string that is pulled through special holes in shoes or clothing to pull the edges together and fasten them
to fasten something by tying a lace
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lace up your shoes or you’ll trip over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鞋带系好﹐否则你会绊倒的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The canvas was laced to a steel frame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帆布用绳子系在钢架上。

Sense.DEF: to add a small amount of alcohol or a drug to a drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: coffee laced with Irish whiskey
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 掺有爱尔兰威士忌的咖啡

Sense.DEF: to weave or twist several things together
Sense.TRAN: 把〔几个东西〕交织在一起

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hannah laced her fingers together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜十指相扣。

Sense.DEF: to include something all through something you write or say
Sense.TRAN: 在〔文章或话语〕中掺入﹐加进
Sense.EXAMPLE: He laces his narrative with a great deal of irrelevant information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在叙述中掺杂了很多不相关的内容。

Sense.DEF: to have some of a quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Iris’s voice was heavily laced with irony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯的话音中嘲讽的味道很浓。

Sense.DEF: to cut skin deeply with something sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fingers were badly lacerated by the broken glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手指被碎玻璃严重割伤。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone very strongly
a cut in your skin

GramExa.EXAMPLE: multiple lacerations to the upper arms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上臂的多处划伤

Sense.DEF: a shoe that is fastened with a lace

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 亮闪闪的黑色系带鞋子

Sense.DEF: lace, or something that looks like lace
often crying
when there is not enough of something, or none of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new parents suffering from lack of sleep
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺少睡眠的新爸爸新妈妈们

Sense.EXAMPLE: Too many teachers are treated with a lack of respect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有太多老师得不到尊重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: comments based on a total lack of information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全无根据的评论
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does their apparent lack of progress mean they are not doing their job properly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们看来没有什么进展﹐是不是说明他们没有做好本职工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: tours that are cancelled for lack of bookings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因预订人数不够而取消的旅游
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no lack of willing helpers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主动提出帮助的不乏其人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: health problems linked to poor diet and a relative lack of exercise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与不良饮食和运动相对缺乏相关的健康问题

Sense.DEF: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use ‘in’ or ‘of’ after the verb lack . 动词 lack 后面不要用in或of: We lack ideas (NOT 不说 We lack in/of ideas). 我们没有主意。 However, you can use these prepositions after be lacking and a lack. 但是be lacking和a lack后面可以用in或of: We are lacking in ideas. 我们没有主意。 | These is a lack of ideas. 没主意了。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of something
Sense.TRAN: 某物应有尽有﹐不乏某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does not lack for critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑他毛病的人很多。

Sense.DEF: not showing enough interest in something or not putting enough effort into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: David has a rather lackadaisical approach to his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维的工作态度有点懒散。

Sense.DEF: someone who always does what a particular person tells them to do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 走卒﹐唯命是从者〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His colleagues accused him of being a management lackey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同事指责他对管理层唯命是从。

Sense.DEF: not having enough of something or any of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was lacking in confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缺乏信心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seems to be entirely lacking in intelligence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好像一点头脑都没有。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new designs have all been found lacking in some important way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新设计好像都少了点重要的东西。

Sense.DEF: if something that you need or want is lacking, it does not exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Financial backing for the project is still lacking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目仍然缺少资金支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These qualities are sadly lacking today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲哀的是﹐这些品质如今已经丧失殆尽。

Sense.DEF: not exciting, impressive etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team gave rather a lacklustre performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的表现毫无生气。

Sense.DEF: not shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: lacklustre hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干枯的头发

Sense.DEF: using only a few words to say something
a liquid painted onto metal or wood to form a hard shiny surface
to cover something with lacquer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a black lacquered box
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑漆箱子

Sense.DEF: to use lacquer on your hair
a game played on a field by two teams of ten players, in which each player has a long stick with a net on the end of it and uses this to throw, catch, and carry a small ball
Sense.TRAN: 兜网球﹐长曲棍球〔两队各十人﹐用带网的长棍来掷球﹑接球和持球〕

Sense.DEF: if a woman or female animal lactates, she produces milk to feed her baby or babies with
the production of milk by a woman or female animal
an acid produced by muscles after exercising and found in sour milk
a type of sugar found in milk, sometimes used as a food for babies and sick people
a place where something is missing in a piece of writing
made of laceor looking like lace
Sense.TRAN: 网眼织物的﹐有蕾丝(花边)的﹔网眼状的
Sense.EXAMPLE: lacy underwear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾丝内衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant with delicate, lacy leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有细致网眼叶子的植物

Sense.DEF: a boy or young man
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young lad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小伙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things were different when I was a lad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年轻的时候﹐情况可不大相同。

Sense.DEF: a group of male friends that a man works with or spends his free time with
Sense.EXAMPLE: a night out with the lads
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和伙伴们外出的一个晚上

GramExa.GLOSS: a member of your group of friends

Sense.DEF: a man that people like even though he behaves rather badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: That Chris is a bit of a lad, isn’t he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个克里斯是个花花公子﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: the way in which some young men behave, involving typically male activities such as drinking a lot of alcohol, driving fast cars, and watching football – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 男孩文化〔指某些青年男子的行为方式﹐如酗酒﹑飙车﹑看足球赛等﹔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a boy or man who works with horses
a piece of equipment used for climbing up to or down from high places. A ladder has two bars that are connected by rungsshort bars that you use as steps .
Sense.EXAMPLE: She climbed up the ladder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爬上梯子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hurt himself falling off a ladder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从梯子上摔下来受了伤。

Sense.DEF: a series of levels which someone moves up and down within an organization, profession, or society
Sense.TRAN: 〔在机构﹑专业或社会中晋升的〕阶梯﹐途径

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stevens slowly worked his way up the corporate ladder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文斯慢慢地在公司晋升的阶梯上往上爬。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Becoming a doctor would be a step up the social ladder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为医生就是在社会阶梯上向上攀升了一级。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first step on the ladder of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈向成功的第一步

Sense.DEF: a long thin hole in stockings or tightwhere some stitches have broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, I know I’ve got a ladder in my tights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐我知道我的紧身裤袜抽丝了。

Sense.DEF: if stockings or tights ladder, or if you ladder them, a long thin hole is made in them because some stitches have broken
a boy
a young man who is laddish likes spending time with other men, drinking alcohol and enjoying things like sport, sex, and music
the attitudes and behaviour of some young men in Britain, who drink a lot of alcohol, and are mainly interested in sport, sex, and music
Sense.EXAMPLE: the culture of laddism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: (英国)小伙子文化

Sense.DEF: heavily loaded with something, or containing a lot of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tables were laden with food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些桌子上摆满了食物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lorry was fully laden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 货车装得满满的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: snow-laden branches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积满雪的树枝

Sense.DEF: having a lot of a particular quality, thing etc
Sense.TRAN: 充满〔某种品质﹑东西等〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was laden with doubts about the affair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心中对此事充满疑问。

Sense.EXAMPLE: trucks laden with equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆辆装满机器设备的卡车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a debt-laden company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家负债累累的公司

Sense.DEF: a young woman who likes to do some things that young men typically do, such as drinking a lot of alcohol and talking about sex and sports
used to describe someone’s behaviour when you think they are talking and behaving as if they consider themselves better than other people
Sense.TRAN: 装腔作势的﹐装模作样的﹐做作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a la-di-da attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装腔作势的态度

Sense.DEF: a man who likes to spend time with women, and thinks they enjoy being with him
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢与女人厮混的男人

Sense.DEF: a women’s toilet
a large deep spoon with a long handle, used for lifting liquid food, especially soup, out of a container
to put soup or other liquid food onto plates or into bowls, especially using a ladle

a type of magazine that is intended for young men. It typically contains a lot of pictures of young women wearing very little clothing, and most of the writing in it is about clothes, cars, drinking, sport etc.

Subsense.DEF: a woman of a particular type or age
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某一类型或年龄的〕女士﹐女子

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 年轻女子/上了年纪的女士/老妇人等

Subsense.DEF: a word meaning woman, used especially to describe women’s sports or products made for women
Subsense.TRAN: 女子﹐女性〔尤用于指女子体育项目或女性使用的产品〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ladies’ darts team
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子掷镖队

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ladies’ underwear
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女式内衣

Subsense.DEF: a word meaning woman, used in order to be polite
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The young lady at reception sent me up here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接待小姐让我来这里的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Give your coat to the lady over there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的外衣交给那边的女士吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: a polite word, which many women find offensive, for a woman doctor, lawyer, etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 女医生/律师等〔礼貌用词﹐但很多女性认为此类称呼有冒犯性〕

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Lady often sounds old-fashioned, especially when it is used about younger women. In everyday English, people usually say woman.
F2NBox.TRAN: lady一词常显过时﹐用于年轻女性时尤其明显。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 woman
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His cousin is a 26-year-old woman who works in a kindergarten.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表妹今年26岁﹐在幼儿园工作。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is polite and behaves very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knows how to behave like a lady.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道怎么做一个淑女。

Sense.DEF: used as the title of the wife or daughter of a British noblemanor the wife of a knight
Sense.TRAN: 太太﹔夫人﹔小姐〔英国贵族女眷或爵士妻子的头衔〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lady Spencer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯宾塞夫人

Subsense.DEF: a women’s toilet
a word meaning women, often used humorously
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His boyish good looks made him a favourite with the ladies.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那小男孩般的俊俏容貌很讨女士们欢心。

Sense.DEF: used to speak to a group of women
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ladies and gentlemen, may I have your attention please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女士们﹑先生们﹐请大家注意！

Sense.DEF: a woman, especially one with a strong character – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 女人〔尤指个性强的女人﹔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can be a tough lady to negotiate with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判时她会是一个很厉害的女人。

Sense.DEF: a woman that a man is having a romantic relationship with – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 女朋友﹐女友 〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Chris with his new lady friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见克里斯和新女友在一起。

Sense.DEF: a woman who does not work and has a lot of free time – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 休闲夫人〔指不上班﹑有大量闲暇时间的女子﹔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So you’re a lady of leisure now that the kids are at school?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们都上学去了﹐现在你成休闲夫人啦？

Sense.DEF: used when talking directly to a woman you do not know, when you are angry with her
Sense.TRAN: 女士﹔小姐〔对不认识的女子生气时用的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, lady, would you mind getting out of my way?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐小姐﹐你让一让道行吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Addressing a woman directly as lady sounds rude. In polite American English, people use Miss or Ma’am instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 直接以 lady 称呼女性会显得无礼。 在美国英语中﹐人们用 Miss 或 Ma’am 称呼女性以示礼貌
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can I help you, Miss?

Sense.DEF: an expression used to mean Mary, the mother of Jesus Christ
Sense.TRAN: 圣母〔指耶稣基督的母亲马利亚〕

Sense.DEF: the most important woman in a house, usually the mother of a family
a woman born into a high social class in Britain
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see the Queen, surrounded by her lords and ladies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到了女王﹐身边簇拥着王公贵族和上流社会的贵妇。

Sense.DEF: a man’s wife
Sense.EXAMPLE: the captain and his lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船长和他的妻子

Sense.DEF: a small round beetlea type of insect that is usually red with black spots
a woman who looks after and serves a queen or princess
Sense.TRAN: 〔女王或公主的〕女侍臣﹐女官﹐宫廷侍女

Sense.DEF: if a woman or girl is ladylike, she behaves in a polite and quiet way that was once believed to be typical of or suitable for women
Sense.EXAMPLE: ladylike behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淑女般的举止

Subsense.DEF: used as a way of speaking to or talking about a woman with the title of Lady
Subsense.TRAN: 夫人﹔小姐〔对有Lady头衔女子的尊称〕

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about a woman who thinks she is very important
Subsense.TRAN: 尊贵的夫人〔称自以为高贵的女子〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you think her ladyship will be joining us?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说那位尊贵的夫人会加入我们吗？

Sense.DEF: another spelling of ladies’ man
to move or develop more slowly than others

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stopped to wait for Ian who was lagging behind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来等落在后面的伊恩。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain is lagging behind the rest of Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国被欧洲其他国家落在了后面。

Sense.DEF: to cover water pipes etc with a special material to prevent the water inside them from freezing or the heat from being lost
Sense.TRAN: 给〔水管等〕加上防冻[保温]层
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had the hot-water tank lagged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已给热水箱加上了保温外罩。

Sense.DEF: a delay or period of waiting between one event and a second event
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个事件之间的〕时间间隔﹐相隔的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time lag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间滞差

Sense.DEF: a light-coloured beer, or a glass of this type of beer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pint of lager
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一品脱淡啤酒

Sense.DEF: a young man who drinks too much and then behaves violently or rudely
someone or something that is very slow or late
special material used to protect a water pipe or container from heat or cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔水管或容器的〕隔热材料﹐保温材料

Sense.DEF: a lake of sea water that is partly separated from the sea by rocks, sand, or coral
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coastal lagoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海潟湖

Sense.DEF: a small lake which is not very deep, near a larger lake or river
another spelling of la-di-da
the past tense and past participle of lay
relaxed and seeming not to be worried about anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how you can be so laid-back about your exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你对考试怎么会如此不在乎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is famed for his laid-back attitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满不在乎的态度是出了名的。

Sense.DEF: the past participle of lie1
the place where a wild animal hides and sleeps
a place where you go to hide or to be alone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smuggler’s lair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走私者的藏身处

Sense.DEF: a person who owns a very large area of land in Scotland
behaving in a way that is very loud, or with too much confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bit lairy, your friend Mick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的朋友米克﹐这人有点过于自信。

Sense.DEF: the principle that the government should allow the economyor private businesses to develop without any state control or influence
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家不限制私营企业发展的〕自由放任主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: the policy of laissez-faire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由放任政策

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 自由放任的经济学/资本主义

Sense.DEF: when you do not become involved in other people’s personal affairs
Sense.TRAN: 放任自流的态度/方法等〔指不干预别人的私事〕

Sense.DEF: all the members of a religious group apart from the priests
a large area of water surrounded by land
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lake Michigan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密歇根湖

Sense.DEF: a very large amount of wine, milk etc that has been produced but is not needed or used
Sense.TRAN: 葡萄酒池/牛奶池等〔指生产过量的葡萄酒﹑牛奶等〕

Exponent.DEF: a large area of water surrounded by land
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lake Michigan
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 密歇根湖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We went for a swim in the lake.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去湖里游泳。

Exponent.DEF: an area of water that is separated from the sea by rocks, sand, or coral
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tropical lagoon
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带潟湖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: coastal lagoons
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海潟湖群

Exponent.DEF: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The reservoirs supply water to Greater Manchester.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些水库为大曼彻斯特郡供水。

Exponent.DEF: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, which is either natural or artificially made
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were several ducks on the village pond.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村子池塘里有几只鸭子。

Exponent.DEF: a small area of still water in a hollow place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pool of water near the summit of the mountain
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶附近的一个水塘
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rockpoola pool in some rocks near the sea
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔海边岩石间的〕潮水潭

Exponent.DEF: a very small area of water on the ground, especially after it has been raining
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She turned quickly to avoid stepping in a puddle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迅速转向﹐免得踩进水坑。

Exponent.DEF: a small area of water in a dry country, where wild animals go to drink
Exponent.TRAN: 〔干旱地区野生动物饮水的〕水洼﹐水坑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The waterhole is used by elephants.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大象在这个水坑边喝水。

Sense.DEF: beside a lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lakeside restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖滨饭店

Sense.DEF: escaping or hiding from someone, especially the police
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brenner was recaptured after three weeks on the lam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦纳潜逃三个星期后被再次抓获。

Sense.DEF: a Buddhist priest in China's Tibet or Mongolia
a young sheep
the meat of a young sheep
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤羊肉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leg of lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条羊腿

Sense.DEF: used to talk to or talk about someone who is gentle and lovable, especially a child
Sense.TRAN: 温柔可爱的人 〔尤指小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben’s asleep now, the little lamb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本正在睡觉﹐像可爱的小羔羊。

Sense.LEXUNIT: like a lamb to the slaughter
Sense.DEF: used when someone is going to do something dangerous, but they do not realize it or have no choice
Sense.TRAN: 像待宰的羔羊〔指面临危险而未觉察或别无选择者〕

Sense.DEF: quietly and without any argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suzie went off to school like a lamb today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏齐今天乖乖地去上学了。

Sense.DEF: to give birth to lambs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ewes are lambing this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周母羊将要产羊羔。

Sense.DEF: a sexy modern dance from Brazil in which two people hold each other closely and move their bodies at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 兰巴达舞〔巴西的一种性感舞蹈〕

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something very strongly, usually in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Democrats lambasted the President’s budget plan for being ‘inadequate’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党猛烈抨击总统的预算计划“不完善”。

Sense.DEF: soft wool from lambs used for making clothes

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 羔羊毛套衫/毛衣/毯子等

Sense.DEF: cloth containing gold or silver threads
Sense.TRAN: 有金银线的织物﹐金银锦缎
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gold lamé dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金色锦缎的裙子

Subsense.DEF: unable to walk properly because your leg or foot is injured or weak
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a lame dog
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条瘸腿的狗

GramExa.GLOSS: become lame

Subsense.DEF: people who are lame

Sense.DEF: a lame excuse or explanation is weak and difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 〔解释或借口〕无说服力的﹐站不住脚的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave some lame excuse about missing the bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找了个拙劣的借口﹐说是没有赶上公共汽车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a lame attempt to deflect criticism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 转移批评的一个无力的尝试

Sense.DEF: boring or not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the songs on this album are a bit lame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑有许多歌曲都不太好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s lame performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的不佳业绩

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal unable to walk properly
Sense.TRAN: 使〔人或动物〕跛[瘸]﹔使残废
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fall left him badly lamed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一跤摔得他走路瘸得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: a person, business etc that is having problems and needs help
Sense.TRAN: 跛足鸭〔指遭遇困难需要帮助的人﹑企业等〕

Sense.DEF: a president, governoretc with no real power because his or her period in office will soon end
Sense.TRAN: 跛足鸭总统/州长/立法机构等〔指因任期将满而无实权〕

Sense.DEF: if you say something lamely, you do not sound confident and other people find it difficult to believe you
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话〕信心不足地﹐不具说服力地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It wasn’t my responsibility,’ he lamely explained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那不是我的责任。”他怯怯地解释道。

Sense.DEF: to express feelings of great sadness about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举国上下都在哀悼他们伟大的战时领袖。

Sense.DEF: to express annoyance or disappointment about something you think is unsatisfactory or unfair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lamented that people had expected too much of him too soon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抱怨大家一下子对他期望过高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She lamented the fact that manufacturers did not produce small packs for single-person households.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抱怨厂商没有生产供单人家庭使用的小包装。

GramExa.PROPFORM: lament the lack/absence/decline etc of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steiner lamented the lack of public interest in the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦纳抱怨公众不关心这个问题。

Sense.DEF: a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lone piper played a lament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风笛手独自吹起一支挽歌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lament for the dead
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哀悼死者

Sense.DEF: very unsatisfactory or disappointing
Sense.TRAN: 可叹的﹐令人惋惜的﹔让人失望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lamentable state of affairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人惋惜的事态
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lamentable lack of support for the idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法令人遗憾地缺乏支持的状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is lamentable that the officer failed to deal with the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐这位警官无法处理这一情况。

Sense.DEF: deep sadness or something that expresses it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was lamentation throughout the land at news of the defeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知战败的消息﹐举国悲恸。

Sense.DEF: laminated material
laminated material is made by joining several thin layers on top of each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: laminated glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹层玻璃

Sense.DEF: covered with a thin layer of plastic for protection
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laminated ID card
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压膜的身份证

PIC.HEADING: LAMPS 灯
PIC.PICCONTENT: uplighter 上射灯；chandelier 枝形吊灯；light bulb 灯泡；lava lamp 熔岩灯；desk lamp 台灯；button 按钮；anglepoise lamp BrE 【英】万向灯；spotlight 聚光灯；oil lamp 油灯；button 按钮； torch BrE 【英】/flashlight AmE 【美】手电筒；floor lamp AmE 【美】/standard lamp BrE 【英】落地灯；table lamp 桌灯；lamp post 路灯柱

Sense.DEF: an object that produces light by using electricity, oil, or gas
a piece of electrical equipment used to provide a special kind of heat, especially as a medical treatment
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指治疗用的〕发热灯﹔照射器

Sense.DEF: the soft light produced by a lamp
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes shone in the lamplight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛在灯光下闪着光芒。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job was to light lamps in the street in the past
to criticize someone or something in a humorous way that makes them seem stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister was frequently lampooned in political cartoons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相在政治漫画里频遭嘲讽。

Sense.DEF: a tall pole that supports a light over a street or public area
a cover fixed over a light bulbfor decoration and in order to reduce or direct its light
a system that connects computers to each other within a building or organization so that people can use and work on the same information
a long thin pointed weapon that was used in the past by soldiers riding on horses
to cut a small hole in someone’s flesh with a sharp instrument to let out pusyellow liquid produced by infection
Sense.TRAN: 〔为放脓而用锋利的刀子〕把…切开

Sense.DEF: a low level rank in the Marines or the British army, or someone who has this rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国海军陆战队的〕准下士﹔〔英国陆军的〕一等兵

Sense.DEF: a small very sharp pointed knife with two cutting edges, used by doctors to cut skin and flesh
a tall narrow window or archthat is pointed at the top
an area of ground, especially when used for farming or building
Sense.TRAN: 土地〔尤指耕作或建筑用地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They own a lot of land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拥有许多土地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bought a piece of land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他买了一块地。

Sense.DEF: the solid dry part of the Earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: After 21 days at sea, we sighted land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过21天的海上航行﹐我们见到了陆地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops began an assault on the city by land and sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队开始由海陆两路攻击这座城市。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crocodile lays its eggs on land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鳄鱼在陆地上产卵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The white stork is one of the biggest land birds of the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白鹳是该地区最大的陆栖鸟类之一。

Sense.DEF: a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their journey took them to many foreign lands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在旅程中走过了许多异国的土地。

GramExa.GLOSS: the land where you were born
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s fiercely proud of his native land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深深为祖国自豪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Australia represented a real land of opportunity for thousands of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对很多人来说﹐澳大利亚是一个充满机遇的国度。

Sense.DEF: the countryside thought of as a place where people grow food

GramExa.GLOSS: grow or catch all the food you need
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A third of the region’s population still lives off the land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区三分之一的人口依旧靠土地生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: grow crops
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people were forced to give up working the land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人被迫放弃耕种。

Sense.DEF: the area of land that someone owns
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ordered us to get off his land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他命令我们离开他的土地。

Sense.LEXUNIT: see/find out how the land lies
Sense.DEF: to try to discover what the situation really is before you make a decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔作出决定前〕了解情况﹐摸清形势

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the land of the living
Sense.DEF: awake – used humorously

Sense.LEXUNIT: the land of milk and honey
Sense.DEF: an imaginary place where life is easy and pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔虚构的〕乳蜜之乡﹐富饶的乐土

Sense.DEF: asleep

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The family owned hundreds of acres of land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族拥有数百英亩土地。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an area of land
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He built a house on a piece of land near the river.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在河边的一块地上盖了一座房子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a piece of land
a narrow piece of land
a large area of land
good for growing crops
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The land near the river is very fertile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 河边的土地非常肥沃。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not good for growing crops
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is poor land that should never have been farmed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地十分贫瘠﹐不应该用来耕作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unused
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The houses could be built on derelict land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以在荒地建造房屋。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: land on which there are no buildings
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In the middle of the city are several hundred acres of open land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市中部有数百英亩开阔地。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: land that crops are grown on
land where factories can be built and industry take place
land where houses can be built

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘a large land’ or或 ‘a small land’. Say 而要说 a large piece of land or 或 a small piece of land.

Exponent.DEF: an area that is owned by someone or that can be used for farming or building houses
Exponent.TRAN: 〔归某人所有或用于耕作﹑建筑的〕土地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This is private land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是私人土地。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They moved to the country and bought some land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们搬到乡下﹐买了一些地。

Exponent.DEF: land that is used for farming
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The area is one of gently rolling hills and farmland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一带有平缓的山丘和农田。

Exponent.DEF: land that belongs to a country or that is controlled by a country during a war
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His plane was forced to make an emergency landing in Chinese territory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的飞机被迫在中国领土紧急降落。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The army was advancing into enemy territory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队正深入敌方领地。

Exponent.DEF: the gardens and land around a big building such as a castle, school, or hospital
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The grounds of the castle are open to visitors every weekend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡庭园每逢周末对游客开放。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the school grounds
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校操场

Exponent.DEF: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film is set on an English country estate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片的场景设在英国一座乡村庄园内。

Subsense.DEF: if a plane, bird, or insect lands, it moves safely down onto the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Flight 846 landed five minutes ago.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 846次航班五分钟之前降落了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bird landed gracefully on the water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿优美地飞落到水面上。

Subsense.DEF: to make a plane move safely down onto the ground at the end of a journey
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pilot managed to land the aircraft safely.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员设法令飞机安全降落。

Sense.DEF: to arrive somewhere in a plane, boat etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We expect to be landing in Oslo in about fifty minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预计约50分钟后在奥斯陆降落。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1969, the first men landed on the moon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1969年﹐人类首次登上月球。

Sense.DEF: to come down through the air onto something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A large branch landed on the hood of my car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根巨大的树枝掉落到我汽车的引擎盖上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Louis fell out of the tree and landed in a holly bush.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易斯从树上掉下来﹐落到了冬青树丛中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She fell and landed heavily on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她掉下来﹐重重地摔在地上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A couple of bombs landed quite near to the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几颗炸弹落在离村子很近的地方。

Sense.DEF: if a boat or aircraft lands people or goods, it brings them to a place, and the people get out or the goods are carried out
Sense.TRAN: 〔从船或飞机上〕卸下〔货物〕﹔使〔乘客〕下船[飞机]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The troops were landed by helicopter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队乘直升机降落。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting a job, contract etc that was difficult to get
Sense.TRAN: 谋得〔难得的工作﹑合约等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He landed a job with a law firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在律师事务所谋得一份工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill’s just landed himself a part in a Broadway show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔刚刚在百老汇的一场演出中谋到一个角色。

Sense.DEF: to cause someone to have serious problems or be in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 使某人陷入困境/得病住院/卷入官司等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Connie’s going to land herself in big trouble if she keeps arriving late for work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康妮要是上班老迟到﹐就会给自己惹出大麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She developed pneumonia which landed her in hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患上肺炎﹐住进了医院。

Sense.DEF: to get someone into trouble by telling other people that they did something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔告诉他人某人做错某事而〕使某人陷入麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geoff landed me in it by saying I should have checked that the door was locked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫跟别人说我本该检查一下门是否锁好﹐这给我惹来了麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to arrive unexpectedly, and cause problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔出乎意料地〕到达﹐来临〔从而引发问题〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just when I thought my problems were over, this letter landed on my desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在我认为所有问题都已解决时﹐这封信送到了我的桌上。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in hitting someone
to get into a good situation again, after having problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: She certainly landed on her feet when she got that job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得到了那份工作﹐她自然是时来运转。

Sense.DEF: to catch a fish
to be in a particular place, situation, or position after a lot of things have happened to you
Sense.TRAN: 〔历经许多事后〕最终落到〔某一处境〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We landed up in a bar at 3 am.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后到了凌晨3点钟﹐我们进了一家酒吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful that you don’t land up in serious debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心﹐切勿债台高筑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I landed up with five broken ribs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后落得五根肋骨骨折。

Sense.DEF: to give someone something unpleasant to do, because no one else wants to do it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔别人都不愿意做的事〕推给〔某人〕去做
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria’s been landed with all the tidying up as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收拾打扫的工作照例又落到玛丽亚头上。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after land, cattle, farms etc that belong to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔看管田地﹑牲畜﹑农场等的〕地产管理人

Sense.DEF: a four-wheeled carriage that is pulled by horses and has a top that folds back
placed on or living on the land
Sense.TRAN: 位于陆地的﹔陆上的﹔栖息在陆地的
Sense.EXAMPLE: land-based missiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆基导弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: land-based animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆栖动物

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of land connecting two large areas of land, especially long ago in the past
Sense.TRAN: 陆桥〔尤指很久以前连接两块大陆的狭长地带〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of years ago, people crossed the land bridge between Asia and North America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很久以前﹐人们越过了连接亚洲和北美洲的大陆桥。

Sense.DEF: a family or group that has owned a lot of land for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 拥有大量土地的乡绅/家族/贵族

Sense.DEF: including a lot of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: landed estates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地产

Sense.DEF: a landslide2
the land that you see or arrive at after a long journey by sea or air, or the act of arriving there
Sense.TRAN: 〔长时间航行或飞行后〕初见的陆地﹔踏上陆地

Sense.DEF: the practice of burying waste under the ground, or the waste buried in this way
Sense.TRAN: 废弃物的填埋﹔填埋的废弃物

Sense.DEF: a place where waste is buried under the ground
the land that is owned by someone
the action of bringing an aircraft down to the ground after being in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: take-off and landing procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起降程序

GramExa.GLOSS: a sudden landing caused by a problem with the engine etc

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Apollo Moon landings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿波罗宇宙飞船登月

Sense.DEF: the floor at the top of a set of stairs or between two sets of stairs
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first-floor landing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一楼的楼梯平台

Sense.DEF: the action of bringing soldiers onto land that is controlled by the enemy
Sense.EXAMPLE: the first landings of American Marines at Da Nang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国海军陆战队在岘港的首次登陆

Sense.DEF: a landing stage
a flat-bottomed boat that opens at one end so that soldiers and equipment can be moved directly onto the shore
an aircraft’s wheels and other parts that support them
a net on a long handle used for lifting a fish out of the water after you have caught it
Sense.TRAN: 抄网〔用以捞取上钩的鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a wooden structure for moving passengers and goods to and from boats
a flat piece of ground that has been prepared for aircraft to use
a woman who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone
a woman who owns or manages a pub
owning no land
Sense.TRAN: 不拥有土地的﹐没有土地的

Sense.DEF: a telephone connection that uses wires, as opposed to a mobile phone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be at home, so you can call me on the landline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会在家的﹐你可以打座机找我。

Sense.DEF: a landlocked country, state etc is surrounded by other countries, states etc and has no coast
a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone
a man who owns or manages a pub
someone who does not have much experience of the sea or ships
Sense.TRAN: 旱鸭子〔指没有多少航海或乘船经验的人〕

Sense.DEF: something that is easy to recognize, such as a tall tree or building, and that helps you know where you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of Belfast’s most famous landmarks, the Grosvenor Hall, has been demolished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔法斯特最著名的地标之一格罗夫纳大厦已被拆毁了。

Sense.DEF: one of the most important events, changes, or discoveries that influences someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discovery of penicillin was a landmark in the history of medicine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青霉素的发现是医药史上的里程碑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Supreme Court issued a landmark decision in January 2001.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2001年1月﹐最高法院作出了一项具有重大意义的裁决。

Sense.DEF: a large area of land such as a continent
a bomb hidden in the ground that explodes when someone walks or drives over it
a government office in the US that keeps records about the sale of land and who buys and sells it
someone who owns land, especially a large amount of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: wealthy landowners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱的地主

Sense.DEF: the political principle of sharing farmland so that more people own some of it
a government office in Britain that keeps records about the sale of land and who owns it
an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beauty of the New England landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新英格兰风光之美

Sense.DEF: a picture showing an area of countryside or land
Sense.EXAMPLE: English landscape artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国风景画画家

Sense.DEF: the general situation in which a particular activity takes place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent electoral shocks have shaken the European political landscape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的选举风波撼动了欧洲政坛。

Sense.DEF: a way of printing a document in which the long sides are horizontal and the short sides are vertical
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc
Sense.TRAN: 给…作景观美化﹐给…作园林美化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area around the mill pond has also been landscaped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨坊水池周围也作了景观美化。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to plan the way an area of land looks, including roads, buildings, and planted areas
Sense.TRAN: 园林建筑师﹔景观设计师

Sense.DEF: the profession or art of arranging gardens and parks so that they look attractive and interesting

a place on the southwest coast of England, which is generally thought of as the furthest point in the southwest of the UK. It is used especially in the phrase ‘from John o’ Groats to Land’s End’, because John o’ Groats is thought of as the furthest point in the northeast of the UK.
Sense.TRAN: 兰兹角〔英格兰西南端点﹔尤用于短语 from John o’ Groats to Land’s End(从约翰奥格罗茨到兰兹角﹐从英国东北端到西南端)〕

Sense.DEF: a victory in an election in which one person or party gets a lot more votes than all the others
Sense.TRAN: 一边倒的选举﹐一方选票占压倒性多数的选举
Sense.EXAMPLE: a landslide election victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压倒性的选举胜利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The SNP candidate won by a landslide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰民族党候选人以压倒性多数获胜。

Sense.DEF: a sudden fall of a lot of earth or rocks down a hill, cliff etc
a small fall of earth or rocks down a hill, cliff etc, that is smaller than a landslide
facing towards the land and away from the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the landward side of the hill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座山朝陆地的一侧

Sense.DEF: a narrow road in the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet country lane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条宁静的乡间小路

Sense.DEF: a road in a city, often used in road names
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Hilton Hotel in Park Lane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园巷的希尔顿酒店
Sense.EXAMPLE: a network of alleys and back lanes narrow unimportant roads, often behind a row of houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纵横交错的后街小巷

Sense.DEF: one of the two or three parallel areas on a road which are divided by painted lines to keep traffic apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: That idiot changed lanes without signalling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个白痴没打灯就变道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use the outside lane for overtaking only.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外侧车道仅限超车使用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cars in the fast lane were travelling at over 80 miles an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快车道上的汽车时速超过80英里。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 三车道的高速公路/公路/道路

Sense.DEF: one of the narrow parallel areas marked for each competitor in a running or swimming race
a line or course along which ships or aircraft regularly travel between ports or airports
Sense.EXAMPLE: busy shipping lanes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁忙的海运航道

Sense.DEF: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area
Sense.TRAN: 〔某国家或地区的〕语言﹔语言文字
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many languages do you speak?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能说几种语言？
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the best-known poems in the English language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

Sense.DEF: the use of written or spok-en words to communicate
Sense.EXAMPLE: the origins of language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言的起源

Sense.DEF: a particular style or type of words
Sense.TRAN: 〔特定风格或类型的〕用语﹔术语

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter was written in complicated legal language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信是用复杂的法律术语写的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The expression is mainly used in written language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个短语主要用在书面语中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is able to explain complicated ideas in simple everyday language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能够用简单的日常语言解释复杂的观点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plays are full of old-fashioned poetic language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些戏剧充斥着老掉牙的诗歌语言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the language of science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学术语

Sense.DEF: words that most people think are offensive

GramExa.GLOSS: stop swearing
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 注意你的言谈﹔嘴巴干净点

Subsense.DEF: angry words used to tell people exactly what you mean
Subsense.TRAN: 措辞强硬的话﹐激烈的言辞

Subsense.DEF: words that most people think are offensive

Sense.DEF: a system of instructions for operating a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a programming language for the web
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种网络编程语言

Sense.DEF: signs, movements, or sounds that express ideas or feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用手势﹑动作或声音的〕表达方式﹐交流方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the language of bees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜蜂的交流方式
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the language of dolphins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚的交流方式

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you speak a foreign language?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会说外语吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children use their native language at home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在家说母语。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Immigrants are expected to learn the language of their new country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民应该要学习移入国的语言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in learning a language well

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He found learning a foreign language extremely difficult.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现学外语极其困难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had some knowledge of the Spanish language.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会一点西班牙语。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the language someone first learned as a child
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His first language was Polish.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的母语是波兰语。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a language you speak that is not your first language
languages that are spoken now
a language that is no longer spoken
the language used for official business in a country
a language that more than one person or group speaks, so that they can understand each other
the problem of communicating with someone when you do not speak the same language
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Because of the language barrier, it was hard for doctors to give good advice to patients.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于存在语言障碍﹐医生难以给予病人有效建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Language learners often have problems with tenses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学习者往往在掌握时态方面有问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone’s ability to speak a language
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人对一种语言的掌握

Section.SECHEADING: TECHNIQUES USED IN LANGUAGE 语言技巧

Exponent.DEF: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The beehive is a metaphor for human society.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜂房可喻指人类社会。

Exponent.DEF: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words as or like, for example ‘as white as snow’
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The poet uses the simile ‘soft like clay’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗人运用了明喻 “如陶土般柔软” 。

Exponent.DEF: the use of words that are the opposite of what you really mean, often in order to be amusing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m so happy to hear that,’ he said, with more than a trace of irony in his voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “听到这消息可真叫我高兴。” 他说道﹐语气中带着重重的嘲讽。

Exponent.DEF: a sudden change from a subject that is beautiful, moral, or serious to something that is ordinary, silly, or not important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The play is too sentimental and full of bathos.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧过于煽情﹐用了太多突降法。

Exponent.DEF: a way of describing something by saying that it is much bigger, smaller, worse etc than it actually is – used especially to excite people’s feelings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In his speeches, he used a lot of hyperbole.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在演讲中运用了大量夸张手法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: journalistic hyperbole
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻报道的夸张

Exponent.DEF: the use of several words together that all begin with the same sound, in order to make a special effect, especially in poetry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the alliteration of the ‘s’ sound in ‘sweet birds sang softly’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: sweet birds sang softly中的s头韵

Exponent.DEF: the use of words to describe ideas or actions in a way that makes the reader connect the ideas with pictures in their mind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the use of water imagery in Fitzgerald’s novel ‘The Great Gatsby’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲茨杰拉德小说《了不起的盖茨比》中水的意象的运用
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She uses the imagery of a bird’s song to represent eternal hope.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用鸟鸣的意象来象征永恒的希望。

Exponent.DEF: a question that you ask as a way of making a statement, without expecting an answer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When he said ‘how can these attitudes still exist in a civilized society?’, he was asking a rhetorical question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “这样的态度怎么能继续存在于文明社会中？” 他这句话是在反问。

Sense.DEF: a room in a school or college where you can learn to speak a foreign language by listening to tapes and recording your own voice
moving slowly and involving very little energy
Sense.TRAN: 无精打采的﹔懒洋洋的﹔慢吞吞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He greeted Charles with a languid wave of his hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无精打采地挥挥手﹐算是和查尔斯打招呼。

Sense.DEF: slow and not involving any activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent a languid afternoon by the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在游泳池边懒洋洋地过了一个下午。

Sense.DEF: if someone languishes somewhere, they are forced to remain in a place where they are unhappy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shaw languished in jail for fifteen years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖身陷囹圄十五载。

Sense.DEF: ifsomething languishes, it fails to improve and develop or become successful
Sense.TRAN: 变得衰弱﹔未能取得进展
Sense.EXAMPLE: The housing market continues to languish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宅市场继续疲软。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shares are languishing at just 46p after yesterday’s fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价经历了昨天的下跌后﹐就停滞在46便士上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: West Ham United are currently languishing at the bottom of the league.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西汉姆联队目前在联赛中一直排名垫底。

Sense.DEF: a pleasant feeling of laziness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lying there beside her, he was filled with an agreeable languor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 躺在她的身边﹐他感到慵懒而惬意。

Sense.DEF: when the air is heavy and there is no wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: the languor of a hot afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热午后的憋闷

Sense.DEF: lank hair is thin, straight, and unattractive
someone who is lanky is tall and thin, and moves awkwardly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lanky young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个又高又瘦﹑行动笨拙的小伙子

Sense.DEF: an oil that is obtained from sheep’s wool, and is used in skin creams
a lamp that you can carry, consisting of a metal container with glass sides that surrounds a flame or light
a thin rope or ribbon worn around your neck to carry something such as a whistle or identity card
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于悬挂哨子﹑证件等的〕挂带

Sense.DEF: a rope or string, especially on a ship

PIC.HEADING: LAP 大腿
PIC.PICCONTENT: Shannon sat on her mother's lap. 香农坐在她妈妈的腿上。

Sense.DEF: the upper part of your legs when you are sitting down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shannon sat on her mother’s lap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香农坐在她妈妈的腿上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hands were folded in his lap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他双手合拢﹐放在腿上。

Sense.DEF: a single journey arounda race track
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rubens Barrichello finished a lap ahead of his team-mate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁本斯·巴里切罗领先队友一圈跑完全程。

GramExa.GLOSS: a lap to celebrate winning
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The entire team took a victory lap in front of their cheering fans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全队在欢呼的球迷面前绕场一周庆祝胜利。

Sense.DEF: a single journey from one end of a swimming pool to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every morning she swims 50 laps in the pool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天早上都会在游泳池里来回游50趟。

Sense.DEF: a part of a long journey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The last lap of their journey was by ship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们旅程的最后一段是坐船。

Sense.DEF: having an easy and comfortable life with a lot of money, possessions etc
Sense.TRAN: 生活优裕的﹐养尊处优的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t used to living in the lap of luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不习惯养尊处优。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the lap of the gods
Sense.DEF: if the result of something is in the lap of the gods, you do not know what will happen because it depends on things you cannot control
Sense.TRAN: 在神的掌控之中﹐难以预料

Sense.DEF: if water laps something or laps against something such as the shore or a boat, it moves against it or hits it in small waves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The waves lapped gently against the rocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 波浪轻轻地拍打岩石。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The tide was lapping the harbour wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮水拍打着港口的防汛墙。

Sense.DEF: if an animal laps water, milk etc, it drinks it by putting its tongue into it
to pass a competitor in a race who is one complete lap behind you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Erik Comas spun off the track when trying to lap Andrew Scott.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克·科马斯试图领先安德鲁·斯科特一圈时失控冲出赛道。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She could hear the soft lapping of the sea.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能听到海浪轻柔的拍打声。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy something without worrying about whether it is good, true etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s lapping up all the attention she’s getting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于大家的关心﹐她照单全收。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The humour was lapped up by an appreciative crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有欣赏力的听众爱听这样的幽默。

Sense.DEF: if an animal laps up water, milk etc, it drinks it by putting its tongue into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat began to lap up the milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫咪开始舔食牛奶。

Sense.DEF: a medical examination or operation in which a special tube is put into someone’s body through a small cut so that the organs inside can be seen
a type of dancing in which a young woman uses sexy movements and removes her clothes while sitting on a customer’s lapin a nightclub
Sense.TRAN: 〔夜总会中坐在顾客腿上表演的〕脱衣舞

Sense.DEF: a small pet dog
someone who is completely under the control of someone else and will do anything they say – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 仰人鼻息的人﹐走狗〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the part of the front of a coat or jacketthat is joined to the collar and folded back on each side
well-written and accurate
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lapidary style of the poem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗优雅严谨的风格

Sense.DEF: relating to the cutting or polishing of valuable stones or jewels
a valuable bright blue stone, used especially in jewellery
Sense.TRAN: 天青石﹐青金石〔尤用于制作珠宝首饰〕

Sense.DEF: a short period of time during which you fail to do something well or properly, often caused by not being careful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite the occasional lapse, this was a fine performance by the young saxophonist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了这处偶然失误﹐这位年轻萨克斯手的表演堪称精彩。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A defensive lapse by Keown allowed Tottenham to score.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基翁的防守失误让托特纳姆队踢进一球。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: lapses in security
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安方面的疏忽

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A single lapse of concentration cost Sampras the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑普拉斯一走神就断送了这一局。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lapse of judgement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 判断失误

Sense.EXAMPLE: After taking the drug, several patients suffered memory lapses when you cannot remember something for a short time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 若干病人服用此药后记忆短暂丧失。

Sense.DEF: a failure to do something you should do, especially to behave correctly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指举止方面的〕疏忽﹐过失﹐过错
Sense.EXAMPLE: He forgot to offer Darren a drink, but Marie did not appear to notice the lapse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忘了给达伦倒饮料﹐玛丽好像也没有注意到这个疏忽。

Sense.DEF: a period of time between two events
Sense.EXAMPLE: The usual time lapse between request and delivery is two days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由订购到交货一般需要两天时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lapse of about ten seconds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约十秒钟的间隔

Sense.DEF: to gradually come to an end or to stop for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conversation lapsed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话慢慢地停了下来。

Sense.DEF: if a contract, agreement etc lapses, it comes to an end, usually because an agreed time limit has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your booking will automatically lapse unless you confirm it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不加以确认﹐您的预订将自动失效。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a contract or agreement runs out rather than lapses.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们说合同或协议失效时通常用 run out﹐而不用 lapse
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His club membership had run out.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的俱乐部会员资格已经终止。

Sense.DEF: to stop believing in or following a religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: those people who have lapsed from the practice of their religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经放弃自己宗教习俗的那些人

Sense.DEF: if a period of time lapses, it passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many years had lapsed since her first visit to Wexford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 距她第一次到韦克斯福德已经过去好多年了。

Sense.DEF: to go into a quiet or less active state
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐失去知觉/陷入沉默/进入睡眠等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lapsed into a coma and died two days later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他陷入昏迷﹐两天后去世了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alison lapsed into puzzled silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾利森一头雾水﹐不作声了。

Sense.DEF: to begin to behave or speak in a way that you did before
Sense.TRAN: 恢复〔以前的行为方式或说话方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lapsed back into her old ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又回到老样子了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Occasionally he lapsed into his native German.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偶尔也会换回母语德语来表达。

Sense.DEF: to get into a worse state or become worse
Sense.TRAN: 陷入﹐进入〔更糟糕的状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Following his death, the Empire lapsed into chaos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死后﹐帝国陷入混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His poetry often lapses into sentimentality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的诗歌经常流于伤感。

Sense.DEF: no longer having the beliefs you used to have, especially religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 背弃的﹐背离的〔尤指宗教信仰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lapsed Catholic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个背弃信仰的天主教徒

Sense.DEF: a small computer that you can carry with you
Sense.TRAN: 笔记本电脑﹐便携式电脑

Sense.DEF: a small black and white European bird with raised feathers on its head
the act or crime of stealing
a tree that looks like a pine tree but drops its leaves in winter
white fat from pigs that is used in cooking
to put small pieces of bacononto meat before cooking it
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹调前〕把小块腌肉片铺在〔其他肉〕上

Sense.DEF: to include a lot of something, especially something that is not necessary, in a speech, piece of writing, plan etc
Sense.TRAN: 在〔讲话﹑文章﹑计划等〕中大量使用[穿插]某类词语〔尤指没有必要这样做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech larded with Biblical quotations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿插很多《圣经》引文的讲话

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone who is fat
a small room or large cupboard for storing food in a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔家中的〕食品贮藏室﹔食品贮藏柜

Sense.DEF: big in size, amount, or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Los Angeles is the second largest city in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛杉矶是美国的第二大城市。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The T-shirt comes in Small, Medium and Large.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种T恤有小号﹑中号和大号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large ovenproof pan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只耐热的大烤盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: large sums ofmoney
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大笔的钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: those who drink large amounts of coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡喝得很多的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large number of students have signed up for the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多学生报名读这门课程。

Sense.DEF: a large person is tall and often fat
if a dangerous person or animal is at large, they have escaped from somewhere or have not been caught
Sense.TRAN: 〔危险人物或动物〕在逃的﹐未被捕获的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The escaped prisoners are still at large.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越狱犯依然在逃。

Sense.DEF: people in general
Sense.TRAN: 全部人口/全部民众/全社会/全世界等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chemical pollution poses a threat to the population at large.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学污染对全部人口造成了威胁。

Sense.DEF: more general facts, situations, or questions related to something
Sense.TRAN: 更大的问题/更广泛的局势
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book helps to explain the larger picture in the Middle East.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书有助于解释中东地区更广泛的局势。

Sense.DEF: mostly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their success was due in large part to their ability to speak Spanish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的成功主要归功于他们会说西班牙语。

Sense.DEF: used when someone has appeared or is present in a place where you did not expect to see them
Sense.TRAN: 确确实实(就在眼前)〔用于表示没有料到某人的出现〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I turned a corner and there was Joe, as large as life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我转过弯﹐乔居然就在我的眼前。

Sense.DEF: someone who is larger than life is very amusing or exciting in an attractive way
Sense.TRAN: 引人注目的﹐与众不同的

Sense.DEF: used when talking generally about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charities, by and large, do not pay tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈善机构一般来说无需缴税。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself, especially in a way that involves drinking alcohol, dancing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s a picture of us larging it up in Brighton last summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们去年夏天在布赖顿狂欢时拍的照片。

Sense.DEF: the lower part of your bowels where food is changed into solid waste matter
mostly or mainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一天真累人﹐主要是因为等得无聊。

Sense.DEF: using or involving a lot of effort, people, supplies etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large-scale rescue operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模的营救行动

Sense.DEF: a large-scale map, model etc is drawn or made bigger than usual, so that more details can be shown
Sense.TRAN: 〔地图﹑模型等〕大型的﹐用大比例尺制作的

Sense.DEF: when someone gives money or gifts to people who have less than they do, or the money or gifts that they give
Sense.TRAN: 慷慨(的赠与)﹔赠款﹔赠送之物

Sense.DEF: fairly big
played or sung slowly and seriously
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏或演唱〕缓慢而庄严的[地]

Sense.DEF: a lasso
a small brown singing bird with long pointed wings
something that you do to amuse yourself or as a joke

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I only went along for a lark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟着一起去只是为了好玩。

Sense.LEXUNIT: blow/sod/bugger etc that for a lark
Sense.DEF: used when you stop doing something or refuse to do something because it needs too much effort
Sense.TRAN: 开玩笑〔用于某事太费精力而不想干时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paint the whole room? Sod that for a lark!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆整个房间？ 开什么玩笑！

Sense.DEF: used to describe an activity that you think is silly or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Salad again? How long are you going to keep up this healthy eating lark?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又是色拉？你这种没意义的“健康”饮食法还要保持多久？

Sense.DEF: to get up very early
to have fun by behaving in a silly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of boys were larking about in the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个男孩在泳池里嬉闹。

Sense.DEF: a young insect with a soft tube-shaped body, which will later become an insect with wings
an illness which makes talking difficult because your larynx and throat are swollen
the part in your throat where your voice is produced
a type of Italian food made with flat pieces of pasta, meat, or vegetables, and cheese
Sense.TRAN: 意大利卤汁宽面条﹐意大利千层面

Sense.DEF: showing strong sexual desire, or making someone feel this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lascivious wink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色迷迷的眨眼

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that produces a powerful narrow beam of light that can be used in medical operations, to cut metals, or to make patterns of light for entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLE: laser surgery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光(外科)手术

Sense.DEF: a beam of light produced by a laser
a disklike a CD which can be read by laser light and used in computers or to watch films
a small piece of equipment that produces a laser beam, used by teachers and people who are giving talks in order to point at things on a map, board etc
a machine connected to a computer system which prints by using laser light
to tie something tightly to something else with a rope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The oars were lashed to the sides of the boat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桨拴在船的两侧。

Sense.DEF: if the wind, sea etc lashes something, it hits it with violent force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨浪拍打着海堤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wind lashed violently against the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风猛烈吹打着大门。

Sense.DEF: to hit a person or animal very hard with a whip, stick etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oliver lashed the horses to go faster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利弗快马加鞭。

Sense.DEF: if an animal lashes its tail, or its tail lashes, it moves it from side to side quickly and strongly, especially because it is angry
to criticize someone angrily – used especially in newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Democrats lashed Republican plans, calling them extreme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党猛烈抨击共和党的计划﹐说是太极端了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gallins lashed back at those who accused him of corruption.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加林斯对指控他贪污腐败的人进行了回击。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly speak angrily to someone or criticize someone angrily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Olson lashed out at the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥尔森痛斥媒体。

Sense.DEF: to try to hit someone with a series of violent uncontrolled movements

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She would suddenly lash out at other children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会突然打起其他孩子来。

Sense.DEF: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were each given fifty lashes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每人挨了50鞭。

Sense.DEF: one of the hairs that grow around the edges of your eyes
a sudden or violent movement like that of a whip
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a lash of its tail, the lion sprang at its prey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮子尾巴一甩﹐朝猎物猛扑过去。

Sense.DEF: the thin piece of leather at the end of a whip
drinking a lot of alcohol in pubs or bars
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went out on the lash last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们昨天晚上出去喝了个痛快。

Sense.DEF: a punishment in which someone is hit with a whip
a rope that fastens something tightly to something else
a large amount of food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 大量的某物〔指食品或饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: apple pie with lashings of cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加了许多奶油的苹果馅饼

Sense.DEF: a girl or young woman – used especially in Scotland and the north of England
Sense.TRAN: 女孩﹐少女〔尤为苏格兰和英格兰北部地区使用〕

Sense.DEF: tiredness and lack of energy or interest
a rope with one end tied in a circle, used to catch cattle and horses, especially in the western US
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指美国西部套捕牛﹑马用的〕套索

Sense.DEF: to catch an animal using a lasso
most recent or nearest to the present time
Sense.TRAN: 最近的﹐最近一段时间的﹐最近一次的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t seen him since the last meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从上次会面后﹐我再没有见到他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you see the game on TV last night?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚你看电视播出的比赛了没有？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law was passed last August.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法律是去年8月份通过的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interest in golf has grown rapidly in the last ten years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去十年里﹐人们对高尔夫球的兴趣一下子浓厚起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Things have changed since the last time the most recent occasion you were here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上次来这里之后﹐情况已经变了。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有看这本书的最后一章。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next meeting will be held in the last week in June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下次会议将于6月的最后一个星期举行。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the last person/thing etc to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna was the last person to see him alive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜是最后一个见到他还活着的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: last except for one other, two others etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: on the last but one day of his trial
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受审前的倒数第二天

GramExa.GLOSS: last except for one other
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the second to last paragraph
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒数第二段

Sense.DEF: remaining after all others have gone, been used etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have the last piece of cake?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把最后一块蛋糕吃了可以吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you mean all of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the money was gone; every last penny of it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的钱都花完了﹐一分都没剩。

Sense.DEF: the latest possible time before something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Travelers will find it hard to get a hotel room at the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游者会发现很难在最后一刻订到房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never makes a decision until almost the last moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来都是等到差不多最后一刻才作决定。

Sense.DEF: used to make a strong negative statement about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 最不可能的人/事物﹔最不想要的人/事物﹔最不适当的人/事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s the last person I’d expect to meet in a disco I would not expect to meet her in a disco at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么也想不到会在迪斯科舞厅遇到她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money was the last thing I cared about right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前﹐钱对我来说是最无所谓的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The last thing she needed was for me to start crying too.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最不希望看到我也哭。

Sense.DEF: to be the final thing in a series of annoying things that makes someone very angry
Sense.TRAN: 成为使人不堪忍受的最后一件事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d broken his promise again, and it was the last straw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又一次食言﹐这让人再也无法忍受下去了。

Sense.DEF: at the very end of the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a couple of these pills last thing at night to help you sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上睡前吃几颗这种药丸帮助睡眠。

Subsense.DEF: very tired
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sarah looks as if she’s on her last legs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉看上去似乎很疲惫。

Subsense.DEF: very ill and likely to die soon

Sense.DEF: old or in bad condition, and likely to stop working soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s on its last legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车已经旧得不能用了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the last word in sth
Sense.DEF: to be the best, most modern, or most comfortable example of something
Sense.TRAN: 在某方面是最好[现代﹐舒适]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the last word in luxury holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是最豪华的度假了。

Section.SECHEADING: THE ONE BEFORE THIS ONE 上一个[次]

Exponent.DEF: most recent or nearest to the present time
Exponent.TRAN: 最近一次的﹐最近一段时间的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His last film was much better.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的上一部电影要好得多。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It rained all day last Saturday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期六下了一整天的雨。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The last time I saw her was two years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上一次见到她是在两年前。

Exponent.DEF: before this one, or before the one that you are talking about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: See the diagram in the previous chapter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 参见上一章的示意图。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His previous records had all been jazz records.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他之前的唱片都是爵士乐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How much were you earning in your previous job?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上一份工作能挣多少钱？

Exponent.DEF: existing or having a particular position in the past, but not now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the former Soviet Union
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 前苏联
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the former US president
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国前总统
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Interest rates are unlikely to return to their former level.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率不太可能回到先前的水平。

Exponent.DEF: used about a person or thing that existed in the past, but has been replaced by a newer one
Exponent.TRAN: 以前的﹐过去的〔已被替代的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an old boyfriend
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前的男友
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The old model was much slower.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧型号要慢得多。

Section.SECHEADING: THE ONE THAT COMES AT THE END 最后的

Exponent.DEF: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time does the last train leave?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一班列车几点发车？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our house is the last one on the right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家的房子是右面最后一幢。

Exponent.DEF: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s the final game of the championship tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天是本届锦标赛的决赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the final scene of the film
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影最后的场景

Exponent.DEF: used about the last part of a long period of time, or of an event, book etc that has been exciting or interesting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the closing years of the twentieth century 20
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世纪最后几年
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Barnes scored the winning goal in the closing minutes of the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴恩斯在比赛结束前几分钟攻入制胜一球。

Exponent.DEF: used about the last part of a piece of writing, a speech, or an organized event, that ends it in a definite way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the concluding section of the report
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的结束部分
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the judge’s concluding remarks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官的结语

Exponent.DEF: the one before the last one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the penultimate chapter
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒数第二章

Sense.DEF: most recently before now
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I last saw her, she was working in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上次见到她时﹐她正在纽约工作。

Sense.DEF: after everything or everyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who is speaking last?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁最后一个发言？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add the flour last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后加面粉。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when giving a final point or piece of information
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last of all, I’d like to thank everyone for coming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐我要感谢各位的光临。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning the last person or thing in a list, to emphasize that they are still important
Sense.TRAN: 最后但同样重要的(一点)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last but not least, let me introduce Jane, our new secretary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后但同样重要的一件事﹐让我来介绍我们的新秘书简。

Sense.DEF: the person or thing that comes after all the others
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think this box is the last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想这箱子是最后一个。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the first to arrive and the last to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到得最早﹐走得最晚。

Sense.DEF: if something happens at last, it happens after you have been hoping, waiting, or working for it a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last it was time to leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终于到了要走的时候。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We reached the summit at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于到达了山顶。

Sense.DEF: the day, week etc before the one that has just finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent the letter off the week before last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是上上个星期把信寄出的。

Sense.DEF: the remaining parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: John ate the last of the bread at lunchtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭的时候﹐约翰把最后一点面包吃掉了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb hasn’t heard the last of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: if you have not heard the last of someone or something, they may return and cause problems for you in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We haven’t heard the last of football violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球暴力事件还会发生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will never hear the last of sth
Sense.DEF: if you will never hear the last of something, someone will be angry with you about it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 某人会被某事没完没了地纠缠
Sense.EXAMPLE: If my mother sees me, I’ll never hear the last of this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈要是看到我﹐肯定和我没完。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone the most recent news that you know about a person or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last I heard, she was at college studying law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近听到的消息是她在大学里攻读法律。

Sense.DEF: until the end of an event or the end of someone’s life
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in 1987, insisting to the last he was innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他1987年去世﹐至死都坚称自己是清白的。

Sense.DEF: to continue for a particular length of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hot weather lasted for the whole month of June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六月份炎热的天气持续了整整一个月。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each lesson lasts an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每堂课上一小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceasefire didn’t last long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停火没能持续多久。

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist, be effective, or remain in good condition for a long time
Sense.TRAN: (使)继续存在﹐(使)保持良好状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: This good weather won’t last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种好天气不会持续很久。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good coat will last you ten years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件好外套你可以穿上十年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut flowers will last longer if you put flower food in the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在水里加花肥﹐剪下的鲜花可以养更长时间。

Sense.DEF: to manage to remain in the same situation, even when this is difficult
