Sense.EXAMPLE: They won’t be able to last much longer without fresh supplies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有新的补给﹐他们维持不了多久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you go into the job with that attitude, you won’t last long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你带着那种态度去工作﹐是干不长久的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She feared she might not be able to last out the afternoon in court without fainting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心自己无法在法庭上坚持一个下午不晕倒。

Sense.DEF: to be enough for someone for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The batteries should last for 20 hours playing time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电池应该足够你玩20小时的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We only had $50 to last us the rest of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只剩下50美元﹐得撑过这个月。

Sense.DEF: a piece of wood or metal shaped like a human foot, used by someone who makes and repairs shoes
the time when customers in a bar can order one more drink before the bar closes
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒吧快打烊时〕购买最后一杯的时间

Sense.DEF: a final attempt to achieve something before it is too late
Sense.EXAMPLE: The negotiators made a last-ditch effort to reach an agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判者为达成协议作了最后的努力。

Sense.DEF: a final effort, event etc at the end of a long period of work, a life etc
Sense.TRAN: 最后一次努力﹐最后一次拼搏
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s made it clear that this Olympics, his third, will be his last hurrah.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明确表示﹐这一届奥运会是他第三次参加奥运会﹐也将是他最后的一次拼搏机会。

Sense.DEF: strong enough, well enough planned etc to continue for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reforms will bring lasting benefits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革将带来长久的利益。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their generosity made a lasting impression on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的慷慨给我留下了难忘的印象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solution that would bring lasting peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将带来持久和平的解决方案

Sense.DEF: the time after death when everyone is judged by God for what they have done in life, according to Christianity and some other religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教等宗教所称的上帝对人类的〕末日审判﹐最终审判(日)

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone the last thing at the end of a list or a series of statements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lastly, could I ask all of you to keep this information secret?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐我请求各位对这一消息保密。

Sense.DEF: happening or done as late as possible before something else happens
Sense.TRAN: 最后一分钟的﹐紧要关头的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few last-minute changes to the script
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲稿在最后一刻的几处改动

Sense.DEF: a surname

Head.HWD: Last Night of the Proms, the

Sense.DEF: last concert of the Proms, a series of concerts held each summer in the Royal Albert Hall in London. The second part of the concert always consists of the same tunes and songs, and the people who go to the concert join in with the singing. Some of them wear silly hats and have their faces painted. The concert ends with the patriotic song Land of Hope and Glory, and many people sing it while waving union jacksBritish national flags.
Sense.TRAN: 漫步音乐会最后一晚的演出〔每年夏季在伦敦举行的漫步音乐会的最后一场。 音乐会下半部分演奏的多是为人熟悉的曲目﹐并以爱国歌曲《希望和荣耀之土》作结。 观众都参与伴唱﹐并挥舞国旗〕

Sense.DEF: the time when customers in a bar or pubcan order one more drink before the bar closes
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒吧快打烊时〕购买最后一杯的时间

Sense.DEF: the tune played on a bugleat British military funerals, or to call soldiers back to camp for the night
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕军人葬礼号﹔军营熄灯号

Sense.DEF: the ceremony performed in some religions, especially the Catholic religion, for people who are dying

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=latitude 纬度

Sense.DEF: a small metal or plastic object used to keep a door, gate, or window closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gwen lifted the latch and opened the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温拉起门闩﹐把门打开。

Sense.DEF: a type of lock for a door that you can open from the inside by turning a handle, but that you need a key to open from the outside

GramExa.GLOSS: shut but not locked
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray went out, leaving the door on the latch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷出去了﹐把门合上但没锁。

Sense.DEF: to fasten a door, gate, or window with a latch
Sense.TRAN: 用碰(簧)锁锁上﹔用插销插上

Sense.DEF: to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s so thick it took him ages to latch on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很笨﹐花了很久才弄明白。

Sense.DEF: to become very interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just latch on to the latest management fads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要只顾着追逐最新出现的时髦管理理念。

Sense.DEF: to follow someone and keep trying to talk to them, get their attention etc, especially when they would prefer to be left alone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He latched onto Sandy at the party and wouldn’t go away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在派对上他缠住桑迪不放。

Sense.DEF: to hold tightly to something with your hand, mouth etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby latching on to its mother’s breast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧紧咬住母亲乳头的婴儿

Sense.DEF: a key that opens a lock on an outside door of a house or an apartment
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子或公寓大门的〕碰锁钥匙

Sense.DEF: a child whose parents both work and who spends time alone in the house after school
Sense.TRAN: 挂钥匙的儿童〔指父母皆工作﹑放学后独自在家的孩子〕

Sense.DEF: arriving, happening, or done after the time that was expected, agreed, or arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I’m late – I overslept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐来晚了——我睡过头了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re half an hour late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你迟到了半个小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was even later than usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车到得甚至比平时还晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We apologize for the late departure of flight AZ709.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为AZ709航班延误起飞表示歉意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are penalties if loan repayments are late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逾期偿还贷款会被处以罚金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cheryl was late for school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢里尔上学迟到了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve never been late with the rent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从来不拖欠租金。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the part near the end of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a late eighteenth century building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢18世纪末的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul’s in his late forties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗快50岁了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the late 1980s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代末期
Sense.EXAMPLE: By late afternoon, she had done 10 drawings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到傍晚的时候﹐她已经画好了10幅画。

Sense.DEF: to arrive or do something after the time when something could or should have been done
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shouted a warning but it was too late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声警告﹐但为时已晚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are we too late to get tickets?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是不是太晚了﹐买不到票了？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was too late to turn back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在回头已经太晚。

Sense.DEF: happening or done after the usual or normal time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a late breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃得晚的早餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The harvest was late this year because of the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为下雨﹐今年收割晚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked tired – too many late nights nights when she went to bed after the normal time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去很累——熬夜太多了。

Sense.DEF: near the end of a day
Sense.EXAMPLE: the late movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜场电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s late – I’d better go home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很晚了﹐我还是回家吧。

Sense.DEF: dead

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs. Moore’s late husband
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆尔太太已故的丈夫

Subsense.DEF: a child who develops socially, emotionally, or physically at a later age than other children
someone who does not become successful until they are older

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s (a little/bit) late in the day (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to show disapproval because someone has done something too late
Sense.TRAN: (做某事)已(有点)晚了﹐已经(有点)来不及
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit late in the day to start having objections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在才开始反对有点晚了。

Sense.DEF: used about someone who has died fairly recently
Sense.TRAN: 故去前住在某地的〔用于指最近故去的某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billy Hicks, late of this parish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久前故去的本教区的比利·希克斯

RunOn.EXAMPLE: despite the lateness of the hour

Exponent.DEF: arriving or happening after the time that was expected or arranged
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry I’m late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我迟到了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bus was late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车晚了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Spring seems to be very late this year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的春天好像来得很晚。

Exponent.DEF: not arriving or doing something at the time that was expected or arranged
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He never hands his homework in on time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不按时交作业。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If we don’t leave on time, we’ll miss the flight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我们不准时出发﹐就赶不上飞机了。

Exponent.DEF: not done or happening by the expected time – used especially about payments that are late or library books that should have been returned
Exponent.TRAN: 到期未付[还﹐做]的〔尤指付款或还书〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your rent is three weeks overdue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经拖欠租金三个星期了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to pay a £3 fine on some overdue library books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有几本图书馆的书到期没有归还﹐得罚3英镑。

Exponent.DEF: to be late in doing something that you have to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t come out because I’m behind with my English essay.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能出去﹐我英文作文都要写不完了。

Exponent.DEF: to be made late for a meeting, appointment etc by something that happens, especially by bad traffic
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was held up by a traffic jam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因为交通堵塞被耽搁了。

Exponent.DEF: to be prevented from arriving, leaving, or happening at the expected time – often used about public transport
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The flight was delayed by bad weather.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 航班因天气恶劣而延误了。

Exponent.DEF: given or done late – used especially about something that someone has forgotten or failed to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a belated birthday card
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到的生日卡
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m still hoping for a belated apology from him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然已经迟了﹐但我仍希望听到他的一声道歉。

Exponent.DEF: arriving or happening late
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a habitually tardy person
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惯于迟到的人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tardy decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟来的决定

Exponent.DEF: to have not made one or more regular payments at the time when you should
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One in eight mortgage payers are in arrears.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有八分之一的按揭贷款者拖欠还款。

Sense.DEF: after the usual time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stores are open later on Thursdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店星期四开门较晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen has to work late tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦今晚得工作到很晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you stay late?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以晚点走吗？

Sense.DEF: after the arranged or expected time
Sense.TRAN: 迟﹐晚﹔迟于安排[预期]的时间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus came ten minutes late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车晚到了十分钟。

Sense.DEF: after the time when something could or should have been done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advice came too late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠告来得太晚了。

Sense.DEF: near to the end of a period of time or an event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wedding took place late in May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼在5月底举行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not a place to walk in late at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深夜不要在那地方走。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise that something considered old-fashioned was still happening so recently
Sense.TRAN: 〔过时的东西〕到…的时候仍然在发生〔表示惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Capital punishment was still used in Britain as late as the 1950s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到20世纪50年代﹐英国仍未废除死刑。

Sense.DEF: recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Birth rates have gone down of late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近出生率下降了。

Sense.DEF: if you do something late in life, you do it at an older age than most people do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事〕比一般人年岁大一点

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are glad someone has done something, or to say that they should do something even though they are late
late-breaking news concerns events that happen just before a news broadcast or just before a newspaper is printed
someone who arrives late
recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: What have you been doing lately?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最近在干什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lately, I’ve had trouble sleeping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近我睡眠有问题。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Latelyis usually used with perfect tenses, not with the simple past tense.
F2NBox.TRAN: lately 通常和完成时连用﹐而不和一般过去时连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ve been very busy lately (NOT 不说 I was very busy lately).

Sense.DEF: happening late at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: late-night television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜电视节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: late-night shopping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深夜购物

Sense.DEF: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The virus remains latent in the body for many years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒会在体内潜伏许多年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: latent aggression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜在的侵略

Sense.DEF: after the time you are talking about or after the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going out for a bit – I’ll see you later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出去一会儿——回头见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became Senator two years later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年后他成了参议员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The baby died later that night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天后半夜婴儿就死了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dentist could fit you in later in the week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙医会把你安排在本周晚些时候就诊。

Sense.DEF: at some time after the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t eat all of this – I’ll finish it later on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃不下这么多——我过后再吃完吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something must be done by a particular time in the future
Sense.TRAN: 不得晚于某时﹐须早于某时
Sense.EXAMPLE: Completed entry forms should arrive not later than 31st July.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 填写完毕的参赛表格须于7月31日前递交。

Sense.DEF: coming in the future or after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The role of marketing is dealt with in a later chapter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场营销的作用会在后面的章节中述及。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The launch was postponed to a later date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发射被延期。

Sense.DEF: more recent
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine has been greatly improved in later models.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几款新型号的引擎作了很大的改进。

Sense.DEF: when someone is older
Sense.EXAMPLE: Using a sunscreen when you are young helps you to have healthy skin in later years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻时使用防晒油能让你在年老时拥有健康的肌肤。

Sense.DEF: relating to the sides of something, or movement to the side
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wall is weak and requires lateral support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙体不坚固﹐需要从侧面加以支撑。

Sense.DEF: relating to positions, jobs, relationships etc that are at the same level or rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔职位﹑工作﹑关系等〕平级的﹐同级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees can expect lateral moves to different departments, to gain experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员可以要求平级调动到不同部门﹐以增加经验。

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking in which you use your imagination to see relationships between things that are not normally thought of together
goodbye
the most recent or the newest
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the latest gossip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近所有的流言蜚语
Sense.EXAMPLE: His latest film is one of the funniest he’s ever made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的这部影片是他最搞笑的电影之一。

Sense.DEF: the most recent or newest thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wednesday’s session was the latest in a series of planning meetings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期三的会议是最近的一次策划会议。

GramExa.GLOSS: the most modern equipment
GramExa.EXAMPLE: using the latest in medical technology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用最新的医疗技术

Sense.DEF: no later than the time mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be back by 11 o’clock at the latest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最迟11点会回来。

Sense.DEF: a thick white liquid produced by some plants, especially the rubber tree, and used in making rubber, paint, glue etc
Sense.TRAN: 胶乳﹔〔尤指橡胶树的〕橡浆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doctor’s latex gloves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副医用胶乳手套

Sense.DEF: an artificial substance similar to latex
a long flat narrow piece of wood used in building to support plastermaterial used to cover walls
a machine that shapes wood or metal, by turning it around and around against a sharp tool
a white mass of bubbles produced by mixing soap in water
a white mass that forms on a horse’s skin when it has been sweating
to get very anxious or upset about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time Alan called, Jody had worked herself into a lather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到艾伦来电话﹐乔迪已经急得发慌了。

Sense.DEF: very worried, upset, or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in a lather of anticipation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他焦急地期盼着。

Sense.DEF: to produce a lather
Sense.EXAMPLE: This soap lathers really well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种肥皂泡沫真是丰富。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with lather
the language used in ancient Rome
someone from Latin America
someone from a Southern European country whose language developed from Latin, for example Spain, Portugal, or Italy
Sense.TRAN: 〔南欧〕拉丁语系国家〔如西班牙﹑葡萄牙﹑意大利等〕的人

Sense.DEF: relating to the Latin language
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Latin inscription
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉丁语碑文

Sense.DEF: from or relating to South America
Sense.EXAMPLE: Latin music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉丁美洲音乐

Sense.DEF: from or relating to Southern European countries whose languages developed from Latin, for example Spain, Portugal, or Italy
a woman in the US whose family comes from Latin America
relating to South or Central America, or its people
Sense.TRAN: 拉丁美洲的﹔拉丁美洲人的

Sense.DEF: a man in the US whose family comes from Latin America. The plural ‘Latinos’ can mean a group of men and women, or just men
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国的〕拉丁美洲男子〔复数 Latinos可指一群男女或只指男性〕

Sense.DEF: the distance north or south of the equatorthe imaginary line around the middle of the world, measured in degrees
an area at a particular latitude
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the planet’s southernmost latitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的最南纬度地区

Sense.DEF: freedom to choose what you do or say

GramExa.GLOSS: a lot of freedom to choose
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 相当大的/更大的自由度
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pupils enjoy considerable latitude in deciding what they want to study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学生们有相当大的自由度来选择想学的内容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees should have some latitude in organizing their work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员应该有一定的自主度来安排自己的工作。

Sense.DEF: a toilet that is outdoors in a camp or military area
very strong coffee with a lot of steamed milk in it, or a cup of this type of coffee
Sense.TRAN: (一杯)牛奶咖啡﹐(一杯)拿铁咖啡

Sense.DEF: the second of two people or things just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔刚提及的两个人或物中的〕后者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where unemployment and crime are high, it can be assumed that the latter is due to the former.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果某地失业率和犯罪率都很高﹐可以认为后者是前者造成的。

Sense.DEF: being the second of two people or things, or the last in a list just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔两者之中的〕后者的﹔〔刚提到的几个之中的〕最后者的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the latter case, buyers pay a 15% commission.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在后一种情况下﹐买家付15%的佣金。

Sense.DEF: the latter part of a period of time is nearest to the end of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Celebrations are planned for the latter part of November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝活动计划在11月的下半月举行。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that exists now but is like a famous thing or person that existed in the past
Sense.TRAN: 现代版的凡尔赛宫/现代沙皇/现代罗宾汉等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ruled his business empire like a latter-day Tsar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就像现代沙皇一样管理着他的商业帝国。

Sense.DEF: relating to a recent period of time, rather than an earlier one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Latter-day students could never meet the college entrance standards required in the 1940s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的学生永远也达不到20世纪40年代的大学入学水准。

Sense.DEF: recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists have studied the Moon through telescopes, and, latterly, from satellites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家通过望远镜研究月球﹐最近还使用了人造卫星。

Sense.DEF: towards the end of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: O’Rourke retired after a 15-year career with Bisons, latterly as chief executive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥罗克在比森斯公司工作了15年﹐最后在总经理职位上退休。

Sense.DEF: a pattern or structure made of long pieces of wood, plastic etc that cross each other so that the spaces between them are shaped like diamonds
a regular arrangement of objects
a type of window made of many small pieces of glass shaped like diamonds
to praise someone or something
deserving praise, even if not completely successful
Sense.TRAN: 值得称道的﹐值得称颂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laudable attempt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得称道的尝试

Sense.DEF: a substance containing the drug opium,used in the past to control pain and help people to sleep
expressing praise
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laudatory biography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颂扬有加的传记

Sense.DEF: to make sounds with your voice, usually while you are smiling, because you think something is funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria looked at him and laughed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚看着他大笑起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I didn’t know what I was doing,’ she said, laughing at the memory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我做了什么自己都不知道。” 她说道﹐自嘲起自己的记忆力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony was laughing so hard he had to steady himself on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼笑得太厉害了﹐靠着桌子才能让自己站稳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nora laughed so much that she nearly cried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺拉笑得眼泪都快出来了。

GramExa.GLOSS: laugh a lot
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 开怀大笑/哄然大笑/歇斯底里地大笑等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids tumbled around on the floor, laughing hysterically.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们狂笑着在地板上打滚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t help it; he burst out laughing suddenly started laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情不自禁地放声大笑起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the few writers who can make me laugh out loud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几位作家能让我放声大笑﹐他是其中之一。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a voice that shows you are amused
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You look ridiculous!’ Nick laughed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你看起来真可笑！” 尼克笑着说。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not know whether to laugh or cry
Sense.DEF: to feel upset or annoyed about something bad that has happened, but also able to see that there is something funny about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: And when I couldn’t find the passports – honestly, I didn’t know whether to laugh or cry!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 而当我找不到护照的时候——说真的﹐我不知道该笑还是该哭！

Sense.DEF: used when someone has just told you something that is completely untrue, asked for something impossible etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you finish this by tomorrow?’ ‘Don’t make me laugh.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你明天能做完吗？” “别开玩笑了。”

Sense.DEF: something serious that should not be joked about
Sense.TRAN: 严肃的事﹐不是闹着玩的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no laughing matter having to walk by a group of rowdy drunks every night just to get home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天晚上回家都得从一群吵吵闹闹的醉汉身边经过﹐可不是开玩笑的事。

Variant.LEXVAR: be laughed out of town/business etc

Sense.DEF: if a person or idea is laughed out of court etc, the idea is not accepted because people think it is completely stupid
Sense.TRAN: 被一笑了之﹐被置之不理
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t propose that! We’d be laughed out of court!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能那样提议！ 会被人家笑话的！

Sense.DEF: used to say that, even though a situation is annoying or disappointing, you can also see that there is something funny about it
Sense.TRAN: 还是值得一笑〔指尽管情况令人心烦或失望﹐但其中有些事还是很好笑〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: be laughing all the way to the bank
Sense.DEF: to make a lot of money without making much effort
Sense.TRAN: 一路笑着去银行﹐轻松地赚到大钱

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will be laughing on the other side of their face
Sense.DEF: used to say that although someone is happy or confident now, they will be in trouble later
Sense.TRAN: 某人将转笑为哭﹐某人将转喜为忧

Sense.DEF: to be happy or in a good situation, for example because something has had a successful result for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well they paid me, didn’t they, so I’m laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喏﹐他们付钱给我了﹐是不是﹐所以我正高兴着呢。

Sense.DEF: to behave towards someone in a way that shows that you do not respect them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told my sister what I thought, and she just laughed in my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的想法告诉姐姐﹐她竟然当面嘲笑我。

Sense.DEF: to be secretly happy, especially because you have played a trick on someone or criticized them without them knowing

Exponent.DEF: to make sounds with your voice and move your face, because you think that something is funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked so funny that we couldn’t stop laughing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去好滑稽﹐我们都忍不住大笑起来。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh quickly in a high voice, especially in a slightly silly way, or because you are nervous or embarrassed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因紧张或尴尬而〕咯咯笑﹐傻笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A group of teenage girls were giggling in a corner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群十几岁的女孩子在角落里咯咯笑着。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tends to giggle when she meets new people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遇见生人就会傻笑。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh quietly, especially because you are thinking about or reading something funny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was chuckling to himself over an article in the paper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他读着报上一篇文章﹐轻声笑了出来。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh quietly in an unkind or unpleasant way, for example when someone is hurt or embarrassed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Billy stood up and started to sing, and one or two people sniggered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利站起身开始唱歌﹐有一两个人偷偷地笑。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh very loudly, especially with a deep voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I could hear my father roaring with laughter at something on TV.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见父亲被电视上的什么东西引得放声大笑。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh very loudly, especially with a high voice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Patsy chased him down the stairs, shrieking with laughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕齐尖声大笑﹐追着他跑下楼来。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh very loudly – used especially about a group of people laughing together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His plays have made audiences howl with laughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的剧作总让观众狂笑。

Exponent.DEF: laughing so much that you cannot stop
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was such a funny film – it had us all in stitches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影太好笑了﹐惹得我们笑个不停。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh very loudly and without trying to stop yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The audience guffawed at his nonstop jokes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的笑话一个接一个﹐观众笑声不断。

Exponent.DEF: to laugh loudly in an unpleasant way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The old woman cackled at the trouble she was causing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那老妇人惹下了麻烦﹐却嘎嘎大笑。

Sense.DEF: to make unkind or funny remarks about someone, because they have done or said something you think is stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid the other kids will laugh at me because I don’t understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心其他孩子会取笑我不懂。

Sense.DEF: to seem not to care about something that most people would worry about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young offenders just laugh at this sort of sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的罪犯对这种判决根本不在乎。

Sense.DEF: to pretend that something is less serious than it really is by laughing or joking about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knox laughed off rumors that he would be running for mayor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺克斯对自己要竞选市长的传言一笑了之。

Sense.DEF: the act of laughing or the sound you make when you laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a short laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑了一声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What a mess!’ she said, with a laugh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “多乱啊！” 她笑了一声说道。

Sense.DEF: if something is a laugh, you have fun and enjoy yourself when you are doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all went to the beach last night – it was a really good laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们都去海滩了——真好玩啊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The other campers were nice, and we had a great laugh together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他几个露营者人很好﹐我们一起玩得很开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a great holiday with lots of laughs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期很愉快﹐有许多好玩的事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is amusing and fun to be with
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like Peter – he’s a good laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢彼得——他这人很风趣幽默。

Sense.DEF: for fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took the hot-air balloon ride, just for laughs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘热气球飞行﹐纯粹是为了好玩。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is silly or unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 简直是笑话〔用于表示某事荒唐或不可能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Me? Star in a film? That’s a laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我？主演一部电影？简直是笑话。

Sense.DEF: to finally be successful, win an argument etc, after other people have earlier criticized you, defeated you etc
Sense.TRAN: 笑到最后﹐取得最后成功[胜利]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men make jokes about women drivers, but women have the last laugh – their insurance rates are cheaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人嘲笑女人开车﹐但是笑到最后的却是女人她们的保费更低。

Sense.DEF: to be very funny – sometimes used humorously to mean that someone or something is not at all funny
Sense.TRAN: 有趣﹐很好笑〔有时幽默地形容十分无趣〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gave a loud laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大声笑起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be laughed at
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most of his jokes didn’t even get a laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大部分笑话甚至没人发笑。

Collocate.COLLOC: get a laugh out of sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone laugh
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I always managed to get a laugh out of my audience.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是能够逗观众发笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: laugh about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The farmer had a good laugh at our attempts to catch the horse.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们费尽气力想抓住那匹马﹐惹得那农场主哈哈大笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: I want to hear something funny to cheer me up
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tell me what she said – I could use a laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉我她说了些什么——让我开心开心。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We all got a good laugh out of it later.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来我们都觉得它很好笑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a big laugh from the crowd.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群一阵大笑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He let out a nervous little laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他紧张地笑了笑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a deep loud laugh

Sense.DEF: something that is laughable is impossible to believe or be serious about, because it is so silly or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The promises are so far from reality that they are laughable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些承诺严重脱离实际﹐甚至荒唐可笑。

Sense.DEF: a gas that is sometimes used to stop you feeling pain during an operation
Sense.TRAN: 笑气﹐一氧化二氮〔有时在手术中用于止痛〕

Sense.DEF: if something is laughingly called something, the name is a joke, or is not suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news network was laughingly referred to as the ‘Disaster Channel.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新闻网络被戏称为“灾难频道” 。

Sense.DEF: if you do something laughingly, you are laughing while you do it
someone who is a laughing stock has done something so silly that people have no respect for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme has made the U.S. a laughing stock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划让美国成了笑柄。

Sense.DEF: the American form of laughter lines
when people laugh, or the sound of people laughing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foster joined in the laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福斯特也跟着笑了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked shocked, then burst into laughter started laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸的震惊﹐接着便放声大笑起来。

GramExa.GLOSS: laugh very loudly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Audiences roared with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众哄然大笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He shook with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑得浑身发颤。

GramExa.GLOSS: loud laughs
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The comment brought peals of laughter from her classmates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这番话博得了她同学们的阵阵笑声。

Sense.DEF: lines on your skin around your eyes, which can be seen when you laugh
recorded laughter that is used during a television show to make it sound as if people are laughing during the performance
Sense.TRAN: 笑声音轨〔电视节目中使用的预先录制的笑声〕 canned laughter

Sense.DEF: to start something, usually something big or important
Sense.TRAN: 发动﹐发起﹐开始从事〔大型或重要活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了筹集15万美元﹐该组织发起了一场募捐活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The press launched a vicious attack on the President.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界开始对总统进行恶毒攻击。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The book launched his career as a novelist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

Sense.DEF: to make a new product, book etc available for sale for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 把〔新产品﹑新书等〕投放市场﹔出版﹐发行
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company hopes to launch the new drug by next October.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司希望于明年10月前推出这种新药。

Sense.DEF: to put a boat or ship into the water
to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space
Sense.EXAMPLE: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

Sense.DEF: to make a computer program start
Sense.EXAMPLE: Double-click on an icon to launch an application.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双击图标打开一个应用程序。

Sense.DEF: to jump up and forwards into the air with a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 向前猛扑/向上跃起/从…猛扑过去等

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start a description or story, or suddenly start criticizing something
Sense.TRAN: 突然开始〔描述﹑叙述或抨击〕﹐发起
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nelson launched into a blistering criticism of greedy lawyers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳尔逊开始对贪心不足的律师予以猛烈抨击。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just launch into exercise without warming up first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有热身不要立即开始做运动。

Sense.DEF: to start something new, especially something that involves risk
Sense.TRAN: 开始﹐着手〔新事情﹐尤指有风险的事〕

Sense.DEF: when a new product, book etc is made available or made known
Sense.TRAN: 〔新产品的〕投放市场﹔〔新书的〕发行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the launch of a new women’s magazine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本新女性杂志的发行

Sense.EXAMPLE: a new product launch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新产品的推出

Sense.DEF: a large boat with a motor
when a weapon or spacecraft is sent into the sky or into space
an object that is used to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rocket launcher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火箭发射装置

Sense.DEF: a base from which a weapon or spacecraft is sent up into the sky
Sense.TRAN: 〔武器或航天器的〕发射台﹐发射坪

Sense.DEF: an event, group, or activity that helps someone start something
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助某人开始做某事的〕跳板

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellington’s band was a launching pad for many gifted jazz musicians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃林顿的乐队是许多天才爵士乐手的跳板。

Sense.DEF: a place on the Internet that helps you start to find information about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their website is a good launchpad to other sites.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的网站是搜索其他网站的一个很好的导航平台。

Sense.DEF: to put money which has been obtained illegally into legal businesses and bank accounts, so that you can hide it or use it
Sense.TRAN: 洗〔钱〕〔即把非法得来的钱注入合法的生意中或存入银行﹐以便隐藏或使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was jailed of laundering drug money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因帮毒贩洗钱而锒铛入狱。

Sense.DEF: to wash and iron clothes, sheets etc
a place where you can go to wash your clothes in machines that work when you put coins in them
Sense.TRAN: 〔装有投币洗衣机的〕自助洗衣店

Sense.DEF: clothes, sheets etc that need to be washed or have just been washed
Sense.TRAN: 待洗的衣物﹔刚洗过的衣物
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did the laundry washed the clothes etc and hung it out to dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她洗了衣服﹐然后挂出去晾干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben was folding laundry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本正在叠洗好的衣服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pile of dirty laundry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆待洗的脏衣服

Sense.DEF: a place or business where clothes etc are washed and ironed
a large basket that you put dirty clothes in until you wash them
a basket used for carrying clothes that have been or need to be washed
Sense.TRAN: 〔装已洗或待洗衣服的〕洗衣篮

Sense.DEF: a list of a lot of different things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laundry list of criticisms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一长串的批评

Sense.DEF: a shop which sells women’s clothes, as well as things for decorating the home, such as curtains, wallpaper, and material for covering chairs. Laura Ashley materials are usually made of cotton and often have delicate patterns with small flowers, and are often similar to clothes worn by people who lived in the countryside in the past.
Sense.TRAN: 罗兰爱思〔专营女式服饰及家庭装饰用品的企业〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has been given an important prize or honour, especially the nobel prize
Sense.TRAN: 重要奖项〔尤指诺贝尔奖〕获得者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigeria’s Nobel laureate, Wole Soyinka
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼日利亚的诺贝尔奖获得者沃莱·索因卡

Sense.DEF: a small tree with smooth shiny dark green leaves that do not fall in winter
to be satisfied with what you have achieved and therefore stop trying to achieve anything new
Sense.TRAN: 满足于既得成就﹐不求上进

Sense.DEF: to work hard in order not to lose the success that you have achieved
Sense.TRAN: 尽力保住已获得的成功

Sense.DEF: honours that you receive for something you have achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: academic laurels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学术桂冠

Sense.DEF: a lavatory
hot liquid rock that flows from a volcano,or this rock when it has become solid
Sense.TRAN: 〔火山喷出的〕岩浆﹐熔岩﹔火山岩

Sense.DEF: a lamp that has a coloured liquid substance inside it that moves up and down
lavatorial jokes are about going to the toilet
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑话〕与如厕有关的﹐低级粗俗的

Sense.DEF: a toilet or the room a toilet is in
a plant that has grey-green leaves and purple flowers with a strong pleasant smell
a pale purple colour
large, impressive, or expensive
Sense.TRAN: 大量的﹔使人印象深刻的﹔昂贵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a royal palace on a lavish scale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞大的皇宫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lavish lifestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈的生活方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was lavish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物很丰盛。

Sense.DEF: very generous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were always lavish with financial aid in times of crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 危难时刻我们总是慷慨解囊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was always lavish in his praise of my efforts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是大力赞扬我的努力。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们配有大量插图的商品目录

Sense.DEF: to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lavished attention on her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她关怀备至。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hug your children and lavish them with love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥抱你的孩子﹐多多关爱他们。

Sense.DEF: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elected officials ought to obey the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民选官员理应遵守法律。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By law, seat belts must be worn by all passengers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照法律规定﹐所有乘客都必须系安全带。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is illegal under English law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这违反了英国法律。

Sense.DEF: a rule that people in a particular country or area must obey
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws passed by Parliament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会通过的法律

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five people arrested under anti-terrorism laws were released without charge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五名涉嫌违反反恐法被捕的人无罪获释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: European laws on equal opportunities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的均等机会法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The laws against drug use were very strict.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打击吸毒的法律十分严厉。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people respect the law, and crime is controlled by the police, the prison system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are concerned about the breakdown of law and order in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为国家治安陷入瘫痪而担忧。

Sense.DEF: the police
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she may be in trouble with the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她可能惹上警察了。

Sense.DEF: something that always happens in nature or society, or a statement that describes this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the law of supply and demand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 供求定律
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the laws of nature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然规律
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the law of gravity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 万有引力定律

Sense.DEF: law as a subject of study, or the profession of being a lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s studying law in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在伦敦攻读法律。

Sense.DEF: one of the rules which controls a sport or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the laws of football
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球比赛规则

Subsense.DEF: the idea that people should only look after themselves and not care about other people if they want to succeed
the principle that only the strongest creatures will stay alive
Subsense.TRAN: 丛林法则﹐弱肉强食法则﹐优胜劣汰原则

Sense.DEF: the probability that one result will happen as often as another if you try something often enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law of averages says we’ll win at least once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从平均律来看﹐我们至少能赢一次。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a law unto himself/herself etc
Sense.DEF: to behave in an independent way and not worry about the usual rules of behaviour or what other people do or think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boys his age are a law unto themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个年龄的男孩都是我行我素。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take the law into your own hands
Sense.DEF: to do something illegal in order to put right something that you think is not fair, for example by violently punishing someone instead of telling the police
Sense.TRAN: 不通过法律擅自处理﹐用私刑处罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: vigilantes who take the law into their own hands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 擅自执法的治安会成员

Sense.DEF: to go to court in order to settle a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: the right of consumers to go to law if they need to
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者必要时可诉诸法律的权利

Sense.DEF: someone who is above the law does not have to obey the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many ministers seem to regard themselves as being above the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多部长似乎认为自己可以凌驾于法律之上。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who is criticizing you that you are not doing anything wrong
Sense.TRAN: 某事又不犯法〔受到批评时说的话〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: there ought to be a law against sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think something should be accepted or allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: There ought to be a law against cutting off power supplies in the middle of February.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须禁止在2月中旬断电的做法。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is always obeyed without argument

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Citizens have a duty to obey the law.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公民有义务遵守法律。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something illegal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Is the company breaking the law?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司违反法律了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: New Jersey passed a law requiring helmets for scooter riders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新泽西通过一项法律﹐规定骑行低座小摩托车的人必须戴好头盔。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially be made a law
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For a bill to become law, it must be approved by both Houses of Parliament.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法案经议会两院通过之后才能成为法律。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people obey a law
deliberately disobey a law
officially end a law
says that it is not allowed
it is illegal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children knew that shoplifting was against the law.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子知道在商店行窃是违法的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not do illegal things
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The security forces must act within the law.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全部队必须依法行动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the country’s strict anti-tobacco laws
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国严厉的禁烟法规

Collocate.EXAMPLE: an accountant who knows about tax law
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟悉税法的会计师

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: laws concerning crimes
laws concerning disagreements between people, rather than crimes
laws that all countries agree to obey
the law of the US, not a particular state
the law in a US state
laws that have come from customs and the decisions of judges
law based on previous court cases

Sense.DEF: respectful of the law and obeying it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a law-abiding citizen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位守法公民

Sense.DEF: someone who does something illegal
a room or building where legal cases are judged
the job of making sure that the law is obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: law enforcement agencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执法机关

Sense.DEF: a police officer
a company that provides legal services and employs many lawyers
allowed or recognized by law
Sense.TRAN: 法律许可的﹐法律承认的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not lawful to kill or injure a pet animal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀死或伤害宠物是犯法的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lawful arrest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依法逮捕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his lawful wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的合法妻子

Sense.DEF: not obeying the law, or not controlled by the law
Sense.TRAN: 不守法的﹔不受法律控制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: this increasingly lawless society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个越来越目无法纪的社会
Sense.EXAMPLE: These border areas are among the most lawless regions in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些边境地区是世界上最没有法纪的区域。

Sense.DEF: any elected official responsible for making laws
any officer who is responsible for making sure that the law is obeyed
an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent all morning mowing the lawn cutting the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carefully tended lawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到细心呵护的草坪

Sense.DEF: a fine cloth made from cotton or linen
Sense.TRAN: 上等细棉布﹔上等细麻布

Sense.DEF: a game played on grass in which you try to roll a big ball as near as possible to a smaller ball
a light chair that you use outside, especially one that folds up
a machine that you use to cut grass
a formal party held outside in the afternoon, especially in a large garden
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指下午在大花园里举行的〕草坪招待会﹐花园酒会

Sense.DEF: a part of a university or a special school in the US where you study to become a lawyer after you get your bachelor’s degree
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国已获学士学位的学生为取得律师资格就读的〕法学院

Sense.DEF: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His lawyer filed a lawsuit against the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的律师对市政府提起诉讼。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court
not strict or careful enough about standards of behaviour, work, safety etc
Sense.TRAN: 不严格的﹐疏忽的﹔松散的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has been lax in carrying out its duties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司没有严格履行义务。

Sense.DEF: a medicine or something that you eat which makes your bowels empty easily
the past tense of lie1
to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lay the material flat on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把布料平铺在桌上。

Sense.DEF: to put or fasten bricks, a carpetetc in the correct place, especially on the ground or floor
Sense.TRAN: 砌砖/铺地毯/铺水泥/铺设电缆等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carpet was laid last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯是上个星期铺的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project involved laying an oil pipeline across the desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工程包括铺设一条穿越沙漠的输油管道。

Sense.DEF: if a bird, insect etc lays eggs, it produces them from its body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flies lay their eggs on decaying meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍蝇在腐肉上产卵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cuckoo is able to lay in a range of different nests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鹃能在许多个不同的鸟巢里下蛋。

Sense.DEF: to put the cloth, plates, knives, forks etc on a table, ready for a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was laying the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰正在摆放餐具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she spoke, she was laying him a place at the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一边说﹐一边给他在餐桌上摆放餐具。

Sense.DEF: to provide the conditions that will make it possible for something to happen or be successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mandela helped lay the foundations for a new democratic South Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼德拉为建立新的民主南非打下了基础。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an invention which laid the foundations of modern radio technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一发明为现代无线电技术奠定了基础。

Sense.DEF: to make a statement, give information etc in an official or public way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several proposals have been laid before the committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数项建议已提交委员会。

Sense.DEF: to emphasize something because you believe it is very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political philosophy that lays great stress on individual responsibility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 着重强调个人责任的政治哲学

Sense.DEF: to touch someone with the intention of hurting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swear I didn’t lay a finger on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发誓我没有对他动过一根手指头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you lay one hand on me, I’ll scream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是碰我一下﹐我就要叫了。

Subsense.DEF: to show what something is really like, or stop hiding facts, feelings etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Every aspect of their private life has been laid bare.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们私生活的每一个方面都暴露无遗。

Subsense.DEF: to remove the thing that is covering or hiding something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When the tide goes out, vast stretches of sand are laid bare.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮水退去﹐露出大片大片的沙地。

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes it possible for other people to blame you, criticize you etc
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某物受到责备[批评]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By doing that, he laid himself open to ridicule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那么做招来了大家的嘲笑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Not to have taken action would have laid the department open to charges of negligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是当初这个部门没有采取行动﹐肯定会招来玩忽职守罪的指控。

Sense.DEF: to destroy or damage something, especially in a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战争中〕把某物摧毁[夷为平地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island was laid waste and abandoned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上已经变成一片废墟﹐荒无人烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attack which laid waste to hundreds of villages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把数百个村庄夷为平地的一次进攻

Sense.DEF: to carefully prepare all the details of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are laying plans now in order to be successful in the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在作好打算﹐为的是将来取得成功。

GramExa.GLOSS: plans that have been made carefully
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 安排周密的计划﹐最好的打算
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bad weather can upset even the best-laid travel plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好﹐再好的旅行计划也会被打乱。

Sense.DEF: to say that something belongs to you or say that you deserve something
Sense.TRAN: 声称对某物的拥有权﹔声称有权做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town can lay claim to having the oldest theatre in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇可以说是拥有英国最古老的剧院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one has laid claim to the property.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还没有人来认领此物。

Subsense.DEF: if a group of people lay siege to a place, they try to get control by surrounding it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The armies laid siege to Vienna in 1529.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1529年﹐军队围攻维也纳。

Subsense.DEF: to do everything you can to get someone to talk to you or notice you
Subsense.TRAN: 包围某人〔指企图跟某人说话或引起注意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A group of young men were always at the stage door, trying to lay siege to the girls.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总有一群青年男子聚集在剧场后门﹐想方设法与那些女孩子搭讪。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: All he wants to do is go out and get laid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一心就想着出去和女人上床。

Sense.DEF: to be in a position in which you are flat – some people consider this use to be incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 平躺〔有些人认为此用法错误〕

Sense.DEF: to risk an amount of money on the result of a race, sports game etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She laid £50 on the favourite, Golden Boy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在大热门赛马“金童”身上押了50英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d lay money that he will go on to play for England.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢打赌他会继续为英格兰队效力。

Subsense.DEF: to state something, especially a threat, demand, or criticism, in a very clear way
Subsense.TRAN: 明确表明某事〔尤指威胁﹑要求或批评〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lay it on the line and tell them what’s really been happening.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就实话实说﹐把真相告诉他们。

Subsense.DEF: to risk losing your life, your job etc, especially in order to help someone
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了帮助别人而〕冒…的风险
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve laid myself on the line for him once already.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经冒风险帮过他一回了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lay sth at the door of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to blame something or someone for something
Sense.TRAN: 把某事归咎于某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The continued divisions within the party cannot be laid entirely at his door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内一直存在分歧﹐不能把责任完全推到他的头上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many illnesses are being laid at the door of stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多疾病被认为是压力造成的。

Subsense.DEF: if an illness lays someone low, they are unable to do their normal activities for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been laid low with flu for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因流感病了一星期。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone fall down, or injure them seriously
Subsense.TRAN: 把某人击倒﹔使某人重伤

Sense.DEF: to bury someone after they have died
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was laid to rest beside her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被安葬在她丈夫身边。

Sense.DEF: to finally stop being worried or upset by something from the past

Crossrefto.REFLEX: put/lay your cards on the table

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: lay, lie
F2NBox.EXPL: The verb lay always has an object, except in sense 3. Its basic meaning is ‘put something down on something’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 除义项3之外﹐动词lay均需有一个宾语。 其基本义为 “放置(某物)”
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She lays a silk cloth over the table.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将一块真丝台布铺在桌上 。
F2NBox.EXPL: The verb lie does not have an object. Its basic meaning is ‘be or get into a horizontal position somewhere’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 动词lie不带宾语。 其基本义为 “平放在某处”
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was lying (NOT 不说 laying) on her back.
Lie down here for a while.
F2NBox.EXPL: Lay is also the past tense of lie.
F2NBox.TRAN: lay也是lie的过去式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I lay on the bed and tried to relax.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我躺在床上﹐想放松一下。
F2NBox.EXPL: The past tense of lay is laid.
F2NBox.TRAN: lay的过去式是 laid
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She laid the baby on the bed.

Sense.DEF: to attack someone violently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He laid about his attackers with a stick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用棍子狠揍攻击他的人。

Sense.DEF: to stop using something and put it down, especially so you can do something else
Sense.TRAN: 把…放在一边〔以便做其他事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard had laid aside his book to watch what was happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德放下书﹐去看看发生了什么事情。

Sense.DEF: to stop behaving in a particular way, or stop having particular feelings, especially so you can achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 停止﹐摒弃〔某种行为或情感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the day of the wedding, all arguments between the families were laid aside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼那天﹐两家人停止了一切争吵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a doctor, you often need to lay aside your personal feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名医生﹐你经常得把个人情感放在一边。

Sense.DEF: to keep something, especially money, so you can use it in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d laid aside a few pounds each week from her wages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每个星期都从薪水里拿出几英镑存起来。

Sense.DEF: to officially state something or say that rules, principles etc must be obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式或坚决地〕阐述﹐声明﹔规定
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had already clearly laid down his view in his opening speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在开场白里已经明确表达了自己的观点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The contract laid down that the work must be completed before 2025.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同规定工程必须在2025年之前完成。

Sense.DEF: if people lay down their weapons, they stop fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrorists were urged to lay down their arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子被敦促放下武器。

Sense.DEF: to tell other people what to do, how they should think etc, in a very strong or impolite way
Sense.TRAN: 〔用强硬或粗鲁的方式〕发号施令
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear him laying down the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他在发号施令。

Sense.DEF: to die in order to help other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was even prepared to lay down his life for his friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至愿意为他的朋友舍命。

Sense.DEF: to store something, especially wine, to use in the future
to record your music, for example in a recording studio
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are just about to start laying down tracks for their second album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正准备录制第二张专辑。

Sense.DEF: to get and store a supply of something to use in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes to lay in a few special drinks for the festive season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢留几瓶特别的酒到节庆时喝。

Sense.DEF: to attack or criticize someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside the club, two men were laying into each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部外面有两名男子在打架。

Sense.DEF: to stop employing someone because there is no work for them to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company laid off 250 workers in December.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司在12月份解雇了250名工人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of people have been laid off in the steel industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢铁工业有数百万人遭解雇。

Sense.DEF: to stop using or doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’d better lay off alcohol for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你最好戒酒一段时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to lay off running for several months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只好数月内不再跑步了。

Sense.DEF: to stop annoying someone or hurting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just lay off, will you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别来烦我﹐好不好！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish he’d lay off me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要再来烦我啦！

Sense.DEF: to pass the ball to someone in your team in a game such as football – used in sports reports

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Murphy has the ball and then lays it off to Owen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨菲拿到球后传给了欧文。

Sense.DEF: to provide something such as food, entertainment, or transport for a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 提供﹐安排〔食物﹑娱乐﹑交通等〕﹔款待﹔安排
Sense.EXAMPLE: They laid on a buffet for his farewell party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为他的送别会安排了自助餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bus has been laid on to take you home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经安排好一辆巴士送你们回家。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to do something, especially something that is difficult or something they will not want to do
Sense.TRAN: 把〔困难或不想做的事情〕推给某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to lay this on you, but we need someone to give a talk at the conference next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉把这个任务交给你﹐不过下星期的会议上我们需要有人发言。

Subsense.DEF: to praise someone or something too much, especially in order to get what you want
to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

Sense.DEF: to spread something out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lay out the map on the table and let’s have a look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把地图铺在桌上﹐我们来看看吧。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or plan a building, town, garden etc
Sense.TRAN: 布置﹐设计〔建筑﹑城镇﹑花园等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden is laid out in a formal pattern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个花园是按规则的几何图形设计的。

Sense.DEF: to describe or explain something clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The financial considerations are laid out in a booklet called ‘How to Borrow Money’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要考虑的经济因素在一本标题为“如何借钱的小册子中写得很清楚。

Sense.DEF: to spend money, especially a lot of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the point in laying out money on something you’ll only wear once?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花那么多的钱买一件你只穿一次的东西有什么意义呢？

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they fall down and become unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the guards had been laid out and the other was missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个卫兵被打昏﹐另一个则不知去向。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a dead body so that it can be buried
to stay somewhere for a short time before continuing your trip
to have to stay in bed because you are ill or injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was laid up for a week with flu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了流感﹐卧床一个星期。

Sense.DEF: to stop using a boat or vehicle, especially while it is being repaired
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因正在维修〕停止使用〔船或车〕﹔使〔船只〕入坞维修﹔使〔车辆〕闲置不用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the yachts were laid up for the winter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分游艇冬季都入坞检修了。

Sense.DEF: to collect and store something to use in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: We started laying up firewood for the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始储备柴火准备过冬。

Subsense.DEF: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject
Subsense.EXAMPLE: lay witnesses
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通证人﹐非专家证人

Subsense.DEF: not in an official position in the church
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a lay preacher
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俗世的传道人﹐平信徒传道人

Subsense.DEF: the situation that exists at a particular time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Get the lay of the land before you make any decisions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先了解情况再作决定。

Subsense.DEF: the appearance of an area of land, for example the way it slopes

Sense.DEF: the appearance of something and where each part of it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr. Lowe will give you the lay of the camp and tell you what we’re going to be doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛先生会给你介绍营地的情况﹐告诉你我们要做些什么。

Sense.DEF: to be a good, quick etc person to have sex with
a poem or song
a lazy person who avoids work
Sense.TRAN: 游手好闲之徒﹐不务正业的人﹐懒人

Sense.DEF: a method of buying goods in which you give the seller of the goods a small amount of money to keep the goods until you can pay the full price
Sense.TRAN: 分期预付购货法〔指预付订金留货﹑付足货款后再交货的购买方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put the dress on layaway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我付订金预购了这条裙子。

Sense.DEF: a space next to a road where vehicles can stop
an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A thick layer of dust lay on the furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具上蒙了一层厚厚的灰尘。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The moon was shining through a thin layer of cloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光透过薄薄的云层照射下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing many layers of clothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Arrange the peppers, garlic and tomatoes in layers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把辣椒﹑蒜和番茄一层一层铺好。

Sense.DEF: one of several different levels in a complicated orga-nization, system, set of ideas etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔复杂的机构﹑制度﹑思想等的〕层次﹔阶层

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are operating with fewer layers of management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在的管理层简化多了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are multiple layers of meaning in the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事有多层含义。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the multi-layered nature of organizations they have many layers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机构的多层次性

Sense.DEF: to make a layer of something or put something down in layers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Layer the raw sliced vegetables in a shallow baking dish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把生蔬菜片一层层叠地放在浅烤盘里。

Sense.DEF: to cut someone’s hair so that the hair on top is in shorter lengths than the lower hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have layered, shoulder-length brown hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一头富有层次的褐色齐肩长发。

Sense.DEF: a complete set of clothing and other things that a new baby needs
someone who is not trained in a particular subject or type of work, especially when they are being compared with someone who is
Sense.EXAMPLE: To the layman laymen in general all these plants look pretty similar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对外行的人来说﹐这些植物看起来都很相似。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t understand what the doctor says, ask to have it explained in layman’s terms in simple language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你听不懂医生的话﹐就请他用通俗易懂的语言来解释一下。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not a priest but is a member of a church
Sense.TRAN: 非神职信徒﹐平信徒﹐普通信徒

Sense.DEF: an occasion when an employer ends a worker’s employment for a temporary period of time because there is not enough work
Sense.TRAN: 〔因工作不多而导致的〕临时解雇﹐裁员
Sense.EXAMPLE: more lay-offs in the car industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车行业更多的裁员

Sense.DEF: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged
Sense.TRAN: 〔城镇﹑花园或建筑物的〕布局﹐设计

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the layout of the park
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园的布局

Sense.EXAMPLE: All the flats in the building had the same layout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼里所有的公寓布局都是一样的。

Sense.DEF: the way in which writing and pictures are arranged on a page

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the layout of a business letter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商务信函的格式

Sense.EXAMPLE: page layout software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 版面设计软件

Sense.DEF: a short stay between parts of a journey, especially a long plane journey
a laymanor laywoman
Sense.TRAN: 外行人﹐门外汉﹔普通信徒

Sense.DEF: someone in Christian churches who is not a priest but who has been given authority to lead a religious service
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教礼拜中领读经文的〕平信徒读经员

Sense.DEF: a throw in basketballmade from very close to the basket or from under it
a woman not trained in a particular subject or type of work, especially when she is being compared with someone who is
a woman who is not a priest but is a member of a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性〕非神职教徒﹐平信徒﹐普通信徒

Sense.DEF: if someone rises like Lazarus, they get better after a serious illness or other hopeless situation. This expression comes from the Bible story about Lazarus, a friend of Jesus. When he died, Jesus brought him back to life.
Sense.TRAN: 拉撒路〔《圣经》中经耶稣救治而起死回生的人﹔喻指大病痊愈或绝处逢生者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After losing 0–3 at halftime, Manchester United made the biggest comeback since Lazarus, eventually winning 5–3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼彻斯特联队上半场0比3落后﹐最终却实现大逆转﹐以5比3胜出。

Sense.DEF: to relax and enjoy yourself in a lazy way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We spent the afternoon lazing in the sun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们懒洋洋地在太阳底下消磨了一个下午。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We lazed around, gazing at the views.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们随处走走﹐欣赏风景。

Sense.DEF: not liking work and physical activity, or not making any effort to do anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: the laziest boy in the class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上最懒的男孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt too lazy to get out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懒得都不想起床。

Sense.DEF: a lazy period of time is spent doing nothing except relaxing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent lazy days relaxing on the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在海滩上放松休息﹐过着慵懒惬意的日子。

Sense.DEF: a lazy person – often used in a friendly way to someone you like
Sense.TRAN: 懒鬼﹐懒骨头〔常用作亲昵称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, lazybones! Get out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行了﹐懒鬼！ 起床吧。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=pound or pounds in weight 磅

Sense.DEF: a way in which your innings can end in cricket, when the ball hits your leg if it is in front of the wicket
Sense.TRAN: 腿碰球〔板球中可导致击球员出局〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a watch, calculator, or small computer where numbers or letters are shown by means of an electric current that is passed through a special liquid
if a substance leaches or is leached from a larger mass such as the soil, it is removed from it by water passing through the larger mass
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manufacturers say that there is no danger of the aluminium leaching into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产厂家说不会有铝渗入水中的危险。

Sense.DEF: to take someone somewhere by going in front of them while they follow, or by pulling them gently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A nurse took her arm and led her to a chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有位护士搀扶她坐到椅子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The horses were led to safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马匹被牵到安全的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was led away from the courtroom in tears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她哭着被带离法庭。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager led the way through the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理带路穿过办公室。

Sense.DEF: to go in front of a line of people or vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLE: A fire truck was leading the parade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆消防车在游行队伍前面开道。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of an organization, country, or team, or a group of people who are trying to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has led the party for over twenty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他领导该党已经二十多年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people say she is too old to lead the country be in charge of its government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人说﹐她年纪太大﹐领导不了国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beckham led his team to victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克汉姆带领球队取得胜利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The investigation will be led by Inspector Scarfe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查将由斯卡夫巡官指挥。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are leading a campaign to warn teenagers about the dangers of drug abuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在领导一场运动﹐告诫青少年吸毒的危害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rebellion was led by the King’s brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场叛乱由国王的弟弟带头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nelson preferred to lead the attack himself from the front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳尔逊更喜欢在前线亲自率军作战。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a man who was born to lead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个天生的领导人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a communist-led strike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场由共产党领导的罢工

Sense.DEF: to cause something to happen or cause someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the events that led to the start of the First World War
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致第一次世界大战爆发的事件
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A degree in English could lead to a career in journalism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿到英语专业学位可让你有机会从事新闻工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her trusting nature often led her into trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她容易轻信别人的性格经常使她遇到麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What led him to kill his wife?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么原因让他杀了妻子？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His actions could lead to him losing his job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为会让他丢掉工作的。

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something, especially something that is not true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had led everyone to believe that his family was very wealthy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使每一个人都相信他家很富有。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel was terrible, and not at all what we had been led to expect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆很差﹐和我们听了介绍后预想的样子根本不一样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our research led us to the conclusion that the present system is unfair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究使我们得出结论﹐现行制度并不公平。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone to make them do something that is wrong
Sense.TRAN: 引导﹐诱导〔某人做坏事〕﹐影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His brother led him into a life of crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哥哥带他走上了犯罪道路。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not a bad boy. He’s just easily led it is easy for other people to persuade him to do things that he should not do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是个坏孩子﹐只是容易被人带坏。

Sense.DEF: to be more successful than other people, companies, or countries in a particular activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: US companies lead the world in biotechnology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国公司在生物科技方面世界领先。

GramExa.GLOSS: be the first to do something, and show other people how to do it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Swedes have led the way in data protection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞典在数据保护方面处于领先地位。

Sense.DEF: to be winning a game, competition etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: At half-time, Brazil led 1-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半场时巴西队以1比0领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With 15 laps to go, Schumacher led the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛还剩15圈的时候﹐舒马赫领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The polls showed Clinton leading Bush 55 percent to 34 percent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意测验显示﹐克林顿的支持率是55%﹐领先于布什的34%。

GramExa.PROPFORM: lead by ten points/two goals etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nadal was leading by two sets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳达尔领先两盘。

Sense.DEF: used to say where a path, wire etc goes or what place is on the other side of a door

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The path led down to a small lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路通向一个小湖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the major artery leading from the heart
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 始于心脏的主动脉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the door leading into the hallway
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往门厅的门

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The riverside path leads visitors to a small chapel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河边小路把参观者带往一座小教堂。

Sense.DEF: if you lead a particular kind of life, that is what your life is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If the operation succeeds, Carly will be able to lead a normal life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果手术成功﹐卡莉将能过上正常的生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He has led a charmed life been very fortunate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他 过着一种神仙眷顾的生活。

GramExa.PROPFORM: lead a life of luxury/poverty etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 过着奢侈/贫困等的生活

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She now leads the life of a recluse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在过着隐居的生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: deceive people by keeping different parts of your life separate and not letting anyone know the whole truth
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 过着双面人的生活〔欺骗别人以隐瞒自己另一部分的生活〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe had been leading a double life, seeing an ex-model while his wife believed he was on business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔过着双面人的生活: 他偷偷地和一名前模特幽会﹐而他妻子却以为他是在出差。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They lead a nomadic existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们过着游牧生活。

Sense.DEF: to control the way a discussion, conversation etc develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to lead the conversation back to the subject of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图把谈话重新引到钱的问题上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lead sb up the garden path
Sense.DEF: to deliberately deceive someone

Subsense.DEF: to encourage someone to do bad or immoral things which they would not normally do
to make someone believe something that is not true

Sense.DEF: to not produce any useful result
Sense.TRAN: 没有产生结果﹐毫无成果
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far police investigations seem to have led nowhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到现在为止﹐警方的调查好像毫无结果。

Sense.DEF: to show the people you are in charge of what you want them to do by doing it yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best managers lead by example.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最优秀的管理人员都要以身作则。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone so much that you can completely control everything that they do
Sense.TRAN: 牵着某人的鼻子走﹐使某人完全听命于自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians think they can easily lead people by the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客以为他们能轻易牵着民众的鼻子走。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a new subject that is connected to the previous one
Sense.EXAMPLE: That leads me to my final point. Where are we going to get the money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那使我想到最后一个问题。 我们到哪里去弄这笔钱？

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb has their own life to lead
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone wants to be able to live their life independently, without having to do things that other people want them to do
Sense.TRAN: 某人有自己的生活要过

Sense.LEXUNIT: lead sb a merry old dance/a right old dance
Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of problems or worries for someone
Sense.TRAN: 给某人造成许多麻烦﹔让某人忧心忡忡

Sense.DEF: most influenced by the market, by exports etc
Sense.TRAN: 由市场主导的/由出口主导的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: an export-led economic recovery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由出口主导的经济复苏

Sense.DEF: if a picture, view etc leads the eye in a particular direction, it makes you look in that direction
Sense.TRAN: 引领目光〔指画﹑风景等使人朝某个方向看〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: marble columns that lead the eye upward
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引人们往上看的大理石柱子

Sense.DEF: to play a particular card as your first card in one part of a card game

Exponent.DEF: to take a person or animal somewhere by going in front of them while they follow, or by pulling them gently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rachel led Jo into the kitchen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔把乔领进厨房。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was leading a horse, which seemed to have a bad leg.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她牵着一匹马﹐马好像伤了一条腿。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone somewhere with you when you have the transport, know the way, are paying etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I took her to see a film.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带她去看电影。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Matt’s taking me in his car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特用他的车送我去。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone through or to a place you know, showing them the way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ali guided us through the streets to his house on the edge of the town.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里领着我们穿街走巷﹐来到他位于城镇边缘的房子前。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone to a place such as a table in a restaurant or a hotel room and leave them there
Exponent.TRAN: 带﹐引〔某人去餐桌﹑酒店房间等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A waitress showed us to our table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名女招待把我们带到桌前。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We were shown to our seats near the front of the theatre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被带到剧院靠近前排的座位上。

Exponent.DEF: to show someone which direction to go using your hand or a sign
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sign back there pointed this way.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面那块指示牌指的是这条路。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone somewhere, protecting them, guarding them, or showing them the way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was escorted from the court by police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由警察护送离开法庭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The President’s car will be escorted by a military convoy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统座驾将由军车车队护送。

Exponent.DEF: to show someone the way to a room or building nearby, usually as part of your job
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指作为某人的工作〕引入﹐领入﹐接入
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His housekeeper ushered us into the living room.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的管家把我们引进客厅。

Exponent.DEF: to carefully take someone somewhere – used especially about a group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police shepherded thousands of people to safety in the cathedral.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察引导成千上万的人进入大教堂的安全地带。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone where to go or how to get somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He directed us to a cafe a few blocks away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉我们怎样去几个街区之外的一家咖啡馆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you direct me to the station?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否告诉我去车站怎么走？

Sense.DEF: to start a meeting, discussion, performance etc by saying or doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to lead off by thanking Rick for coming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我首先要感谢里克的到来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The French team led off with two quick goals in the first five minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛刚开始五分钟法国队就先攻入两球。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hal led the evening off with some folk songs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈尔唱了几首民歌来开启晚会。

Sense.DEF: if a road, room etc leads off a place, you can go directly from that place along that road, into that room etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pointed down a street leading off from the square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他沿从广场通出来的一条街指去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a large room, with doors leading off it in all directions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个大房间﹐有门通往各个方向

Sense.DEF: to be the first player to try to hit the ball in an inningperiod of play in a game of baseball
to deceive someone, especially to make them think you love them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在男女感情上〕欺骗〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thought she loved him, but in fact she was just leading him on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以为她爱他﹐但实际上她只是在骗他。

Sense.DEF: to cause something to develop or become possible at a later time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan Turing’s work led onto the development of modern computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦·图灵的工作促成了现代计算机的研制。

Sense.DEF: if a newspaper or television programme leads with a particular story, that story is the main one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Washington Post leads with the latest news from Israel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《华盛顿邮报》头版头条报道以色列的最新消息。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular hand to begin an attack in boxing, or a particular foot to begin a dance
Sense.TRAN: 先出〔指拳击比赛中先出左拳或右拳﹐或跳舞时先出左脚或右脚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam led with his left and punched his opponent on the jaw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当先出左拳﹐一拳打在对手的下巴上。

Sense.DEF: if a series of events or a period of time leads up to an event, it comes before it or causes it
Sense.TRAN: 是…的先导﹔导致﹐引起﹐造成
Sense.EXAMPLE: the weeks that led up to her death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她死亡前的那几个星期
Sense.EXAMPLE: the events leading up to his dismissal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终导致他被解雇的几件事

Sense.DEF: to gradually introduce an embarrassing, upsetting, or surprising subject into a conversation
Sense.TRAN: 渐渐引入〔令人尴尬﹑不安或惊讶的话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had already guessed what he was leading up to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经猜出他要说什么了。

Sense.DEF: the first position in a race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in the lead from start to finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从头到尾都是她领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Canadians went into the lead after only 30 seconds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 才过30秒﹐加拿大队就取得了领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goal put Holland into the lead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个进球使荷兰队比分领先。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Bears took the lead for the first time this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季熊队首次成为领头羊。

Sense.DEF: the amount or distance by which one competitor is ahead of another
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量或距离的〕超前量﹐领先程度
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Chicago Bulls had a narrow lead were winning by a small number of points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥公牛队以微弱优势领先。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Socialists now have a commanding lead over their opponents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党现在遥遥领先于对手。

Sense.DEF: if someone follows someone else’s lead, they do the same as the other person has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other countries are likely to follow the U.S.’s lead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他国家很可能会效法美国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Government should give industry a lead in tackling racism show what other people should do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在处理种族歧视问题上应该为企业树立榜样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The black population in the 1960s looked to Ali for a lead looked to him to show them what they should do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代的黑人视阿里为黑人的楷模。

Sense.DEF: to be the first to start doing something or be most active in doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The U.S. took the lead in declaring war on terrorism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国带头向恐怖主义宣战。

Sense.DEF: a piece of information that may help you to solve a crime or mystery
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have checked out dozens of leads, but have yet to find the killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方核查了许许多多的线索﹐但还是没有找到杀人凶手。

Sense.DEF: the main acting part in a play, film etc, or the main actor

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will play the lead role in Hamlet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将主演《哈姆雷特》。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Powers was cast in the lead role he was chosen to play it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍尔斯被选中饰演主角。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were having trouble casting the female lead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们难以选定女主角。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the film’s romantic lead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中浪漫多情的主角

Sense.DEF: the main singer, guitarist etc in a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the lead singer of Nirvana
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涅槃乐队的主唱

Sense.DEF: a piece of rope, leather, or chain for holding or controlling a dog

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All dogs must be kept on a lead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的狗都必须系牵狗带。

Sense.DEF: a wire used to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the power supply
a soft heavy grey metal that melts easily and is poisonous, used to cover roofs, or in the past, for water pipes. It is a chemical element:symbol Pb
Sense.TRAN: 铅〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Pb〕

Sense.DEF: the central part of a pencil that makes the marks when you write

Sense.LEXUNIT: go down like a lead balloon
Sense.DEF: if a suggestion or joke goes down like a lead balloon, people do not like it at all
bullets
Sense.EXAMPLE: They filled him full of lead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向他扫射。

Subsense.DEF: sheets of lead used for covering a roof
narrow pieces of lead used for holding small pieces of glass together to form a window

Sense.DEF: leaded petrol contains lead
leaded windows have narrow pieces of lead separating small square or diamond-shaped pieces of glass
leaded windows
a leaden sky or sea is dark grey
if your body feels leaden, you move slowly, because you are tired, unhappy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stumbled forward, her legs leaden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她蹒跚着往前走﹐两条腿像灌了铅一般。

Sense.DEF: dull
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leaden joke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无趣的笑话

Sense.DEF: a leaden feeling is a feeling of great unhappiness or anxiety
Sense.TRAN: 阴郁的﹔死气沉沉的﹔焦虑的

Sense.DEF: made of lead
the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the leader of the local black community
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地黑人社区的领袖

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 政党/工会/政府/反对派等的领导人

Sense.EXAMPLE: the largest ever gathering of world leaders people who are in charge of countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界领导人史无前例的大聚会

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who naturally has all the qualities needed to be a leader
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His air of confidence makes him a natural leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那自信的神态显得他天生就是一个领导者。

Sense.DEF: the person or group that is in front of all the others in a race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: County Championship leaders of Hampshire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉普郡的郡锦标赛优胜者

Sense.DEF: the product or company that is the best or most successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a world leader in defence and space electronics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防和航天电子产品的全球领导者

Sense.EXAMPLE: These products are firmly established as the market leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些产品牢固地确立了其市场主导产品的地位。
