Sense.DEF: a piece of writing in a newspaper giving the paper’s opinion on a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Times leader column
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《泰晤士报》的社论栏目

Sense.DEF: the main violinplayer in an orchestra
someone who directs the playing of a musical group
the part at the beginning of a film or recording tape which has nothing on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔胶卷的〕牵引片﹔〔磁带的〕引导带﹔空白段

Sense.DEF: a long thin branch that grows from the stem of a bush or tree beyond other branches

Exponent.DEF: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 12,000 party members will vote next week to elect a new leader.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1.2万名党员将于下周投票选举新领袖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: leaders of developing nations from around the world
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界发展中国家的领导人

Exponent.DEF: someone, such as a king or queen or a military leader, who has official power over a country or area
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sheik Mohamed, ruler of Dubai
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆罕默德酋长﹐迪拜的统治者
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Argentina’s former military rulers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿根廷前军事首领

Exponent.DEF: someone who leads a country or state
Exponent.TRAN: 国家首脑傀儡﹔有名无实的领导人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Twenty-one heads of state will meet at the annual World Trade summit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 21位国家元首将出席年度世界贸易峰会。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is seen as the leader of a country or organization, although he or she does not have any real power
Exponent.TRAN: 傀儡；有名无实的领导人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Queen’s role as a national figurehead
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王充当名义上的国家领袖的角色
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are advantages in having a respected personality as a figurehead for the organisation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一位深孚众望的人物充当团体的名誉领导人是十分有利的。

Exponent.DEF: someone who leads a group that is doing something illegal or wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 〔带领一伙人干坏事的〕头目﹐首恶﹐匪首﹔元凶
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The alleged ringleaders of the gang have been arrested.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 被指认为团伙头目的嫌疑人已被捕。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the ringleaders of the airplane bomb plot
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机爆炸阴谋的罪魁祸首

Sense.DEF: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the leadership of the Conservative party
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党的领导地位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our prospects of winning an election will be better under his leadership.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的领导下﹐我们赢得选举的希望将会更大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Conservative leadership contest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党的领导人角逐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next leadership election is due in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being good at leading a group, organization, country etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has great faith in her own leadership qualities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的领导才能非常有信心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: someone with vision and leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有远见卓识和领导才能的人

Sense.DEF: all the people who lead a group, organization, country etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s military leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的军事领导层
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party leadership are in agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党领导层意见一致。

Sense.DEF: the position of being in front of others in an activity or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leadership in science is important to our nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学上的领先地位对我们国家很重要。

Sense.DEF: lead-free petrol or paint contains no lead
remarks made by someone to introduce a radio or television show
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播或电视节目的〕开场白﹐介绍

Sense.DEF: best, most important, or most successful
Sense.TRAN: 最好的﹔最重要的﹔最成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the leading industrial nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要的工业国
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leading heart specialist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的心脏病专家
Sense.EXAMPLE: leading members of the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府要员

Subsense.DEF: the part of something that is at the front of it when it moves
the part of an activity where the most modern and advanced equipment and methods are used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the leading edge of medical technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是医疗技术的前沿。

Sense.DEF: a respected person who leads a group or organization, or is important in a particular area of knowledge or activity
Sense.TRAN: 受人尊敬的领导者﹐有影响的重要人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two women were leading lights of the women’s union.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两位女性是妇联的主要人物。

Sense.DEF: a question that deliberately tricks someone into giving the answer you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t ask leading questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要提诱导性的问题。

Sense.DEF: the woman or man who acts the most important female or male part in a film, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 扮演女主角/男主角的演员

Sense.DEF: leadused for covering roofs, for window frames etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔盖屋顶用的〕铅片﹔〔固定窗玻璃的〕铅框

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing in a newspaper giving the paper’s opinion on a subject
leading-edge machines, systems etc are the most modern and advanced ones available
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑系统等〕最现代的﹐最先进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: leading-edge technologies for military and computer applications
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应用于军事和计算机领域的尖端技术

Sense.DEF: happening or going first or before others
the most important report in a newspaper or news programme, which is put first
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或新闻节目的〕头条新闻

Sense.DEF: the time that it takes to make or produce something
the things that are done in the time before an important event
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lead-up to the election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选的筹备工作

Sense.DEF: one of the flat green parts of a plant that are joined to its stem or branches
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flowering bush with large shiny leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶子大而油亮的开花灌木

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add a few leaves of fresh basil to the salad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在色拉中加入一些新鲜的罗勒叶。

GramExa.GLOSS: have or start growing leaves, at a particular time of year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The forest was just coming into leaf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林里的树木刚开始长叶。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a leaf out of sb’s book
Sense.DEF: to copy the way someone else behaves because you want to be like them or be as successful as they are
Sense.TRAN: 学某人的样﹐以某人为榜样
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are committing $3m to research. We could take a leaf out of their book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要投入300万美元搞研究﹐我们也可以仿效他们。

Sense.DEF: to change the way you behave and become a better person
Sense.TRAN: 翻开新的一页﹔改过自新﹔重新做人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see fatherhood as a chance to turn over a new leaf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把当父亲看作翻开生命新一页的一个机会。

Sense.DEF: a page of a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slipped the letter between the leaves of his notebook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把信悄悄塞进他的笔记本里。

Sense.DEF: a part of the top of a table that can be taken out to make the table smaller
to turn the pages of a book quickly, without reading it properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked up the magazine and leafed through it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起杂志快速翻阅。

Sense.DEF: a leafless tree or bush has no leaves on it
a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 散页印刷品﹔传单﹔单张广告﹔〔广告或提供资料的〕小册子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leaflet on skin cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关皮肤癌的宣传页

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students were handing out election leaflets at the station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生在车站分发选举传单。

Sense.DEF: to give leaflets to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s leafleting the neighbourhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在向街区居民散发传单。

Sense.DEF: dead decaying leaves that improve soil
having a lot of leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: leafy green vegetables such as spinach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠菜之类的绿叶蔬菜

Sense.DEF: having a lot of trees and plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leafy suburb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木茂密的郊外

Sense.DEF: a group of sports teams or players who play games against each other to see who is best
Sense.EXAMPLE: He makes his football league debut tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天他将在足球联赛中首次出战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Rugby League Championship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橄榄球联合会锦标赛

GramExa.PROPFORM: be (at the) top/bottom of the league
GramExa.GLOSS: be the best or the worst team in a group
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在联赛中排名最高/垫底

Sense.DEF: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the National Socialist League
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家社会主义联盟

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be in the same league (as sb/sth)
Sense.DEF: to be not nearly as good or important as someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: (和某人/某物)不在同一档次[级别]上
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re not in the same league as the French at making wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的葡萄酒酿造水平远不及法国人。

Sense.DEF: to be much better than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: For most of the match, Brazil were in a different league, and won 4-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛的大部分时间里﹐巴西队的表现都高出对手一大截﹐最后以4比0获胜。

Sense.DEF: to not be skilled or experienced enough to do or deal with something
to be working with someone secretly, especially for a bad purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vernon was accused by his enemies of being in league with the devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗农被敌人指责与恶势力勾结。

Sense.DEF: an ancient unit for measuring distance, equal to three miles or about 4,828 metres on land, and three nautical miles or 5,556 metres at sea
Sense.TRAN: 里格〔旧时长度单位﹐相当于3英里或3海里〕

Sense.DEF: a list in which people, teams, or organizations are shown in order of their success or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s school league tables are published today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的学校排名表今天公布。

Sense.DEF: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof is leaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶在漏水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

Sense.DEF: if a gas or liquid leaks somewhere, it gets through a hole in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sea water was leaking into the batteries which powered the electric motors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水正渗入给电动机供电的电池。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately give secret information to a newspaper, television company etc
Sense.TRAN: 透露﹐泄露〔秘密给报纸﹑电视台等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report’s findings had been leaked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告的调查结果已经泄露。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: civil servants who leak information to the press
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把消息透露给媒体的公务员

Sense.DEF: if secret information leaks out, a lot of people find out about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: No sooner had the news leaked out than my telephone started ringing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息刚泄露出去﹐我的电话就响了起来。

Sense.DEF: a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a leak in the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花板上有条裂缝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat had sprung a leak a hole had appeared in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船出现了漏洞。

Sense.DEF: an escape of gas or liquid through a hole in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gas leak caused the explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气泄漏引起了爆炸。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which secret information is deliberately given to a newspaper, television company etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔秘密信息向报纸﹑电视台等的〕透露﹐泄露
Sense.EXAMPLE: It became evident from the leaks that something important was going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据透露出来的消息﹐显然有重大事情发生。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of waste liquid from your body
when gas, water etc leaks in or out, or the amount of it that has leaked
the deliberate spreading of secret information
Sense.EXAMPLE: leakages of confidential information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机密的泄露

Sense.DEF: a container, roof etc that is leaky has a hole or crack in it so that liquid or gas passes through it
Sense.TRAN: 漏的﹔有漏洞的﹔有裂缝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house had a leaky roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子的屋顶漏雨。

Sense.DEF: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们面对面身体前倾。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lean back and enjoy the ride.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体往后靠﹐尽情享受乘车旅行的乐趣吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She leant towards him and listened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她探过身子去听他说。

Sense.DEF: to support yourself in a sloping position against a wall or other surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他靠在桥上﹐看着船来船往。

Sense.DEF: to put something in a sloping position where it is supported, or to be in that position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A huge mirror was leaning against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一面巨大的镜子斜靠在墙上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He leant his bicycle against the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自行车斜靠在篱笆上。

Sense.DEF: to slope or bend from an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: trees leaning in the wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在风中东倒西歪的树木

Sense.DEF: to depend on someone for support and encouragement, especially at a difficult time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple lean on each other for support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻俩互相扶持。

Sense.DEF: to try to influence someone, especially by threatening them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过恐吓对某人〕施加压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won’t pay unless you lean on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不吓吓他﹐他是不会付钱的。

Sense.DEF: to tend to support, or begin to support, a particular set of opinions, beliefs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Canada, the UK and Japan leant towards the US view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大﹑英国和日本都倾向于支持美国的看法。

Sense.DEF: thin in a healthy and attractive way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was lean, tall, and muscular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身材瘦高﹐肌肉结实。

Sense.DEF: lean meat does not have much fat on it
a lean organization, company etc uses only as much money and as many people as it needs, so that nothing is wasted
a lean period is a very difficult time because there is not enough money, business etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife was a source of constant support during the lean years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在不景气的那些年里﹐妻子一直在支持他。

Sense.DEF: a tendency to prefer or agree with a particular set of beliefs, opinions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: his radical political leanings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那激进的政治倾向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leaning towards the Right
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼倾向

Sense.DEF: a past tense and past participle of lean
a small roughly-made building that is built against the side of a larger building
Sense.TRAN: 〔依傍较大建筑物搭建的〕单坡屋顶小屋﹐披屋

Subsense.DEF: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She leapt over the fence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跳过篱笆。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The smaller animals can easily leap from tree to tree.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体形较小的动物可以在树丛间轻巧地跳来跳去。

Subsense.DEF: to jump over something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Brenda leaped the gate and ran across the field.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦达跃过大门﹐跑过田野。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly and with a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I leapt up the stairs three at a time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一步三级地冲上楼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leapt out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从床上一跃而起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leapt to her feet stood up quickly and started shouting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她立刻站起来开始大喊大叫。

Sense.DEF: to increase quickly and by a large amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits leapt to £376m.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润骤增至3.76亿英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He leapt 27 places to second spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上升了27位﹐跃居第二名。

Sense.DEF: to accept an opportunity very eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I leapt at the chance of studying abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赶紧抓住了出国留学的机会。

Sense.DEF: to quickly defend someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: When her younger brother was being bullied she leapt to his defence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弟弟遭人欺负﹐她挺身而出保护他。

Sense.DEF: if your heart leaps, you feel a sudden surprise, happiness, or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart leaped when I saw Paul at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在机场看到保罗时﹐我的心猛地一跳。

Sense.DEF: if a word or phrase in a piece of writing leaps out at you, you notice it particularly, because it is interesting, important etc
a big jump
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一根枝条扔到河里﹐那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

Sense.DEF: a large increase or change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quantum leap very great increase or change in population levels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口水平的巨大增长

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 16% leap in pre-tax profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前利润激增16%

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the huge leap forward that took place in the 1980s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生在20世纪80年代的巨大飞跃

Sense.DEF: if something increases, develops, grows etc by leaps and bounds, it does it very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lifeboat technology has advanced by leaps and bounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救生艇技术突飞猛进。

Sense.DEF: a mental process that is needed to understand something difficult or see the connection between two very different ideas
Sense.TRAN: 想象跳跃﹐想象力的发挥

Sense.DEF: something you do without knowing what will happen as a result
Sense.TRAN: 冒险举动﹐轻举妄动﹔瞎闯

Sense.DEF: something you do even though it involves a risk, hoping that it will have a good result
a children’s game in which someone bends over and someone else jumps over them
to suddenly become better, more advanced etc than people or organizations that were previously better than you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company leapfrogged its rivals into a leading position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司超越竞争对手﹐处于领先地位。

Sense.DEF: a past tense and past participle of leap
a year, which happens every fourth year, when February has 29 days instead of 28

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb learn are. 本图表所示为动词learn构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, by experience, by studying it, or by being taught
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way to learn a language?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习语言的最佳方法是什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I learnt to drive when I was 17.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我17岁那年学会了开车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hector spent the winter learning how to cope with his blindness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个冬天赫克托都在学习如何适应失明的生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher’s task is to help the pupil learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师的任务是帮助学生学习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I learned a lot from my father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从父亲那里学到了很多东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kids can have fun and learn about music at the same time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子可以在学习音乐的同时得到乐趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Youngsters must learn what is dangerous and what is not to be feared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子必须要知道什么有危险﹐什么不要害怕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The student will learn from experience about the importance of planning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生将从经验中学到制订计划的重要性。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that you ‘learn someone something’ or ‘learn someone how to do something’. Use teach. 不要说 learn someone something或learn someone how to do something’。 要用teach: I taught him how to send an e-mail. 我教他怎么发送电子邮件。

Sense.DEF: to find out information or news by hearing it from someone else or reading it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t tell her the truth. She would learn it for herself soon enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有告诉她真相﹐很快她自己就会知道的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He learned about his appointment by telephone yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天他从电话里得知自己被任命的消息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last week I learned that I was pregnant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个星期我得知自己怀孕了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was surprised to learn that he was a lot older than she had thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊讶地发现﹐他比她认为的要年长很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I waited to learn whether I’d secured a college place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在等待大学录取的消息。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have yet to learn who will be the new manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还不知道谁将成为新经理。

Sense.DEF: to get to know something so well that you can easily remember it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The actors hardly had time to learn their lines before filming started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员们几乎没有时间记台词电影就开拍了。

Sense.DEF: to gradually understand a situation and start behaving in the way that you should

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have to learn that they can’t just do whatever they like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须明白做事不能随心所欲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young hairdressers must learn to treat the client as a person, not a head of hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的发型师必须认识到要把顾客看作是人﹐而不只是一头头发。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve told him a hundred times not to bully people, but he never learns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我都跟他说了一百次不能欺负别人﹐可他从来都不明白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have to learn from your mistakes understand why what you did was wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要从自己的错误中吸取教训。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the lessons learned in the Gulf War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从海湾战争中吸取的教训

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will not do something wrong or stupid again, because they suffered as a result
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve learned my lesson; I’ve now got a burglar alarm and a guard dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有过教训﹐现在装了一个防盗警报器﹐还养了一条看门狗。

Sense.DEF: to understand a situation or develop a skill by learning from your mistakes and bad experiences
Sense.TRAN: 历经挫折才明白[学会](某事)

Sense.DEF: used when something bad has just happened to someone as a result of their actions, especially when they ignored a warning
Sense.TRAN: 这可以给某人一个教训！

Exponent.DEF: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, especially by being taught or trained
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How long have you been learning Italian?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你学意大利语多久了？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What age can you learn to drive in America?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在美国要到什么年纪可以学开车？

Exponent.DEF: to learn about a subject by reading books, going to classes etc, especially at school or university
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在学校或大学〕学习﹐攻读
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s studying music at Berkeley College in California.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在加利福尼亚的伯克利学院学习音乐。

Exponent.DEF: to learn the skills and get the experience that you need in order to do a particular job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Julie’s training to be a nurse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉正在接受培训﹐准备当护士。

Exponent.DEF: to learn something without much effort, by watching or listening to other people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to pick up a language when you’re living in a country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一个国家生活﹐很容易就能学会那里的语言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rules of the game are easy – you’ll soon pick them up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏规则很简单﹐你很快就能学会。

Exponent.DEF: to learn how to do or use something that is fairly complicated, especially with practice
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指通过练习〕学会做某事﹐学会使用某物〔指相当复杂的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It took me a while to get the hang of all the features on my new camera.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了点时间才学会使用新相机的所有功能。

Exponent.DEF: to study facts again, especially on your own, in order to learn them before an examination
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jenny’s upstairs revising for her Maths exam tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮在楼上为明天的数学考试复习。

Exponent.DEF: to learn something so well that you have no difficulty with it, especially a skill or a language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She gave me a book called ‘Mastering the Art of French Cooking’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给我一本书﹐叫做《掌握法国烹饪艺术》。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I learnt Spanish for years but I never really mastered it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙语我学了很多年﹐但一直没能真正掌握。

Sense.DEF: a learned person has a lot of knowledge because they have read and studied a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a learned professor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位博学的教授

Sense.DEF: books etc that are written by people who have a lot of knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLE: learned works on natural history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于博物学的学术著作

Sense.DEF: someone who is learning to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new dictionary for learners of business English
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本新的商务英语学习词典

Sense.EXAMPLE: the needs of slow learners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习迟缓者的需要
Sense.EXAMPLE: attractive grammar books for adult learners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对成年学生的精美语法书

Sense.DEF: someone who is learning to drive a car
an official document that gives you permission to learn to drive
Sense.TRAN: 学员驾照﹐见习驾驶员执照

Sense.DEF: knowledge gained through reading and study
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of great learning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学识渊博的人

Sense.DEF: the rate at which you learn a new skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone in the centre has been through a very steep learning curve they had to learn very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该中心的每一个人都经历了强化速成的学习过程。

Sense.DEF: a mental problem that affects someone’s ability to learn
Sense.EXAMPLE: a school for children with learning difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为有学习障碍的儿童开设的学校

Sense.DEF: a mental problem that affects someone’s ability to learn
Sense.TRAN: 学习障碍﹐学习能力缺陷

Sense.DEF: a past tense and past participle of learn
Sense.TRAN: learn 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They took out a lease on a seven-acre field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们租下了一块七英亩的土地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租约条款你都理解吗？

Subsense.DEF: if something has a new lease of life, it is changed or repaired so that it can continue
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某物经改装或修理后的〕延续使用寿命
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Historic buildings can have a new lease of life through conversion.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史建筑通过改建可以获得新生。

Subsense.DEF: if someone has a new lease of life, they become healthy, active, or happy again after being weak, ill, or tired
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an operation to give her a new lease of life
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使她重获新生的一次手术

Sense.DEF: to use a building, car etc under a lease
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m interested in leasing your cottage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有兴趣租下你的小屋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lease the site from the council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向市政会租来这块场地。

Sense.DEF: to let someone use a building, car etc under a lease

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building was leased to a health club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大楼租给了一个健身俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in which you sell or give something to someone, but continue to use it by paying them rent
Sense.TRAN: 售后回租〔指租用已出售的财产〕

Sense.DEF: leasehold property is property that you will own only for the period of time stated in a lease
someone who lives in a leasehold house, apartment etc
a piece of rope, leather etc fastened to a dog’s collar in order to control it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At her side on a leash trotted a small grey dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只用绳子牵着的灰色小狗在她的身边小跑着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Never leave your dog off the leash outside a store.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不能不拴皮带就把狗留在商店外面。

Sense.DEF: to control someone – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marcus keeps you on a short leash, does he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马库斯是不是牢牢地控制着你？

Sense.DEF: to put a leash on a dog

Subsense.DEF: not less than a particular number or amount
Subsense.TRAN: 不少于﹐至少﹐起码〔指数或量〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It will take you at least 20 minutes to get there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那里至少要花20分钟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had at least £100,000 in savings.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他起码有10万英镑的存款。

GramExa.GLOSS: not less than and probably much more than
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would cost $1 million at the very least.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最起码要花100万美元。

Subsense.DEF: even if something better is not true or is not done
Subsense.TRAN: 至少〔指尽管没有更好的情况〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At least he didn’t lie to me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少他没跟我撒谎。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t expect you to pay me, but you could at least cover my expenses.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不指望你给我报酬﹐但你至少也得支付我的开销呀。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house still needed a lot of work, but at least the kitchen was finished.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子还有不少活要干﹐但至少厨房已经完工了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are correcting or changing something that you have just said
Subsense.TRAN: 至少﹐起码〔用于纠正或改变刚说过的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They all knew I was on their side. At least, that’s what they said.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都知道我站在他们这一边﹐至少他们是这么说的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I made everything perfectly clear – or at least I thought I did.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把一切都解释得很清楚了——至少我自己是这么认为的。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning the least extreme thing that happens, is needed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer viruses are at the very least annoying and often actually destructive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机病毒往轻了说让人恼火﹐实际上还经常具有破坏性。

Subsense.DEF: the smallest amount
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Women work in those sectors of the job market which pay the least.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性在就业市场中报酬最低的行业里工作。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Which method causes the least damage to the environment?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪一种方法对环境危害最小？

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize how small something is, especially when it hardly exists at all
Subsense.TRAN: 极微小的〔尤指几乎没有〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t the least idea what you are talking about.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点也不明白你在说什么。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He used to wake at the least noise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前总是有一点点动静就会醒过来。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are saying what someone should do in a situation, and suggesting that they should really do more
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The least you could do is give me her phone number.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你起码可以把她的电话号码告诉我。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The least they could have given her is some money towards the rent.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们起码可以给她一点钱帮她交房租。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not the least/not in the least/not the least bit
Sense.DEF: none at all, or not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to convince them, but they weren’t the least interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图说服他们﹐可他们一点也不感兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not in the least afraid of you any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在一点都不怕你了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was alert, not the least bit sleepy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音透着警觉﹐没有一丝睡意。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something is worse or more serious than you are actually saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: His teaching methods were strange, to say the least.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的教学方法至少可以说是怪异。

Sense.DEF: something that someone is not worried about because there are other more important problems
Sense.TRAN: 某人最不担心的事﹐某人一点都不在乎的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: What I looked like was the least of my problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看上去怎么样根本无所谓。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s the least I can do
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are very willing to do something or to reply to someone’s thanks
Sense.TRAN: 这是我起码可以做的事〔表示非常愿意做某事﹐或用于回答某人的感谢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll look after them – it’s the least I can do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来照顾他们——这是我起码可以做的事。

Sense.DEF: less than anything or anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey would impose extra expense on those least able to afford it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行会给那些最负担不起的人增加额外的开支。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is quite amazing what turns up when you are least expecting it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真的很奇妙﹐你根本想不到会有什么出现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s my least favourite member of staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是最不讨我喜欢的员工。

Sense.DEF: especially not a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hardly ever lost her temper – least of all with Anne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎从不发脾气——对安妮就更不用说了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother was upset about his appearance here, not least because she felt it was invading her privacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这里出现使我母亲很不高兴﹐尤其是因为她觉得这侵犯了她的隐私。

Sense.DEF: at least
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way to cross the mountains, leastways at this time of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有办法穿越群山﹐至少在一年中的这个时候是不行的。

Sense.DEF: the least worst choice is the best choice from a list of choices that you think are all bad
Sense.TRAN: 坏中最好的﹐差中最优的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Often it’s a question of choosing the least worst option.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这往往是一个坏中求好的问题。

Sense.DEF: animal skin that has been treated to preserve it, and is used for making shoes, bags etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inside of the bag was lined with soft leather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这包的里面衬了软皮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: elegant leather boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精美的皮靴

Sense.DEF: special leather clothes worn for protection by someone riding a motorcycle
a cheap material made to look like leather
hard and stiff like leather, rather than soft or smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: her leathery brown skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那粗糙的棕色皮肤

Sense.DEF: to go away from a place or a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: My baby gets upset when I leave the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一离开房间宝宝就会不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before leaving the train, make sure you have all your belongings with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下火车前一定要带好随身物品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the motorway at Junction 7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在七号交叉路口驶离高速公路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane leaves at 12.30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机于12点30分起飞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried calling him, but he’d already left for work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着打电话给他﹐可他已经去上班了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he left immediately, he’d catch the 7.30 train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要是马上出发﹐就能赶上7点30分的火车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frances left work early to meet her mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西丝提前下班去接她母亲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never leave children playing near water unattended.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不能让儿童在水边独自玩耍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll leave you to it go away and let you continue with what you are doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我就留给你做了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My youngest boy has not left my side has stayed near me since his daddy was killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最小的儿子自从他爸爸死后就没有离开过我的身边。

GramExa.GLOSS: go away from someone so that they can think, work etc alone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 让某人清静﹐不打扰某人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just a few more questions, then we’ll leave you in peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再问几个问题我们就不打扰你了。

Sense.DEF: if you leave your job, home, school etc, you permanently stop doing that job, living at home etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the past two years, 20 staffers have left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去两年里﹐有20名员工离职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How old were you when you left home your parents’ home?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是多大的时候从家里搬出来的？

Sense.EXAMPLE: My daughter got a job after she left school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我女儿毕业后找了一份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lawsuit will be postponed until the president leaves office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场诉讼要推迟到总统离任以后。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many missionaries were forced to leave the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多传教士被迫离开这个国家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems that Tony has left the band for good permanently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来托尼是永远离开这个乐队了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura left her native England to live in France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉离开她的家乡英格兰﹐移居法国了。

Subsense.DEF: to stop annoying or upsetting someone
Subsense.TRAN: 不去打扰某人﹐让某人独自待着
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, just leave me alone, will you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐你就别来烦我了好不好？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leave the boy alone, he can make up his own mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要去打扰这孩子﹐他会自己作决定的。

Subsense.DEF: to go away from someone so that they are on their own
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Six-year-old Gemma had been left alone in the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六岁的杰玛被单独留在了屋子里。

Subsense.DEF: to stop touching something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leave that alone. You’ll break it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别碰﹐你会把它打碎的。

Subsense.DEF: to stop being involved in or trying to change a situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why can’t they just leave well alone and let us concentrate on teaching?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为什么就不能不再插手﹐让我们专心教课呢？

Sense.DEF: to make or allow something or someone to stay in a place when you go away
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物或某人〕留在某处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you leaving the kids with Grandma on Saturday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算星期六把孩子们留在奶奶那里吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As soon as I’d shut the door, I realized I’d left the keys inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚关上门﹐就想起钥匙留在里面了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did anybody leave a jacket behind last night?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天晚上有哪位忘记拿夹克衫了吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She left her son in the care of a friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把儿子留给一个朋友照顾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He left Ruth to find her own way home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让露丝自己回家去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Students were left to their own devices left alone and allowed to do whatever they wanted for long periods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们有很长时间没人管﹐想干什么就干什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl had been attacked and left for dead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩遭到袭击﹐袭击者认为女孩已死﹐逃离了现场。

Sense.DEF: to let something remain in a particular state, position, or condition
Sense.TRAN: 使保持〔某种状态或在某个位置〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ve left your lights on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你忘了关灯。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She must have left the phone off the hook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一定是没挂好电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop leaving the door open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别老开着门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trial left many questions unanswered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次试验留下了许多未解决的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leave the next two lines blank for the tutor’s comments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面两行空出来让老师写评语。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drivers should always leave room for cyclists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员应该始终给骑车人留出地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll just leave the engine running while I go in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我进去时不会关闭引擎。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t leave tools lying about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工具不要到处乱放。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leave the pots to soak overnight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把锅泡一个晚上。

Sense.DEF: if an event, accident, illness etc leaves you in a particular condition, you are in that condition because of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: An explosion at a chemical plant has left one worker dead and four injured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家化工厂爆炸造成一名工人死亡﹐四人受伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Although the infection cleared up, he was left with a persistent cough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管感染治愈了﹐可是给他留下了一直咳嗽的毛病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident left her feeling confused and hurt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事让她感到困惑和受伤。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The announcement has left shareholders nursing huge losses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则公告令股民蒙受巨大损失。

Sense.DEF: if something is left, it remains after everything else has gone, been taken away, or used
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got a few dollars left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上只剩几美元了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a couple of seats left at the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面还剩几个位子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have much time left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有多少时间了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pointed to what was left of the house used when very little is left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指着房子的残骸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All that was left was a pile of bones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩下的只是一堆骨头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After we’ve paid the bills, there’s never much left over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们付完账单总是所剩无几。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They ate some bread rolls left over from the night before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吃了前一天晚上剩下的几个小圆面包。

Sense.DEF: to deliver a message, note, package etc for someone or put it somewhere so that they will get it later
Sense.TRAN: 〔给某人〕留下〔口信﹑便条﹑包裹等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She left a message on his answerphone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在他的电话答录机上留了言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you leave me some money for the bus?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我留点钱乘公共汽车吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ian left this note with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩留了这张字条给我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A guy left these flowers for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些花是一个男的留下给你的。

Sense.DEF: to not do something or to do it later than you intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the dishes. I’ll do them later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碟子放着吧﹐过会儿我来洗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So much had been left undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有这么多事情还没做。

GramExa.PROPFORM: leave sth until the last minute/until last
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you leave your preparation until the last minute, you’ll reduce your chances of passing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你到最后一刻才去准备﹐合格的可能性就减少了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left the best bit until last.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把最好的留到最后。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to think about it. Can I leave it for now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想考虑考虑﹐可以暂时留着吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid you’ve left it too late to change your ticket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你到现在来换票太晚了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you will not do any more of something, because you have done enough
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s leave it at that for today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今天就到此为止吧。

Sense.DEF: to let someone else decide something or be responsible for something
Sense.TRAN: 把…留交〔某人决定或负责〕﹔委托﹔交由

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leave it to me. I’ll make sure it gets posted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它交给我吧﹐我保证把它寄出去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The choice of specialist subject is left entirely to the students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专业课的选择完全由学生自己做主。

GramExa.PROPFORM: leave it (up) to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll leave it up to you to decide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这件事交给你决定。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She leaves it to the reader to draw their own conclusions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让读者自己去下结论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is it okay if I leave writing the results to you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让你来写结果行吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leave it with me, I’ll fix it for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它交给我吧﹐我会帮你修好的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not the sort to leave things to chance take no action and just wait to see what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是那种心存侥幸的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: force someone to take a particular action
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You leave me with no choice but to fire you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让我别无选择﹐只有辞退你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clive moved to London, leaving Edward to run the Manchester office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫搬到伦敦去了﹐曼彻斯特办事处就交给爱德华来管。

Sense.DEF: to stop living with or having a relationship with your husband, partner etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martha was always threatening to leave, but I never believed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎动不动就威胁要走﹐但我从来都不相信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Rushworth left her for a younger woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉什沃思先生离开她﹐找了一个更年轻的女人。

Subsense.DEF: to arrange for someone to receive your money, property etc after you die
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Aunt Alice died, leaving almost $5 million.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯姑妈死了﹐留下近五百万美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hugo left me his mother’s ring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨果把他母亲的戒指留给了我。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his will, he had left all his children a small sum of money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在遗嘱中给每个孩子留了一小笔钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you thought of leaving a gift to charity after you die?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有想过死后给慈善机构捐赠一笔钱？

Subsense.DEF: used when someone dies before their wife, children etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: PC Davis leaves a wife and three small children.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警员戴维斯死后撇下了妻子和三个年幼的孩子。

Sense.DEF: to make a mark that remains afterwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wine had left a permanent mark on the tablecloth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄酒在台布上留下了洗不掉的痕迹。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He staggered to the door, leaving a trail of blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踉踉跄跄地走向门口﹐留下一行血迹。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure that you don’t leave any footprints.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不能留下脚印。

Sense.DEF: if you leave food or drink that you have been given, you do not eat or drink it
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m really hungry now.’ ‘That’s because you left half your lunch.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我现在饿坏了。” “那是因为你午饭剩下一半没吃。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rose from the table, leaving his brandy untouched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从餐桌旁站起来﹐白兰地一口也没喝。

Sense.DEF: to be much better, quicker, more successful etc than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 远远胜过某人/某物﹐让某人/某物望尘莫及
Sense.EXAMPLE: In terms of fitness, he discovered that Kate left him standing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从健康这方面来说﹐他发现凯特令他望尘莫及。

Sense.LEXUNIT: leave a lot/sth/much to be desired
Sense.DEF: to be very unsatisfactory
Sense.TRAN: 还有许多需要改进的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inspectors say health and safety procedures at the factory leave a lot to be desired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稽查员说工厂的卫生和安全措施还有许多需要改进的地方。

Sense.DEF: in a sum, to have a particular amount remaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three from seven leaves four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七减三余四。

Sense.DEF: to not think about or consider one part of something for a time, so that you can consider another part of it
Sense.TRAN: 把某事暂时搁在一边﹐暂时不考虑某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaving aside for a moment the question of expense, what would your view be of the suggested changes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暂时不说费用的问题﹐你对修改建议有什么看法？

Sense.DEF: to not upset, speak to, or annoy someone or to not touch something
Sense.TRAN: 不去打扰某人﹐不去管某人﹔不去动某物

Sense.DEF: to stop holding something

Sense.LEXUNIT: leave it to sb (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that no one should be surprised that someone does something, because it is typical or expected of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave it to you to have the whole day planned out!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然是你来安排这一整天的事！

Sense.DEF: used humorously to emphasize that something is definitely over or that someone has gone and will not return
Sense.TRAN: 某人已经一去不复返﹔某事已经彻底结束〔幽默用法〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: sb can take it or leave it

Sense.DEF: to not take someone or something with you when you leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I might have left my wallet behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我可能把皮夹子忘在哪儿了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He departed for Washington, leaving the children behind with their mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他动身前往华盛顿﹐把几个孩子留给了他们的母亲。

Sense.DEF: if a person, country, or organization is left behind, they do not develop as quickly or make as much progress as other people, countries etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: In class, a child with poor eyesight can soon get left behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在课堂上﹐视力不好的孩子很快就会落在别人的后面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fear of being left behind by better-organized rivals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对落后于组织更有序的竞争对手的担心

Sense.DEF: to permanently stop being involved with a person, place or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to leave the past behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是时候该告别过去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although Armstrong overcame the circumstances of his birth, he never really left New Orleans behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿姆斯特朗虽然摆脱了他出生时的境遇﹐但他从没有真正割断与新奥尔良的联系。

Sense.DEF: to move away from someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had left the city behind and were heading into open country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开城市﹐奔向广阔的乡村。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah, with her long legs, soon left the rest of us far behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉腿长﹐很快就把我们其他人远远地抛在了后面。

Sense.DEF: to produce a thing or situation that remains after you have gone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drove off, leaving behind him a trail of blue smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开车走了﹐身后留下一股青烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mess the previous government left behind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上届政府留下的烂摊子

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something

GramExa.PROPFORM: take up/pick up/continue (sth) etc where sb left off
GramExa.GLOSS: continue something that has stopped for a short time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 从某人停下来的地方开始
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barry took up the story where Justine had left off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴里从贾斯廷停下的地方接着把故事讲下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you leave off nagging?’ he snarled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你别唠叨了好不好？” 他咆哮道。

Sense.DEF: to not include something such as someone’s name in a list or other document
Sense.TRAN: 没有把某人/某物包括进(某物)﹐不把某人/某物列入(某物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why was her name left off the list?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单上为什么漏了她的名字？

Sense.DEF: to not include someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She outlined the case to him, being careful not to leave anything out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向他概述了情况﹐注意不遗漏任何一件事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kidd has been left out of the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基德未能入选球队。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you are not accepted or welcome in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 被忽视[冷落]/觉得被忽视[冷落]
Sense.EXAMPLE: New fathers often feel left out when baby arrives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了小宝宝以后﹐初为人父者往往有一种被冷落的感觉。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop lying, pretending, or being annoying
Sense.TRAN: 得啦！ 算啦！〔用于叫某人不要撒谎﹑假装﹑烦人等〕

Sense.DEF: time that you are allowed to spend away from your work, especially in the armed forces
Sense.TRAN: 假期﹐假日﹔〔尤指军人的〕休假
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve applied for three days’ leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经请了三天假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: navy officers home on leave
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休假回家的海军军官

Sense.EXAMPLE: Your basic annual leave is 20 days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的基本年假是20天。

Sense.DEF: time that you are allowed to spend away from work because you have had a baby, because you are ill, or because of a personal problem such as the death of a relative
a period of time that you are allowed to spend away from work for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been given leave of absence to attend a computer course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获准休假去参加计算机培训课程。

Sense.DEF: permission to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this was done entirely without my leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些都是在根本没有得到我许可的情况下进行的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a petition for leave to appeal to the European court
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请求上诉至欧洲法庭的诉状

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He asked leave to speak to her in private.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他请求允许和她私下里谈。

Sense.LEXUNIT: without so much as a by your leave
Sense.DEF: without asking permission, in a way that seems very rude
Sense.EXAMPLE: He marched into my office without so much as a by your leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未经许可就大模大样地走进我的办公室。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start behaving in a strange way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You want to marry him? Have you taken leave of your senses?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要嫁给他？ 你是不是疯了？

Sense.LEXUNIT: take leave of sb/take your leave
Sense.DEF: to say goodbye to someone
a substance, especially yeast, that is added to a mixture of flour and water so that it will swell and can be baked into bread
something that makes an event or situation less boring, serious, or sad
Sense.TRAN: 使事件[情景]变得有趣[生动]的东西﹔调和剂

Sense.DEF: to make something less boring, serious, or sad
the plural of leaf
an act of saying goodbye when you go away
things that are left because people do not want them
to show sexual desire for someone in a way that is unpleasant or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-aged man leching after young girls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂涎年轻姑娘的一个中年男子

Sense.DEF: a man who shows his sexual desire for women in a way that is unpleasant or annoying
a lecherous man shows his sexual desire for women in a way that is unpleasant or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lecherous old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个好色的老男人

Sense.DEF: sexual desire or pleasure that is considered bad because it is not part of a romantic relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hint of lechery in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼神里带着一丝淫欲。

Sense.DEF: an object with a sloping surface that you put an open book or notes on while you are speaking to people in public
a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大学里的〕讲座﹐讲课﹐演讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

Sense.DEF: an act of criticizing someone or warning them about something in a long, serious talk, in a way that they think is unfair or unnecessary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father caught me and gave me a long lecture about the dangers of drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲拉住我﹐长篇大论地告诫我喝酒的种种危害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She gave a fascinating lecture on crime in the 1800s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她作了一个关于19世纪犯罪活动的精彩讲座。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s doing a lecture on modern poetry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在作一个关于现代诗歌的讲座。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you been to any of Professor MacPherson’s lectures?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有去听过麦克弗森教授的讲座？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most students spend about a quarter of their time listening to lectures.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学生把四分之一的时间用在听讲座上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The lecture hall was packed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 演讲厅内座无虚席。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I borrow your lecture notes?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能不能借你的听课笔记看看？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a trip that someone takes to many different places to give a lecture
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s on a lecture tour of the US.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在美国作巡回演讲。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a series of lectures on the history of art
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个关于艺术史的系列讲座

Sense.DEF: to talk angrily or seriously to someone in order to criticize or warn them, in a way that they think is unfair or unnecessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop lecturing me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要再教训我！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He began to lecture us about making too much noise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始教训我们﹐说我们太吵了。

Sense.DEF: to talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially to students in a university
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤对大学生〕讲授﹐讲课﹐作讲座﹔演讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

Subsense.DEF: someone who gives lectures, especially in a university
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指大学的〕讲课者﹐讲授者﹔演讲者
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s a brilliant lecturer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是位出色的演讲者。

Subsense.DEF: a teacher in a British university or college

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lecturer in medieval studies at Edinburgh University
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡大学一位研究中世纪的讲师

Sense.DEF: a teaching job at a university or college in Britain, in which you give lectures to students

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was offered a lectureship in mathematics at Bristol University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里斯托尔大学提供给他一个数学讲师的职位。

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of lead

a small electronic object that produces light when an electrical current is sent through it. LEDs are used, for example, as lights on electrical equipment, and to make words and pictures on large screens.
having a particular thing as the most important cause or influence
Sense.TRAN: 以…为主导的﹐以…为重点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an export-led economic recovery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以出口为主导的经济复苏

Sense.DEF: a narrow flat piece of rock that sticks out on the side of a mountain or cliff
Sense.EXAMPLE: We crept carefully along the narrow ledge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们小心翼翼地沿着狭窄的岩架爬行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leapt onto a ledge of rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跳到一个岩架上。

Sense.DEF: a narrow shelf
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s some money on the window ledge narrow shelf below the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗台上放着一点钱。

Sense.DEF: a book in which a business, bank etc records how much money it receives and spends
a line on which you write musical notes that are too high or low to be shown on a stave
next to something, and protected from the wind by that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat in the lee of a tall hedge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在高树篱背风的一侧。

Sense.DEF: the thick substance that collects at the bottom of a bottle of wine
a small soft creature that fixes itself to the skin of animals in order to drink their blood
someone who takes advantage of other people by taking their money, food etc
Sense.TRAN: 依赖他人生活的人﹐寄生虫﹐占他人便宜者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family began to see him as a leech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人开始当他是个寄生虫。

Sense.DEF: a vegetable with a long white stem and long flat green leaves, which tastes like an onion
to look at someone in an unpleasant way that shows that you think they are sexually attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sick of old men leering at her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讨厌老男人色迷迷的目光。

Sense.DEF: careful in the way that you deal with something or someone because you do not trust them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was very leery of him after I found out he had lied to Jennifer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现他对珍妮弗说谎之后﹐就对他深存戒心。

Sense.DEF: the leeward side of something is the side that is sheltered from the wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: We camped on the leeward side of the mountain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在山上背风的一面扎营。

Sense.DEF: a leeward direction is the same direction as the wind is blowing
Sense.TRAN: 向下风方向的[地]﹐顺风的[地]

GramExa.GLOSS: in a leeward direction
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship cruised slowly to leeward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船慢慢地顺风航行。

Sense.DEF: freedom to do things in the way you want to
Sense.TRAN: 自主权﹐自由活动的空间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government does not have much leeway in foreign policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在外交政策上没有多少回旋余地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to give teenagers more leeway to make their own decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量给青少年更多的自由﹐让他们自己作决定。

Sense.DEF: if you have to make up leeway, you have to do extra work because you have not done as much work as you should have done
Sense.TRAN: 弥补失去的时间﹐补做工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got quite a lot of leeway to make up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有很多工作要补做。

Sense.DEF: your left side is the side of your body that contains your heart
Sense.EXAMPLE: She held out her left hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伸出左手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scar on the left side of his face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左脸上的伤疤

Sense.DEF: on the same side of something as your left side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the next left turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个路口左转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the left bank of the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河的左岸
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of papers on the left side of the desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子左边的一叠文件

Sense.DEF: to move in an awkward way when you are running or doing a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, clumsy-looking boy with two left feet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 样子愚鲁﹑行动笨拙的高个子男孩

Sense.LEXUNIT: the left hand doesn’t know what the right hand is doing
Sense.DEF: used to say that one part of a group or organization does not know what the other parts are doing
towards the direction or side that is on the left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn left just after the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了那所学校马上左转。

Sense.DEF: the side of your body that contains your heart

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take the next road on the left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在下一个路口向左转。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our house is just to the left of the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家就在学校左边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On your left you can see the Houses of Parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你的左边可以看到议会大厦。

Sense.DEF: from the left side to the right side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photo shows, from left to right, his daughters Molly, Fiona, and Anne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片上从左到右依次是他的女儿莫莉﹑菲奥娜和安妮。

Sense.DEF: political parties and groups that support the ideas and beliefs of socialism.They usually want large industries to be owned by the state, and to use taxes to help solve social problems.
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has support from the Left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有左派的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians on the left of the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党的左派政客
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party is moving further to the left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个党越来越左了。

Sense.DEF: a hit made with your left hand
to turn left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the next left turn left at the next road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个路口左拐。

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of leave
Sense.TRAN: leave 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a position in baseball in the left side of the outfield
something that comes out of left field is unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: People don’t know how to react when a question like that comes at them out of left field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然遇到这样的问题﹐人们就不知该如何应对了。

Sense.DEF: on the left side of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live about halfway down the street on the left-hand side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在这条街中间靠左边的地方。

Sense.DEF: a left-hand drive vehicle is one in which the driver sits on the left
a left-handed person uses their left hand for writing, throwing etc
left-handed tools have been made for left-handed people to use
Sense.TRAN: 供惯用左手的人使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: left-handed scissors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 左手用的剪刀

Sense.DEF: a statement that seems to express admiration or praise, but at the same time is insulting
someone who uses their left hand for writing, throwing etc
another spelling of lefty
supporting left-wing ideas or groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: a coalition of leftist parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 左翼政党联盟

Sense.DEF: a place in a station, airport etc where you can pay to leave your bags and collect them later
supporting ideas and aims that are between the centre and the left in politics
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modern left-of-centre party with wide appeal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有广泛吸引力的一个中间偏左的现代党派

Sense.DEF: remaining after all the rest has been used, taken, or eaten
Sense.TRAN: 剩余的﹐未用完的﹔未吃完的
Sense.EXAMPLE: leftover vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃剩的蔬菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few pieces of leftover carpet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩余的几块地毯

Sense.DEF: food that has not been eaten at the end of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the leftovers to the dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把吃剩的饭菜喂狗。

Sense.DEF: something from an earlier time that still remains, even though it is not really useful or important any more

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The headmaster was a leftover from the Victorian era.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长是维多利亚时代的遗老。

Sense.DEF: on or towards the left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Follow the path leftwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着小路向左走。

Sense.DEF: a left-wing person or group supports the political aims of groups such as socialists and communists
Sense.EXAMPLE: a left-wing newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份左翼报纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: a left-wing political organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个左翼政治组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got very left-wing views.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的观点左派色彩浓厚。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the left wing of the Labour party
She is supported by left-wingers in the party.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到党内左翼势力的支持。

Sense.DEF: someone who has left-wing political ideas – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of liberals and lefties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群开明人士和左翼分子

Sense.DEF: someone who uses their left hand for writing, throwing etc

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I don’t get on with his lefty friends.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他那些左派朋友合不来。

Sense.DEF: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young boy with skinny legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双腿干瘦的小男孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell and broke her leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摔断了腿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: four-legged animals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四足动物

Sense.DEF: the leg of an animal when it is cooked and eaten as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast leg of lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤羊腿

Sense.DEF: one of the upright parts that support a piece of furniture
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the legs on the table was a bit wobbly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子的一条腿有点不稳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chair leg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 椅子腿
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-legged stool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三脚凳

Sense.DEF: the part of your trousers that covers your leg
Sense.EXAMPLE: The legs of my jeans were covered in mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的牛仔裤裤腿上沾满了泥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rolled up his trouser legs and waded out into the stream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他卷起裤腿蹚进小溪。

Sense.DEF: one part of a long journey or race

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the final leg of the Tour de France
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环法自行车赛的最后一程

Sense.DEF: one of the series of games in a football competition played between two teams
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leeds will have to win the second leg if they are to go forward to the finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹队若要进入决赛﹐第二场比赛一定要赢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a leg to stand on
Sense.DEF: to be in a situation where you cannot prove or legally support what you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you didn’t sign a contract, you won’t have a leg to stand on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你没签合同的话﹐就没有凭据了。

Sense.DEF: to have sex with someone
if a piece of news has legs, people continue to be interested in it and talk about it
to run in order to escape from someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We saw him coming, and legged it out of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们见他来了﹐就从屋里逃了出来。

Sense.DEF: something that happens or exists as a result of things that happened at an earlier time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The invasion left a legacy of hatred and fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次入侵留下的是仇恨和恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a legacy from the colonial period
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民时期遗留下来的问题

Sense.DEF: money or property that you receive from someone after they die
Sense.EXAMPLE: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

Sense.DEF: a legacy system, piece of software etc is one that a person or organization continues to use, although more modern ones are available
old information that an organization has, especially information that is stored in an old-fashioned way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用过时方式存储的〕遗留数据

Sense.DEF: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law
Sense.TRAN: 法律允许的﹐合法的﹔法律规定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

Sense.DEF: concerned with or relating to the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: free legal advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费法律咨询
Sense.EXAMPLE: a costly legal dispute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代价很大的法律纠纷
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Scottish legal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰的法律制度

GramExa.GLOSS: lawyers

Sense.DEF: the use of the legal system to settle an argument, put right an unfair situation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threatened to take legal action against the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扬言要起诉医院。

Sense.DEF: a system in which a government gives money to people who need a lawyer but cannot afford to pay for one
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府为请不起律师的人提供的〕法律援助
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have been granted legal aid and now intend to take their case to court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经获得法律援助﹐现在打算向法庭提起诉讼。

Sense.DEF: language used by lawyers that is difficult for most people to understand
an official holiday on which most government offices and banks are closed
a British spelling of legalize
too concerned about small legal details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a legalistic interpretation of the agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个协议的拘泥于法律条文的解释

Sense.DEF: the fact of being allowed by law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several ministers have questioned the legality of the ban.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几位部长对这个禁令的合法性提出了质疑。

Sense.DEF: the legal parts of an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve sold the house and are just waiting to complete all the legalities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经把房子卖了﹐正在等待把所有的法律手续办完。

Sense.DEF: to make something legal so that people are allowed to do it
Sense.TRAN: 使合法化﹐使得到法律认可
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abortion was legalized in the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎在20世纪60年代得到法律认可。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a campaign calling for the legalization of certain drugs
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取某些毒品合法化的运动

Sense.DEF: according to the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are still legally married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在法律上仍然是夫妻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which of them is legally responsible for the accident?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们中谁应该对这起事故负法律责任？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a legally binding agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份具有法律约束力的协议

Sense.DEF: if you can do something legally, you are allowed to do it by law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The station can now broadcast legally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个电台现在可以合法广播了。

Sense.DEF: a book containing sheets of yellow writing paper with lines on it, of a type sold in the US
the laws and the way they work in a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British legal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的法律制度

Sense.DEF: coins or bank notes that people can officially use as money in a particular country
an important official representative, especially an official representative of the pope
someone who receives money or property from a person who has died
a group of government officials who work in a foreign country and represent their own government in that country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a member of the British legation in Peking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国驻北京公使馆工作人员

Sense.DEF: the building or office where a legation works
music that is played legato is played very smoothly, so that each note connects to the next one without a pause
an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a book of ancient Greek legends
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本讲述古希腊传说的书
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the legend of St George and the dragon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣乔治和龙的传说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: According to legend, he escaped by leaping from the cliffs into the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据传﹐他是跳崖入海逃生的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Local legend has it that says that the island was the original Garden of Eden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

Sense.DEF: someone who is famous and admired for being extremely good at doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must put more money into the sport if we want to create the tennis legends of the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们若想造就未来网坛的传奇人物﹐就必须在这项运动上投入更多资金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a marvellous player who was a legend in his own lifetime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在世的时候是一名传奇人物的杰出球员

Sense.DEF: words that have been written somewhere, for example on a sign
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sign above the door bore the legend ‘Patience is a Virtue’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门的上方有一块匾额﹐上面写着“忍耐即美德”。

Sense.DEF: the words that explain a picture or map
Sense.TRAN: 〔图片或地图的〕文字说明﹐图例

Sense.DEF: very famous and admired
Sense.TRAN: 非常有名的﹐大名鼎鼎的﹐传奇式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lonnie Johnson, the legendary blues guitarist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传奇蓝调吉他手朗尼·约翰逊
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her singing was legendary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱歌非常有名。

Sense.DEF: talked about in a legend
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cave is the home of a legendary giant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个山洞是传说中一个巨人的家。

Sense.DEF: when you deceive people cleverly
Sense.EXAMPLE: economic legerdemain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上的花招

Sense.DEF: tight trousers for women, which stretch to fit the shape of your body
a pair of trousers that you wear over other clothes to protect your legs
a woman or child who is leggy has long legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leggy blonde
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个双腿修长的金发美女

Sense.DEF: a leggy plant has grown too tall very quickly and its stem cannot support its weight very well
written or printed clearly enough for you to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her handwriting was so tiny it was barely legible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的字写得这么小﹐简直都看不清楚。

Sense.DEF: a large group of soldiers, especially in ancient Rome
a large number of people
very many
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stories of her adventures were legion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的历险故事数不胜数。

Sense.DEF: a member of a legion
a member of a legion, especially the French Foreign Legion
Sense.TRAN: 军团成员﹐ 〔尤指法国军队中的〕外籍军团成员

Sense.DEF: a serious disease that affects your lungs
Sense.TRAN: 军团病〔一种严重的肺部疾病〕

Sense.DEF: metal chains that are put around a prisoner’s legs
to make a law about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only Parliament has the power to legislate on constitutional matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有议会才有权就宪法问题立法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to legislate against discrimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已经承诺制定反歧视的法律。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must legislate for equal pay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须为同工同酬立法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must legislate to control these drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须立法限制这些毒品。

Sense.DEF: to think about how something may affect what you are doing, and do something to prepare for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t legislate for bad luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厄运难防。

Sense.DEF: a law or set of laws
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a very important piece of legislation law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the legislation on abortion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于堕胎的法规

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new legislation to protect children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护儿童的新法规

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to bring in new legislation to combat this problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺颁行新法规来防止这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both individuals and companies can be prosecuted under the new legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据新法规的规定﹐个人和公司都有可能遭到起诉。

Sense.DEF: concerned with making laws
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new assemblies will have no legislative power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的议会将没有立法权。

GramExa.GLOSS: one with the power to make laws
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 立法议会/委员会/机构等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main legislative body of the EC
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧共体的主要立法机构

Sense.EXAMPLE: new legislative measures to stem the flow of drugs into the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遏制毒品流入美国的新的立法措施

Sense.DEF: someone who has the power to make laws or belongs to an institution that makes laws
an institution that has the power to make or change laws

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the state legislature of Virginia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗吉尼亚州立法机构

Sense.DEF: legal or allowed by official rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, the deal’s strictly legit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐这项交易是完全合法的。

Sense.DEF: honest and not trying to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure he’s legit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你敢肯定他没有骗人？

Sense.DEF: fair or reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a perfectly legitimate question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个问题完全合乎情理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most scientists believe it is legitimate to use animals in medical research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数科学家认为用动物作医学研究是正当的。

Sense.DEF: acceptable or allowed by law
Sense.TRAN: 合法的﹐法律许可的﹐依法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their business operations are perfectly legitimate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的商业活动完全合法。

Sense.DEF: a legitimate child is born to parents who are legally married to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔子女〕合法婚姻所生的﹐婚生的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He complained quite legitimately about his treatment.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他理所当然对自己所受到的对待提出不满。
反对派对裁决的合法性提出了质疑。

Sense.DEF: the usual American form of legitimize
to make something that is unfair or morally wrong seem acceptable and right
Sense.TRAN: 使〔不公平或不正当的事〕看起来可以接受﹐使显得正当
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a danger that these films legitimize violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些电影可能存在美化暴力的倾向。

Sense.DEF: to make something official or legal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acceptance by the UN would effectively legitimize the regime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国的认可实际上就使这个政权合法化了。

Sense.DEF:
when parents legitimize a child, they get married so that the child becomes
legitimate 1 3
Sense.TRAN: 赋予〔非婚生子女〕合法地位

Sense.DEF: very drunk
without legs
a toy consisting of small plastic bricks that you fit together to build things
Sense.TRAN: 乐高积木玩具〔由小塑料模块组成〕

Sense.DEF: a joke in which you make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first reaction was that this must be a leg-pull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一反应是这肯定是个玩笑。

Sense.DEF: space for your legs in front of the seats in a car, theatre etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑戏院等座位前〕供伸腿的空间﹐腿脚活动余地
Sense.EXAMPLE: There wasn’t enough leg room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腿脚的活动空间不够大。

Sense.DEF: a plant such as a bean plant that has seeds in a poda long thin case

Subsense.DEF: to help someone to get up to a high place by joining your hands together so they can use them as a step
to help someone succeed in their job

Sense.DEF: the hard boring work that has to be done in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a team of volunteers who do most of the legwork for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一组志愿人员为他做大部分跑腿工作。

Sense.DEF: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些﹐闲暇时间多些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店提供游泳池﹑桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leisure industry the business of providing leisure activities is now an important part of the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

Sense.DEF: if you do something at your leisure, you do it slowly and without hurrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come round for lunch and then we can discuss it at leisure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有空过来吃午饭吧﹐我们可以慢慢讨论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the leaflets home and read them at your leisure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些传单拿回家﹐有空慢慢看。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not have to work – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔不必工作的〕有闲先生/女士〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a place where people can do many different sports activities, exercise classes etc
leisured people do not have to work because they are rich
Sense.TRAN: 〔因富有而〕有空闲的﹐悠闲自在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the leisured aristocracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有闲的贵族

Sense.DEF: doing things slowly because you feel relaxed and are enjoying yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seemed to live a very leisured life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的生活好像非常悠闲。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in a leisurely way, you do it in a slow relaxed way, without hurrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: After lunch we went for a leisurely stroll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃过午饭﹐我们慢悠悠地散了个步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: working at a leisurely pace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不慌不忙地干活

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He sipped leisurely at his drink.

Sense.DEF: clothes that are made to be worn when you are relaxing or playing sport
a musical phrase that is repeated several times during a long musical work and represents a particular character or idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐的〕主旋律﹐主导动机﹐主导主题

Sense.DEF: something that is seen or heard very many times and so becomes a typical feature of a place, time, or person
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个地方﹑时代或人的〕主题﹐主旋律
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her designs in clothing became a leitmotif of the 1970s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的服装设计成了20世纪70年代的主旋律。

Sense.DEF: a small animal that looks like a rat. Lemmings are known for following each other in large numbers and killing themselves by jumping off cliffs into the sea.
a fruit with a hard yellow skin and sour juice
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slice of lemon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片柠檬
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a few drops of lemon juice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加几滴柠檬汁。

Sense.DEF: a drink that tastes of lemons
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of fizzy lemon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯柠檬汽水

Sense.DEF: a pale yellow colour
something that is useless because it fails to work or to work properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon realized the van was a lemon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久我便发现﹐这辆小货车根本就不中用。

Sense.DEF: a silly person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just stood there looking like a real lemon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就像个十足的傻瓜一样站在那里。

Sense.DEF: pale yellow in colour
a sweet fizzy drink that tastes of lemons
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of lemonade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯柠檬汽水
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a lemonade?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要来一杯柠檬汽水吗？

Sense.DEF: a drink made from lemons, sugar, and water
a sweet food made from eggs, butter, and lemon juice that is eaten on bread
Sense.TRAN: 柠檬酪〔由蛋﹑黄油和柠檬汁制成﹐涂在面包上食用〕

Sense.DEF: a type of grass that grows in warm countries and is used in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 柠檬草﹐香茅草〔生长在热带国家﹐用于烹饪〕

Sense.DEF: a type of flat fish that is cooked and eaten
Sense.TRAN: 檬鲽〔可食用的一种扁形鱼〕

Sense.DEF: a small kitchen tool that you use for getting the juice out of a lemon
smelling or tasting of lemons
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovely lemony flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可口的柠檬味

Sense.DEF: an animal that looks like a monkey and has a long thick tail

Subsense.DEF: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time
Subsense.TRAN: 借给〔某人钱或东西〕﹐借出

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lent my CD player to Dave and I haven’t got it back yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把CD播放机借给戴夫﹐到现在还没有拿回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital agreed to lend us a wheelchair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院同意借给我们一把轮椅。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me £10 until tomorrow?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 借给我10英镑﹐明天还你好吗？

Subsense.DEF: if a bank or financial institution lends money, it lets someone have it on condition that they pay it back later, often gradually, with an additional amount as interest
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government is trying to encourage the banks to lend more.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府设法鼓励银行发放更多贷款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of banks are unwilling to lend money to new businesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多银行都不愿意给新企业贷款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building society agreed to lend us £60,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购房互助协会答应借给我们6万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to help someone do something, especially something that needs physical effort
Sense.TRAN: 帮助(某人)做事〔尤指需要体力的事〕﹔(给某人)搭把手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me a hand with this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个你能帮我一把吗？

Sense.DEF: to give a situation, event etc a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The presence of members of the royal family lent a certain dignity to the ceremony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室成员的出席为这场典礼增添了一种庄严的气氛。

Sense.DEF: to listen to someone, especially in a sympathetic way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always prepared to lend a sympathetic ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是怀着一颗同情心去倾听。

Sense.DEF: to be suitable for being used in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of her books really lends itself to being made into a film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书没有一本适合拍成电影。

Sense.DEF: to support or help someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has now lent its support to the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府现已开始支持这场运动了。

Sense.DEF: to make an opinion or belief seem more likely to be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have new evidence which lends weight to their theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方有新证据支持他们的说法。

Sense.DEF: to announce publicly that you support something that someone is trying to do
Sense.TRAN: 公开支持某事﹐声援某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The French prime minister has now lent his name to the protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国总理现在已开始声援这场抗议运动。

Exponent.DEF: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time
Exponent.TRAN: 借给〔某人钱或东西〕﹐借出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me $20?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借我20美元吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you lend that book to Mike?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是把那本书借给迈克了？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The documents were loaned by the local library.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件由当地图书馆出借。

Exponent.EXP: let sb use sth/let sb have sth
Exponent.DEF: to let someone use something that belongs to you for a short time, especially a room, a house, or something big and expensive
Exponent.TRAN: 允许某人使用某物〔尤指房间﹑房子等大型贵重物品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some friends are letting us use their house while they are on vacation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几位朋友外出度假期间让我们住他们家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dad said he’d let me have his car for the weekend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸说我可以在周末用他的车。

Exponent.DEF: if something is on loan, it has been lent to a person or organization in an official way – often used about a library book or a work of art
Exponent.TRAN: 〔图书馆书籍或艺术品等正式〕出借
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The museum has an exhibition of paintings on loan from the Louvre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该博物馆正举办一个画展﹐画作均借自卢浮宫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: According to the computer, this book is still out on loan.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑显示﹐这本书仍外借未还。
