Sense.DEF: a person or organization that lends money to people on condition that they pay it back
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several lenders are offering very attractive rates of interest at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前有几家贷款机构贷款 利率非常优惠。

Sense.DEF: a library that lends books, records etc for people to use at home
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑唱片等可外借的〕借阅图书馆

Sense.DEF:
the rate of
interest 1 4
that you have to pay to a bank or other financial institution when you borrow money from them
the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: We measured the length and width of the living room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a length of 1 metre/2 feet etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some fish can grow to a length of four feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些鱼可以长到4英尺长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel pool is 15 metres in length.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店的游泳池有15米长。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

Sense.DEF: the amount of time that you spend doing something or that something continues

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your pension will depend on your length of employment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 养老金的多少取决于工作年限。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the average length of stay in hospital?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住院时间平均有多长？

GramExa.GLOSS: not for very long
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t left alone for any length of time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被单独留下来的时间不长。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually talk about how long something is in space or time, rather than using the noun length.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们在提及某事物的长度或持续时间时一般用 how long﹐而不用名词 length
F2NBox.BADEXA: We need to know the length of the table.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: We need to know how long the table is.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得知道桌子有多长。
F2NBox.BADEXA: He was annoyed by the length of time he had to wait.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: He was annoyed by how long he had to wait.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得等那么长时间﹐这让他很生气。

Sense.DEF: the amount of writing in a book, or the amount of time that a film, play etc continues
Sense.TRAN: 〔书的〕篇幅﹔〔电影﹑戏剧等的〕长度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had to cut the length of the book by one third.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不把书的篇幅砍掉三分之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Films of this length as long as this are pretty unusual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么长的电影很少见。

Sense.LEXUNIT: run/stretch/walk etc the (full) length of sth
Sense.DEF: to go or move from one end to the other of something
Sense.TRAN: 横跨/延伸/走过某物的整个长度
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wall ran the full length of the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那堵墙从花园这头延伸到那头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They walked the length of the pier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走完了整条长堤。

Sense.DEF: reaching down as far as your shoulders etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: shoulder-length hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 齐肩的头发
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ankle-length dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长及脚踝的连衣裙

Sense.LEXUNIT: go to some/great/any lengths (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to try very hard or to do whatever is necessary to achieve something that is important to you
Sense.TRAN: 千方百计/竭尽全力(做某事)
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went to great lengths to keep their name out of the papers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想方设法不让他们的名字见报。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bella would go to any lengths to fulfil her ambition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝拉会想尽一切办法去实现她的抱负。

Subsense.DEF: if you talk at length about something, you talk about it for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The young people spoke at length about their experiences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人畅谈各自的经历。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve already discussed the subject at great length.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个话题我们已经讨论了很长时间。

Subsense.DEF: after a long time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t agree,’ she said at length.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不同意。” 最后她说道。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the length and breadth of the area/country/land etc
Sense.DEF: in or through every part of a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police searched the length and breadth of the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方搜遍了全国各地。

Sense.DEF: a piece of something long and thin
the measurement of a horse, boat etc from one end to the other – used when saying how far the horse, boat etc is ahead of another
Sense.TRAN: 一马位﹔一艇位〔比赛中超出对手的长度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse won by three lengths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这匹马领先三个马位获胜。

Sense.DEF: the distance from one end of a swimming pool to the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She does at least 20 lengths a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天在游泳池里至少游20趟。

Sense.DEF: to make something longer or to become longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you lengthen this skirt for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能帮我把这条裙子改长？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The days lengthened as summer approached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着夏天来临﹐白天变长了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something gets longer rather than lengthens.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示某物变长﹐人们一般说 get longer﹐而不说 lengthen
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The days began to get longer.

Sense.DEF: in the direction or position of the longest side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lay the bricks lengthwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纵向砌砖。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a long time, often too long
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lengthy period of training is required.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要很长一段时间的培训。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An accident is causing some lengthy delays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起事故造成长时间的延误。

Sense.DEF: a speech, piece of writing etc that is lengthy is long and often contains too many details
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话﹑文章等〕冗长的﹐过于详尽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lengthy report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇冗长的报告

Sense.DEF: not strict in the way you punish someone or in the standard you expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lenient sentences handed down by some judges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些法官作出的宽大判决
Sense.EXAMPLE: School examiners say that marking has become more lenient in recent years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的阅卷人称近年来评分标准放宽了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the trend towards greater leniency for most offenders
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大多数违法者宽大处理的倾向

Sense.DEF: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film
Sense.EXAMPLE: a standard 50mm lens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50毫米标准镜头

Sense.DEF: a piece of curved glass or plastic which makes things look bigger, smaller, or clearer when you look through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: glasses with powerful lenses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镜片度数很高的眼镜
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lens of the microscope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显微镜镜片

Sense.DEF: the clear part inside your eye that focuses so you can see things clearly
a contact lens
the past tense and past participle of lend
the 40 days before Easter when some Christians eat less food or stop doing something that they enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 大斋期﹐四旬期〔复活节之前的40天〕

Sense.DEF: a small round seed like a bean, dried and used for food
music that is played lento is played slowly
the fifth sign of the zodiac, represented by a lion, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between July 24 and August 23
someone who was born between July 24 and August 23
Sense.TRAN: 属狮子座的人〔即7月24日至8月23日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: like a lion in character or appearance
Sense.TRAN: 狮子般勇猛的﹐狮子般雄壮的

Sense.DEF: a large animal of the cat family, with yellow fur and black spots, which lives in Africa and South Asia

Sense.LEXUNIT: a leopard can’t change its spots
Sense.DEF: used to say that people cannot change their character
a tight piece of clothing that looks a little like a woman’s swimsuit and is worn for exercise or dancing, especially by women
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指女子运动或跳舞穿的〕紧身连衣裤

Sense.DEF: relating to someone whose first language is not English and who cannot communicate very well in English
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of LEP students has risen since 1993.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从1993年起﹐英语水平有限的学生人数有所增加。

Sense.DEF: someone who has leprosy
someone that people avoid because they have done something that people disapprove of
Sense.TRAN: 〔因做了不为人赞许的事〕别人避之唯恐不及的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: They treated me as if I was a leper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把我当成避之唯恐不及的人。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary creature in the form of a little old man, in old Irish stories
Sense.TRAN: 〔爱尔兰古老传说中的〕矮妖精

Sense.DEF: a very serious infectious disease in which the flesh and nerves are gradually destroyed
a woman who is sexually attracted to other women
damage to someone’s skin or part of their body such as their stomach or brain, caused by injury or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔因伤病而致的〕损伤﹐损害﹔病变
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute gastric lesions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急性胃损伤

Sense.DEF: not so much or to a smaller degree
Sense.TRAN: 更少地﹐较少地﹔较小程度地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe he would worry less if he understood the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要是了解情况﹐也许就不会那么担心了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In recent years she has appeared in public less frequently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来她在公开场合露面的次数少了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tickets were less expensive than I had expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 票比我原来想的要便宜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Social class matters a lot less than it used to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会阶层远不如以前重要了。

GramExa.GLOSS: not less
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your second point is no less important.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的第二点也同样重要。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a common problem but this doesn’t make it any the less disturbing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个普遍问题﹐但同样令人担忧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know he’s done a dreadful thing, but I don’t love him any the less.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他做了件很差劲的事﹐可我依然爱他。

GramExa.GLOSS: be not so much like one thing as another
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you please come with me?’ It was less a request than a command.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你和我一起去吧。” 这话不像请求﹐而更像是命令。

Sense.DEF: not at all helpful, honest etc
Sense.TRAN: 一点也没有帮助/一点也不诚实/一点也不热心等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was less than enthusiastic about the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这个想法一点也不热心。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a quality, situation etc gradually decreases
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the years went by, he seemed to care less and less about his reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年年过去﹐他好像越来越不在乎自己的名声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking in the workplace is becoming less and less acceptable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在工作场所抽烟越来越不被接受了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a greater thing is even less true, likely, or possible than the thing you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: These people can scarcely afford to buy food, still less luxury goods like perfume.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人连食物都买不起﹐更不用说香水这样的奢侈品了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think Dave would ever read a book, much less write one himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得戴夫都不会去看一本书﹐更不用说自己去写了。

Sense.DEF: a smaller amount or not as much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors recommend eating less salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议少吃盐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People today seem to have less time for each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在人与人之间相处的时间好像比以前少了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of us got £4 an hour, but some received even less.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中大多数人的报酬都是每小时4英镑﹐但有些人的报酬甚至更少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The map covered less of the area than I’d thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图覆盖的范围比我原来想的要小。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flying is less of a risk than driving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘飞机比开车风险小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She knows less than I do about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事她没有我知道的多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a distance of less than 100 metres
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不足100米的距离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It costs much less to go by bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘公共汽车去要便宜很多。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Less, not ‘fewer’, should be used before an uncountable noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不可数名词前应用less﹐而不用fewer
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Less electricity is used.
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Sometimes people use less before a plural noun, but many people think that this is incorrect, so it is better to use fewer , especially in writing.有时有些人在复数名词前也用less﹐但许多人认为不正确﹐因此用fewer更好﹐尤其在书面语中: There are fewer delays (NOT 不说 less delays ). 延误次数减少了 。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that an amount or number is large

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By 1977, the USA was importing no less than 45% of its oil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了1977年﹐美国有高达45%的石油依赖进口。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that the person or thing you are talking about is important or impressive
Subsense.TRAN: 正是﹔竟是〔强调谈及的人或物很重要〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our awards were presented by the mayor, no less.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我们颁奖的正是市长。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The message came from no less a person than the prime minister.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电文竟是首相发来的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how important, serious, or impressive something is
Sense.TRAN: 简直是某物﹐绝对是某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: His appearance in the show was nothing less than a sensation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在节目中出现引起了不小的轰动。

Sense.DEF: a decreasing amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They began spending less and less time together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在一起的时间越来越少了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band was doing less and less of that kind of music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支乐队越来越少演奏那种音乐了。

Sense.DEF: very quickly or very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: In less than no time they found that they owed over $10,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快他们就发现他们已经欠了一万多美元。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a child to stop doing something
Sense.TRAN: 不要做某事〔对小孩说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Less of that noise, please!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别吵了﹐好不好！

Sense.DEF: taking away or not including a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is 121 less 36?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 121减去36是多少？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave us our money back, less the $2 service charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钱还给我们﹐扣去两美元的服务费。

Sense.DEF: without something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt powerless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到无能为力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a childless couple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对无子女的夫妇
Sense.EXAMPLE: tasteless food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡而无味的食物

Sense.DEF: not doing or using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re too careless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你太不小心了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s perfectly harmless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对没有害处。

Sense.DEF: not possible to treat or affect in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: on countless occasions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在无数场合中
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s tireless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知疲倦。

Sense.DEF: someone who is allowed to use a house, building, land etc for a period of time in return for payment to the owner
to become smaller in size, importance, or value, or make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Exercise lessens the risk of heart disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动可降低患心脏疾病的风险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new project will lessen the effects of car pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新项目将减少汽车污染的影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Gradually her anxiety lessened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的焦虑慢慢减轻了。

Sense.DEF: not as large, as important, or as much as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: They originally asked for $5 million, but finally settled for a lesser sum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们原先要五百万美元﹐但最后同意少要一些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This was true in Madrid and, to a lesser extent, Valencia and Seville.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马德里是这样﹐巴伦西亚和塞维利亚也这样﹐只是程度轻一些罢了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: to a lesser or greater extent

Sense.DEF: the less unpleasant or harmful of two unpleasant choices
used in the names of some types of animal, bird, or plant that are slightly smaller than the main type
Sense.TRAN: 略小的〔用于动植物名称中﹐表示比主要品种略小〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the lesser-known artists of the period
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段时期中不那么出名的艺术家
RunOn.EXAMPLE: one of Glasgow’s lesser used venues
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉斯哥较少使用的场地之一

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which someone is taught a particular skill, for example how to play a musical instrument or drive a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: piano lessons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴课

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s started taking driving lessons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已开始上驾驶课了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: lessons in First Aid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 急救课
GramExa.EXAMPLE: lessons on road safety
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路安全课程

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which school students are taught a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lessons start at 9 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 九点钟开始上课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a double maths lesson next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接下去要连上两堂数学课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Andrew gives private lessons in Spanish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁教授私人西班牙语课程。

Sense.DEF: something that provides experience or information that you can learn from and use

GramExa.GLOSS: gain useful experience or information
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were important lessons to be learned from these discoveries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这些发现中可以获取重要的教训。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has failed to learn the lessons of history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府没有吸取历史的教训。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men’s courage and faith is a lesson to us all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人的勇气和信心是我们大家学习的榜样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Now let that be a lesson to you all be careful to avoid having the same bad experience again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你们大家就从中吸取教训吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her fate should be a salutary lesson one that teaches or warns you about something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的命运应该是一个有益的教训。

Sense.DEF: a part of a book that is used for learning a particular subject, especially in school
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn to lesson 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请翻到第25课。

Sense.DEF: a short piece that is read from the Bible during a religious ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔宗教仪式中选读的〕《圣经》经文

Sense.DEF: someone who allows someone else to use their house, building, land etc for a period of time for payment
in order to make sure that something will not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned away from the window lest anyone see them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身离开窗边﹐免得有人看见他们。

Sense.DEF: used to show that someone is afraid or worried that a particular thing might happen
Sense.TRAN: 唯恐﹐生怕〔用于表示害怕或忧虑某事可能发生〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He paused, afraid lest he say too much.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停顿下来﹐唯恐说得太多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was worried lest he should tell someone what had happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心他会把发生的事说出去。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verb let in spoken and written English. 动词let在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t come out tonight – my dad won’t let me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上我不能出来﹐我爸爸不允许。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let Johnny have a go on the computer now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在让约翰尼来玩玩电脑吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people seem to let their kids do whatever they like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些人似乎允许自己的孩子随心所欲。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me have a look at that letter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来看看那封信吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: give something to someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can let you have another £10, but no more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以再给你10英镑﹐再多就没有了。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘be let to do something’, because let has no passive form. Use the active form, or use be allowed . 不要说 be let to do something﹐因为let没有被动语态。 要用主动语态﹐或者用 be allowed: They let me leave 他们让我走。 | I was allowed to leave. 我获准离开。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use allow sb to do sth rather than let sb do sth , as it is slightly more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往使用allow sb to do sth﹐而非let sb do sth﹐因为前者稍显正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We must allow young people to develop independence.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须允许年轻人学会独当一面。

Sense.DEF: to not stop something happening, or to make it possible for it to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny let the note fall to the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮任由字条掉落到地上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let anyone know it was me who told you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让别人知道是我告诉你的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Max let the door swing open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯任由门打开。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let the cookies cool down before you try them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 等曲奇冷一冷再尝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stupidly let myself be persuaded to take part in a live debate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我傻乎乎地被人劝去参加一个现场辩论会。

Subsense.DEF: to stop holding something or someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let go! You’re hurting me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放开！你把我弄疼了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guard let go of the lead, and the dog lunged forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫兵松开绳子﹐那只狗就猛冲上去。

Subsense.DEF: to accept that you cannot change something and stop thinking or worrying about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes you just have to learn to let go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候你就得学会放手。

Subsense.DEF: to allow someone to leave a place where they have been kept
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The police had to let him go through lack of evidence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺乏证据﹐警方只得放他走。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The hijackers were persuaded to let some hostages go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劫持者被说服释放部分人质。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone leave their job – used in order to avoid saying this directly
Subsense.TRAN: 叫某人走人〔解雇某人的委婉说法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid we had to let several of our staff go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我们不得不让几名员工走人了。

Sense.DEF: used to make a suggestion or to offer help
Sense.TRAN: 让〔用于表示提议或帮忙〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s make a start, shall we?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始好吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s all get together over Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一起过圣诞节吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s not jump to conclusions – he might have been delayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不要急于下结论——他也许是被耽搁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me help you with those bags.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮你拿那些袋子吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me give you a piece of advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你一个建议吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s hope he got your message in time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿他及时收到了你的留言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let’s argue like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不要这样争吵了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are thinking about or trying to remember something
Sense.TRAN: 让我想一想〔用于正在想或努力记起某事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today’s date is – let me see, March 20th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天是——让我想想——3月20号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, let’s see, where did I put your application form?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐我来想想﹐我把你的申请表放哪儿了呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you need time to think about or remember something
Sense.TRAN: 让我想一想〔用于表示需要时间思考或想起〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was his name, now? Let me think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫什么名字？让我想想。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not care if someone does something they are threatening to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She says she’s going to sell her story to the newspapers!’ ‘Well, let her!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她说要把她的故事卖给报纸！” “行啊﹐随她的便！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone must accept an unpleasant fact or situation
Sense.TRAN: 我们面对现实吧/我们实话实说吧〔表示必须接受令人不快的事实或状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s face it, no one’s going to lend us any money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们面对现实吧﹐没有人会借钱给我们。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not going to give someone all the details about something
Sense.TRAN: 知道…就够了〔用于不打算告诉某人所有细节时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So who did it?’ ‘Let’s just say it wasn’t anyone in this family.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么这是谁干的呢？” “反正不是这家人。”

Subsense.DEF: to relax completely and enjoy yourself
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For goodness sake, Peter, why don’t you just let yourself go for once?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在老天爷的份上﹐彼得﹐你为什么就不能让自己放松一回呢？

Subsense.DEF: to stop looking after yourself properly, for example by not caring about your appearance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Poor Dad. He’s really let himself go since Mum died.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的爸爸﹐自从妈妈过世以后他就不修边幅了。

Subsense.DEF: to not punish or criticize someone for something they have done wrong
Subsense.EXAMPLE: OK, I’ll let it go this time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐这一回就算了。

Subsense.DEF: to stop worrying or thinking too much about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to let the past go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该忘掉过去了。

Subsense.DEF: to sell something for a particular amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t let it go for less than £300.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少于300英镑我是不会卖的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you wish or hope that something happens, or does not happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him be the one who died, she prayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿死的不是他﹐她祈祷道。

Sense.DEF: used after a negative statement to say that the next thing you mention is even more unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 更不用说﹐更谈不上〔用于否定句之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby can’t even sit up yet, let alone walk!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个宝宝连坐都不会﹐更不用说走了！

Sense.DEF: to stop talking about or trying to deal with something
Sense.TRAN: 停止谈论某事﹔不去管某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems the press are not going to let the matter rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来媒体是不会对此事罢休的。

Sense.DEF: to accidentally tell someone something that should have been kept secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liz let slip that she’d seen him quite recently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹说漏了嘴﹐说她不久前见过他。

Sense.DEF: to charge someone an amount of money for the use of a room or building
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interhome has over 20,000 houses to let across Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上居公司在欧洲各地有两万多幢房屋出租。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve let my spare room to a student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把空余的一间房租给了一个学生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you consider letting me the garage for a few months?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能考虑一下把车库租给我用几个月吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We let the smaller studios out to local artists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把较小的工作室租给了当地的艺术家。

GramExa.GLOSS: written on a sign outside a building to show that it is available for renting

Sense.DEF: used in mathematics to mean that you give something a particular measurement or value in order to make a calculation
Sense.TRAN: 假设某物为/等于/代表某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let angle A equal the sum of the two opposite sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设角A为两对角之和。

Sense.DEF: to do something that will cause you a lot of trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think Carol realizes what she’s letting herself in for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想卡萝尔还没有意识到她在给自己招来的麻烦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: never let a day/week/year etc go by without doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does a particular thing very regularly
Sense.TRAN: 没有一天/一个星期/一年等不做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They never seem to let a year go by without introducing a new version of their software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们好像每年都会推出他们这种软件的新版本。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is time for people to start having fun
Sense.TRAN: 让好时光飞转起来吧﹐大家开始玩起来吧

Sense.DEF: to attack someone
to not do something that someone trusts or expects you to do
Sense.TRAN: 使失望﹐辜负〔别人的信任或期望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been let down badly in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去她曾深深失望过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The worst feeling is having let our fans down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最难受的就是辜负了球迷。

GramExa.GLOSS: disappoint a group of people that you belong to

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something less successful or effective
Sense.TRAN: 使失望〔指让某人或某事不是很成功或很有效〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: McKenzie’s judgement rarely lets him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦肯齐的判断很少让他失望。

Sense.DEF: to move something or someone to a lower position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let down a rope so that I can climb up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放一根绳子下来﹐我好爬上去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carefully, she let herself down into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地下到水里去。

Sense.DEF: to relax and enjoy yourself, especially after working hard
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指辛劳后〕放松下来﹐轻松玩乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Visitors young and old let their hair down and enjoyed the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老老少少的游客都放松下来尽情欣赏演出。

Sense.DEF: to relax and stop worrying about what might happen or what someone might find out about you
Sense.TRAN: 解除防备﹐解除戒备心理
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie never really lets her guard down, does she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉从来都放不下她的戒备心理﹐对吗？

Sense.DEF: to give someone bad news in a way that will not upset them too much
Sense.TRAN: 委婉地把坏消息告知某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get asked out on dates quite often, but I always try to let the guy down gently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常常有人约我出去﹐但我都婉拒了。

Sense.DEF: to allow the air to escape from something so that it loses its shape and becomes flat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s let my tyres down!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把我的轮胎放气了！

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of clothing longer by unfolding a folded edge
to tell something that is secret or only known by a few people
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV chef Raymond Blanc lets us in on the secrets of his kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视大厨雷蒙德·布朗向我们透露了他厨房的秘密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would someone mind letting me in on the joke?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁来告诉我你们笑什么？

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that is secret or private
Sense.TRAN: 让〔某人〕知道﹐告知〔秘密或私事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was time to let the rest of the family into the secret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该让家里的其他人知道这个秘密了。

Sense.DEF: to put something such as a window or a decoration into a wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two large windows were let into the wall each side of the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门两边的墙上开了两扇大窗。

Sense.DEF: to not punish someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll let you off this time, but don’t do it again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我且饶过你这一回﹐但下不为例。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After checking our identities, the customs men let us off with a warning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海关人员核查我们的身份之后﹐给了一个警告就放过了我们。

GramExa.GLOSS: allow someone to escape punishment or criticism
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d decided to make Sandra wait before letting her off the hook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打定主意要放过桑德拉﹐但也得让她等等。

GramExa.GLOSS: give someone a less serious punishment than they deserve
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 轻罚某人﹐轻易放过某人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think young criminals are let off far too lightly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得对年轻罪犯量刑太轻了。

Sense.DEF: if someone in authority lets you off something you should do, they give you permission not to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve worked hard all week, so I’ll let you off today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你整个星期都很辛苦﹐所以今天我放你假。

Sense.DEF: to make something explode
Sense.EXAMPLE: One boy had let off a firework in class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个男孩在课堂上放了一个爆竹。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something, especially something you have been keeping secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let on that I told you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要告诉别人是我对你说的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We never did let on how we found out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确实从来没有透露我们是怎么发现的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he knows more than he’s letting on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能肯定他知道的不止他说的这些。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly make a loud sound such as a shout or cry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He let out a cry of disbelief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然大叫了一声﹐表示自己无法相信。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of clothing wider or looser, especially because it is too tight
to charge someone an amount of money for the use of a room or building
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re letting out our son’s old room to a student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把儿子原来住的房间租给了一个学生。

Sense.DEF: if a school, college, film etc lets out, it ends and the people attending it can leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time does the movie let out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影什么时候散场？

Crossrefto.REFLEX: let the cat out of the bag

Sense.DEF: to become less severe or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind had dropped and the rain gradually let up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风势减弱﹐雨也渐渐小了。

Sense.DEF: to be less severe, unkind, or violent towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even when the crowd had scattered, the police didn’t let up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使人群散开了﹐警察还是不肯放过他们。

Sense.DEF: to stop working as hard as you were
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re doing really well, but you can’t afford to let up now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的成绩很不错﹐可你现在还是不能放松啊。

Sense.DEF: an arrangement in which a house or flat is rented to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: An agency is managing the let.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个中介正在安排租借事务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-term let
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期出租

Sense.DEF: happening freely without being prevented in any way
a small kind of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a booklet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小册子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piglet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小猪

Sense.DEF: another spelling of lech
an event, performance etc that is not as good as you expected it to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: The end of the book was a real letdown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的结尾实在是个败笔。

Sense.DEF: causing death, or able to cause death
Sense.TRAN: 致命的﹐致死的﹐具杀伤力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lethal dose of heroin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命剂量的海洛因
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lethal weapon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命的武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: death by lethal injection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These chemicals are lethal to fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化学品对鱼类是致命的。

Sense.DEF: likely to be powerful or dangerous – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 危险的﹐要命的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were all drinking lethal amounts of tequila!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都在不要命地喝特奎拉酒！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Higher taxes and higher inflation were a lethal combination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重税加上高通货膨胀真是让人没法活了。

Sense.DEF: feeling as if you have no energy and no interest in doing anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hot weather was making us all lethargic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热的天气使我们所有人都昏昏欲睡。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being lethargic
Sense.EXAMPLE: New mothers often complain of lethargy and mild depression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初为人母者经常抱怨说身体疲倦乏力﹐有轻微的抑郁。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘let us’, used especially to make suggestions 让我们…吧〔尤用于提议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走吧！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Let’s is used to suggest in a fairly firm way that you and someone else should do something together, and is usually used when you think the other person will agree.
F2NBox.TRAN: let’s 是以较为肯定的语气建议某人和自己一起做某事﹐通常用于认为对方会同意时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Let’s go somewhere different tonight.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚上我们换个地方去吧。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Let’s start by introducing ourselves.
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not forget the apostrophe.不要遗漏撇号Let’s go (NOT不是Lets go). 我们走吧。

To make a negative suggestion, do not say ‘let’s don’t’. Say let’s not . 提出否定形式的建议时不能说let’s don’t﹐而要说let’s not: Let’s not tell anyone about this. 这事我们谁也别告诉 。 Speakers of British English also sometimes say don’t let’s . 一些说英国英语的人有时也会说don’t let’s: Don’t let’s argue. 我们别争了 。

Sense.DEF: a written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got a letter from Melanie today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我收到梅拉妮的一封信。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bart’s writing a letter to his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴特正在给他父母写信。

Sense.DEF: a sign in writing or printing that represents a speech sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语字母表有26个字母。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fill in the form in capital letters written in their large form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大写字母填写表格。

Sense.DEF: paying exact attention to the details of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I followed the instructions to the letter, but it still wouldn’t work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我严格按照说明去做﹐但还是不行。

Sense.DEF: the exact words of a law or agreement rather than the intended or general meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: employees who stick to the letter of the law in their contracts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格遵守合同字面规定的雇员

Sense.DEF: a large cloth letter that you sew onto a jacket, given as a reward for playing in a school or college sports team
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为奖励缝在校运动队队员队服上的〕校名首字母标志
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark got a letter in soccer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克因足球比赛表现突出获得了校名首字母标志奖励。

Sense.DEF: the study of the literature of a particular country or language
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major figure in English letters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位英语文学领域的重要人物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I got a letter from my mother.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收到母亲写来的一封信。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He wrote a letter inviting her to visit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写信请她来做客。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school sent a letter to all the children’s parents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校给所有孩子的父母都发去一封信。

Collocate.COLLOC: answer a letter/reply to a letter
a letter is addressed to sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: has their name and address on the envelope

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was thrilled to get a long letter from her son.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她收到儿子寄来的一封长信﹐异常激动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The letter sounded very formal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信读起来非常正式。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don’t want him reading my personal letters.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不希望他读我的私人信件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that you send with your CV to an employer
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔连同履历一起寄给雇主的〕附函﹐说明信
感谢信/介绍信/投诉信等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I finally got a letter of apology from the company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我收到了公司的一封致歉信。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say不要说 ‘invitation letter’ or 或 ‘complaint letter’. Say 而要说 letter of invitation or 或 letter of complaint.

Sense.DEF: to write, draw, paint etc letters or words on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The card was neatly lettered P. A. DUFFY.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡片上工整地写着P. A. DUFFY。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several pages are lettered in gold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几页用的是烫金字。

Sense.DEF:
to earn a
letter 1 5
in a sport
Sense.TRAN: 获得校名首字母标志奖励

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lettered in basketball at Brandeis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在布兰德斯大学校篮球队获得了校名首字母标志奖励。

Sense.DEF: a small bomb hidden in a package and sent to someone in order to kill or harm them
a narrow hole in a door, or a special box outside a house where letters, packages etc are delivered
a box in a post office or street, in which letters are posted
Sense.TRAN: 〔设于邮局或街上的〕邮箱﹐邮筒

Sense.DEF: when a film from the cinema is broadcast on television with black bands at the top and bottom of the television screen so that the film will have the same dimensions as it did on a cinema screen
Sense.TRAN: 宽银幕模式播放〔指在电视上播放电影时﹐上下方都出现黑边﹐以保持与电影银幕放映相同的画面比例〕

Sense.DEF: well educated
the name and address that is printed at the top of a sheet of writing paper
Sense.TRAN: 信笺抬头﹐笺头〔印于信笺上端的名称和地址〕

Sense.DEF: paper that has the name and address of a person or business printed at the top of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter had been written on university letterhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信是用印有大学校名抬头的信纸写的。

Sense.DEF: written or drawn letters, especially of a particular type, size, colour etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用某种字体﹑大小或颜色书写的〕字
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chinese lettering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国字

Sense.DEF: the art of writing or drawing letters or words
an official letter from a bank allowing a particular person to take money from another bank
correct in every detail
Sense.TRAN: 正确无误的﹐一字不差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a letter-perfect product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完美的产品

Sense.DEF: letter-size paper is 8.5 inches wide and 11 inches long
Sense.TRAN: 信纸大小的〔宽8.5英寸﹐长 11 英寸〕

Sense.DEF: a house or apartment that can be rented
Sense.EXAMPLE: short-term holiday lettings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短期出租的度假房屋

GramExa.GLOSS: one that arranges lettings

Sense.DEF: a round vegetable with thin green leaves eaten raw in salads
when something unpleasant stops or becomes less difficult, severe etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pressure at work continued without any let-up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作上的压力还是丝毫没有减轻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Streets were flooded, but still there was no let-up in the rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街道上都漫了水﹐可雨还是下个不停。

Sense.DEF: a type of cancer of the blood, that causes weakness and sometimes death
a special wall built to stop a river flooding
the amount or degree of something, compared to another amount or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation fell to its lowest level in 30 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀降至30年来最低点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Increased supplies are needed to meet the level of demand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要增加供应以满足需求量。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dolphins show a high level of intelligence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚显示出很高的智力水平。

Sense.DEF: a particular standard of skill or ability, for example in education or sport

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students at this level may have problems with basic grammar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一水平的学生可能会有基本语法的问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What level do you think you’re at?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为自己是什么水平？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few athletes can compete at international level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能参与国际水平比赛的运动员很少。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an advanced-level coursebook
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级程度课本

Sense.DEF: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

GramExa.GLOSS: the same height as your eyes etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 齐眼/齐膝/齐肩等的高度
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Skirts this year are just above knee level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的裙子都刚好在膝盖以上。

GramExa.GLOSS: the height of the water etc from the ground or the bottom of a container
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Check the water level in the car radiator.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查一下汽车散热器的水位。

Sense.DEF: a floor or area of ground that is at a particular height, especially when you can go up or down to other floors or areas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Didn’t we park the car on Level 2?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不是把车停在第二层了吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town is built on different levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个小镇建在高低不同的地面上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The medical center is on one level so that you do not have to go up or down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗中心在同一层楼。

Sense.DEF: a particular position in a system that has different ranks of importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Training is offered at each level in the department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部门内各级人员都能获得培训。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Further talks at ministerial level were held.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长级进一步会谈已经举行。

Sense.DEF: a way of considering or understanding something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The story can be understood on many different levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事可以从多个不同的层面来理解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I agree with you, but only on a theoretical level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同意你的看法﹐但只是在理论层面上。

Sense.DEF: happening within a small area or the whole area of a state, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 地区级的/州级的/国家级的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: These changes are taking place at regional level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变化正在地区范围内发生。

Sense.DEF: to be honest and legal
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is all on the level, right?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切都是合理合法的﹐对吗？

Sense.DEF: to behave as badly as someone
Sense.TRAN: 降低身份到和某人一样
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you hit him back, you’ll only be descending to his level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你还手打他﹐那你只会自降身份到和他一样了。

Sense.DEF: a tool used for checking that a surface is flat

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The level of salt in his diet was too high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他饮食中盐的摄入量太高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The level of violent crime is lower than ten years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪水平比十年前要低。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the highest ever level
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sales have reached record levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售量已达创纪录的水平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Noise levels are unacceptably high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪音大得不堪忍受。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Wage levels had failed to keep up with inflation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪金水平已无法赶上通货膨胀。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I find exercise helps with my stress levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现锻炼有助于缓解压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The level of unemployment has increased.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率有所上升。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pollution levels have fallen slightly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染程度略有下降。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: China’s imports of wheat reached record levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的小麦进口达到创纪录的水平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fees are likely to remain at current levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用可能维持现有水平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to maintain the same level of physical fitness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难使身体状况维持在同一水准不下降。

Sense.DEF: flat and not sloping in any direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a level surface suitable for wheelchairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合轮椅的平坦表面

Subsense.DEF: two things that are level are at the same height as each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your eyes should be level with the top of the screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双眼应与屏幕上端齐平。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The curtains aren’t quite level.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘挂得不是一样高。

Subsense.DEF: two sports teams, competitors etc that are level have the same number of points

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before the weekend, Madrid was level with Barcelona.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在本周末之前﹐马德里队和巴塞罗那队积分相同。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: They finished level, with ten points each.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最后打成平局﹐各得10分。

Subsense.DEF: having the same value or position as something or someone else
Subsense.TRAN: 相同价值的﹔相同地位的﹔相同水平的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Borrowing rates rose to over 8%, roughly level with those in America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贷款利率上涨到8%以上﹐几乎与美国持平。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He cycled along beside her, keeping level.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和她并肩骑行。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which different people, companies, countries, etc can all compete fairly because no one has special advantages
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small businesses want to compete on a level playing field with larger ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小企业想和大企业公平竞争。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do your level best (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to try as hard as possible to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll do my level best to help you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽最大努力帮助你。

Sense.DEF: a steady voice, look etc that shows you are calm or determined
Sense.TRAN: 平静[坚定]的声音/神色/目光

Sense.DEF: an amount of a substance that fills a spoon, cup etc to the top but no more, used as a measure in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 平平的一茶匙/一杯等(某物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add one level teaspoon of salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入平平的一茶匙盐。

Sense.DEF: to make something flat and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers leveled the wet concrete with a piece of wood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们用木块把湿的混凝土抹平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cover with a layer of sand and level it off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺上一层沙﹐并把它推平。

Sense.DEF: to knock down or destroy a building or area completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bombs levelled a large part of the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹把城里一大部分地区夷为平地。

Sense.DEF: to make the score in a game or competition equal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slipped the ball into the net to level the score at 1/1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他送球入网﹐把比分扳成1比1平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: United went ahead but the visitors levelled in the 73rd minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队一路领先﹐但是到第73分钟时客队把比分追平。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation in which people are competing fair, with no one having special advantages
to aim criticism etc at a particular person, country etc, especially publicly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开地〕对某人提出批评/指控/指责等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the criticism levelled at the United States
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对美国的批评
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serious allegations were levelled against the minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种严重指控都指向了部长。

Sense.DEF: to aim something such as a weapon at someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly he levelled his gun at the tiger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地把枪口对准老虎。

Sense.DEF: to stop going up or down and continue at the same height
Sense.EXAMPLE: After climbing steeply, the path levelled off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了陡坡以后﹐小路就变平坦了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane levelled out at 30,000 feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在30,000英尺高空水平飞行。

Sense.DEF: to stop rising or falling and become steady
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation has begun to level off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通胀已开始趋于平稳。

Sense.DEF: to make something flat and smooth
Sense.TRAN: 使某物平坦﹐使某物平整

Sense.DEF: to speak honestly to someone, after hiding some unpleasant facts from them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to level with him and tell him how she felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定坦白告诉他自己的感受。

Sense.DEF: a place where a railway crosses a road, usually protected by gates
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路与公路的〕平面交叉点﹐平交道口

Sense.DEF: calm and sensible in making judgments or decisions
Sense.TRAN: 冷静明智的﹐头脑清醒的

Sense.DEF: something, especially death or illness, that makes people of all classes and ranks seem equal
Sense.TRAN: 使人人平等的事物〔尤指死亡或疾病〕

Sense.DEF: if competitors in a race, election etc are level-pegging, they are equal and it is difficult to know who will win
a stick or handle on a machine or piece of equipment, that you move to operate it
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或设备的〕控制杆﹐操纵杆
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pull this lever to open the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉此横杆开启大门。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
something you use to influence a situation to get the result that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rich countries use foreign aid as a lever to achieve political aims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富国利用对外援助作为达到政治目的的手段。

Sense.DEF: to move something with a lever

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He levered the stone into place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把石头撬到位。

Variant.LEXVAR: lever yourself onto/out of etc sth

Sense.DEF: to move your body by pushing on something with your arms to help you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slowly levered himself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地撑起身。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a particular job, situation etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re trying to lever him out of his job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正设法排挤他离职。

Sense.DEF: influence that you can use to make people do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: diplomatic leverage by the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的外交影响力

Sense.DEF: the action, power, or use of a lever
Sense.TRAN: 杠杆作用﹔杠杆力量﹔杠杆的使用

Sense.DEF: to make money available to someone in order to investor to buy something such as a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: the use of public funds to leverage private investment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动用公共基金为私人投资项目融资

Sense.DEF: to spread or use resourcesmoney, skills, buildings etc that an organization has available, ideas etc again in several different ways or in different parts of a company, system etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reusable software is leveraged across many applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可重复使用的软件得到广泛应用。

Sense.DEF: when someone borrows money to buy all or most of the stock of a company by promising to pay the bank back by selling the company’s assets if they cannot pay back the money they borrowed
something very large and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leviathan of a ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨轮

Sense.DEF: a very large and frightening sea animal
to rise and float in the air by magic, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔靠魔力〕浮在空中﹐飘浮﹔使升空﹐使飘浮

Sense.DEF: lack of respect or seriousness when you are dealing with something serious
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

Sense.DEF: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wants to impose a levy on landfill waste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想对填埋的废弃物征税。

Sense.DEF: using rude words or movements that make you think of sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: lewd comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下流话

Sense.DEF: dealing with words, or related to words
the skill, practice, or profession of writing dictionaries
all the words and phrases used in a language or that a particular person knows
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种语言或某人知晓的〕全部词汇

Sense.DEF: an alphabetical list of words with their meanings, especially on a particular subject or in a particular language
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某学科或语言的〕词汇表
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lexicon of geographical terms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地理学术语词汇表

Sense.DEF: all the words in a language
an imaginary line connecting buildings, places etc that is believed to follow an ancient track that has special power
Sense.TRAN: 雷线﹐地脉〔据信沿远古路线连接建筑﹑地点等的有特殊力量的假想线〕

Sense.DEF: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指法律上对还款﹑赔偿等的〕责任﹐义务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: your liability to capital gains tax
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缴付资本利得税的义务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court ruled there was no liability to pay any refund.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院判定无需退款。

Sense.DEF: the amount of debt that must be paid
someone or something that is likely to cause problems for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: A kid like Tom would be a liability in any classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像汤姆这样的孩子放到任何班上都是个累赘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outspoken minister has become a liability to the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位直言不讳的部长成了政府的麻烦。

Sense.DEF: the amount by which something is likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc
Sense.TRAN: 易受某事物影响的程度

Sense.DEF: likely to do or say something or to behave in a particular way, especially because of a fault or natural tendency
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was liable to just show up without warning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是不预先通知一声就来了。

Sense.DEF: legally responsible for the cost of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who are liable for income tax at a higher rate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 须按照较高税率缴纳所得税的人

Sense.DEF: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc
Sense.TRAN: 易受…影响的﹔易出问题的﹔易得病的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re more liable to injury when you don’t get regular exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不经常锻炼更容易受伤。

Sense.DEF: likely to be legally punished or forced to do something by law
Sense.TRAN: 可能受处罚的﹐可能要承担法律义务的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyone found trespassing is liable to a maximum fine of $100.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 擅自闯入者一经发现﹐最高可罚款100美元。

Sense.DEF: to exchange information with someone who works in another organization or department so that you can both be more effective

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Council officers are liaising closely with local groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会官员与地方团体联系密切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The education officer liaises between students, schools and colleges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育官在学生与学校之间充当联络人。

Sense.DEF: the regular exchange of information between groups of people, especially at work, so that each group knows what the other is doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: close liaison between the army and police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军警之间的密切联系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: better liaison with other agencies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与其他机构之间更好的联系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The project has been set up in liaison with the art department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目是和艺术系联合设立的。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to talk to different departments or groups and to tell each of them about what the others are doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Renee Ball, liaison to the State Parks Authority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州立公园管理处联络员勒妮·鲍尔

Sense.DEF: a secret sexual relationship between a man and a woman, especially a man and a woman who are married but not to each other
someone who deliberately says things which are not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you calling me a liar?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是说我在撒谎？

Sense.DEF: a gift of wine to a god

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 缩写= Liberal Democrat自由民主党

Sense.DEF: when someone writes or prints untrue statements about someone so that other people could have a bad opinion of them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Holt sued the newspaper for libel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔特控告该报诽谤。

GramExa.GLOSS: a court case against someone for libel

Sense.EXAMPLE: restrictions on press freedom, such as libel laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诽谤法之类对新闻自由的限制

Sense.DEF: to write or print a libel against someone
containing untrue written statements about someone which could make other people have a bad opinion of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: libellous gossip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诽谤性质的流言

Sense.DEF: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a more liberal attitude towards sexuality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对两性关系比较开通的态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had quite liberal parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父母思想很开明。

Sense.DEF: supporting or allowing gradual political and social changes
Sense.TRAN: (思想)开放的﹐支持[主张]变革的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a more liberal policy on issues of crime and punishment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在罪与罚的问题上更加开明的政策

Sense.DEF: allowing people or organizations a lot of political or economic freedom
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治和经济上〕开明的﹐自由的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 政治开明的国家/社会/民主体制等

Sense.DEF: generous or given in large amounts
Sense.TRAN: 慷慨的﹐大量给予的﹔丰富的﹐充足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a liberal supply of drinks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮料的充足供应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If only they were as liberal with their cash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他们花钱也一样大方就好了。

Sense.DEF: not exact
Sense.TRAN: 不严格的﹐不拘泥字面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a liberal interpretation of the original play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对原剧作的灵活诠释

Sense.DEF: a kind of education which encourages you to develop a large range of interests and knowledge and respect for other people’s opinions
someone with liberal opinions or principles
someone who supports or belongs to the former Liberal Party in Britain or the Liberal Party in Canada
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国先前的或加拿大的〕自由党支持者﹐自由党党员

Sense.DEF: the areas of learning which develop someone’s ability to think and increase their general knowledge, rather than developing technical skills
a British political party
liberal opinions an principles, especially on social and political subjects
understanding of, and respect for, other people’s opinions
the quality of being generous
to make a system, laws, or moral attitudes less strict
Sense.TRAN: 使自由化﹔放松对…的限制

Sense.DEF: using or including plenty of something, especially in a generous way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apply the glue liberally to both surfaces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把两面都涂满胶水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: dark hair liberally sprinkled with grey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛着银丝的黑发

Sense.DEF: with liberal ideas or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people around here are more liberally inclined than back home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人比老家那边的人思想更加开明。

Sense.DEF: subjects that are taught in order to increase someone’s general knowledge and their ability to write, speak, and study more effectively
to free someone from feelings or conditions that make their life unhappy or difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: women’s freedom to pursue careers liberated from childcare
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女从养儿育女中解放出来去追求事业的自由

Sense.EXAMPLE: the liberating power of education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育的解放力量

Sense.DEF: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control
Sense.TRAN: 释放〔囚犯〕﹔解放〔城市﹑国家等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几天以后﹐我军解放了这座城市。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the liberation of Paris in August 1944

Sense.DEF: free to behave in the way you want, and not restricted by traditional rules of social and sexual behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社交和性行为上〕不受约束的﹐思想解放的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a liberated woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个思想开放的女性

Sense.DEF: a modern form of Christian teaching and activity, mainly in the Roman Catholic Church, that is based on the idea that the Church should work to change bad social, political, and economic conditions
Sense.TRAN: 解放神学〔主要为天主教会信奉的一种现代基督教教义﹐主张教会应努力改善社会﹑政治和经济状况〕

Sense.DEF: someone who believes strongly that people should be free to do and think what they want to, without any government control
someone who leads an immoral life and always looks for pleasure, especially sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在两性关系上〕放荡不羁的人

Sense.DEF: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fight for liberty and equality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取自由和平等的斗争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: threats to individual liberty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对个人自由的威胁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: struggles for political liberty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取政治自由的斗争

Sense.DEF: a particular legal right
Sense.EXAMPLE: liberties such as freedom of speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言论自由等合法权利

Sense.DEF: something you do without asking permission, especially which may offend or upset someone else
Sense.TRAN: 自作主张的行为﹐冒犯的举动﹐放肆的行为

GramExa.PROPFORM: take the liberty of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I took the liberty of cancelling your reservation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自作主张取消了你的预订。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at liberty to do sth
Sense.DEF: to have the right or permission to do something
Sense.TRAN: 有权做某事﹔获准做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am not at liberty to discuss these matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无权讨论这些问题。

Subsense.DEF: to make unreasonable changes in something such as a piece of writing
Subsense.TRAN: 随意改动某物﹐任意窜改某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film-makers took too many liberties with the original novel.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影制作人对原著改动太多。

Subsense.DEF: to treat someone without respect by being too friendly too quickly, especially in a sexual way
Subsense.TRAN: 与某人相处时太放肆﹐对待某人过于狎昵〔尤指言行带有性意味〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s been taking liberties with our female staff.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我们的女职员态度太随便了。

Sense.DEF: if a prisoner or an animal is at liberty, they are no longer in prison or enclosed in a small place
Sense.TRAN: 〔犯人或动物〕不受拘禁的﹐自由的

Sense.DEF: someone’s desire to have sex
the seventh sign of the zodiac, represented by a pair of scales, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between September 24 and October 23
someone who was born between September 24 and October 23
Sense.TRAN: 属天秤座的人〔即9月24日至10月23日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a library
Sense.TRAN: 图书馆管理员﹔图书馆馆长

Sense.DEF: a room or building containing books that can be looked at or borrowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a public library
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共图书馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a library book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的书

Sense.DEF: a group of books, CDs etc, collected by one person
a room in a large house where books are kept
a set of books, CDs, videos etc that are produced by the same company and have the same general appearance
Sense.TRAN: 文库﹔系列丛书[CD集﹑成套录像等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a library of modern classics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代经典文库

Sense.DEF: film or pictures used in a television programme which are not recent
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视节目中放映的〕资料图片/旧影片

Sense.DEF: someone who writes librettos
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌剧﹑音乐剧的〕歌词[脚本]作者

Sense.DEF: the words of an opera or musical play
the plural of louse1
an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dealers applied for an export licence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经销商申请了出口许可证。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested for driving without a license.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因无照驾驶被捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tennessee Valley Authority applied for a license to operate the facility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田纳西河谷管理局申请了这个场所的经营执照。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The owner of land could grant a licence to cut and remove timber.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土地所有者可发执照授权砍伐和运走木材。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forgot to renew my licence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘记去办理执照展期了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Persistent offenders face losing their licence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多次违规者将会被没收执照。

Sense.DEF: an agreement with a company or organization giving permission to make, sell, or use their product

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guinness is brewed under licence in South Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 健力士啤酒经特许在南非酿造。

GramExa.GLOSS: permission for computer software to be used by a certain number of people or in a certain place only
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔计算机软件〕单用户/10用户/站点许可证
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a licence agreement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特许协议

Sense.DEF: freedom to do or say what you think is best
Sense.EXAMPLE: Headteachers should be allowed greater licence in the exercise of their power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应允许校长在行使权力时享有更大自由。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a painter or writer changes the facts of the real world to make their story, description, or picture of events more interesting or more beautiful
the freedom or opportunity to behave in a way that is wrong or immoral

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police say it gives youngsters licence to break the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说这会纵容年轻人违法乱纪。

Sense.DEF: an opportunity to make a lot of money without much work or effort – especially used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 轻松大赚一笔的机会〔尤作贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a restaurant which is licensed to sell alcohol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获准出售酒类的一家餐厅

Sense.EXAMPLE: The vaccine has been licensed by the US Food and Drug Administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疫苗已经得到美国食品与药物管理局的批准。

Sense.DEF: having a licence to sell alcoholic drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a licensed restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有售酒许可证的餐厅

Sense.DEF: a car, gun etc that is licensed is one that someone has official permission to own or use
Sense.TRAN: 持有执照的﹐获准拥有的

Sense.DEF: having been given official permission to do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a licensed private investigator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有执照的私人侦探

Sense.DEF: someone who has official permission to do something
Sense.TRAN: 执照持有人﹐许可证持有人

Sense.DEF: one of the signs with numbers on it at the front and back of a car
the British laws that say when and where you can sell alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 售酒法〔规定酒类销售时间和地点的英国法律〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has been given official permission to practise a particular art or profession
behaving in a sexually immoral or uncontrolled way
another spelling of lychee
a grey, green, or yellow plant that spreads over the surface of stones and trees
to move your tongue across the surface of something in order to eat it, wet it, clean it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog jumped up and licked her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗跳起来舔她的脸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A cat licked up the drops spilt on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只猫把溅在地板上的东西舔光了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He licked the drops off his upper lip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他舔去上唇的液滴。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bet we could lick the best teams in Georgia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢打赌我们能打败佐治亚州最强的队。

Sense.DEF: if flames or waves lick something, they touch it again and again with quick movements

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soon the flames were licking at the curtains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火舌很快就吞卷窗帘。

Sense.DEF: to have succeeded in dealing with a difficult problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just when you think you’ve got it licked, it comes back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在你以为万事大吉的时候﹐问题又回来了。

Sense.DEF: to feel eager and excited because you are expecting to get something good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scottish rugby fans are licking their lips in anticipation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰的橄榄球迷正在热切期盼着。

Sense.DEF: to quietly think about the defeat or disappointment you have just suffered
Sense.TRAN: 〔失败或失望后〕舔舐伤口﹐重整旗鼓

Sense.DEF: to obey someone completely because you are afraid of them or want to please them
when you move your tongue across the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have a lick of your ice cream?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以舔一口你的冰激凌吗？

Sense.DEF: a small amount of paint etc put onto the surface of something to improve its appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be okay after a lick of paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刷上一点油漆就行了。

Sense.DEF: not even a small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann won’t do a lick of work around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里的事安一点也不做。

Sense.DEF: part of a song played on a guitar
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bluesy guitar lick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用吉他演奏的蓝调风格小过门

Sense.DEF: very fast

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sth a lick and a promise

Subsense.DEF: to wash or clean something quickly and carelessly
Subsense.TRAN: 马虎地清洗某物﹔随便打扫一下某物

Subsense.DEF: to do a job quickly and carelessly

Sense.DEF: an act of hitting someone
very quickly
a defeat in a sports competition or match
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育竞赛或比赛的〕失败﹐挫折
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got a real licking in the final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在决赛中一败涂地。

Sense.DEF: a severe beating as a punishment
the American spelling of liquorice
a cover for the open part of a pot, box, or other container

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the name on the coffin lid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 棺盖上的姓名

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He carefully lifted the lid of the box.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心翼翼地打开盒盖。

Sense.DEF: an eyelid
to control a situation very carefully, especially so that it does not cause problems
Sense.TRAN: 严密控制某事﹔看紧某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: keeping the lid on inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制通货膨胀
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kline keeps a very tight lid on his private life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克兰把他的私生活隐藏得很严实。

Sense.DEF: to do something that finally stops something or ruins or ends someone’s plans or hopes
Sense.TRAN: 结束某事﹔使计划[希望]落空
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s put a lid on all these rumours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们来粉碎这一切谣言吧。

Sense.DEF: to let people know the true facts about a bad or shocking situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a documentary that takes the lid off the world of organized crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 揭开有组织犯罪真相的纪录片

Sense.DEF: eyes with large eyelids
a lidded container, pot etc has a lid
an outdoor public area, often at a beach, lake etc, for swimming and lying in the sun
Sense.TRAN: 海[湖]滨浴场﹐露天游泳池

Subsense.DEF: to be in a position in which your body is flat on the floor, on a bed etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was lying on the bed smoking a cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正躺在床上抽烟。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t lie in the sun for too long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要在日光下躺太长时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a few minutes he just lay there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几分钟时间他只是躺在那里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She would lie awake worrying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会担忧得无法入睡。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The dog was lying dead on the floor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗躺在地上死了。

Subsense.DEF: to put yourself in a position in which your body is flat on the floor or on a bed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lie flat on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 平躺在地板上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lay back against the pillows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她躺下来﹐靠在枕头上。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a flat position on a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The papers were lying neatly on his desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件整齐地摆放在他的桌上。

Sense.DEF: if a problem, an answer, blame etc lies somewhere, it is caused by, exists, or can be found in that thing, person, or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Part of the blame must lie with social services.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会服务机构肯定也有一部分责任。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the problem/answer etc lies with/in sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The difficulty lies in providing sufficient evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 困难在于要提供足够的证据。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The strength of the book lies in the fact that the material is from classroom experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的优点是它取材于课堂经验。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: And herein lies the key to their achievements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们成功的关键所在。

Sense.DEF: if a town, village, etc lies in a particular place, it is in that place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town lies in a small wooded valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城镇坐落于一个林木茂盛的山谷中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tasman Sea lies between Tasmania and Australia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔斯曼海位于塔斯马尼亚和澳大利亚之间。

Sense.DEF: if something lies ahead of you, lies in the future etc, it is going to happen to you in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How will we cope with the difficulties that lie ahead?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们如何应付以后的困难呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A blank and empty future lay before me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的未来是一片茫然和空白。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I was wondering what lay in store for us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想﹐等待着我们的会是什么呢？

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular state or condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book lay open on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书摊开放在桌子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The town now lay in ruins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城镇现已成为一片废墟。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lie at the heart/centre/root of sth
Sense.DEF: to be the most important part of something, especially the main cause of it
Sense.TRAN: 处在某事物的核心/是某事物的根基
Sense.EXAMPLE: the issue that lies at the heart of the present conflict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前冲突的中心问题

Subsense.DEF: to remain hidden because someone is trying to find you or catch you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to lie low until tonight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得躲到今天晚上。

Subsense.DEF: to wait and try not to be noticed by anyone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He decided to lie low for a while after the report came out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道出来以后他决定暂时不露面。

Subsense.DEF: to remain hidden in a place and wait for someone so that you can attack them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a giant crocodile lying in wait for its prey
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条守候猎物的巨鳄

Subsense.DEF: if something bad lies in wait for you, it is going to happen to you

Sense.DEF: to be in second, third etc position in a competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在竞赛中〕名列第二/第三/第四等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool are lying third in the football championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队在足球锦标赛中名列第三。

Sense.DEF: if something lies heavy on you, it makes you feel unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 沉重地压在某人心头﹐使某人感到不安
Sense.EXAMPLE: The feelings of guilt lay heavy on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内疚感沉重地压在他的心头。

Sense.DEF: if someone lies in a particular place, they are buried there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here lies Percival Smythe written on a gravestone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珀西瓦尔·斯迈思长眠于此。

Sense.DEF: if an important person who has died lies in state, their body is put in a public place so that people can go and look at the body in order to show their respect for that person
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要人物的遗体〕停放于某处供瞻仰

Sense.DEF: if something is lying around, it has been left somewhere in an untidy way, rather than being in its proper place
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you leave your shoes lying around like that, you’ll trip over them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果鞋子这样到处乱放﹐你会被绊倒的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Papers and books lay around the room in complete chaos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间内到处堆放着报纸和书﹐一片狼藉。

Sense.DEF: if you lie around, you spend time lying down and not doing anything
Sense.TRAN: 无所事事地闲躺着混日子
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt so lazy just lying around on the beach all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整天就是闲躺在沙滩上﹐感觉懒洋洋的。

Sense.DEF: if something lies behind an action, it is the real reason for the action even though it may be hidden
Sense.EXAMPLE: She soon guessed what lay behind his question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就猜出他为什么会问这样的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two basic assumptions lay behind the policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项政策的背后有两个基本的假设。

Sense.DEF: to put yourself in a position in which your body is flat on the floor or on a bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just lie down on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就躺在床上吧。

Sense.DEF: to accept bad treatment without complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to take this lying down!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我是不会罢休的！

Sense.DEF: to remain in bed in the morning for longer than usual
to hide or rest somewhere for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next day they lay up in a cave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天他们躲在一个山洞里。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately tell someone something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell from her face that she was lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以从她脸上看出她在说谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would never lie to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远不会对你说谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lied about her age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她隐瞒了她的年龄。

GramExa.GLOSS: say something that is completely untrue

Sense.DEF: if a picture, account etc lies, it does not show the true facts or the true situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Statistics can often lie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计数字往往会造成一种假象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The camera never lies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相机从来不会作假。

Sense.DEF: something that you say or write that you know is untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always know when he’s telling lies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一说谎我就知道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I knew that soon she would hear the lies about me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道她很快就会听说针对我的那些谎言。

Sense.DEF: to show that something is untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: This report gives the lie to the company’s claims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告表明公司的说法不属实。

Subsense.DEF: the way that a situation is developing at a particular time
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某一时期〕形势的发展﹐情况的变化
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll talk to him and get the lie of the land before we go over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会先和他谈谈﹐了解一下情况﹐然后我们再过去。

Subsense.DEF: the way an area of land has been formed and the physical feature it has

Sense.DEF: used when you realize that something you have just said is not correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was £25, no, tell a lie, £35.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是25英镑﹐不对﹐说错了﹐是35英镑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He got into trouble for telling a lie.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撒了个谎﹐惹下麻烦了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How could you believe his lies?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么会听信他的谎言？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell them to a lot of people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How dare you spread such vicious lies?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么胆敢散布如此恶毒的谎言？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that is completely untrue
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Of course the whole thing was a complete lie.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那整件事当然完全是一派谎言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a small lie that you tell someone for good reasons, for example to avoid hurting their feelings
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We all have to tell white lies sometimes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我们都得说一些善意的小谎言。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when something is a clearly a lie, especially when you feel annoyed
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 十足的谎言〔尤用于表示愤怒〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: That’s a downright lie. I never said any such thing!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是彻头彻尾的谎言。 我从没说过这样的话！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is very unkind and very untrue
an obvious lie
an obvious lie that is told with no sense of shame
a lot of lies
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everything he had told me was a pack of lies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉我的一切都是一派谎言。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘say a lie’. Say 而要说 tell a lie.

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used especially by the police to check whether someone is lying, by measuring sudden changes in their heart rate
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was asked to take a lie detector test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被要求做一个测谎试验。

Sense.DEF: a short rest, usually on a bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going upstairs to have a lie down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要上楼去躺一会儿。

Sense.DEF: a lord who was served and obeyed in the Middle Ages
someone who had to serve and obey a lord in the Middle Ages
an occasion when you stay in bed longer than usual in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always have a lie-in on a Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天我总要睡个懒觉。

Sense.DEF: the legal right to keep something that belongs to someone who owes you money, until the debt has been paid
instead of
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra time off in lieu of payment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代替报酬的额外休假

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= lieutenant 陆军中尉﹔海军上尉﹔空军中尉﹔〔美国警察的〕警督

Subsense.DEF: a fairly low rank in the armed forces, or an officer of this rank
Subsense.TRAN: 陆军中尉﹔海军上尉﹔空军中尉

Subsense.DEF: a fairly high rank in the US police force, or an officer of this rank

Sense.DEF: an officer or official with the rank just below colonel, general2, governor etc
someone who does work for, or in place of, someone in a higher position
the period of time when someone is alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learning goes on throughout life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习是一生的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have your whole life ahead of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For the first time in my life I was happy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我人生中第一次感到幸福。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been so embarrassed in my life!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子还从来没有这么尴尬过呢！

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known John all my life since I was born.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从小就认识约翰了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His main aim in life was to have fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was one of the best days of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我一生中最快乐的时光之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident scarred him for life for the rest of his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场事故给他留下了终生的创伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew she’d feel guilty for the rest of her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道自己将内疚终生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raj spent his life caring for others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉杰一辈子都在关爱他人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bonington spent his entire adult life in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博宁顿成年后就一直在法国生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t know much about the poet’s early life when he was young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这位诗人的早年生活所知甚少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor diet can lead to a whole range of diseases in later life when you are older.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食不良会在晚年引发各种疾病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She married late in life when she was fairly old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她结婚晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a life member continuing until he dies of the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是俱乐部的终身会员。

Sense.DEF: the state of being alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: The right to life is the most basic of human rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生存权是最基本的人权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny was a cheerful little boy who loved life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼是一个热爱生命的快乐小男孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two firefighters risked their lives to save the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名消防员冒着生命危险营救这些孩子。

Sense.DEF: the way you live your life, and what you do and experience during it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The operation should enable Bobby to lead a normal life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次手术应该能让博比过上正常的生活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She just wanted to live a quiet life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是想过平静的生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Having a baby changes your life completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了孩子会彻底改变你的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family moved to Australia to start a new life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人移居澳大利亚﹐开始新的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken’s whole life revolved around surfing that was the main interest and purpose of his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯的全部生活都以冲浪为中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t let your boyfriend rule your life control and affect everything you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该让你的男朋友主宰你的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandmother had a hard life a life full of problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖母一生坎坷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s led a very sheltered life a life in which you have been protected from unpleasant things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她过着备受呵护的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had been drawn into a life of crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被引上了犯罪的道路。

Subsense.DEF: the experiences, activities, and ways of living that are typical of being in a particular job, situation, society etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why do so few women enter political life?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么涉足政坛的女性这么少？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the British way of life
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国人的生活方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Noise has become one of the main pollutants of modern city life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪音已成为现代城市生活的主要污染之一。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He missed the routine of army life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怀念按部就班的军队生活。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you enjoying married life?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你婚后生活开心吗？

Subsense.DEF: the time in your life when you are doing a particular job, are in a particular situation etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔从事某一工作﹑处于某一状况时的〕生活经历

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now a celebrity chef, he rarely talks about his life as an army cook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在是一位名厨﹐很少谈起他在部队里当炊事员的经历。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sara admits to having affairs throughout her married life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉承认她婚后一直有外遇。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most of his working life was spent in the shipyards.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作生涯中大部分时间是在船厂度过的。

Sense.DEF: the activities in your life relating to your friends, your family, sex etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t need advice about my love life.
