Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的爱情生活不需要有人来指手画脚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional views of family life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的家庭生活观念
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children need a caring and happy home life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童需要充满关爱﹑幸福的家庭生活。

Sense.DEF: human existence, considered as a variety of experiences and activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: My Aunt Julia had very little experience of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姨妈朱莉娅的生活经验很少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life has a way of changing the best of plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生就是这样﹐偏要改变你好好的计划。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some people, religion gives life a meaning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有些人来说﹐宗教信仰使人生有了意义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the frustrations and disappointments of everyday life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日常生活中的挫折和失意

Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to see the funny side of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量去发掘生活中有趣的一面。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 某事物的存在期/使用寿命

Subsense.DEF: the period of time during which something happens or exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The issues will not be resolved during the life of the present parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题在本届议会任期内是得不到解决的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building began life as a monastery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑物最初是一座修道院。

Subsense.DEF: the period of time during which something is still good enough to use
Subsense.TRAN: 使用寿命﹔有效期﹔保鲜期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the average life of a passenger aircraft?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 客机的平均使用寿命是多久？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Careful use can extend the life of your washing machine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心使用可延长洗衣机的寿命。

Subsense.DEF: the quality of being alive that people, animals, plants etc have and that objects and dead things do not have
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ben felt her neck for a pulse or any other sign of life.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本摸了摸她的脖子﹐看是不是还有脉搏或者其他生命迹象。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the springtime, everything comes to life again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天﹐万物复苏。

Subsense.DEF: living things, such as people, animals, or plants
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is there life on other planets?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他行星上有生命吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island is rich in bird life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上鸟类繁多。

Sense.DEF: to be the most important thing or person to someone
Sense.TRAN: 是某人的(全部)生活﹔是某人的生命
Sense.EXAMPLE: Music is Laura’s whole life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐是劳拉生命的全部。

Sense.DEF: used for emphasizing that a situation, decision etc is extremely urgent and important, especially because someone is at risk of dying
Sense.TRAN: 生死攸关(的)﹐决定生死(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t call me unless it’s a matter of life and death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不是什么生死大事就不要打电话给我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life or death decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生死攸关的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: A doctor’s job involves life and death situations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生的工作经常关乎生死。

Sense.DEF: a chance in a game, especially a computer game, in which you can be defeated or do something wrong and can still continue playing
Sense.TRAN: 命〔尤指计算机游戏中继续玩下去的机会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s up to level five and still has three lives left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打到了第五关﹐仍有三条命。

Sense.DEF: activity or movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was quiet and there was no sign of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋子里静悄悄的﹐没有一丝动静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was always so cheerful and full of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是那么乐观﹑充满生气。

Sense.DEF: a quality of being interesting or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to put some life into your writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章要尽量写得有生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game really came to life after a magnificent goal from Rouney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁尼攻入漂亮一球后﹐比赛变得非常精彩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gifted teacher can really bring literature to life for his or her students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有才华的老师可以把文学教得生动有趣。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come to life/roar into life/splutter into life etc
Sense.DEF: to suddenly start working
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally the car spluttered into life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车终于突突地发动了起来。

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult, easier etc to do something
Sense.TRAN: 使生活变得困难/较容易等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surely computers are supposed to make life easier, not more complicated!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑按说应当是要方便生活﹐而不是让生活更复杂吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why make life difficult for yourself?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么要给自己的生活找麻烦呢？

Sense.LEXUNIT: the life and soul of the party
Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys social occasions and is fun and exciting to be with
Sense.TRAN: 社交聚会中最活跃的人

Sense.DEF: your life and physical health – used especially when this is threatened in some way
Sense.TRAN: 生命﹐生死安危〔尤用于生命受到某种威胁时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She risks life and limb every day in her job as an undercover investigator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作是当密探﹐每天都要冒生命危险。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think they are boring and should find more exciting things to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You guys should just stop moaning and get a life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些家伙就别抱怨了﹐来点有意思的吧！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is disappointing but you have to accept it
Sense.TRAN: 生活就是这样﹐这就是生活〔用于表示某事令人失望﹐但必须接受〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh well, that’s life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐生活就是这样！

Sense.DEF: used to say that bad things happen in life
used when you are relaxing and doing something you enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 这样才是生活﹐生活就该这样〔用于放松并做自己喜欢的事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ah, this is the life! Lying on the beach, sipping cool drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐这样才是生活！躺在沙滩上﹐喝着清凉的饮料。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the shock/surprise/game etc of sb’s life
Sense.DEF: the biggest shock or surprise, the best game etc that someone has ever had
Sense.TRAN: 某人平生最大的震惊/最大的意外/最出色的比赛等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the surprise of my life when I saw John standing there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到约翰站在那里﹐真是天大的意外。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have the time of your life

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they are well, what they have been doing etc
Sense.TRAN: 你过得好吗？你生活得怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi Bob! How’s life?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐鲍勃﹐你好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s life been with you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你过得好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you must continue to live a normal life even when something sad or disappointing has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: We both miss him, but life goes on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都想念他﹐可是生活还得继续呀。

Subsense.DEF: if something has a life of its own, it seems to move or work by itself
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ball seemed to have acquired a life of its own.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个球就像活了一样。

Subsense.DEF: if something has a life of its own, it exists and develops without depending on other things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Slowly but surely, the project is taking on a life of its own.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目正依靠自身力量缓慢但稳步地向前发展。

Sense.LEXUNIT: cannot for the life of me
Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot remember or understand something even when you try hard
Sense.TRAN: 我拼了命也不能﹐我怎么也不能〔用于不能记起或理解某事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t for the life of me remember his name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么也想不起他的名字。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not waste time doing something or worrying about something
Sense.TRAN: 人生苦短﹐生命太短暂〔用于表示不能浪费时间去做某事或为某事担心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forget about it. Life’s too short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忘了这事吧﹐生命太短暂了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Life’s too short for moping about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生短暂﹐没时间自怨自艾。

GramExa.PROPFORM: life’s too short to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Life’s too short to bear grudges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生苦短﹐何必怀恨心头。

Sense.DEF: used as a reply to a question or suggestion to say that you definitely will not do something
Sense.TRAN: 决不〔用于回答问题或建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you going to go and work for him then?’ ‘Not on your life!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么你是要去替他工作喽？” “我才不干呢！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: the woman/man/girl etc in your life
Sense.DEF: the woman or man you are married to or are having a relationship with – used especially in advertisements
Sense.TRAN: 你生命中的女人/男人/女孩等〔尤用于广告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the ideal gift for the man in your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是送给你生命中的男人最理想的礼物。

Sense.DEF: the punishment of being put in prison for the rest of your life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sentenced to life for the murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因谋杀罪被判终身监禁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she should get life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得应该判她无期徒刑。

Sense.DEF: when you paint, draw etc something you are looking at, especially a person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s taking classes in life drawing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在上写生课。

Sense.LEXUNIT: frighten/scare the life out of sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t do that! You scared the life out of me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那样做！你把我的魂都吓掉了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s life in the old dog yet
Sense.DEF: used to say that although someone or something is old, they are still able to do something – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 宝刀未老﹐老当益壮〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to have a very easy and comfortable life and not have to work hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spends all day lounging by the pool and living the life of Riley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他整天就是懒洋洋地躺在游泳池旁﹐日子过得舒适安逸。

Sense.DEF: the story of someone’s life
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boswell’s ‘Life of Johnson’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍斯韦尔所著的《约翰逊传》

Sense.DEF: the time after death, in which some people believe life continues in another form
Sense.EXAMPLE: She expects to meet her dead husband in the next life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她期待着来生与亡夫相会。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The money you give will save the life of a child.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给的这些钱能拯救一个孩子的生命。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He risked his life to help Jews during the Second World War.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战中他冒着生命危险帮助犹太人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: die
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of people lost their lives on the first day of the fighting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗第一天就有数百人丧生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: kill someone
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 夺去(某人的)生命﹐杀死某人
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All cultures consider it wrong to take a life for no reason.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的文化均认为无故剥夺他人生命是错误的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: kill yourself
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was depressed and decided to take his own life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他意志消沉﹐决定自杀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: kill someone – used of a thing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The disease claimed the lives of up to a quarter of the population.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该病已夺走了四分之一人口的生命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: result in deaths/in someone’s death

Collocate.COLLOC: give your life/lay down your life
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: die in order to save other people, or because of a strong belief
not kill someone, when you could kill them
be so ill or injured that you might die
try to stay alive, even though you are very ill or injured
be still alive because of someone’s actions
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The victim said he owed his life to the stranger who helped him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害人说他能活下来全亏那位陌生人相助。

Collocate.COLLOC: take your life in your hands
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put yourself in a dangerous situation

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the cost of life’. Say 而要说 the cost of living.

Sense.DEF: a life buoy
a special belt you wear in the water to prevent you from sinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔绑在腰间防止在水中下沉的〕救生带

Sense.DEF: the most important thing needed by an organization, relationship etc to continue to exist or develop successfully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Communication is the lifeblood of a good marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沟通是美满婚姻的根本保证。

Sense.DEF: your blood
Sense.TRAN: 人的血液﹐生命必需的血液

Sense.DEF: a boat that is sent out to help people who are in danger at sea

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 救生船全体船员/停泊港/服务

Sense.DEF: a small boat carried by ships in order to save people if the ship sinks
a large ring made out of material that floats, which you throw to someone who has fallen in the water, to prevent them from drowning
an important decision which you make about your life, for example where you choose to live, what kind of job you do, whether you get married etc
Sense.TRAN: 人生的抉择〔指人生中的重大决定〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to help other people be successful in their lives. A life coach helps his or her client to be clear about what they want to do in the future and helps them to make a plan that will allow them to achieve their aims.
Sense.TRAN: 人生教练﹐生活教练〔以帮助别人实现人生目标为职业的人〕

Sense.DEF: all the different levels of development that an animal or plant goes through during its life
the length of time that a person or animal is expected to live
the length of time that something is expected to continue to work, be useful etc
a living thing such as a plant or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: life forms on other planets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他星球上的生物

Sense.DEF: someone whose job at a beach or swimming pool is to help swimmers who are in danger
all the events and changes that happen during the life of a living thing
a type of insurance that someone makes regular payments into so that when they die their family will receive money

PIC.HEADING: LIFE JACKET 救生衣
PIC.PICCONTENT: life jacket BrE【英】/life vest AmE【美】救生衣

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that can be filled with air and worn around your upper body to stop you from sinking in the water
dead or appearing to be dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anton’s lifeless body was found floating in the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安东的尸体被发现漂浮在湖里。

Sense.DEF: lacking the positive qualities that make something or someone interesting, exciting, or active
Sense.TRAN: 单调的﹐无生气的﹐无活力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The actors’ performances were lifeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员的表演了无生气。

Sense.DEF: not living, or not having living things on it
Sense.TRAN: 无生机的﹐没有生命的﹔没有活物的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The surface of the Moon is arid and lifeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球表面干旱﹐没有生命。

Sense.DEF: lifeless hair or skin is in bad condition and does not look healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔头发或皮肤〕干枯的﹐不光润的

Sense.DEF: a lifelike picture, model etc looks exactly like a real person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very lifelike statue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一尊栩栩如生的塑像

Sense.DEF: something which someone depends on completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The telephone is her lifeline to the rest of the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话是她与外界保持联系的生命线。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organization has proved to be a lifeline for thousands of needy families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构已经成为数以千计贫困家庭的生命支柱。

Sense.DEF: a rope used for saving people in danger, especially at sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用于海上救生的〕救生索

Sense.DEF: continuing or existing all through your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She became a lifelong friend of ours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成了我们一辈子的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: David finally realized his lifelong ambition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维终于实现了他毕生的抱负。

Sense.DEF: someone who has the rank of a British peerlord or lady but who cannot pass it on to their children
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国爵位不可世袭的〕终身贵族

Sense.DEF: something such as a life beltor life jacket that can be worn in the water to prevent you from sinking
someone who has been sent to prison for the rest of their life
a small rubber boat that can be filled with air and used by passengers on a sinking ship
someone or something that helps you avoid a difficult or unpleasant situation
Sense.TRAN: 救星﹐帮助解决困难的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A microwave oven can be a real lifesaver when you’re pressed for time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间紧迫时﹐微波炉真是个救星。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that prevents you from dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: The seat belt is the biggest single lifesaver in cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全带是汽车里最重要的救命装备。

Sense.DEF: a lifeguard
life-saving medical treatments or equipment are used to help save people’s lives

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy needs a life-saving transplant operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个男孩需要做移植手术来保命。

Sense.DEF: the skills necessary to save a person from drowning
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of the staff have been trained in lifesaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都受过水中救生培训。

Sense.DEF: subjects such as biology that are concerned with the study of humans, plants, and animals
the punishment of sending someone to prison for the rest of their life or for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller is serving a life sentence for murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒因谋杀罪在服无期徒刑。

Sense.DEF: a picture or model of something or someone that is life-size is the same size as they really are
Sense.TRAN: 与实物[真人]大小一样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life-sized statue of the president
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真人大小的总统雕像

Sense.DEF: the average length of time that someone will live or that something will continue to work
Sense.TRAN: 〔人的〕平均寿命﹔〔物的〕使用寿命
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men have a shorter lifespan than women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性的平均寿命比女性短。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a lifespan of 5 days/10 years etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A TV set has an average lifespan of 11 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视机的平均使用寿命为11年。

Sense.DEF: the story of someone’s whole life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She insisted on telling me her whole life story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持要把她一生的经历说给我听。

Sense.DEF: the way a person or group of people live, including the place they live in, the things they own, the kind of job they do, and the activities they enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular exercise is part of a healthy lifestyle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼身体是健康生活方式的一部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lead an extremely lavish lifestyle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的生活穷奢极侈。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that keeps someone alive when they are extremely ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔病重时使用的〕生命维持系统

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that keeps people alive in conditions where they would not normally be able to live, such as in space
Sense.TRAN: 〔在太空等处生存的〕生命保障系统

Sense.DEF: a life-threatening situation, illness, or injury could cause a person to die
Sense.TRAN: 危及生命的﹐威胁着生命的﹐可能致命的

Sense.DEF: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During her lifetime she had witnessed two world wars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生亲历了两次世界大战。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the chance/experience etc of a lifetime
Sense.DEF: the best opportunity, experience etc that you will ever have
Sense.TRAN: 千载难逢[终生难得]的机会/经历等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the holiday of a lifetime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的假期终生难得。

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you go out with him after he dropped you?’ ‘Not in this lifetime.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他甩了你之后你还会和他约会吗？” “这辈子是不会了。

Sense.DEF: a life jacket
to move something or someone upwards into the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

GramExa.PROPFORM: lift sb/sth onto/into/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lifted Andrew onto the bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把安德鲁抬到床上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver was lifted from the wreck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员被人从汽车残骸中抬了出来。

Sense.DEF: to move part of your body up to a higher position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lifted her hand to knock on the door once again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再次举手敲门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pam lifted her shoulders in a little shrug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕姆微微耸了耸肩。

GramExa.GLOSS: move your head or eyes up so that you can look at something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lifted her head to gaze at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抬头注视着他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He heard a scream and the hairs on the back of his neck began to lift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到一声尖叫﹐吓得脖子后面寒毛直竖。

Sense.DEF: to remove a rule or a law that says that something is not allowed
Sense.TRAN: 解除〔某项规定或法规〕﹐撤销〔限制〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government plans to lift its ban on cigar imports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府打算解除雪茄进口的禁令。

Sense.DEF: to take people or things to or from a place by aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLE: More troops are being lifted into the area as the fighting spreads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着战火的蔓延﹐越来越多的部队被空运到这个地区。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not lift a finger (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to do nothing to help
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never lifted a finger to help me with the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来都不帮我照顾一下孩子。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel more cheerful and hopeful
Sense.TRAN: 使某人开心起来﹐使某人振奋

Sense.DEF: if cloud or mist lifts, it disap-pears
if feelings of sadness lift, they disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan’s depression seemed to be lifting at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简的沮丧情绪看来终于要烟消云散了。

Sense.DEF: to take words, ideas etc from someone else’s work and use them in your work, without stating where they came from and as if they were your own words etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The words were lifted from an article in a medical journal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段文字是从某医学杂志上的一篇文章中抄来的。

Sense.DEF: to steal something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had lifted dozens of CDs from the store.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从商店里偷来许多CD。

Sense.DEF: if you lift your voice, you speak, shout, or sing more loudly
to make prices, profit etc increase
Sense.EXAMPLE: The U.S. may use tax cuts to lift the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国可能会用减税的方法来提振经济。

Sense.DEF: to dig up vegetables that grow under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was lifting potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在挖马铃薯。

Exponent.DEF: to move something or someone upwards to a higher position, especially something heavy, either by using your hands or a machine
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用手或机器〕抬起﹐提起﹐举起〔尤指重物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t lift anything heavy if you have a bad back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你背疼就不该抬重物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lifted the girl up onto his knee.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把女孩抱起来﹐放到腿上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They used a crane to lift the carriages back onto the rails.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用起重机把车厢搬回到轨道上。

Exponent.DEF: to lift something to a higher position for a short time before lowering it again. Raise is more formal than lift.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bridge can be raised to allow ships to pass under it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥面可升起﹐让船只从下面通过。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Cheers, everyone!’ said Larry, raising his glass.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “各位﹐干杯！” 拉里举杯说道。

Exponent.DEF: to lift something up from the ground, from a table etc, especially something small or light
Exponent.TRAN: 拾起﹐拿起〔尤指小或轻的物体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She picked up her bag and left the room.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起包就离开了房间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tom picked the papers up off the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆把文件从地板上拾起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you just pick up the phone and call him?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不拿起电话打给他呢？

Exponent.DEF: to lift someone or something quickly from the ground, from a table etc, using your hand or arm
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She bent down and scooped up the little dog.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她弯下腰﹐一把抱起小狗。

Exponent.DEF: to lift up something which is heavy and difficult to carry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Joe picked up the sack and hoisted it onto the truck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔拎起袋子﹐搬到卡车上。

Exponent.DEF: to lift something to a higher position and keep it there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor advised me to rest and elevate my ankle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议我休息并抬高脚踝。

Exponent.DEF: to lift your arm into the air, for example because you want to speak in a class or when voting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Put your hand up if you know the answer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道答案请举手。

Sense.DEF: if an aircraft or spacecraft lifts off, it leaves the ground and rises into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took the lift down to the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在三楼﹐我们乘电梯上去吧。

Sense.DEF: if you give someone a lift, you take them somewhere in your car
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want a lift into town?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要搭便车进城吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: John gave me a lift home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰顺便开车送我回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He very kindly offered me a lift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很好心﹐让我搭他的车。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone feel more cheerful and more hopeful
Subsense.TRAN: 让某人振奋起来﹐给某人提一提精神
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The new park has given everyone in the neighbourhood a lift.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新公园让附近的每一个人都很开心。

Subsense.DEF: to make something such as a business, the economy etc operate better
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Bank of England’s announcement gave the stock market a lift today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天英格兰银行的公告让股市备受鼓舞。

Sense.DEF: a movement in which something is lifted or raised up
Sense.EXAMPLE: She does sit-ups and leg lifts every morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天早上做仰卧起坐和抬腿练习。

Sense.DEF: the pressure of air that keeps something such as an aircraft up in the air or lifts it higher
the moment when a vehicle that is about to travel in space leaves the ground
a band of strong material in your body, similar to muscle, that joins bones or holds an organ in its place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tore a ligament in his left knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拉伤了左膝韧带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: damaged ankle ligaments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤的踝关节韧带

Subsense.DEF: the energy from the Sun, a flame, a lamp etc that allows you to see things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We saw a flash of light.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到一道闪光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything looked grey in the dim light of the oil lamp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在昏暗的油灯下﹐所有的东西看上去都是灰蒙蒙的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I read by the light of the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我借着火光读书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The man moved forward into the light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人向前走到光亮的地方。

Subsense.DEF: a particular type of light, with its own particular colour, level of brightness etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The colours look different in different lights.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些颜色在不同光线下看上去不同。

Subsense.DEF: something that produces light, especially electric light, to help you to see
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ahead of us we could see the lights of the city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前方﹐我们能看到城市的灯光。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a mixture of wall lights and ceiling lights in different parts of the house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在房子的不同地方装了壁灯和顶灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I switched on the light in the bedroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打开卧室的灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to switch the lights off when you go out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出去时别忘了关灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the light out downstairs?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把楼下的灯关了好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lights in the office were still on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里依然亮着灯。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The street lights were just beginning to come on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街道两旁华灯初上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He left a light on in the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让厨房里的一盏灯亮着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure all the lights are off when you leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你走的时候一定要把所有的灯都关了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly all the lights in the house went out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忽然屋里所有的灯都熄灭了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the light down make it less bright a bit?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把灯调暗一点好吗？

Subsense.DEF: something such as a lamp that you can carry to give you light
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shine a light over here, will you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把灯往这边照﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: one of a set of red, green, and yellow lights used for controlling traffic
Sense.EXAMPLE: We waited for the lights to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等着红绿灯转换。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually the lights turned green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿灯终于亮了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver had failed to stop at a red light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红灯亮时司机没有把车停下。

Sense.DEF: one of the lights on a car, bicycle etc that help you to see at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was dazzled by the lights of oncoming traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被迎面车辆的灯光照得睁不开眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve left your lights on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的车灯一直亮着。

Sense.DEF: the time when light first appears in the morning sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: We set out at first light the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天天刚亮我们就出发了。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from getting all the light they need to see or do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you move to the left a little – you’re standing in my light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能往左边移一移吗——你挡住了我的光线。

Sense.DEF: a match or something else to light a cigarette
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a light, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问你有火吗？

Sense.DEF: an expression in someone’s eyes that shows an emotion or intention
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a murderous light in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他目露凶光。

Sense.DEF: to make something start burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candle fell over and set light to the barn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜡烛倒了﹐引燃了谷仓。

Sense.LEXUNIT: come to light, be brought to light
Sense.DEF: if new information comes to light, it becomes known
Sense.TRAN: 〔新信息〕为人所知﹐被披露出来
Sense.EXAMPLE: This evidence did not come to light until after the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庭审结束以后这个证据才被披露出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mistake was only brought to light some years later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个错误数年之后才浮现出来。

Sense.DEF: to provide new information that makes a difficult subject or problem easier to understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔提供新资料〕使某事物更容易理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melanie was able to shed some light on the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅拉妮能对情况作进一步解释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These discoveries may throw new light on the origins of the universe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些发现也许可以让人们更进一步了解宇宙的起源。

Sense.DEF: if you do or decide something in the light of something else, you do it after considering that thing
Sense.TRAN: 考虑到某事物﹐根据[鉴于]某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: In light of this tragic event, we have canceled the 4th of July celebrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为这场悲剧﹐我们取消了7月4日的庆祝活动。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is seen or shown in a particular light, people can see that particular part of their character
Sense.TRAN: 从新的/不同的/坏的等角度看
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suddenly saw my father in a new light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然对父亲有了新的看法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This incident will put the company in a very bad light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事件将使公司形象大为折损。

Subsense.DEF: to suddenly understand something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At last doctors have seen the light!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们终于明白过来了！

Subsense.DEF: to begin to believe in a religion very strongly
Subsense.TRAN: 开始虔诚地信仰某宗教

Subsense.DEF: if an object sees the light of day, it is taken from the place where it has been hidden, and becomes publicly known
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some of these documents will probably never see the light of day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件中有一部分也许永远也不会公开。

Subsense.DEF: if a law, decision etc sees the light of day, it comes into existence for the first time

Sense.LEXUNIT: light at the end of the tunnel
Sense.DEF: something that gives you hope for the future after a long and difficult period
Sense.TRAN: 黑暗尽头的光明〔指经历长期磨难后终于看到希望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a hard few months, but we’re finally beginning to see the light at the end of the tunnel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几个月很艰难﹐但是我们终于见到曙光了。

Sense.DEF: to be successful and famous in theatre or films
to go to sleep very quickly because you are very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went straight to bed and went out like a light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直接上了床﹐倒头就睡着了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is important in a particular organization
Sense.TRAN: 某组织中的权威人士[重要人物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s one of the leading lights of the local dramatic society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是当地戏剧协会的权威人士。

Sense.DEF: the person that someone loves more than anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 某人最心爱的人﹐某人的心肝宝贝
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her son was the light of her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子是她的心肝宝贝。

Sense.DEF: a window in a roof or wall that allows light into a room

Crossrefto.REFLEX: hide your light under a bushel
in the cold light of day

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The light was so bright he had to shut his eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线太强了﹐他不由得闭上了眼睛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely bright
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The white buildings reflected a blinding light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色建筑反射出刺眼的光线。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not bright
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Gradually her eyes became accustomed to the dim light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐渐地﹐她的眼睛适应了昏暗的光线。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: bright enough
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Stand over here where the light is good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 站到这里来﹐这里光线好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not bright enough
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The light was too poor for me to read.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线太差了﹐我没法阅读。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: light that seems slightly yellow or orange
light that seems slightly blue
light produced by the sun
light produced by lamps

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The light from the streetlamp shone through the curtains.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 路灯的光透过窗帘照进来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The only light came from the fire.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的光线来自火焰。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a large amount of light comes in
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Light streamed in through the window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 光从窗户泻进来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The light fell on her book.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 光照在她的书上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: makes it bright or able to be seen
it is getting darker as the sun is going down
send light onto something
something has a lot of light shining on it
a thin line of light
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a shaft of light from the doorway.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 门口有一道光。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a bright light that appears suddenly for a very short time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A flash of light caught his attention.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道闪光引起了他的注意。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an area of light

Sense.DEF: a light colour is pale and not dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look nice in light colours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿浅色衣服很好看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had blue eyes and light brown hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一双蓝眼睛和一头浅棕色的头发。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted a lighter yellow paint for the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一种颜色更浅的黄色墙面涂料。

Sense.DEF: if it is light, there is the natural light of day
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll keep on looking while it’s still light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会趁天亮继续寻找。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was seven o’clock and just starting to get light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是早上7点钟﹐天刚蒙蒙亮。

Sense.DEF: a room that is light has plenty of light in it, especially from the sun
Sense.TRAN: 明亮的﹐采光好的〔尤指阳光充足〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was light and spacious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房明亮宽敞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office was a big light room at the back of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室在房子后部﹐是一个明亮的大房间。

Sense.DEF: not very heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以拿这个袋子——它很轻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该穿轻便舒适的鞋子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆卡车很轻﹐容易驾驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was as light as a feather very light to carry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抱起来轻得很。

Sense.DEF: if something is light, there is not very much of it or it is not very great
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic is lighter before 8 a.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上8点钟以前交通流量小一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light rain began to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天开始下起了小雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing only light make-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只化了个淡妆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只受到轻度辐射的人

Sense.DEF: light clothes are thin and not very warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a light sweater in case the evening was cool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带了一件薄毛衣﹐晚上感到凉时穿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a light summer coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天穿的薄外套

Sense.DEF: a light wind is blowing without much force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaves were blowing about in the light wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶在微风中晃动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a light easterly breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵东风轻轻吹来。

Sense.DEF: a light sound is very quiet
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a light tap at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人轻轻敲门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was light and pleasant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音轻柔悦耳。

Sense.DEF: a light touch is gentle and soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a light kiss on the cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻吻了他的脸颊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt a light tap on his shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到有人在他肩上轻轻地拍了一下。

Sense.DEF: light work is not hard or tiring
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found him some light work to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给他找了点轻松的工作干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She only has a few light duties around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只做一点轻松的家务活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor has advised me to take regular light exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议我经常做一些轻松的运动。

Subsense.DEF: food or drink that is light either does not have a strong taste or does not make you feel full very quickly, for example because it does not contain very much fat, sugar, or alcohol
Subsense.TRAN: 清淡的﹔不腻的﹔易消化的﹔低度的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We had a light white wine with the fish.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们喝了点低度白葡萄酒配鱼吃。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a light, refreshing dessert
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种清淡﹑提神的甜食
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a new light cheese spread with virtually no fat
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种几乎不含脂肪的新品种清淡奶酪酱

Subsense.DEF: a light meal is a small meal
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I had a light lunch in town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在镇上简单地吃了顿午饭。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a delicious light snack
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味的小吃

Subsense.DEF: food that is light contains a lot of air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a type of light, sweet bread
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种松软的甜面包
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Beat the mixture until it is light and fluffy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把混合物搅打到松软为止。

Sense.DEF: a light punishment is not very severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fairly light sentence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较轻的刑罚

Sense.DEF: someone who does not smoke etc very much
Sense.TRAN: 抽烟/饮酒/食量等少的人

Sense.DEF: a sleep from which you wake up easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell into a light sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迷迷糊糊地睡得不沉。

Sense.DEF: someone who wakes up easily if there is any noise etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s quite a light sleeper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她睡觉容易惊醒。

Sense.DEF: not serious in meaning, style, or manner, and only intended to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 〔意义﹑风格或方式〕不严肃的﹐供消遣的﹐轻松的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech gradually became lighter in tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话的口气慢慢轻松起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evening of light music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻音乐晚会
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a really good book if you want a bit of light reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想来点轻松的阅读﹐这本书很合适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look at some of the lighter moments from the world of politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看一看政界的一些轻松时刻

Sense.DEF: something that is pleasant and amusing after something sad or serious
Sense.TRAN: 〔悲伤或严肃的事情后的〕轻松的调剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m glad you’ve arrived – we could all do with a little light relief!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴你到了——我们都需要略微放松放松呢！

Sense.DEF: to joke about something or treat it as not being very serious, especially when it is important
Sense.TRAN: 不把某事当一回事﹐轻松对待某事﹐〔尤指〕拿重要的事开玩笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to make light of the situation, but I could tell that she was worried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽量装出一副轻松的样子﹐但是我看得出她对这局面很担心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on a lighter note/in a lighter vein
Sense.DEF: used when you are going to say something less sad or serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: On a lighter note, the concert raised over £300 for school funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说点轻松的话题吧﹐这场音乐会为学校基金募集了300多英镑。

Sense.DEF: to do something or deal with something quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 迅速而轻松地完成某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: A freezer and microwave oven can make light work of cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱和微波炉可以让烹饪变得更加便捷。

Sense.DEF: to be able to move quickly and gracefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very agile and light on her feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她行动敏捷﹐脚步轻快。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a light heart feels happy and not worried
Sense.TRAN: 轻松愉快的心情﹐无忧无虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: I set off for work with a light heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀着轻松愉快的心情出发去上班了。

Sense.DEF: light soil is easy to break into small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrots grow well in light soils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡萝卜在松软的土壤里生长良好。

Sense.DEF: to start to burn, or to make something start to burn
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped to light a cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来点了一支烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lit the fire and poured a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生好火﹐倒了一杯酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t get the candles to light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我点不着蜡烛。

Sense.DEF: to provide light for a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was lit by one large, central light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间由中央的一盏大灯照明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The porch is always well lit at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里﹐门廊总是灯火通明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was warm and brightly lit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里暖融融的﹐灯光明亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poorly lit car park
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线暗淡的停车场

Sense.DEF: to provide light for someone while they are going somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 用灯给某人照路﹔拿灯给某人引路
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had only a few torches between us to light the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家只有几个手电筒照路。

Sense.DEF: to notice or find something by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eye lit on a ruby ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视线落到一枚红宝石戒指上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I might have lit upon an ancient manuscript.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想﹐我可能是发现了一份古代手稿。

Sense.DEF: if a bird or insect lights on something, it stops flying and stands on it
to run away, especially because you are afraid
to give light to a place or to shine light on something
Sense.TRAN: 照亮〔某处〕﹔把光照在〔某物〕上
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flames lit up the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火光照亮了天空。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fountain is lit up at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里喷泉打上了灯光。

Sense.DEF: to become bright with light or colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: At night the harbour lights up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了晚上﹐海港灯火通明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the screen lit up, he typed in his password.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕亮起﹐他键入密码。

Subsense.DEF: if someone’s face or eyes light up, they show pleasure, excitement etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔脸上或眼中〕流露出喜悦[兴奋]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His eyes lit up with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑得两眼放光。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face lit up with pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她高兴得满面春风。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone’s face or eyes show pleasure or excitement
Subsense.TRAN: 使〔某人的脸或眼睛〕流露出喜悦[兴奋]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly a smile lit up her face.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她顿时喜笑颜开。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A mischievous gleam lit up her eyes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛里流露出淘气的神情。

Sense.DEF: to light a cigarette
Sense.EXAMPLE: I watched Paul light up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着保罗又点了一支烟。

Sense.DEF: a small plane
a type of fairly weak pale beer
the glass object inside a lamp that produces light and has to be replaced regularly
a lighted window, room etc is bright because there is a light on inside
Sense.TRAN: 〔窗户﹑房间等〕灯光照亮的﹐灯火通明的

Sense.DEF: a lighted candle, match etc is burning at one end

a small electronic object that produces light when an electrical current is sent through it. Light-emitting diodes are used, for example,as lights on electrical equipment, and to make words and pictures on large screens.
to reduce the amount of work, worry, debt etc that someone has
Sense.TRAN: 减轻﹐减少〔工作量﹑担忧﹑债务等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should hire another secretary to lighten Barbara’s workload.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该再招聘一位秘书﹐减轻芭芭拉的工作量。

Sense.DEF: to become brighter or less dark, or to make something brighter etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the sky lightened, we were able to see where we were.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色渐亮﹐我们能看清楚身处何地了。

Sense.DEF: if you lighten something such as a mood or atmosphere, or if it lightens, it becomes less sad or serious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nora didn’t respond to my attempts to lighten the conversation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我努力让谈话变得轻松一点﹐可诺拉却没有反应。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s face or expression lightens, they begin to look more cheerful
Sense.TRAN: 〔脸或表情〕变得高兴﹐露出喜色
Sense.EXAMPLE: His whole face would lighten when anyone mentioned Nancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有人提起南希﹐他就满脸喜悦。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the weight of something or, to become less heavy
used to tell someone not to be so serious about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to lighten up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要放松一点。

Sense.DEF: a small object that produces a flame for lighting cigarettes etc
a large open low boat used for loading and unloading ships
likely to steal things
unable to think clearly or move steadily, for example during a fever or after drinking alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 〔发热时或饮酒后〕神志不清的﹔脚步不稳的﹔眩晕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun and the wine had made him a little light-headed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日晒加上喝了点酒使他有点头重脚轻。

Sense.DEF: not intended to be serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a light-hearted comedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松的喜剧

Sense.DEF: cheerful and not worried about anything
Sense.TRAN: 轻松愉快的﹐无忧无虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found her in a light-hearted mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现她心情轻松愉快。

Sense.DEF: a boxer who weighs less than 79.38 kilograms, and who is heavier than a middleweight but lighter than a cruiserweight
Sense.TRAN: 轻重量级拳击手〔体重在79.38 公斤以下﹐级别在次重量级和中量级之间〕

Sense.DEF: a tower with a powerful flashing light that guides ships away from danger
industry that produces small goods, for example computers, in small factories using light machinery
the lights that light a room, building, or street, or the quality of the light produced
Sense.TRAN: 照明设备﹔〔照明的〕光线﹐灯光
Sense.EXAMPLE: Better street lighting might help to reduce crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善街道照明或许有助于减少犯罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fluorescent lighting is much cheaper to use than light bulbs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用荧光灯照明比用普通灯泡便宜得多。

GramExa.GLOSS: lighting that is not very bright

Sense.DEF: a structure that holds the lights for a stage in a theatre, at an outdoor concert etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔舞台﹑露天音乐会等使用的〕照明架﹐灯光设备

Sense.DEF: with only a small amount of weight or force
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knocked lightly on the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我轻轻地敲了敲门。

Sense.DEF: using or having only a small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lightly greased pan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涂了少许油的平底锅
Sense.EXAMPLE: lightly armed soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻装士兵

Sense.DEF: to do something without serious thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divorce is not a matter you can afford to take lightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚的事轻率不得。

Sense.DEF: to be punished in a way that is less severe than you deserve
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got off lightly because his father was a lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得轻判﹐因为父亲是一名律师。

Sense.DEF: without worrying, or without appearing to be worried
Sense.TRAN: 无忧无虑地﹔看似轻松地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Things will be fine,’ he said lightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “会没事的。”他轻松地说。

Sense.DEF: an instrument used by a photographer to measure how much light there is
a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two farmworkers were struck by lightning hit by lightning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个农民遭闪电击中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lightning flashed overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶上电光闪闪。

Sense.DEF: extremely quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mitch moved like lightning and caught the little girl before she fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米奇眼疾手快﹐一把抓住了小女孩﹐没有让她摔倒。

Sense.DEF: something bad or unpleasant is not likely to happen to the same people or in the same place twice
Sense.TRAN: 闪电不在一处打两次﹔倒霉的事不可能在同一人身上〔同一场所〕重复发生﹔事不过二

Sense.DEF: very fast, and often without warning
Sense.TRAN: 闪电般的﹐很快的〔往往事先没有警告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lightning attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪电式突袭

GramExa.GLOSS: extremely quickly

Sense.DEF: an insect with a tail that shines in the dark
a metal wire or bar that is attached to the side of a building and goes from the top to the ground, used to protect the building from lightning
a lightning conductor
someone or something who gets most of the criticism, blame, or public attention when there is a problem, although they may not be responsible for it
Sense.TRAN: 众矢之的﹔代人受过者﹐替罪羊

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a lightning rod for sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The senator has become a lightning rod for criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该参议员成了众矢之的。

Sense.DEF: a strikeact of stopping work without any warning
Sense.TRAN: 〔事先没有警告的〕闪电式罢工

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment like a pen, used to draw or write on a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于在计算机屏幕上画线或书写的〕光笔

Sense.DEF: artificial light from towns etc that makes the sky less dark at night, so that the stars cannot be seen clearly
an electric railway system that uses light trains and usually carries only passengers, not goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常只载客而不运送货物的〕轻便铁路﹐轻轨

Sense.DEF: a small ship that stays near a dangerous place at sea and guides other ships using a powerful flashing light
a type of entertainment that uses a series of moving coloured lights, at a pop concert
the time at night when a group of people who are in a school, the army etc must put the lights out and go to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校﹑军队等的〕熄灯(就寝)时间

Sense.DEF: a glowstick
someone who has no importance or influence, or who does not have the ability to think deeply – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 微不足道的人﹐无足轻重的人﹔思想浅薄的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intellectual lightweight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 智力平庸的人

Sense.DEF: a boxer who weighs less than 61.24 kilograms, and who is heavier than a featherweight but lighter than a welterweight
Sense.TRAN: 轻量级拳击手〔体重在61.24公斤以下﹐级别在羽量级和次中量级之间〕

Sense.DEF: someone or something of less than average weight
weighing less than average
Sense.EXAMPLE: a torch made from lightweight plastic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用轻质塑料制成的手电筒

Sense.DEF: lightweight clothing or material is thin, so you can wear it in warm weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lightweight jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件轻便的夹克衫

Sense.DEF: showing a lack of serious thought – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 思想肤浅的﹐浅薄的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lightweight novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本肤浅的小说

Sense.DEF: the distance that light travels in one year, about 9,460,000,000,000 kilometres, used for measuring distances between stars
Sense.EXAMPLE: a star 3,000 light years from Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 距离地球3,000光年的一颗恒星

Sense.LEXUNIT: light years ahead/better etc than sth
Sense.DEF: much more advanced, much better etc than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 比某物超前很多/好很多等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Japanese company is light years ahead of its European competitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家日本公司远远超前于其欧洲的竞争对手。

Sense.DEF: a very long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: It all seems light years ago now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在看来﹐这一切都好像非常久远了。

Sense.DEF: a soft substance like coal, used as fuel
likable people are nice and easy to like
Sense.EXAMPLE: a friendly likeable little boy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 友善可爱的小男孩

Sense.DEF: similar to something else, or happening in the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair is dark brown like mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发是深褐色的﹐和我的一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A club should be like a big family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部就应该像一个大家庭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He eats like a pig!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃东西像猪一样！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden looked like a jungle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那花园看上去就像是一个热带丛林。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last he felt like a real soldier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于感到自己像一个真正的军人了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My experience is very much like that described in the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的经历很像这本书上说的那样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very like his brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很像他的哥哥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes you sound just like exactly like my mum!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候你听上去简直就像我妈！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s growing more like his father every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一天比一天长得更像他的父亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked nothing like not at all like the man in the police photograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去一点也不像警方照片上的那个人。

Sense.DEF: used when asking someone to describe or give their opinion of a person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物是什么样的？某人/某物怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s their house like inside?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子里面是什么样子的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are Dan’s parents like?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹的父母是怎样的人？

Sense.DEF: for example
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things like glass, paper, and plastic can all be recycled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃﹑纸张﹑塑料之类的东西都可以回收利用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to avoid fatty foods like cakes and biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量不要吃蛋糕和饼干之类的高脂食品。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually use for example, for instance , or such as rather than like .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们一般用 for example ﹐ for instance 或 such as ﹐而不用 like
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: packaging materials, for instance paper, glass, and plastic
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 包装材料﹐比如纸张 ﹑ 玻璃及塑料
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Try to avoid fatty foods such as cakes and biscuits.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量不要吃蛋糕和饼干等高脂食品 。

Sense.DEF: typical of a particular person

GramExa.PROPFORM: be like sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not like Steven to be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不像史蒂文﹐他不会迟到的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just like her to run away from her responsibilities!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是这样﹐总是逃避责任！

Sense.DEF: used when you are showing someone how to do something
Sense.TRAN: 像这样〔用于教人做某事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to fold the corners back, like so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把角折回去﹐像这样。

Sense.DEF: if you do something just like that, you do it without thinking about it or planning it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 就像那样〔表示做某事没有经过仔细思考或计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t give up your job just like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能就那样把工作辞了！

Sense.DEF: not much more or less than a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The machinery alone will cost something like thirty thousand pounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单是机器就要花费大约3万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s scored something like 60 goals this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季他进了约60个球。

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Twenty years ago travel was nothing like as easy as it is now. 20
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年前旅行根本不像现在这样方便。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will be nothing like enough money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这点钱根本不够。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular thing is very enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing like a nice cup of tea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么能比得上一杯好茶了！

Sense.DEF: used when giving an amount or number that you think is closer to being right than one that has been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 更可能像[是]〔用于提供较之前提及的更准确的数量或数目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The builders say they’ll be finished in three months, but I think it’ll be more like six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑商说他们会在三个月内完工﹐但是我认为六个月的可能性更大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s more like it/this is more like it
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is better, more correct, or more enjoyable than something else
Sense.TRAN: 那还比较像样﹐这还差不多
Sense.EXAMPLE: That gives us a total of 52 – that’s more like it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样我们得出的总数是52个——这还比较像样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat down by the pool and took a sip of her wine. ‘This is more like it,’ she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在泳池旁边坐下来﹐抿了一口葡萄酒。“这还差不多。她说。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to change something that has been said, to make it more true
Sense.TRAN: 应该说﹐说成是…还差不多
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Poor David,’ she said. ‘Poor Harriet, more like it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可怜的戴维﹐”她说﹐“更应该说可怜的哈丽雅特！”

Sense.DEF: used in a joking, friendly way, when you are surprised by what someone has just said or done
Sense.TRAN: 你什么人哪！你怎么回事！〔一种开玩笑的友好说法﹐表示惊异于对方的说法或做法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think she’s a lovely lady.’ ‘What are you like!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我觉得她是一位可爱的女士。”“你怎么回事！”

Sense.DEF: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like your jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢你这件上衣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really like classical music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you like this colour?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like my coffee quite weak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like it when you get angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you like living in London how much do you like it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t like talking in public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢在公共场合说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like to see people enjoying themselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢看到人们玩得开心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I quite like their new album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We really liked the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The time I like best like most of all is the evening when it’s cool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the things I like about John is his sense of humour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢约翰的一点就是他的幽默感。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想当单亲家长。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone is nice or enjoy being with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jessica’s really nice, but I don’t like her boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰茜卡人很好﹐可我不喜欢她的男朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll like my brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会喜欢我哥哥的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really like Sam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢萨姆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a lovely girl and I like her very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个很可爱的女孩﹐我非常喜欢她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In time, I got to like her began to like her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段时间之后﹐我开始喜欢她了。

Sense.DEF: to approve of something and think that it is good or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like dishonesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢不诚实的行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like the way he shouts at the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢他那样对孩子们吼叫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s never liked talking about people behind their backs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不喜欢在背后议论别人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t like him taking all the credit when he didn’t do any of the work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢他什么事也没做却独占功劳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t like to swear in front of the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢在小孩子面前说粗话。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something regularly or make something happen regularly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like to get up early and get a bit of work done before breakfast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢早起﹐在吃早餐前干点活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We like our students to take part in college sports activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望学生参加学院的体育活动。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you want something or want to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 想要﹐希望〔用于表示想要某物或做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like a cheeseburger, please.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一个奶酪汉堡包。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to see that film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想看那部电影。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s something I’d like to tell you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点事想要告诉你。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to apologize for my behaviour yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想为我昨天的行为道歉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d just like to say how grateful we are for your help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想说﹐我们非常感激你的帮助。

GramExa.PROPFORM: would like sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He would like us all to be at the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望我们全都参加会议。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone if they want something or want to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 想要〔用于问某人是否想要某物或做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a drink?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要喝一杯吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What would you like to eat?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想吃什么？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Contact our office if you would like more information.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 若要了解详情﹐请与我们的办事处联系。

GramExa.PROPFORM: would sb like to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to come with us?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想和我们一起去吗？

Subsense.EXAMPLE: How would you like would you like to spend the summer in Italy?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想到意大利去过夏天吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: would sb like sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like me to pick you up in the morning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要我早上去接你吗？

Sense.DEF: whatever thing you want, in whatever place you want etc
Sense.TRAN: 你想要的任何事物/任何地方/任何东西等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can sit wherever you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想坐哪里就坐哪里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can choose anything you like from the menu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菜单上的东西你随便点。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as long as you like/as much as you like etc
Sense.DEF: as long, as much etc as you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know you’re welcome to stay with us as long as you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道﹐你在我们家想住多久都是欢迎的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take as many as you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想拿多少就拿多少吧。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something unpleasant is true or will happen and cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 不管你喜不喜欢〔强调令人讨厌的事是真的或即将发生﹐并且无法改变〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like it or not, people are often judged by their appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你喜不喜欢﹐大家都往往以貌取人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you wish or hope something is true, when you are not sure that it is
Sense.TRAN: 我倒是想[希望](……)〔用于表示希望某事是真的﹐但不肯定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to think that we offer an excellent service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒是希望我们能提供出色的服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would like to believe that the company can be successful in the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我愿意相信公司将来能取得成功。

Subsense.DEF: used to suggest or offer something to someone
Subsense.TRAN: 如果你愿意〔用于提出建议或提供某物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can give you her phone number, if you like.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要的话﹐我可以把她的电话号码给你。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you like, I could go with you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意﹐我可以陪你去。

Subsense.DEF: used to agree to something, even if it is not really what you want yourself
Subsense.TRAN: 要是你喜欢﹐随便你〔用于表示同意﹐即使并非自己所愿〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shall we get a takeaway on the way home?’ ‘If you like.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们回家路上买份外卖好吗？”“随便你。”

Subsense.DEF: used to suggest one possible way of describing something or someone
Subsense.TRAN: 可以说是〔用于提出形容某物或某人的可行方法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have a proper agreement, but we have an informal understanding, if you like.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有签正式的协议﹐但是可以说﹐非正式的协定还是有的。

Sense.DEF: to think someone is sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think Alex likes me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得亚历克斯喜欢我吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’d like to see you/him do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe someone can do something
Sense.TRAN: 我倒要看看你/他如何做某事〔表示不相信某人能做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to see you organize a conference!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒要看看你是怎样筹办大会的！

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to imagine how they would feel if something bad happened to them instead of to you or someone else
Sense.TRAN: 如果…你会有什么样的感觉？〔用于叫人设身处地想想﹐如果不好的事情发生在自己身上会如何〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How would you like being left alone for hours in a strange place?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果把你一个人丢在陌生的地方好几个小时﹐你会有什么感觉？
Sense.EXAMPLE: How would you like it if someone treated you in that way?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人那样对你﹐你会怎么想？

Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone has said or done is rude and unfair
Sense.TRAN: 亏你说得出口[干得出来]！〔用于表示对粗鲁和不公正言行的反感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like that! She didn’t even say thank you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真亏她做得出来！连句谢谢的话都没有！

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone must accept a situation or decision they do not like because it cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢不喜欢都得这样〔用于表示某种情形或某个决定不能改变而只能接受〕

Exponent.DEF: to think that someone or something is nice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I like your dress – it’s a beautiful colour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢你的裙子——颜色很漂亮。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I like travelling by train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢坐火车旅行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everybody liked Mr Schofield.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都喜欢斯科菲尔德先生。

Exponent.DEF: to like someone or something, especially something that you have liked for a long time or someone who you have known for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Connie had always been fond of animals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 康妮一直很喜欢动物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Over the years, I’ve become quite fond of him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过了这些年﹐我已经非常喜欢他了。

Exponent.DEF: to like someone or something – often used in negative sentences
Exponent.TRAN: 喜欢某人/某物〔常用于否定句〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I like Maria but I’m not keen on her husband.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢玛丽亚﹐但不喜欢她丈夫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our English teacher was very keen on Shakespeare, but I couldn’t stand him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的英语老师非常喜欢莎士比亚﹐可我却受不了他。

Exponent.DEF: to like doing a particular activity or be interested in a particular subject – used especially by young people
Exponent.TRAN: 喜欢某物﹔对某物感兴趣〔尤为年轻人用语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s really into music at the moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这一阵子迷上音乐了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What kind of films are you into?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢哪一类电影？

Exponent.DEF: to like someone or something, especially something surprising or unusual
Exponent.TRAN: 喜欢某人/某物〔尤指出人意外或特别的人或物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve always had a thing about wolves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直非常喜欢狼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has this thing about tall women.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他特别喜欢高个子女人。

Exponent.DEF: to like to have something – often used humorously
Exponent.TRAN: 喜爱某物〔常为幽默用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s partial to the occasional glass of wine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢偶尔来杯葡萄酒。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that you begin to like something, especially something that you did not like before
Exponent.TRAN: 开始喜欢某物〔尤指原本不喜欢的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like the colour of the room at first, but it’s growing on me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 起先我不喜欢房间的颜色﹐可现在越来越喜欢了。

Section.SECHEADING: TO LIKE SOMETHING VERY MUCH 非常喜欢某物

Exponent.DEF: to like something very much. Adore is stronger than love but is less common.
Exponent.TRAN: 非常喜欢〔adore 语气比love更强烈﹐但不如love常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I love the smell of coffee.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常喜欢咖啡的气味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children absolutely adore her books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们对她的书喜欢极了。

Exponent.DEF: to be extremely interested in an activity and spend a lot of time doing it or watching it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jonah’s crazy about basketball.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔纳痴迷篮球。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s always been mad about horses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直对马着迷。

Exponent.DEF: to like an activity very much, because it gives you a lot of pleasure or excitement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: From a very early age he had a passion for fast cars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从很小的时候就酷爱跑车。

Exponent.DEF: to like doing something so much that you spend all your free time doing it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My son’s addicted to computer games – he hardly ever comes out of his room.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿子沉迷于电脑游戏——他几乎不踏出房门一步。

Sense.DEF: the things that someone likes and does not like
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all have our own likes and dislikes when it comes to food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到食物﹐我们都有自己的好恶。

Sense.DEF: and similar things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers, policemen, and the like were all called in to help with the emergency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队﹑警察等都奉令来应付这一突发事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They believe that the government does not spend enough money on health, education, and such like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为﹐政府在卫生﹑教育等方面投入的经费不够。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about someone you do not like or do not approve of
Subsense.TRAN: 类似某人[物]的人/物〔用于谈论不喜欢或不赞同的人或物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want you spending time with the likes of him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不希望你和他这种人交往。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about people of a particular type …
Subsense.TRAN: 的一类人〔用以谈论某种人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Information is collected through the likes of the FBI, CIA, and Scotland Yard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情报是通过联邦调查局﹑中央情报局和苏格兰场这一类的机构收集来的。

Sense.DEF: something similar to someone or a particular person or thing, or of equal importance or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will be a show the like of which has never been seen before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将会是一个前所未见的节目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man was a genius. We shall not see his like again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人是个天才﹐我们将再也见不到这样的人了。

Sense.DEF: used in speech to fill a pause while you are thinking what to say next
Sense.TRAN: 嗯〔用在说话中填补思考下文时出现的停顿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water was, like, really cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那水﹐嗯﹐非常冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just, like, standing there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时我﹐呃﹐就站在那里。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell the exact words someone used
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I asked Dave if he wanted to go, and he’s like, no way!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问戴夫想不想去﹐他说﹐决不！

Subsense.DEF: used to describe an event, feeling, or person, when it is difficult to describe or when you use a noise instead of words
Subsense.TRAN: 我/他/她就这个样子〔用于描述难以形容的事件﹑感情或人﹐或用声音代替语言〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was like, huh? she did not understand
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就这个样子﹐嗯？

Sense.DEF: probably
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ambulance will be too late, as like as not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等救护车来很可能已经太晚了。

Sense.DEF: in the same way as. Some people consider this use to be incorrect.
Sense.TRAN: 像…一样﹐如同〔有些人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one else can score goals like he can!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人能像他那样进球！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t talk to me like you talk to a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要像跟孩子说话那样跟我说话。

Sense.DEF: used when you are repeating something that you have already said
Sense.TRAN: 正如我说的/说过的那样
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like I said, I don’t mind helping out on the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说过了﹐我不介意那天去帮忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, but, like I say, she’s not here at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐不过如我所说﹐她这会儿不在这里。

Sense.DEF: as if. Some people think that this use is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 好像﹐似乎〔有些人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked at me like I was mad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着我﹐就好像我是个疯子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like it’s going to rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天看上去好像要下雨了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This meat smells like it’s gone bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肉闻上去好像已经变质了。

Sense.DEF: similar in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The second dispute was sorted out in a like manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次纠纷也是用类似的方式解决了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They get on well together because they are of like mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们志趣相投﹐因而关系不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to buy two fish of like size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量买两条一样大的鱼。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to do something
used after a noun to say that something is similar to or typical of the noun
Sense.TRAN: 像…似的﹐有…特征的〔用于名词后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jelly-like substance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果冻状的物质
Sense.EXAMPLE: childlike simplicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子般的单纯
Sense.EXAMPLE: ladylike behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淑女般的举止

Sense.DEF: another spelling of likable
the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was very little likelihood of her getting the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到这份工作的可能性很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They must face the likelihood that the newspaper might go bankrupt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须面对这个可能性报社也许会破产。

Sense.DEF: almost certainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I refused, it would in all likelihood mean I’d lose my job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我拒绝﹐那我十有八九会丢掉工作。

Sense.DEF: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
Sense.TRAN: 可能的﹔可能发生的﹔可能是真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow showers are likely tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天可能有阵雪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are the likely effects of the law going to be?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法规可能会产生什么样的影响？

Sense.EXAMPLE: the most likely cause of the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成这个问题最有可能的原因

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children who live in the country’s rural areas are very likely to be poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在该国乡村地区的孩子大多很贫穷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young drivers are far more likely to have accidents than older drivers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻司机发生车祸的可能性要远远大于年长的司机。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is more than likely almost certain the votes will have to be counted again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选票很有可能要重新点算。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely not very likely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这有可能是意外事故﹐但可能性不大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could offer no likely explanation when I asked him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问他的时候﹐他不能给出一个合理的解释。

Sense.DEF: suitable for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: the three most likely candidates for president
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最有可能当选的三位总统候选人
Sense.EXAMPLE: One likely source of energy is windpower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一种合适的能源就是风能。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone you do not believe what they have just said
Sense.TRAN: 说得像真的似的〔告诉某人你不相信他刚才说的话〕

Sense.DEF: probably

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是处在你这种情况﹐也很有可能会那样做的。

GramExa.GLOSS: very probably
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As likely as not, the meeting will take place in the village pub.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议很有可能就在村子的酒馆里开。

Sense.DEF: used to disagree strongly, or to say that something will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 才不呢！ 不可能！〔表示强烈反对或断言某事不会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He said you’d be giving them a lift.’ ‘Not likely!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他说你会让他们搭便车。”“才不呢！”

Sense.DEF: having similar interests and opinions
Sense.TRAN: 趣味相投的﹐想法一致的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to meet like-minded people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结识志趣相投者的机会

Sense.DEF: to say that someone or something is similar to another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Critics have likened the new theater to a supermarket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者称新剧院就像是一个超级市场。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being similar in appearance to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hugh’s uncanny likeness to his father
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休和他父亲酷似

Sense.EXAMPLE: I can see the family likeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看出这一家人都长得很像。

Sense.DEF: a painting or photograph of a person, especially one that looks very like the person
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指酷似本人的〕画﹔肖像﹔相片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s a remarkable likeness of Julia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画跟朱莉娅像极了。

Sense.DEF: in the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nanny put on a shawl and told the girls to do likewise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南妮披上披肩﹐并叫女孩们也这样做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clams were delicious. Likewise, the eggplant was excellent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛤蜊味道鲜美﹐茄子也同样美味。

Sense.DEF: used to return someone’s greeting or polite statement
Sense.TRAN: 也一样〔用于回答问候或客气话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re always welcome at our house.’ ‘Likewise.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “欢迎你随时来我家做客。”“你也一样。

Sense.DEF: when you like someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim and Keith had a liking and respect for each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆和基思互相喜欢﹑互相尊重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s developed a liking for theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢上了戏剧。

Sense.DEF: to begin to like someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He immediately took a liking to Steve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他马上就喜欢上了史蒂夫。

Sense.DEF: if something is to someone’s liking, they like it or think it is satisfactory
Sense.TRAN: 对某人的胃口﹐合某人的心意
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope everything was to your liking, sir.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先生﹐我希望一切都如您心意。

Sense.DEF: if something is too crowded, serious, long etc for someone’s liking, they think it is too crowded, serious, long etc
Sense.TRAN: 对某人来说〔与too 连用﹐表示否定〕

Sense.DEF: a small tree with pale purple or white flowers
a pale purple colour

an imaginary country in the book Gulliver’s Travels by Jonathan Swift, where all the people, animals, and buildings are very small. Places where everything is small are sometimes said to be like Lilliput.
Sense.TRAN: 小人国〔小说《格列佛游记》中的假想国﹔有时喻指各类设施微小的地方〕

Sense.DEF: extremely small compared to the normal size of things
a rubber mattress filled with air and used as a bed or for floating on water
Sense.TRAN: 充气垫〔用作床或用于水上漂浮〕

Sense.DEF: a pleasant pattern of rising and falling sound in someone’s voice or in music
Sense.TRAN: 抑扬顿挫的声音﹔优美的旋律
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lilt of a Scottish accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰口音的抑扬顿挫

Sense.DEF: one of several types of plant with large bell-shaped flowers of various colours, especially white
lacking courage
a plant with several small white bell-shaped flowers
pure white
Sense.EXAMPLE: lily-white skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白皙的皮肤

Sense.DEF: morally perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not so lily-white yourself!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你自己也不是那么纯洁无瑕！

Sense.DEF: a round flat light green bean that grows in America
alone and without help or support
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the other countries signed the agreement, leaving Britain out on a limb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他国家都签署了协议﹐使英国处于孤立无援的境地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d gone out on a limb taken a risk to help us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冒险帮助我们。

Sense.DEF: an arm or leg
having strong, long etc arms and legs
Sense.TRAN: 四肢强壮的/四肢长的等

Sense.DEF: a large branch of a tree
to do gentle exercises in order to prepare your muscles for a race, competition etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在赛跑﹑比赛等前〕做热身运动

Sense.DEF: able to move and bend easily
a situation in which nothing happens or changes for a long period of time, and it is difficult to make decisions or know what to do, often because you are waiting for something else to happen first
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指因等待另一事先发生而所处的〕不确定的状态

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m in limbo now until I know whether I’ve got the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在心中没有着落﹐要一直到知道自己是否得到那份工作为止。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the limbo of his eight years in jail
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这八年停的牢狱生活

Sense.DEF: a West Indian dance in which the dancer leans backwards and goes under a stick that is lowered gradually
Sense.TRAN: 林波舞〔一种西印度群岛舞蹈﹐舞者向后弯腰通过逐步降低的横杆〕

Sense.DEF: a small juicy green fruit with a sour taste, or the tree this grows on
a tree with pleasant-smelling yellow flowers
a white substance obtained by burning limestone, used for making cement, marking sports fields etc
a light yellowish green colour
to add lime to soil to control acid
Sense.TRAN: 撒石灰于〔土壤中以控制酸性〕

Sense.DEF: a drink made from the juice of limes
a light yellowish green colour
a situation in which someone receives a lot of attention, especially from newspapers, television etc
Sense.TRAN: 公众〔尤指报纸﹑电视等〕关注的中心

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tad loves being in the limelight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔德喜欢成为公众关注的焦点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president’s wife wanted to stay out of the limelight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统夫人想避免引人注目。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s afraid this new actor will steal the limelight from her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心这位新演员会抢去她的风头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his few moments of limelight in front of the cameras
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为数不多的几次成为镜头焦点的时刻

Sense.DEF: a humorous short poem that has five lines that rhyme
a hard white or grey substance that forms on the inside of pipes, taps, and water containers
a type of rock that contains calcium
a slightly insulting word for someone from Britain
Sense.TRAN: 英国佬〔对英国人略具侮辱性的用语〕

Sense.DEF: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 55 mph speed limit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 55英里的时速限制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no age limit for applicants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请者不受年龄限制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My wife and I set a limit on how much we spend on clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和妻子给服装的开支设定了一个限额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pesticide levels in drinking water are already above legal limits in many areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多地区的饮用水中所含杀虫剂浓度已超出法定限度。

Sense.DEF: the greatest possible amount of something that can exist or be obtained
Sense.TRAN: 〔现有的或可获取的〕最大量﹐极限

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the limits of human knowledge
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类知识的极限
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d reached the limit of his patience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的忍耐到了极限。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our finances are already stretched to the limit we do not have any extra money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的财力已经用到了极限。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no limit to what you can do if you try.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你努力的话﹐成就无可限量。

Sense.DEF: the furthest point or edge of a place, often one that must not be passed
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指不可以通过的〕界限﹐边界
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had not been outside the limits of the prison walls for 20 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经20年没出过监狱高墙了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Los Angeles city limits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛杉矶的市区范围

Subsense.DEF: beyond the area where someone is allowed to go
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That area of beach was off limits to us ‘city kids’.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们“城市孩子”不得进入那个沙滩区域。

Subsense.DEF: beyond what you are allowed to do or have
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His private life is off limits to the press.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的私生活不容媒体涉足。

Sense.DEF: within the time, level, amount etc considered acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can come and go when you want – within limits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以自由来去——但要有分寸。

Sense.DEF: to have drunk more alcohol than is legal or safe for driving
to know what you are good at doing and what you are not good at
Sense.TRAN: 知道自己的长处和短处
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know my limits. I’m not an administrator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有自知之明﹐我不是搞管理的料。

Sense.DEF: to have a set of rules about what is reasonable behaviour, and to not accept behaviour that does not follow those rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have my limits. You will not use that kind of nasty language in class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有我的原则﹐你在课堂上不能用那种污秽的语言。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Set a time limit for the completion of the task.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要给该工作设定完成时限。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have to put a limit on the number of participants.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须限定参与人数。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go beyond a limit
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He reported a driver for exceeding the speed limit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举报一名司机超速行驶。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go beyond a limit
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Borrowers who go over the spending limit set by the credit card company are penalised.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 借款人若超出信用卡公司设定的消费限额﹐将受到处罚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the highest/lowest amount allowed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is no upper limit on the amount you can borrow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的借款额没有上限。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are strict limits on spending.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 支出有严格的限制。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a limit set by law
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The alcohol in his blood was four times more than the legal limit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他血液中的酒精浓度超出法定限度四倍。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Too many people go over the speed limit in residential areas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有太多人在住宅区内超速。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: limits on how much time a politician can spend in office

Exponent.DEF: the highest number, speed, temperature etc that is allowed by a law or rule
Exponent.TRAN: 〔数量﹑速度﹑温度等的〕规定限度
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The speed limit is 65 m.p.h.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 限速为65英里/小时。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no limit on the amount of money that may be brought into the US.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国对携款入境的数额没有限制。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pollution levels are over the official limit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染水平已超出官方限值。

Exponent.DEF: rules or laws that strictly control what you are allowed to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Travel restrictions might reduce the spread of the disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行限制或可减缓疾病传播。
