Exponent.EXAMPLE: New restrictions have been imposed on immigration.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民已受到新的限制。

Exponent.DEF: limits on what a person or thing is able to do – used especially when you would like to be able to do more
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对能力或权力的〕制约﹐限制﹔局限
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The president was unwilling to accept limitations on his power.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统不愿接受对其权力的限制。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the limitations of the computer system
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机系统的局限
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hikers should know their physical limitations and not take unnecessary risks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远足者应了解自身体力极限﹐不做无谓的冒险。

Exponent.DEF: facts or conditions that limit what you can do, for example not having enough time, money etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Financial constraints are forcing many people in their twenties to live with their parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 限于财力﹐许多人年满20岁仍不得不和父母同住。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The last part of the show had to be cut because of time constraints.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于时间有限﹐不得不剪去节目的最后部分。

Sense.DEF: to stop an amount or number from increasing beyond a particular point
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decision to limit imports of foreign cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 限制进口外国汽车的决定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seating is limited to 500.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 座位限定在 500个。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from doing what they want or from developing and improving beyond a particular point
Sense.TRAN: 限制﹐制约〔某人的发展等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lack of formal education will limit your job opportunities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏正规教育会令你的就业机会受到局限。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I limit myself to two cups of coffee a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我限制自己一天只喝两杯咖啡。

Sense.DEF: to exist or happen only in a particular place, group, or area of activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The damage was limited to the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有屋顶受到了损坏。

Sense.DEF: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any limitation to the king’s power could be permanent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国王权力的任何限制都有可能是永久性的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear limitation treaty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核限制条约

Sense.DEF: qualities that stop someone or something from being as good or as effective as you wish they could be
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人或某事物的〕局限性﹐不足之处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite the limitations of the survey, it did suggest some general trends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查尽管有局限性﹐但也确实说明了一些普遍的倾向。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good little car, but it has its limitations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一辆很好的小汽车﹐但也有不足之处。

Sense.DEF: a rule or condition that stops something from increasing beyond a particular point

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a limitation on the number of hours children can work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对儿童学习时间的限制

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new law imposes limitations on campaign contributions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的法律给竞选捐款规定了限额。

Sense.DEF: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are only a limited number of tickets available.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票数量有限。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My knowledge of the business is limited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这一行了解有限。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization has very limited resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家机构资源非常有限。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迄今为止﹐教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, the drug is of limited value in treating cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐该药对于治疗癌症作用有限。

Sense.DEF: used after the name of British business companies that have limited liability
Sense.TRAN: 有限责任的〔置于英国有限责任公司名称之后〕

Sense.DEF: a company in Britain whose owners only have to pay a limited amount if the company gets into debt
a small number of special copies of a book, picture etc which are produced at one time only
Sense.TRAN: 〔书画等的一次印刷〕限量版﹐限数本

Sense.DEF: the legal position of being responsible for paying only a limited amount of debt if something bad happens to yourself or your company
preventing any improvement or increase in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A limiting factor in health care is the way resources are distributed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健的一个制约因素是资源的分配方式。

Sense.DEF: preventing someone from developing and doing what they are interested in
Sense.TRAN: 限制的﹐局限的〔指阻止某人发展或做其感兴趣的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job’s OK, but it’s sort of limiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作不错﹐但有点束缚。

Sense.DEF: without a limit or end
Sense.EXAMPLE: limitless possibilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无限的可能

Sense.DEF: a limousine
Sense.TRAN: 大型豪华轿车﹔〔美国小型的〕机场巴士

Sense.DEF: a very large, expensive, and comfortable car, driven by someone who is paid to drive
a small bus that people take to and from airports in the US
not firm or strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a limp handshake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无力的握手
Sense.EXAMPLE: His body suddenly went limp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然身子一软。

Sense.DEF: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
Sense.TRAN: 〔因一腿受伤而〕跛行﹐一瘸一拐地走
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moreno limped off the field with a foot injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫雷诺脚上受了伤﹐一瘸一拐地走出球场。

Sense.DEF: if a ship or aircraft limps somewhere, it goes there slowly, because it has been damaged
Sense.TRAN: 〔船或飞机因损坏而〕缓慢地行进﹐艰难地行驶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The damaged liner limped into New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受损的邮轮缓缓驶进纽约港。

Sense.DEF: if a company, project etc limps along, it is not successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team is limping along in fifth place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队勉强排在第五名。

Sense.DEF: the way someone walks when they are limping
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young walked with a slight limp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬走路有一点跛。

Sense.DEF: a small sea animal with a shell, which holds tightly onto the rock where it lives
clear or transparent
Sense.EXAMPLE: limpid blue eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清澈的蓝眼睛

Sense.DEF: a limp-wristed man is considered to lack male qualities such as strength; sometimes used to say that a man is homosexual
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕缺乏阳刚气的﹔〔有时指男子〕同性恋的

Sense.DEF: the person or thing in a group, system etc that is most important, because everything depends on them
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体﹑制度等的〕关键人物[事物]

Sense.DEF: a liquid medicine used for curing coughs
a lime tree
a long thin mark on a piece of paper, the ground, or another surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Draw a straight line across the top of the page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一页的上方画一条直线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sign your name on the dotted line line made up of a series of dots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在虚线上签名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The edges of the pitch are marked by white lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球场的四边画着白线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper just managed to stop the ball going over the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员刚好把球截住﹐没有让它越过球门线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raced towards the finishing line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝终点线冲刺。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary line on the surface of the Earth, for example showing where one country or area of land stops and another begins

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was born in a small town just across the state line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的出生地正好位于州界线另一头的一个小镇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were still travelling along the same line of longitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们依旧在同一条经线上飞行。

Subsense.DEF: a row of people or things next to each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a line of fir trees on either side of the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路两旁枞树林立。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The four men were standing in a line on the other side of the table.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那四个男人在桌子的另一边站成一排。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A couple of the posts were out of line not in a straight row.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几根柱子没有排成一条直线。

Subsense.DEF: a row of people, cars etc that are waiting one behind the other
Subsense.TRAN: 〔人﹑汽车等在等候时排的〕队﹐队伍
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I looked in despair at the long line in front of the ticket office.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝望地看着售票处前面的长队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I joined the line of vehicles waiting to get into the car park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我排进车辆的队伍﹐等着进停车场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Customers stood in line for 20 minutes at the cash register.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客在收银机前排了20分钟的队。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He tried to cut in line go in front of other people who are waiting.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图插队。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The woman next in line began to mutter to herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排在后面的那个女人开始嘀嘀咕咕地自言自语。

Sense.DEF: the direction or imaginary line along which something travels between two places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Light travels in a straight line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光沿直线传播。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A boat came into my line of vision direction I was looking in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘船进入了我的视线。

GramExa.GLOSS: the direction in which someone shoots, attacks, moves etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 射击/攻击/行动等的方向
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was directly in the animal’s line of attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正好处于那动物的攻击方向。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They knew they needed to block their enemy’s supply lines the direction used for carrying supplies of food etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们知道必须封锁敌人的补给线。

Sense.DEF: a line on the skin of someone’s face
Sense.EXAMPLE: She frowned, and deep lines appeared between her eyebrows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她皱起眉头﹐眉心出现深深的皱纹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were fine lines around her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼睛周围有细纹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one can avoid lines and wrinkles as they get older.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人年纪大了免不了长皱纹。

Sense.DEF: a telephone wire or connection
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, the line is busy someone is already using it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐电话占线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seems to be a fault on the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话线路好像出故障了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a click, then the line went dead suddenly stopped working completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗒一声﹐线路断了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry is on the line on the phone from New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利从纽约打来电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got on the line to phoned the hospital as soon as I heard about the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一听说这起事故就打电话去医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wished he would just get off the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望他把电话挂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, it’s a bad line and I can’t hear you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐线路不好﹐我听不见你说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold the line wait on the phone, please, and I’ll put you through to our sales department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请别挂电话﹐我给你接我们的销售部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a separate line for your modem?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的调制解调器有独立的电话线吗？

Sense.DEF: a track that a train travels along
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were delayed because of a problem further along the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们因为前方路轨故障晚点了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you get to central London, take the Victoria Line to Finsbury Park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到了伦敦市中心以后﹐乘维多利亚线到芬斯伯里公园。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trail follows a disused railroad line along the edge of the valley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小路沿着山谷边缘一条废弃的铁路线延伸。

Sense.DEF: the point at which one type of thing can be considered to be something else or at which it becomes a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a fine line between superstition and religion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷信与宗教之间只有一线之隔。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dividing line between luxuries and necessities is constantly changing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈品和必需品之间的界线一直在变化。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes he found it hard to draw the line between work and pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候他觉得很难划清工作和娱乐之间的界线。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her remarks did not quite cross the line into rudeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话还不能算很无礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Large numbers of families are living on or near the poverty line the point at which people are considered to be very poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多家庭生活在贫困线上或贫困线的边缘。

Sense.DEF: the outer shape of something long or tall
Sense.TRAN: 〔长或高的物件的〕线条﹐轮廓﹐外形
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a loose dress which softened the lines of her body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一条宽松的连衣裙﹐身体的曲线变得柔和了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modern building with clean, elegant lines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢线条简洁优雅的现代化建筑

Subsense.DEF: a line of written words, for example in a poem or a document
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He quoted a few lines from Shakespeare.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他引用了莎士比亚的一些诗句。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Scroll down to line 29.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向下滚动到第29行。

Subsense.DEF: a remark
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He liked to introduce himself with a witty opening line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢用一句俏皮的开场白作自我介绍。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This was one of his favourite chat-up lines remark for impressing someone you want to attract.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他最爱用的搭讪话之一

Subsense.DEF: words that someone has to learn and say as part of a play or performance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Paul often messed up his lines.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗经常说错台词。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It always took me ages to learn my lines.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是要花很长时间才能记住台词。

Sense.DEF: an opinion or attitude, especially one that someone states publicly and that influences their actions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开表明并影响本人行为的〕态度﹐方针﹐路线

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t agree with the government’s line on immigration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能认同政府在移民问题上的态度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists are often too willing to accept the official line the opinion that a government states officially.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者对官方说法往往很乐意全盘接受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found it hard to accept the party line the official opinion of a political party on every issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得很难在每个问题上都认同党的路线。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take a tough/firm/hard line on sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school takes a very tough line on drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该学校在毒品问题上采取非常强硬的态度。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of doing something or of thinking about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed useless to pursue this line of questioning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照这样盘问下去好像没有用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Opposition parties soon realized they would have to try a different line of attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久反对派就意识到﹐他们必须改变攻击方法。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are following several different lines of enquiry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在采用几种不同的调查方法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were both thinking along the same lines in the same way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩想法相同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In South Africa, the press developed along very different lines in a very different way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在南非﹐报刊的发展方向很不一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: More groups will now be set up on these lines this way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在将会有更多的团体以这种方式成立。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s rapid success means it’s definitely on the right lines doing something the right way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的迅速兴起说明它肯定是走对了路。

Sense.DEF: a series of events that follow each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the latest in a long line of political scandals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一连串政治丑闻中最近发生的一桩。

Sense.DEF: the edge of an area that is controlled by an army, where soldiers stay and try to prevent their enemy from moving forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: They finally broke through the German line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于突破了德军防线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: young soldiers who were sent to the front line to fight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被送去前线作战的年轻士兵
Sense.EXAMPLE: One regiment was trapped behind enemy lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个团被困在敌军后方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reinforcements were available just behind the lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 援军就在后方。

Sense.DEF: a series of levels of authority within an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Decisions are taken by senior officers and fed down through the line of command to the ordinary soldiers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级军官作出决策﹐然后通过各级指挥传达给普通士兵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There should be more direct discussion between managers and workers lower down the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理人员和下层工人之间应该有更直接的商讨。

Sense.DEF: a piece of strong string, rope, or wire used for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔作某用途的〕一段绳子[电线等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hung the clothes out on the washing line line for hanging wet clothes on to dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把衣服挂在外面的晾衣绳上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fishing line line for catching fish snapped and the fish got away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钓鱼线啪的一声绷断﹐鱼儿逃走了。

Sense.DEF: a type of goods for sale in a shop
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has just launched a new line of small, low-priced computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司刚刚推出新款价格低廉的小型电脑。

Sense.DEF: similar to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually start with general questions along the lines of, ‘How do you feel?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始交谈时﹐通常会问“你感觉如何？”这类笼统的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re trying to organize a trip to the beach or something along those lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在想法安排一次去海滨的旅行或类似的活动。

Sense.DEF: if people divide along religious, party etc lines they divide according to the religion, political party, or other group they belong to
Sense.TRAN: 按照宗教/民族/党派等(划分)
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee was split along party lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个委员会有党派之分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The community remains divided along religious lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个社区依然根据宗教分成不同的群体。

Subsense.DEF: using a computer to get information or to communicate with people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can book tickets on line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在网上订票。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most of our sales staff now work on line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的销售人员现在大多在线操作。

Subsense.DEF: working properly as planned
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a new nuclear reactor which should be on line by 2005
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应于2005年前启用的一个新核反应堆
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If there is a power failure, the emergency generators should come on line within 15 minutes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果停电﹐应急发电机应在15分钟内开始运转。

Sense.DEF: to write a short letter or email to someone
Sense.TRAN: 给某人写短信[电子邮件]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drop me a line and let me know how you’re getting on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我发个短信﹐告诉我你的近况。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe someone’s excuse
Sense.TRAN: 别跟我来那一套〔表示不相信对方的借口〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know for a fact you weren’t sick yesterday, so don’t give me that line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确定你昨天没有生病﹐所以别跟我来这一套。

Sense.LEXUNIT: fall into line/bring sb into line
Sense.DEF: to start to do what someone else wants you to do, or to make someone do this
Sense.TRAN: 取得一致/使某人行动一致
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now that France and Germany have signed up, other countries will soon fall into line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然法国和德国都已经签字﹐其他国家很快就会照办的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The few party rebels were soon brought into line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个叛党分子不久便就范了。

Sense.DEF: if something changes in line with something else, it changes in the same way and at the same rate as it
Sense.TRAN: 与某事物一致﹐按照某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pensions will be increased in line with inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休金会随着通货膨胀而增加。

Sense.LEXUNIT: bring sth into line with sth
Sense.DEF: to change a system so that it works according to a particular set of rules, laws etc
Sense.TRAN: 使某事物与某事物一致
Sense.EXAMPLE: UK immigration procedures will have to be changed to bring them into line with the latest European ruling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的移民程序必须修改﹐以便和欧盟最新的裁决保持一致。

Subsense.DEF: to say or do something that is not acceptable in a particular situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You just keep quiet! You’re way out of line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你闭嘴！你太过分了。

Subsense.DEF: to not obey someone, or to do something that you should not do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anybody who steps out of line will be in deep trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁要是违规谁就会倒大霉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in line for sth/be in line to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be very likely to get or be given something
Sense.TRAN: 很有可能获得某物/做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be in line for promotion soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该很快就能晋升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He must be first in line for the editor’s job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定是最有望得到那份编辑工作的人选。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be first/second/next etc in line to the throne
Sense.DEF: to be the person who has a right to become a future king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 是王位的第一/第二/下一位等继承人
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the eldest son, he was next in line to the throne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为长子﹐他是王位的下一位继承人。

Sense.DEF: if something important is on the line, there is a risk that you might lose it or something bad could happen to it
Sense.TRAN: 有失去的可能﹔处在危险中
Sense.EXAMPLE: From now on, all our jobs are on the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在起﹐我们都有失业的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew that her whole future was on the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道自己前途未卜。

GramExa.PROPFORM: put yourself/your neck on the line (for sb)
GramExa.GLOSS: risk something bad happening to you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve already put myself on the line for you once, and I’m not going to do it again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经为你冒险过一次﹐不会再有第二次了。

Sense.DEF: to be the type of thing that someone is interested in or good at
Sense.TRAN: 是某人感兴趣的事﹔是某人的专长
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acting’s not really in my line, I’m afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演戏恐怕不是我的专长。

Sense.DEF: to get information about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 获得有关某人/某事的消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get some kind of a line on these guys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要了解一下这些家伙的情况。

Sense.DEF: at some time during an activity or period of time
Sense.TRAN: 在某活动[时期]中的某段时间﹔某个时刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somewhere along the line, Errol seemed to have lost interest in her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这期间有段时间﹐埃罗尔似乎对她失去了兴趣。

Sense.DEF: later, after an activity or situation has been continuing for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be more costs further down the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往后说不定还有更多的开销。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, three years down the line, we’re beginning to see the problems with the treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年下来﹐我们现在开始看到这种疗法的问题所在。

Sense.DEF: happening or done as part of your job
Sense.TRAN: 在工作期间发生﹔在执行任务时
Sense.EXAMPLE: firefighters dying in the line of duty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因公殉职的消防队员

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the firing line/in the line of fire

Subsense.DEF: to be one of the people who could be criticized or blamed for something
Subsense.TRAN: 在受批评者之列﹐成为批评[指责]的对象
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As one of the President’s chief advisers, he’s bound to be in the firing line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为总统的首席顾问之一﹐他势必成为批评的对象。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a place where a bullet etc might hit you
Subsense.TRAN: 在火线上﹐在射程范围内
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A couple of civilians were caught in the firing line.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个平民被困在火线上。

Sense.DEF: a punishment given to school children that consists of writing the same thing a lot of times
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got 50 lines for being cheeky to a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为对老师无礼而被罚抄写50遍。

Sense.DEF: your family, considered as the people you are related to who lived before you and the people who will live after you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She comes from a long line of actors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出身演员世家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks as if Joe might be the last of the line the last in his family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来乔可能是这个家族的最后一代了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This particular gene is passed down through the male line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一特定的基因是由父系遗传的。

GramExa.GLOSS: the system by which an important position or property is passed from a parent to their children, and then to their children etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry the Eighth wanted a male heir to ensure the Tudor line of succession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利八世想要一名男性继承人来确保都铎王朝的延续。

Sense.DEF: the type of work someone does

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What line of business is he in?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是干哪一行的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s keen to do something in the fashion line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很想在时装行业有所作为。

Sense.DEF: a company that provides transport for moving goods by sea, air, road etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He runs a transatlantic shipping line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经营一家跨大西洋航运公司。

Sense.DEF: an amount of an illegal drug in powder form, arranged in a line so it can be breathed in through the nose
Sense.TRAN: 〔粉末状毒品在吸食前排成的〕一条﹐一行

Crossrefto.REFLEX: where do you draw the line?

Sense.DEF: to sew a piece of material onto the inside or back of another piece to make it stronger or warmer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are those curtains lined?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些窗帘加衬里了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leather coat lined with silk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件有丝绸衬里的皮夹克

Sense.DEF: to form a layer over the inner surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds use small leaves for lining their nests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿用小叶子来铺垫鸟巢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cage should be lined with straw.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼子里应该铺上稻草。

Sense.DEF: to form rows along the sides of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds lined the route to the palace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群夹道站在通往王宫的路上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The street was lined with small shops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这街道两旁小商铺鳞次栉比。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a tree-lined avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林荫道

Sense.DEF: to make yourself richer, especially by doing something dishonest – used to show disapproval
if people line up, or if you line them up, they stand in a row or line, or you make them do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Line up, everybody!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家排好队！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lined us all up in the corridor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我们全体在走廊里排好队。

Sense.DEF: to arrange things in a row
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lined the bottles up on the sideboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把瓶子放在餐具柜上排好。

Sense.DEF: to move one thing so that it is in the correct position in relation to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The windows should be lined up with the door frame.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户应该与门框对齐。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for something to happen or for someone to be available for an event
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve lined up some excellent speakers for tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为今天晚上安排了几位非常出色的演讲者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s already got a new job lined up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经安排好一份新的工作。

Sense.DEF: the way in which members of a family are descended from other members
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family of ancient lineage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老世家

Sense.DEF: related directly to someone who lived a long time before you
Sense.EXAMPLE: lineal descendants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直系后代

Sense.DEF: a feature of your face
a typical quality
consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line
Sense.EXAMPLE: a linear diagram
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 线形图

Sense.DEF: relating to length
Sense.EXAMPLE: linear measurements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长度量度

Sense.DEF: involving a series of connected events, ideas etc, that move or progress from one stage to the next
Sense.TRAN: 涉及一连串直接相关的事物的﹔线性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: linear thinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 线性思维

Sense.DEF: a player in American football who tries to tacklemembers of the other team
line-caught fish have been caught using hooks on a long string, which causes less harm to other sea creatures than using a net
a coat, skirt etc that is lined has a piece of thin material covering the inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fleece-lined jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有羊毛衬里的夹克

Sense.DEF: paper that is lined has straight lines printed or drawn across it
skin that is lined has wrinkles on it
a type of dancing in which people dance in lines, all following the same series of steps
a drawing consisting only of lines
a player in American football who plays in the front line of a team
someone whose job is to take care of railway lines or telephone wires
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路的〕养护工人﹔〔电话线的〕线务员

Sense.DEF: a system of management in which information and instructions are passed from one person to someone immediately higher or lower than them in rank
Sense.TRAN: 直线管理〔指组织内部直属上下级之间传递信息和指示的管理方式〕

Sense.DEF: a manager in a company who is responsible for the main activities of production, sales etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司中负责生产﹑销售等主要活动的〕直线经理﹐产销经理

Sense.DEF: someone who is one level higher in rank than you in a company and is in charge of your work
sheets, tablecloths etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: bed linen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 床单
Sense.EXAMPLE: table linen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌布

Sense.DEF: cloth made from the flax plant, used to make high quality clothes, home decorations etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a linen jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚麻布夹克

Sense.DEF: underwear
a cupboard in which sheets, towels etc are kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔存放床单﹑毛巾等的〕家庭日用织品橱柜

Sense.DEF: a line in American football where the ball is placed at the beginning of a period of play
the way of starting play again in a rugby union game, when the ball has gone off the field
Sense.TRAN: 界外球〔联合会橄榄球出界后继续比赛的方式〕

Sense.DEF: a machine that prints information from a computer at a very high speed
a piece of material used inside something, especially in order to keep it clean
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指起保持清洁作用的〕衬里﹐衬垫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dustbin liner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾袋
Sense.EXAMPLE: nappy liners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尿布衬垫

Sense.DEF: a large ship for passengers
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ocean liner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远洋客轮

Sense.DEF: printed information about the music or musicians that comes with a CD or record
an official in a sport who decides when a ball has gone out of the playing area
Sense.TRAN: 〔球类运动中的〕边线裁判﹐巡边员﹐司线员

Sense.DEF: the players in a sports team who play in a particular game
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was his first match in the starting line-up the players who begin the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他进入首发阵容的第一场比赛。

Sense.DEF: a group of people, especially performers, who have agreed to be involved in an event
Sense.TRAN: 全体参与人员〔尤指表演者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The line-up included top bands Prodigy and Radiohead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加演出的有顶级乐队“神童乐队”和“电台司令”。

Sense.DEF: a number of events or programmes arranged to follow each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wonderful line-up of programmes for Christmas and the New Year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节和新年的一系列精彩节目

Sense.DEF: a row of people who stand in front of a witness to a crime, who is then asked if he or she recognizes any of them as the criminal
Sense.TRAN: 〔待目击者辨认的〕一排嫌疑犯

Sense.DEF: a small, young, or less important type of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a duckling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小鸭
Sense.EXAMPLE: princelings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小王子

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist, be noticeable etc for longer than is usual or desirable
Sense.TRAN: 继续存留〔较惯常或理想的时间长〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a taste that lingers in your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口中的余味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately the tax will linger on until April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐这项税收要持续到4月份。

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere a little longer, especially because you do not want to leave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lingered over coffee and missed the last bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们多喝了一会儿咖啡﹐错过了末班公共汽车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent a week at Kandersteg and could happily have lingered on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在坎德施泰格逗留了一个星期﹐本来还可以开开心心地多待几天。

Sense.DEF: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable
Sense.TRAN: 盯着〔某物〕﹔拖延〔某事〕﹐停留﹐磨蹭

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike let his eyes linger on her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克的目光在她的脸上徘徊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to linger over this stage of the interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要纠缠于访问的这个部分。

Sense.DEF: to continue to live although you are slowly dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拖了几个星期才去世﹐让所有的医生都很惊讶。

Sense.DEF: women’s underwear
continuing to exist for longer than usual or desirable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any lingering hopes of winning the title soon disappeared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有尚存的夺冠希望很快就破灭了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Wilkins suffered a lingering death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔金斯先生拖了很久才咽气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the lingering aroma of chocolate
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 久久不散的巧克力香味

Sense.DEF: a language, especially a foreign one
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to go to Greece, but I don’t speak the lingo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想去希腊﹐可我不会说希腊语。

Sense.DEF: words or expressions used only by a particular group of people, or at a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 行话﹐术语﹔〔某一时期的〕说法
Sense.EXAMPLE: academic lingo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学术用语

Sense.DEF: a language used between people whose main languages are different
Sense.TRAN: 〔母语不同的人之间使用的〕通用语﹐交际语
Sense.EXAMPLE: English is the lingua franca in many countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语在很多国家是通用语言。

Sense.DEF: long thin flat pieces of pasta
someone who is good at foreign languages, especially someone who speaks several
Sense.TRAN: 通晓外语的人﹔〔尤指〕会说几种外语的人

Sense.DEF: someone who studies or teaches linguistics
related to language, words, or linguistics
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s linguistic development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的语言发展

Sense.DEF: the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history
a liquid containing oil that you rub on your skin when you feel sore or stiff
Sense.TRAN: 皮肤搽剂〔用以消除疼痛和僵硬〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of material that covers the inside of something, especially a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jacket with a silk lining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有丝绸衬里的夹克

Crossrefto.REFLEX: every cloud has a silver lining

Sense.DEF: a substance or material that covers the inside of part of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lining of the womb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子宫内膜

Sense.DEF: if two things are linked, they are related in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police think the murders are linked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这些谋杀案互有关联。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some birth defects are linked to smoking during pregnancy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些先天缺陷与孕期吸烟有关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our economy is inextricably linked with America’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的经济和美国经济有着密不可分的关系。

Sense.DEF: to make a connection between two or more things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: A love of nature links the two poets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大自然的热爱把两位诗人联系在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Exactly how do we link words to objects?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到底如何把词语和所指物体联系起来？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strong family ties still linked them together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牢固的家庭纽带依然把他们联系在一起。

Sense.DEF: to physically join two or more things, people, or places
Sense.TRAN: 连接〔两个或两个以上的人﹑物或地点〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pipe must be linked to the cold water supply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条水管必须和冷水供应系统连接。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The climbers were linked together by ropes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者用绳子连在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A long bridge links Venice and the mainland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座长桥把威尼斯和大陆连接了起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked with her, linking arms putting his arm around her arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与她挽臂同行。

Sense.DEF: to show or say that there is a connection between two people, situations, or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He denied reports linking him to Colombian drug dealers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有报道称他和哥伦比亚毒贩有联系﹐对此他矢口否认。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 使某事物取决于另一事物
Sense.DEF: to make one thing or situation depend on another thing or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pay increases will now be linked to performance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今后加薪将与业绩挂钩。

Sense.DEF: to connect computers, broadcast systems etc, so that electronic messages can be sent between them
Sense.TRAN: 连接〔计算机﹑广播系统等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local terminals are linked to the central computer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 区域终端和中央计算机连接。

Sense.DEF: to connect with another idea, statement, type of work etc, especially in a way that is useful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This point links in with our earlier discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一点和我们之前的讨论有关联。

Sense.DEF: to happen at the same time as something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Minister’s visit was scheduled to link in with the meeting in Harare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长的访问和在哈拉雷的会议安排在同一时间。

Sense.DEF: to connect with something or to make a connection between things, especially so that they can work together
Sense.TRAN: 连接〔尤指使某事物同步运作〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The train links up with the ferry at Dover.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这趟列车与多佛尔的渡船联运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The next stage is to link the film up with the soundtrack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一步是将电影和音轨匹配起来。

Sense.DEF: to connect computers, broadcast systems etc so that electronic messages can be sent between them
Sense.TRAN: 连接〔计算机﹑广播系统等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All these PCs are linked up to the network.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些个人电脑都与网络连接。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Internet allows people from all over the world to link up for chat sessions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网能把世界各地的人连接起来聊天。

Sense.DEF: to join with someone so that you can do something together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We linked up with the Daily Express to help run the campaign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和《每日快报》联手协助开展这场宣传活动。

Sense.DEF: a way in which two things or ideas are related to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个事物或观点之间的〕联系﹐关联

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the link between drug use and crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒和犯罪之间的联系
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a number of links between the two theories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两种理论之间有一些联系。

Sense.DEF: a relationship or connection between two or more people, countries, organizations etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑国家﹑组织等之间的〕联系﹐关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the close link between teacher and student
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 师生之间的紧密关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has strong links with big investors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司与大投资者之间关系牢固。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Organizers of the project hope that international links will be forged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目的筹划者希望能建立起国际间的联系。

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that makes possible a relationship or connection with someone or something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For elderly people, TV is a vital link with the outside world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于老年人来说﹐电视是他们与外界保持联系的一个重要媒介。

Sense.DEF: something that makes communication or travel between two places possible
Sense.TRAN: 铁路/公路/电话线等线路
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office has direct computer links to over 100 firms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个办事处与一百多家公司的电脑直接相连。

Sense.DEF: one of the rings in a chain
one of the stages involved in a process
a piece of ground near the sea where golf is played
a special word or picture in an Internet document that you click on to move quickly to another part of the same document or to another document
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send an email to the above address to report a broken link a link that is not working properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如发现链接失败﹐请发送电子邮件至上述地址告知。

Sense.DEF:
a
link 2 1

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the linkage between wages and prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资和物价之间的关联

Sense.DEF: a system of links or connections
a condition in a political or business agreement by which one country or company agrees to do something, only if the other promises to do something in return
Sense.TRAN: 关联原则〔政治或商业协议中﹐一方同意做某事﹐以换取对方做某事的条件〕

Sense.DEF: a verb that connects the subject of a sentence with its complement, for example ‘seem’ in the sentence ‘the house seems big’
a word that is used to connect one part of a sentence with another, or to show how one sentence is related to another. For example, ‘and’, ‘although’, and ‘however’ are linking words.
a connection between two things, especially organizations or communication systems
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指机构或通信系统之间的〕连接

Sense.DEF: a small brown singing bird
the art of cutting a pattern on a block of linoleum
a picture printed from such a block
a floor covering made from strong shiny material

a system for arranging
type 1 5
in the form of solid metal lines
Sense.TRAN: 莱诺铸排机〔用于印刷的整行排字系统〕

Sense.DEF: the seed of the flax plant
the oil from linseed, used in paints, for protecting wood surfaces etc
soft light pieces of thread or wool that come off cotton, wool, or other material
soft cotton material used for protecting wounds
a piece of stone or wood across the top of a window or door, forming part of the frame

a computer operating system that was invented by Linus Torvalds, a Finnish university student. You can get Linux for free, or you can buy it from companies who provide information and instructions on how to operate it.
Sense.TRAN: Linux操作系统〔一种计算机操作系统〕

Sense.DEF: a large animal of the cat family that lives in Africa and parts of southern Asia. Lions have gold-coloured fur and the male has a manelong hair around its neck.
the largest part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm has captured the lion’s share of the UK market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司已经占有英国市场最大的份额。

Sense.DEF: if you go into the lion’s den, you go among people who are your enemies
a female lion
very brave
to treat someone as being very important or famous
one of the two soft parts around your mouth where your skin is redder or darker

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His bottom lip was swollen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的下唇肿起来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had big eyes and full lips large and round lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼睛大大的﹐嘴唇很丰满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt opened the door with a smile on his lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特开了门﹐嘴角挂着微笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marty kissed me right on the lips!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂一下吻在我的嘴唇上！

GramExa.GLOSS: having lips that are thin, or large and round
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 薄嘴唇的/厚嘴唇的/嘴唇丰满的

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen pursed his lips with distaste brought them together tightly into a small circle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬厌恶地噘起嘴唇。

Sense.DEF: the edge of a hollow or deep place in the land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the old road that ran along the lip of the gorge
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着峡谷边缘的一条古道

Sense.DEF: the edge of something you use to hold or pour liquid
talk that is not polite or respectful – used especially by adults to children
Sense.TRAN: 无礼的话〔尤为大人对小孩说话时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t give me any of your lip!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不许对我无礼！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will not tell anyone about a secret
Sense.TRAN: 我会守口如瓶﹐我会保密

Sense.DEF: being talked about by everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actress whose name is on everyone’s lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名字挂在大家嘴边的一个女演员

Sense.DEF: a substance used to protect dry lips
a substance used to make lips look very shiny
one of several types of fattysubstances in living things, such as fat, oil, or wax
a way of removing fat from someone’s body, using suction

Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute, I’ll just put a bit of lippy on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐我抹点口红马上就好。

Sense.DEF: not showing respect in the way that you speak to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某人说话时〕出言不逊的﹐无礼的

Sense.DEF: to understand what someone is saying by watching the way their lips move, because you cannot hear them
a small ring that someone puts through their lip, as jewellery
a substance used to make sore lips feel better
to say that you support or agree with something without doing anything to prove it
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事空口答应﹐口惠而实不至
Sense.EXAMPLE: organizations that pay lip service to career development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空口保证可获得职业发展的机构

Sense.DEF: lip-smacking food tastes very good. This word is often used in advertisements.
Sense.TRAN: 令人咂嘴的〔常用于广告﹐表示食物美味〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: lip-smacking recipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人咂嘴的食谱

Sense.DEF: something used for adding colour to your lips, in the shape of a small stick
a lesbianwoman who is sexually attracted to other women who behaves and dresses in a very feminine way
Sense.TRAN: 〔举止打扮非常女性化的〕同性恋女子

Sense.DEF: to move your lips at the same time as a recording is being played, in order to pretend that you are singing or saying the words
the act of making something a liquid or of becoming a liquid
to become liquid, or make something become liquid
a sweet very strong alcoholic drink, drunk in small quantities after a meal
Sense.TRAN: 〔饭后浅酌的〕利口酒﹐烈性甜酒

Sense.DEF: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

Sense.DEF: in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童服用液态抗生素。
Sense.EXAMPLE: liquid soap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 液体皂

Sense.DEF: easily changed into money by being sold or exchanged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their shares are more liquid than those of many smaller companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的股票比许多较小公司的股票更容易变现。

Sense.DEF: drink, especially alcoholic drink – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 饮料〔尤指酒类﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: clear and shiny, like water
Sense.TRAN: 清澈明亮的﹐晶莹剔透的
Sense.EXAMPLE: liquid green eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清澈明亮的绿眼睛

Sense.DEF: liquid sounds are clear and pure
the money that a company or person has, and the property they can exchange for money
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或个人拥有的〕流动资产

Sense.DEF: to close a business or company and sell the things that belong to it, in order to pay its debts
Sense.TRAN: 停业清盘﹐清算〔指公司停业后出售资产以偿还债务〕

Sense.DEF: to pay a debt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stock was sold to liquidate the loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票被卖出以偿还贷款。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone or destroy something that is causing a problem
Sense.TRAN: 杀死﹐干掉〔某人〕﹔毁掉〔某物〕

Sense.DEF: the act of closing a company by selling the things that belong to it, in order to pay its debts
Sense.TRAN: 停业清盘﹐清算〔指公司停业后出售资产以偿还债务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of small businesses went into liquidation were closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数以百计的小公司破产了。

Sense.DEF: the act of paying a debt
an official whose job is to close a company and use any money obtained to pay its debts
when a business or a person has money or goods that can be sold to pay debts
the state of being liquid
to crush fruit, vegetables etc into a thick liquid
a small electric machine that makes solid foods into liquids
a small bag filled with liquid soap, used in a washing machine
a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky
any alcoholic drink
a black substance produced from the root of a plant, used in medicine and sweets
Sense.TRAN: 甘草浸膏〔用来制药和糖果〕

Sense.DEF: sweets made from this substance
a shop where alcohol is sold
the standard unit of money in Malta and Turkey, and used in Italy before the euro
Sense.TRAN: 里拉〔马耳他和土耳其的标准货币单位﹐也是意大利在使用欧元前的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a fault in the way someone speaks which makes them pronounce ‘s’ sounds as ‘th’
Sense.TRAN: 咬舌〔语音缺陷﹐把s发成th音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She speaks with a slight lisp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话带点咬舌音。

Sense.DEF: a body that is lissom is thin and graceful
a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be high/low on a list (of sth)

Variant.LEXVAR: be at the top/bottom of a list

Sense.DEF: to be considered very important or not very important
Sense.TRAN: 是最紧要的/最不紧要的（事情）
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good car is high on my list of priorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买一辆好车是我的当务之急。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Could you make a list of any supplies we need?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否为我们列一个必需品清单？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: write a list
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They’ve compiled a list of children’s clubs and organizations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已列出一份儿童俱乐部及机构的清单。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was put on a waiting list to see a specialist at the hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已被列入那家医院一位专科医生的预约候诊名单。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be the first thing in a list
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The novel topped the best-seller list.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该小说位居畅销榜榜首。

Collocate.COLLOC: at the top/bottom of a list
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her name was at the top of the list of students.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字位列学生名单之首。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 在名单的第一个/最后一个
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Your name will be first on my list.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我的名单上﹐你的名字将是头一个。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He read out a long list of errors.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣读了一份长长的错误列表。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一份完整的/全面的/详尽的名单
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The full list of winners is on page seven.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 完整的获奖者名单在第七页。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ll send you a catalog and price list.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将为您寄送一份目录及价格清单。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a list of things you want to buy
a list of food you want to buy
a list of wines available in a restaurant
a list of people who are waiting for something
a list of people that a company sends information to
a list of people invited somewhere
a list of things you must do

Sense.DEF: to write a list, or mention things one after the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

Sense.DEF: to put someone on an official list, especially a hospital or court list
Sense.TRAN: 把…列入正式名单〔尤指医院或法庭的名单〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: list sb in fair/stable etc condition
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several passengers were listed in critical condition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几名乘客被列入重症名单。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The case was listed for trial in the Crown Court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该案被列入刑事法庭审理清单。

Sense.DEF: if a ship lists, it leans to one side
a listed building is one of historical interest in Britain, and is protected by a government order
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物〕被列入文物保护范围的

Sense.DEF: a listed company is one which offers its shares for sale on the stock exchange
to pay attention to what someone is saying or to a sound that you can hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen! There’s a strange noise in the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听！引擎发出奇怪的声音。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sat around listening to music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们围坐着听音乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole class was listening attentively.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全班学生都在专心听着。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liz stood still and listened hard very carefully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹静静地站着﹐仔细倾听。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Listen is never followed directly by a noun. Use to and then a noun or a clause. listen从不直接跟名词﹐须用to﹐然后跟名词或从句: Listen to what I say (NOT 不说 listen what I say). 听我说。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to pay attention to what you are going to say
Sense.TRAN: 听着﹐听好〔用于告诉某人留意你要说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen, I want you to come with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听着﹐我要你跟我一起去。

Sense.DEF: to consider what someone says and accept their advice
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told him not to go, but he just wouldn’t listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫他不要去﹐可他就是不听。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d listened to Dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当初要是听爸爸的话就好了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to listen to reason accept sensible advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不听劝告。

Sense.DEF: to listen carefully so that you will notice a particular sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen for the moment when the music changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留心听音乐变化的那一瞬间。

Sense.DEF: to listen to a broadcast on the radio

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I must remember to listen in to the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一定要记得收听新闻。

Sense.DEF: to listen to someone’s conversation when they do not want you to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounded like someone was listening in on us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像有人在偷听我们谈话。

Sense.DEF: to listen carefully so that you will notice a particular sound
Sense.TRAN: 注意听﹐留心听〔某个声音〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Listen out for the baby in case she wakes up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意听宝宝的动静﹐当心她醒来。

Sense.DEF: used to get people’s attention so they can hear what you are going to say
Sense.TRAN: 注意﹐听着〔用于吸引别人注意听你将要说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey everybody, listen up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐各位﹐注意听好！

Sense.DEF: an act of listening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have a listen to this new album!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听一听这张新专辑！

Sense.DEF: pleasant to listen to
someone who listens to the radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new programme for younger listeners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对年轻听众的新节目

Sense.DEF: someone who listens carefully and sympathetically to other people
Sense.TRAN: 认真倾听的人/有同情心的听者

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that allows you to listen secretly to other people’s conversations
a type of bacteria that makes you sick
an official or public list

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a listing of all households in the district
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 区内所有住户的名单

Sense.DEF: lists of films, plays, and other events, with the times and places at which they will happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧等的〕上映信息﹐演出信息﹔活动一览表

Sense.DEF: if a company has a listing on the stock exchange, it can offer its shares for sale
feeling tired and not interested in things
Sense.TRAN: 倦怠的﹐无精打采的﹐懒洋洋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat was making me listless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热的天气使我懒洋洋的。

Sense.DEF: a price that is suggested for a product by the people who make it
a computer program that allows a group of people to send and receive e-mail from each other about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 电子邮件列表管理程序﹐电子邮件群发系统

Sense.DEF: a past tense and past participle of light

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 缩写= literature or 或 literary 文学（作品）﹔文学的
Sense.EXAMPLE: French lit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国文学

Sense.DEF: a long list of problems, excuses etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 冗长乏味的陈述﹐赘述〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an endless litany of complaints
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喋喋不休的抱怨

Sense.DEF: a long prayer in the Christian Church in which the priest says a sentence and the people reply
used in the names of some food or drink products to mean that they have fewer calories or less fat than other similar products
Sense.TRAN: 低热量的﹔低脂的﹔清淡的〔用于某些食品或饮料名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: lite beer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡啤酒

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of litre
the state of being able to read and write
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new adult literacy campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一轮成人识字[扫盲]运动

Sense.DEF: the literal meaning of a word or expression is its basic or original meaning
Sense.TRAN: 〔词或词组〕本义的﹐原义的﹐字面意思的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A trade war is not a war in the literal sense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易战不是字面意义上的战争。

Sense.DEF: a translation that translates each word exactly instead of giving the general meaning in a more natural way
not showing much imagination
according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression
Sense.TRAN: 按照原义﹐根据字面意思
Sense.EXAMPLE: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte﹐字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally I did not mean exactly what I said!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是说我不想干了﹐但并不是真的不干了！

Sense.DEF: to believe exactly what someone or something says rather than trying to understand their general meaning
Sense.TRAN: 仅仅从字面上理解某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: She takes the Bible literally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是从字面上去理解《圣经》的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something, especially a large number, is actually true
Sense.TRAN: 的确﹐确实〔用于加强语气﹐尤指数目庞大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Olympic Games were watched by literally billions of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会确确实实有几十亿人观看。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a strong expression or word that is not being used in its real or original meaning. Some people consider this use to be incorrect.
Sense.TRAN: 简直〔用于加强本已强烈的语气﹔有些人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was literally blazing with anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸简直是火冒三丈。

Sense.DEF: relating to literature
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary prize
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学奖

GramExa.GLOSS: the study of the methods used in writing literature

Sense.DEF: typical of the style of writing used in literature rather than in ordinary writing and talking
Sense.TRAN: 用于文学作品的﹔典雅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary style of writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典雅的文体

Sense.DEF: liking literature very much, and studying or producing it
Sense.TRAN: 爱好文学的﹔从事文学研究[创作]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女文人

Sense.DEF: able to read and write
able to use computers, understand and play music etc
Sense.TRAN: 会使用计算机的/会演奏乐器的等

Sense.DEF: well educated
a small group of people in a society who know a lot about literature
books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has read many of the major works of literature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Italian literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利文学

Sense.DEF: all the books, articles etc on a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: literature on the history of science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学史的文献资料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several cases of mercury poisoning have been recorded in the literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文献上记载了几宗汞中毒事件。

Sense.DEF: printed information produced by people who want to sell you something or tell you about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔推销商品或提供信息的〕印刷品﹐宣传品
Sense.EXAMPLE: sales literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销宣传品

Sense.DEF: having a body that moves easily and gracefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: the strong lithe bodies of gymnasts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体操运动员强壮柔韧的身体

Sense.DEF: a soft silver-white metal that is the lightest known metal, is used in batteries, and is often combined with other metals. It is a chemical element:symbol Li
Sense.TRAN: 锂〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Li〕

Sense.DEF: a printed picture produced by lithography
a method of printing in which a pattern is cut into stone or metal so that ink sticks to some parts of it and not others
someone who is making a claim against someone or defending themselves against a claim in a court of law
to take a claim or complaint against someone to a court of law
the process of taking claims to a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The threat of litigation can be a deciding factor in some business decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诉讼的威胁会成为有些经营决策的决定性因素。

Sense.DEF: very willing to take disagreements to a court of law – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 好讼的﹐好打官司的〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a litigious society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个动辄打官司的社会

Sense.DEF: a chemical that turns red when it touches acid, and blue when it touches an alkali
Sense.TRAN: 石蕊〔一种遇酸变红﹑遇碱变蓝的化学物质〕

Sense.DEF: paper containing litmus, used to test whether a chemical is an acid or an alkali
one detail that is examined in order to help you make a decision about how suitable or acceptable someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人或某事物的〕检验办法﹐试金石

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mayoral election is regarded as the litmus test for the integrity of the electoral process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长竞选被认为是检验选举程序是否完善的试金石。

Sense.DEF: a test using litmus paper
the basic unit for measuring liquid in the metric system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a litre of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一升水

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a litre bottle of wine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶一升装的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: a measurement that shows the size and power of a vehicle’s engine
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Ford’s 2.8 litre engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福特汽车2.8升排量的引擎

Sense.DEF: waste paper, cans etc that people have thrown away and left on the ground in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 〔在公共场所乱扔的〕垃圾﹐废弃物
Sense.EXAMPLE: People who drop litter can be fined in some cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在有些城市﹐乱扔垃圾的人会被罚款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a town with a litter problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存在乱扔垃圾问题的一个小镇

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Litter is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: litter 是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐后跟单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Litter spoils the countryside.

Sense.DEF: a group of baby animals that a mother gives birth to at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a litter of kittens
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一窝小猫

Sense.DEF: small grains of a dry substance that is put in a container that a cat uses as a toilet indoors
Sense.TRAN: 猫砂〔一种干燥的颗粒物质﹐置于容器中供猫在室内便溺用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: cat litter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫砂
Sense.EXAMPLE: a litter tray
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫砂盘

Sense.DEF: dead leaves and other decaying plants on the ground in a forest
a group of things that look very untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: A litter of notes, papers, and textbooks were strewn on the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆笔记﹑考卷和课本乱七八糟地摊在桌子上。

Sense.DEF: a substance such as straw that a farm animal sleeps on
a chair or bed for carrying important people, used in past times
if things litter an area, there are a lot of them in that place, scattered in an untidy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clothes littered the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣服扔了一地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The desk was littered with papers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子上乱七八糟地堆满报纸。

Sense.DEF: if something is littered with things, there are a lot of those things in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent business news has been littered with stories of companies failing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的商业新闻都是公司倒闭的消息。

Sense.DEF: to leave waste paper, cans etc on the ground in a public place
if an animal such as a dog or cat litters, it gives birth to babies
a container in a public place, for things people throw away, such as papers or cans
someone who drops paper, cans etc on the ground in public places
Sense.TRAN: 〔在公共场所〕乱扔垃圾者﹐垃圾虫

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of a littleand a bit in spoken and written British English. a little和a bit在英国英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
A bitis more informal than a little. a bit比a little更加不正式。

Sense.DEF: small in size
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cake decorated with little flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点缀着小花的蛋糕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was cutting the meat up into little bits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把肉切成小丁。

GramExa.GLOSS: extremely small
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: a little tiny puppy
丁点大的小狗

GramExa.GLOSS: extremely small
a small present, or a small amount of food
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to buy him a little something to thank him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给他买样小东西谢谢他。 thesaurussmall

Sense.DEF: used between an adjective and a noun to emphasize that you like or dislike something or someone, although they are not important, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 小的〔用于形容词和名词之间﹐强调喜欢或厌恶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could be a nice little business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能是一门不错的小生意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a useful little gadget
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件有用的小玩意儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was another of her silly little jokes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是她开的另一个愚蠢的小玩笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boring little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个无趣的小男人

GramExa.GLOSS: used to show sympathy
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 可怜的小东西〔表示同情〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The poor little thing had hurt its wing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可怜的小东西翅膀受伤了。

Subsense.DEF: a small amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With a little bit of luck we should finish by five o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有点运气的话﹐
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to give you a little bit of advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要给你一点小小的建议。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let me tell you a little bit about myself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你稍微讲讲我自己吧。

Subsense.DEF: slightly or to a small degree
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was a little bit disappointed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点失望。

Sense.DEF: short in time or distance
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could have a little sleep in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在车里小睡一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked a little way along this path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿着这条小路走了一小段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He arrived a little while ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚到一会儿。

Sense.DEF: little children are young
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t have toys like this when I was little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我小时候﹐我们没有这样的玩具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two little boys playing in the street
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个在街上玩耍的小男孩

GramExa.GLOSS: someone’s son or daughter who is still a child
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人的小儿子/女儿〔指尚未成年〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum, I’m 17 – I’m not your little girl any longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈﹐我17岁了——我不再是你的小女孩了。

GramExa.GLOSS: a younger brother or sister who is still a child
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人的小弟弟/妹妹〔指仍然是孩子〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her little brother and sister were fighting again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她年幼的弟弟和妹妹又在打架了。

Sense.DEF: done in a way that is not very noticeable
Sense.TRAN: 微弱的﹔不明显的﹔轻微的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微微一笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicolo gave a little nod of his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼科洛微微点了点头。

Subsense.DEF: not important
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She gets very angry over little things.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为一点小事就会很生气。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There isn’t time to discuss every little detail.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有时间讨论每一个琐碎的细节了。

Subsense.DEF: not important – used when you really think that something is important
Subsense.TRAN: 微不足道的〔指实际上认为某事很重要〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s just that little matter of the £5,000 you owe me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就是你欠我5,000英镑这件小事情。

Sense.DEF: better, easier etc by a small amount that will have an important effect
Sense.TRAN: （就）更好/更简单一点等〔指量少而效果大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working fewer hours will make life just that little bit easier for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间少几个小时就会让我的生活轻松一点。

Sense.DEF: someone’s wife – often used humorously but now considered offensive by many women
Sense.TRAN: 老婆﹐婆娘〔指某人的妻子﹔常为幽默用法﹐但现在许多妇女认为此说法具有冒犯性〕

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: You can say smaller or smallest , but ‘littler’ and ‘littlest’ are not often used.
F2NBox.TRAN: 可以说 smaller 或 smallest ﹐但 littler 和 littlest 很罕见
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her feet are even smaller (NOT 不说 littler/more little) than mine.
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use words like ‘quite’, ‘very’, and ‘too’ in front of small , but do not use them with little .
F2NBox.TRAN: 可在small前用quite、very﹑too等词﹐但不能在little前使用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a very small car (NOT 不说 a very little car)

Sense.DEF: only a small amount or hardly any of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s little doubt in my mind that he’s guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心里几乎毫不怀疑他是有罪的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I paid little attention to what the others were saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不大注意别人在说什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little is known about the causes of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题的起因人们所知甚少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Changes in the law have done little to improve the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修改法律对于改善局势几乎没有什么作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Little of their wealth now remains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的财富现在已经所剩无几。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s very little money left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没剩下多少钱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the students speak little or no English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生几乎一点英语也不会说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew little or nothing almost nothing about fixing cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对修车几乎一无所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My lawyer advised me to say as little as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的律师建议我尽量少说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did precious little very little to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有帮多少忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The laboratory tests are of little real value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些实验室测试几乎没什么实际的价值。

Sense.DEF: a small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fortunately I had a little time to spare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好我能抽出一点时间来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan speaks a little French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊会说一点法语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little over half the class can swim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上有一半多一点的人会游泳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked on a little a short distance and then turned back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往前走了一小段﹐然后掉头往回走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like a little more milk in your coffee?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的咖啡里要再加一点牛奶吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city is regaining a little of its former splendour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市正在一点点恢复昔日的辉煌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as little as £5/3 months/10 feet etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how surprisingly small an amount is
Sense.TRAN: 只是5英镑/3个月/10 英尺等而已〔表示数量少得令人惊讶〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices for his paintings start from as little as £100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画起价只有100英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather can change completely in as little as half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气可以在短短半小时之内完全改变。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how small an amount there is, how small an amount is possible etc
Sense.TRAN: 仅有的一点﹔尽可能的一点
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did what little we could to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已尽绵薄之力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I handed over what little money I had left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把仅剩的一点钱交了出来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a little (of sth) goes a long way
Sense.DEF: used to say that only a small amount of something is needed or has a great effect
Sense.TRAN: 一点点（某物）就已足够[有很大的作用]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little kindness goes a long way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小小的善举能有大作用。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: A little and little are used before uncountable nouns.
F2NBox.TRAN: a little和little均用于不可数名词前。
F2NBox.EXPL: A little means ‘some, but not a lot’.
F2NBox.TRAN: a little意为 "有一些﹐但不多"
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We still have a little time left.
F2NBox.EXPL: In spoken British English, it is more usual to say a bit of.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英国英语口语中﹐更常用 a bit of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a bit of money left.
F2NBox.EXPL: Little on its own (without a ) means ‘not much’. It emphasizes how small the amount is. It is mainly used in writing or formal speech.
F2NBox.TRAN: little(没有a时)意为 “很少”﹐ 强调数量非常少﹐主要用于书面语或正式讲话
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There is now little hope of success.
F2NBox.EXPL: In conversation or informal writing, it is more usual to say not much.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在对话或非正式书面语中﹐更常用 not much
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There was not much milk left.

Sense.DEF: slightly or to a small degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: She trembled a little as she spoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话时有些颤抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a little surprised at her request.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于她的请求﹐他有点吃惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to wait a little longer to see what happens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得再等一会儿﹐看看会发生什么事情。GRAMMAR 语法When you use a littlewith an adjective, it should come before the adjective, not after it. 与形容词连用时﹐a little应置于形容词前﹐而不能置后: I was a little worried about her (NOT 不说 I was worried a little ...). 我有点替她担心。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you use a little with an adjective, it should come before the adjective, not after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 与形容词连用时﹐a little应置于形容词前﹐而不能置后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I was a little worried about her (NOT 不说 I was worried a little ...).
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: You cannot use a little with an adjective before a noun. Use rather or slightly. a little加形容词不能用在名词前。 要用rather或slightly: It was a rather strange situation (NOT 不说 a little strange situation). 这局面相当奇怪。

Sense.DEF: not much or only slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town has changed little over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来﹐小镇几乎没有什么变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation has improved very little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情形没怎么好转。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: not known about by many people

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜为人知的 a little known corner of the world 世上鲜为人知的角落

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His voice was little more than a whisper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的说话声就像是窃窃私语。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone did not know or think that something would happen or was true
Sense.TRAN: 某人没有想到/意识到/认为等〔某事会发生或是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little did I know that the course of my life was about to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时我一点也没有想到﹐我的人生轨迹即将发生变化。

Sense.DEF: gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little by little he became accepted by the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他渐渐地被这家人接受了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: more than a little/not a little
Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham was more than a little frightened by what he had seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆被眼前所见吓了一大跳。

Sense.DEF: an English person who thinks that everything English is best, and does not like or trust people from other countries
the smallest finger on your hand
all the people in a country or organization who have no power
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the little people who bear the brunt of taxation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税负压力最大的是平民百姓。

Sense.DEF: imaginary people with magic powers, especially Irish leprechauns
Sense.TRAN: 小仙子﹔〔尤指爱尔兰传说中的〕矮妖精

Sense.DEF: an area near the coast
relating to church services and ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 教堂仪式的﹐礼拜仪式的

Sense.DEF: a way of praying in a religious service using a fixed order of words, prayers etc
the written form of these services
another spelling of liveable
if you live in a place, you have your home there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lived in Holland for ten years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在荷兰住了10年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He lives just across the street from me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就住在我街对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We live only a few miles from the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一看到那地方﹐就觉得不想住在那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does Paul stilllive here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗还住在这儿吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还在找住的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve finally found a place to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandmother came to live with us when I was ten.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我10岁的时候﹐祖母搬来和我们同住。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at homelive with their parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m quite happy living alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一个人住很开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house has 3,600 square feet of living spacethe areas of a house you live in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

GramExa.GLOSS: living outside because they have no home
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I ran away from home and lived rough for nine months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我离家出走﹐露宿了9个月。

Sense.DEF: a plant or animal that lives in a particular place grows there or has its home there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These particular birds live on only one island in the Pacific.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些独特的鸟只栖息在太平洋的一个岛上。

Sense.DEF: if you live at a particular time, you are alive then

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lived in the eighteenth century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生活在18世纪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lived at a time when women were not expected to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生活的时代妇女不用工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gladstone lived during a period of great social change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉德斯通生活在一个社会大变革时期。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the best/greatest etc that/who ever lived
GramExa.GLOSS: the best, greatest etc who has been alive at any time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有史以来最好的/最伟大的等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s probably the best journalist who ever lived.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也许是有史以来最优秀的新闻记者。

Sense.DEF: to be alive or be able to stay alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without light, plants couldn’t live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有阳光﹐植物就无法生存。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is extremely ill and not expected to live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病得很重﹐看来活不成了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby only lived a few hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个婴儿只活了几个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People on average arelivingmuchlongerthan before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人的平均寿命比以前长多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never forget this for as long as I live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一辈子也忘不了这件事。

GramExa.PROPFORM: live to (be) 80/90 etc/live to the age of 80/90 etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandmother lived to 85.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖母活到85岁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She lived to the age of 79.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她活到79岁。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have two weeks/six months etc to live
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He knows he’s only got a few months to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己只能再活几个月。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He did notlive to see live long enough to seethe realization of his dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没能活着看见自己的梦想实现。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular type of life, or live in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 过…生活﹔以〔某种方式〕生活

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people in this country just want to live in peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的人只想过和平的生活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People should not live in fear of crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们不应该生活在对犯罪的恐惧中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We live in hope that a cure will be found.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直抱着能够找到治疗方法的希望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two communities live peacefully alongside each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个社区和平相处。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She thought that she would get married andlive happily ever afterlike in a children’s story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想她会结婚﹐从此过上幸福的生活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people like to live dangerously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人喜欢过冒险的生活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most elderly people prefer to live independently if they can.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数老年人只要自己还行﹐都喜欢独立生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They earn enough money tolive wellhave plenty of food, clothes etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赚的钱足够过上富足的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to live mylifein my own way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想按自己的方式生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not well enough tolive a normal life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体欠佳﹐还不能正常生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lives a very busy life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生活很忙碌。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had chosen tolive the life of a monk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他选择了过僧侣的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s now in Hollywood living a life of luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她目前在好莱坞﹐过着奢侈的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have always tried to live by my faith according to my religion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直努力按照自己的信仰生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We struggle on,living from day to day trying to find enough money each day to buy food etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们艰难度日﹐过一天算一天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tired of living out of a suitcasespending a lot of time travelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他厌倦了拎着行李东奔西跑的生活。

Sense.DEF: the way that someone lives is the way that they earn money to buy food etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fishing is the way their families have lived for generations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕鱼是他们祖祖辈辈的谋生手段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They live by hunting and killing deer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以猎杀鹿为生。

Sense.DEF: to have an exciting life
Sense.TRAN: 过精彩的生活﹐享受生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to get out and live a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想出去享受一下生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re beginning to live at last!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于开始享受生活了！

Sense.DEF: to imagine that things are happening to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lives in a fantasy world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他活在一个虚幻的世界里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lived through her children’s lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生活在儿女的世界里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You must stopliving in the pastimagining that things from the past are still happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能总是生活在过去。

Sense.DEF: the place where something lives is the place where it is kept
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do these cups live?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些杯子放在哪里的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those big dishes live in the cupboard next to the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大碟子放在冰箱旁边的碗橱里。

Sense.DEF: if an idea lives, it continues to exist and influence people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Democracy still lives!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主尚存！
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name willlive forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将名垂千古。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That day will alwayslive inmymemory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一天将永远留在我的记忆里。

Sense.DEF: the part of a building where people live, especially a building that is used by many people or is used for several different purposes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the White House living quarters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫的生活区

Sense.DEF: the money you need to spend in order to live, for example on food or a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: His tuition is paid, but he’ll work to cover his living expenses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的学费已经付了﹐但是他还要打工赚取生活费。

Sense.DEF: the way someone organizes how and where they will live
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother disapproved of the living arrangements, saying that two girls living with four boys was bound to cause problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲不赞成她的生活安排﹐说两个女孩和四个男孩住在一起肯定会出麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to do things that you enjoy and spend a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 享乐﹐过花天酒地的生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam was living it up in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆在伦敦挥霍享乐。

Sense.DEF: to get money by being clever or dishonest, and not by doing an ordinary job
to pretend all the time that you feel or believe something when actually you do not feel that way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that I could not continue to live a lie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我不能继续过虚伪的生活了。

Sense.DEF: to be still alive after the time that you were expected to die
Sense.TRAN: 捡了一条命〔比预期活得更久〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been living on borrowed time for the last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去的一年﹐她的命是捡来的。

Sense.DEF: if people live in sin, they live together and have a sexual relationship without being married
to enjoy doing something so much that you spend most of your time on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politics is the stuff I live and breathe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治是我所热衷的事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have just learned something that you did not know before
Sense.TRAN: 真是活到老学到老〔用于表示刚得知以前不知道的事〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should accept other people’s behaviour, even if it seems strange
Sense.TRAN: 自己活也得让别人活〔用于表示要接受别人的行为﹐即使看上去奇怪〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s life will be boring if they do not do a particular exciting thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: You haven’t lived until you’ve tasted champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有尝过香槟的话﹐你就算白活了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will live to regret it
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will wish that they had not done something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you marry him, you’ll live to regret it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是嫁给他﹐会后悔一辈子的。

Sense.DEF: to continue to live or work after a failure or after you have dealt with a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔经历失败或困难后〕继续奋斗下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopefully, the company will live to fight another day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望公司能继续经营下去。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy doing a lot of different things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She believes in living life to the full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她相信生活就是要多姿多彩。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has a nice life because they have a lot of money and buy expensive things – often used to show disapproval
to have only just enough money to buy food
Sense.EXAMPLE: We lived from hand to mouth, never knowing where the next meal was coming from.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们日子过得紧巴巴的﹐从来是吃了上顿没下顿。

Sense.DEF: used as an expression of loyal support for a person
used to say that you hope something continues to exist for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long live free education!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费教育万岁！

Exponent.DEF: to have your home somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lives with his parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和父母同住。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you like living in Tokyo?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢住在东京吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jo lives next to a busy road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔住在一条繁华路段旁边。

Exponent.DEF: use this when talking about the country, city, or area where you usually live
Exponent.TRAN: 来自〔指通常居住的国家﹑城市或地区〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Where are you from?’ ‘I’m from Japan.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是哪国人？” “我是日本人。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The winner came from Australia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 优胜者来自澳大利亚。

Exponent.DEF: if a group of people or animals inhabit an area, they live there. Used especially in written descriptions.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人或动物〕居住于〔某地﹐尤用于书面描述〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The island is mainly inhabited by sheep.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上主要栖居着绵羊。

Exponent.DEF: to live in a particular country, city etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She now resides in the US.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前她居住在美国。

Exponent.DEF: to live somewhere when you are a child or teenager
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I grew up on a farm in South Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在南非的一个农场长大。

Sense.DEF: if someone does not live something down, people never forget about it and never stop laughing at them for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll never live that down!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她永远也无法使人忘记那件事！

Sense.DEF: if you live for something, it is the thing that you enjoy or hope for most in your life
