Sense.EXAMPLE: He lived for his art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是为自己的艺术而活着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had nothing left to live for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有什么生活目标了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shelives for the day when she can have a house of her own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生活的目标就是有一天能拥有自己的房子。

Sense.DEF: if someone lives in, they live in the place where they work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes it can be easier if you have a nanny who lives in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候雇一个住家保姆生活会方便一些。

Sense.DEF: to get your income or food from a supply of money or from another person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom used to live off the interest from her savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈过去靠存款利息生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad lost his job and we had to live off welfare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸失业了﹐我们只能靠福利救济过日子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people in the countrysidelive off the landlive by growing or finding their own food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村中大多数人都靠土地生活。

Sense.DEF: if something lives on, it continues to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alice’s memory will live on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯会一直留在大家的记忆里。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular amount of money to buy food and other necessary things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how they manage to live on £55 a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他们一个星期55英镑是怎么过日子的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the number of families who live on benefits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠救济过日子的家庭数量

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of a particular type of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live on bread and potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以面包和马铃薯为主食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He practically lives on fish and chips!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎以吃炸鱼和薯条为生！

Sense.DEF: if someone lives out, they do not live in the place where they work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most home helps prefer to live out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数家务用人不喜欢住在雇主家里。

Sense.DEF: to experience or do something that you have planned or hoped for
Sense.TRAN: 实现某事〔指已计划或想做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money enabled them to live out their dreams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱使他们实现了梦想。

Sense.DEF: to continue to live in a particular way or place until you die
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种方式或在某地方〕终老
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lived out his life in solitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在孤独中度过余生。

Sense.DEF: to experience difficult or dangerous conditions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the generation that lived through the Second World War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历过第二次世界大战的那一代人
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hard to describe the nightmare she had lived through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦魇般的遭遇很难描述。

Sense.DEF: if people live together, they live in the same house and have a sexual relationship but are not married
Sense.EXAMPLE: They lived together for two years before they got married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同居了两年才结婚。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone lives up to a particular standard or promise, they do as well as they were expected to, do what they promised etc
Sense.TRAN: 符合〔标准〕﹔不负〔盛名〕﹔履行〔诺言〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank is insolvent and will be unable to live up to its obligations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行已经破产﹐将无力履行其义务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film has certainlylived up tomyexpectations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影果然没有辜负我的期望。

Sense.DEF: to accept a difficult situation that is likely to continue for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 忍受﹐容忍〔可能为时长久的困难局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to learn to live with stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得学会承受压力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has lived with his illness for most of his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大半辈子都在忍受病痛。

Sense.DEF: to live in the same house as someone and have a sexual relationship with them without being married
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s living with her boyfriend now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在和男朋友住在一起。

Sense.DEF: if something lives with you, it stays in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: That episode has lived with me all my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那段经历我毕生难忘。

Sense.DEF: not dead or artificial
Sense.EXAMPLE: experiments on live animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物活体实验
Sense.EXAMPLE: Protesters want to stop the export of live sheep and cattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者希望阻止出口活羊活牛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the number of live births per 1,000 population
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每1,000人中的活产婴儿数目
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were so excited to seereal liveelephants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到活生生的大象我们非常兴奋。

Sense.DEF: a live television or radio pro-gramme is seen or heard on television or radio at the same time as it is actually happening
Sense.TRAN: 现场直播的﹐实况转播的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a live radio phone-in show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个现场直播的听众来电广播节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be live TV coverage of tonight’s big match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的大赛电视将现场直播。

Sense.DEF: a live performance is one in which the entertainer performs for people who are watching, rather than a film, record etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the bars havelive music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多酒吧都有现场音乐演奏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band will be giving a live concert performance next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期该乐队将举办一场现场音乐会。
Sense.EXAMPLE:
We’ll be playing you a track from his new live album
album that was recorded from a live performance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将为你播放他的现场版新专辑中的一首歌曲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s always different when you perform in front of alive audiencean audience watching a live performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在现场观众面前表演总是不一样的。

Sense.DEF: a wire or piece of equipment that is live has electricity flowing through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful – those wires are live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心——那些电线带电。

Sense.DEF: a live bomb still has the power to explode because it has not been used
Sense.EXAMPLE: They came across a field of live, unexploded mines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走过一片尚未引爆的雷区。

Sense.DEF: live bullets are real ones that are made of metal and can kill people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops firedlive ammunitionto disperse the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队发射实弹驱散人群。

Sense.DEF: a live subject or problem is one that still interests or worries people
Sense.TRAN: 当前所关心的﹐时下仍受人关注的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drink-driving is still very much a live issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒后驾车仍然是个时下非常受人关注的话题。

Sense.DEF: pieces of coal that are burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threw the paper onto the live coals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把纸扔到燃烧的煤块上。

Sense.DEF: live yoghurtcontains bacteriathat are still alive
if something is broadcast live, it is broadcast on television or radio as it is actually happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceremony will be broadcast live on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场典礼将在电视上现场直播。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match will be shown live by the BBC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛将由英国广播公司现场直播。

Sense.DEF: if people perform live, they perform in front of people who have come to watch, rather than for a film, record etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love their music, but I’ve never seen them perform live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢听他们的音乐﹐但我从来没有看过他们的现场表演。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band is playing live in Birmingham tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚该乐队将在伯明翰现场演出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their latest CD was recorded live recorded at a live performancein New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的这张最新唱片是在纽约现场演出时录制的。

Sense.DEF: when a system or project goes live, people start to use it after it has been planned and discussed for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统或项目经长时间计划和讨论后〕开始使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their new information retrieval system went live last month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们新的信息检索系统上个月开始使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new security project which will go live in October
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将于10月份启动的一个新的安全项目

Sense.DEF: a situation that is liveable is satisfactory but not good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having the children had made his life more liveable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了孩子以后他的生活更有意义了。

Subsense.DEF: good enough to live in
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We need to do more to make the neighborhood more livable.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让这个街区更适合居住﹐我们需要做得更多。

Subsense.DEF: nice to live in
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s one of the most liveable cities in the US.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里是美国最宜人的城市之一。

Sense.DEF: a salary that is enough for you to buy the things you need, such as food, a house etc
lived-in places or clothes look as though they have been used or worn a lot – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕像有人住过的﹔〔衣服〕像穿旧的〔含褒义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The most fashionable jeans this winter have a lived-in look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今冬最流行的牛仔裤有做旧感。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lived-in face looks fairly old and as though they have had a lot of interesting experiences
a live-in job is one in which you live with the family you work for
Sense.EXAMPLE: a live-in nanny
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住家保姆

Sense.DEF: someone who lives with their sexual partner but is not married to them
the way you earn money in order to live

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fishing is the main source of livelihood for many people in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打鱼是这一地区许多人的主要生活来源。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to earn a livelihood as an artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搞艺术很难谋生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bates says he will lose his livelihood if his driving licence is taken away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝茨说﹐如果驾照被吊销﹐他就没有了谋生的手段。

Sense.DEF: a phrase meaning ‘all day’, used when this seems like a long time to you
Sense.TRAN: 整整一天〔用于指时间似乎很漫长时）

Sense.DEF: someone who is lively has a lot of energy and is very active
Sense.TRAN: 充满活力的﹐生气勃勃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lively child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛的孩子

Sense.DEF: a place or situation that is lively is exciting because a lot of things are happening
Sense.TRAN: 激动人心的﹐令人兴奋的〔因有很多事情发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is situated next to the lively bustling port.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店位于那个熙熙攘攘的港口旁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the city’s lively nightlife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市丰富多彩的夜生活

Sense.DEF: lively movements or music are very quick and exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lively Spanish dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻快活泼的西班牙舞蹈

Sense.DEF: a lively discussion, description etc is very interesting and involves a lot of ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book offers a lively account of her travels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中生动地描绘了她的旅行见闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lively debateon environmental issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于环境问题的热烈争论

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lively mind is intelligent and interested in a lot of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even Paula has shown a lively interest in politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就连葆拉也对政治表现出浓厚的兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie has a very lively imagination he often invents stories, descriptions etc that are not true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利有非常丰富的想象力。

Sense.DEF: very bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lively combination of colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜艳的颜色搭配

Sense.DEF: something that has a lively taste has a strong but pleasant taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine has a lively fruity flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这葡萄酒有一股浓郁的果香味。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
to become more exciting, or to make an event become more exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party really livened up when Mattie arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂来了之后﹐聚会的气氛确实活跃起来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we invite Jane? That’ll liven things up!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不邀请简呢？那样才热闹呢！

Sense.DEF: to make something look, taste etc more interesting
Sense.TRAN: 使某物更好看[更有趣味]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why not liven up the room with some flowers?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不摆些花使房间更有生气呢？

Sense.DEF: to become more interested or excited, or to make someone feel like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few drinks she livened up a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几杯酒下肚﹐她活跃了一些。

Sense.DEF: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood
the liver of an animal, used as food
wearing livery
Sense.EXAMPLE: a liveried servant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿制服的仆人

Sense.DEF: painted with the colours and designs that represent a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: liveried aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涂着航空公司彩色标志的飞机

Sense.DEF: slightly ill, especially after eating or drinking too much
someone from the city of Liverpool in England
a cooked soft sausage made from liver
the colours and designs used by a company on its property and vehicles
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于公司财物和车辆上的〕彩色标志

Sense.DEF: a special uniform worn by servants in past times
the business of keeping and taking care of horses, especially in past times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a livery stable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代养马房

Sense.DEF: the plural of life
animals such as cows and sheep that are kept on a farm
someone who is very active and has a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 活跃分子﹐精力充沛的人

Sense.DEF: a wire that has electricity passing through it
extremely angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was absolutely livid that he had lied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为他说谎而大发雷霆。

Sense.DEF: a mark on your skin that is livid is dark blue and grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: livid bruises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌青色的瘀伤

Sense.DEF: a face that is livid is very pale
alive now
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the greatest living composers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是仍然健在的最伟大的作曲家之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun affects all living things people, animals, and plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳与一切生物息息相关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a living language one that people still use
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活语言﹐仍在使用的语言

Sense.DEF: if someone is living proof of a particular fact, they are a good example of how true it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m living proof that you don’t need a college degree to be successful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有大学学位也能获得成功﹐我就是一个活生生的例子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the living proof of government economic incompetence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在经济上无能的一个明证

Sense.DEF: during the time that anyone can remember
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the worst storm in living memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是人们记忆中最严重的风暴。

Sense.DEF: a life that is so unpleasant that it seems better to be dead
a very unpleasant situation that makes you suffer for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: These past few days have been a living hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去这几天真是人间地狱。

Sense.DEF: someone who is famous for being extremely good at something, and who still does that activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔某方面极为杰出的〕活着的传奇人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: His music has made him a living legend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐使他成为当今的传奇人物。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: scare/frighten the (living) daylights out of sb
beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb

Sense.DEF: the way that you earn money or the money that you earn
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not a great job, but it’s a living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是什么了不起的工作﹐不过是一种生计。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do youdo for a living? what do you do as a job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是做什么营生的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to make a decent living as a musician.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当音乐家很难过上体面的生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: get just enough to eat or live

Sense.DEF: all the people who are alive as opposed to dead people
the way in which someone lives their life
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stresses of city living
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市生活的压力

Sense.DEF: the position or income of a parish priest

Crossrefto.REFLEX: in the land of the living

Sense.DEF: a bandage made from skin cells, especially cells that have been taken and grown from the patient’s own skin
Sense.TRAN: 活绷带〔尤指取用病人自身皮肤细胞培育而成的绷带〕

Sense.DEF: an ancient animal or plant that still exists and has not changed
the main room in a house where people relax, watch television etc
the level of comfort and the amount of money that people have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living standards have improved over the last century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去一百年中生活水平有所提高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: rising living standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越高的生活水准
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a decline in the living standards of old people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人的生活水平有所下降。

Sense.DEF: a salary that is high enough to allow you to buy the things that you need to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: jobs that don’t even pay a living wage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资连基本生活都无法维持的工作

Sense.DEF: a document explaining what medical or legal decisions someone should make if you become so ill that you cannot make those decisions yourself
Sense.TRAN: “活遗嘱”﹐生前遗嘱〔一种文件﹐说明当事人若病重无法作决定时应采取哪种医疗或法律方面的决定〕

Sense.DEF: a type of reptile that has four legs and a long tail

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=lines, used in writing to refer to specific lines of a poem etc〔诗歌等中的〕行

Sense.DEF: a South American animal with thick hair like wool, and a long neck
a first university degree in law
a doctorate in law
a university degree in law that you can get after your first degree
used to tell someone to look at something that is surprising
Sense.TRAN: 看哪﹐瞧〔用于叫人注意出乎意料的事〕

Sense.DEF: used before mentioning something surprising that happened – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had just been talking about John when, lo and behold, he walked into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚刚谈到约翰﹐你瞧﹐他就走进房间来了。

Sense.DEF: a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a load of wood
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一车木头

Sense.EXAMPLE: The lorry hadshed its loadthe load had fallen off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车上的货掉下来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was carrying afull loadof fuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机载满燃料。

Sense.DEF: a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We got a load of complaints about the loud music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人向我们投诉音乐太响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, there’s loads of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用担心﹐时间很充裕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s loads to see in Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎可看的东西太多了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a bus load/car load/truck load etc
Sense.DEF: the largest amount of something that a vehicle can carry
Sense.TRAN: 满满一公共汽车/一汽车/一卡车等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bus load of tourists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满满一车游客

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is bad, untrue, or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 十足的胡闹﹔一派胡言﹔彻头彻尾的蠢话
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the game was a load of crap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这场比赛简直就是瞎胡闹。

Sense.DEF: the amount of work that a person or machine has to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个人或一台机器的〕工作量﹐负荷
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer couldn’t handle the load and crashed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机难以处理负荷﹐死机了。

GramExa.GLOSS: not much or a lot of work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hans has a heavy teaching load this semester.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这学期汉斯的教学任务很重。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My work load has doubled since Henry left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利走后﹐我的工作量加倍了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hired more staff in order tospread the load.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们雇用了更多员工来分担工作量。

Sense.DEF: a problem or worry that is difficult to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: When someone is depressed, the extra load of having financial problems can make the situation worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当一个人情绪低落的时候﹐如果还有经济困难﹐那便是雪上加霜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knowing he was safe wasa load off my mind I felt less worried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知他平安以后﹐我如释重负。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coping with ill health was a heavy load to bear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克服病痛是个难以承受的重负。

Sense.DEF: a quantity of clothes that are washed together in a washing machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve already done three loads of laundrythis morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我已经用洗衣机洗过三缸衣服了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to look at or listen to something that is surprising or funny
Sense.TRAN: 看[听]某人/某事〔用于叫人注意令人惊奇或好笑的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get a load of this! Your stars say you are going to meet someone who’s rich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看这个！你的星座运程说你会遇上一个有钱人呢。

Sense.DEF: the amount of weight that something is supporting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a load-bearing wall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 承重墙
Sense.EXAMPLE: It increased the load on the wheels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这加重了车轮的负荷。

Sense.DEF: an amount of electrical power that is being produced
to put a large quantity of something into a vehicle or container
Sense.TRAN: 把…装上〔车辆〕﹐将…装进[容器]﹔（给…）装货
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you finished loading up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你装完货了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took an hour to load the van.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给小型货车装货花了一小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you help me load the dishwasher?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我把碗碟放进洗碗机好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emma loaded all the groceries into the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛把所有的食品杂货放进车里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He loaded the cups onto a tray.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把杯子放到托盘上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She loaded up the car with camping gear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把露营设备放进车里。

Sense.DEF: to put a necessary part into something in order to make it work, for example bullets into a gun or film into a camera
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某物〕装入〔设备中以便使用〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you load it with 200 or 400 film?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你装的是200还是400的胶卷？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you load the CD into the player, please?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把光盘放入播放机中好吗？

Sense.DEF: to put a program into a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program takes a while to load.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 载入这个程序需要一点时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To load the file, press the ‘return’ key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按 “回车” 键载入文档。

Sense.DEF: if a ship, aircraft etc loads, goods are put onto it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first ship to load at the new port was the ‘Secil Angola’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个新港口装货的第一艘轮船是 “西塞尔·安哥拉” 号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat called at Lerwick to load up with fresh vegetables.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船在勒威克停靠装载新鲜蔬菜。

Sense.DEF: to give someone more work or problems than they can deal with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jane felt loaded down with money worries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简因为担心钱而心事重重。

Sense.DEF: to make someone carry too many things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was loaded down with bags so I took a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我随身带着大包小包﹐所以就叫了一辆出租车。

Sense.DEF: to get a lot of something so that you are sure you will have enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were loading up on bottled water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们大量购买瓶装水。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a lot of things, especially things they have to carry
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕带很多〔尤指必须带的东西〕

Sense.DEF: containing bullets, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 装了子弹的﹔装上胶卷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loaded pistol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹上膛的手枪

Sense.DEF: a loaded vehicle or container is full of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loaded trailer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装得满满的拖车
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came back carrying a loaded tray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她捧着一个装得满满的托盘回来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a truck loaded with bananas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 装满香蕉的卡车

Sense.DEF: very rich
Sense.EXAMPLE: Giles can afford it – he’s loaded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尔斯花得起这笔钱——他富得很。

Sense.DEF: full of a particular quality, or containing a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: snacks loaded with fat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脂肪含量很高的小吃
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of paintings loaded with cultural significance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化内涵丰富的一批藏画

Sense.DEF: a loaded word, statement etc has more meanings than you first realize and is intended to influence the way you think
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ‘deserved’ it? That’s a loaded word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他 “应得” 的？ 用这个词可是话里有话啊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loaded silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现了一阵意味深长的沉默。

Sense.DEF: a question that is unfair because it is intended to affect your opinions and make you answer in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 有圈套的问题﹐诱导性问题

Sense.DEF: very drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg used to come home loaded almost every night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格以前几乎天天晚上都喝个烂醉回家。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the dice/odds are loaded against sb/sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is unlikely to succeed or win
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事不大可能成功

Sense.DEF: used to say that a system, situation, or organization is unfair and some people have a disadvantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The justice system is loaded against people from ethnic minorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该司法制度对少数民族人士不利。

Sense.DEF: dice that have weights in them so that they always fall with the same side on top, used to cheat in games
Sense.TRAN: 灌铅骰子﹐做了手脚的骰子〔总是掷出某一面〕

Sense.DEF: an area at the side of a large shop or warehouse from which goods are taken off or put onto trucks
Sense.TRAN: 〔大商店或仓库旁边的〕卸货区﹐装货区

Sense.DEF: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loaf of bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条面包

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 白面包/全麦面包/谷类面包等

Sense.DEF: food that has been cut into very small pieces, pressed together, and baked
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meat loaf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉糕

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to think more carefully about what they are doing
to spend time somewhere and not do very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They spend all day loafing around on street corners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们整天在街角闲荡。

Sense.DEF: a flat leather shoe that does not need to be fastened onto your foot
Sense.TRAN: 乐福鞋﹐平跟船鞋﹐懒汉鞋

Sense.DEF: someone who is lazy and does nothing when they should be working
good quality soil consisting of sand, clay, and decayed plants
an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a loan of £60,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 6万英镑的贷款

Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to take out a loan to buy my car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得贷款买车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be years before we’ve paid off the loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要过好几年才能还清贷款。

Sense.DEF: when you lend something to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thanks for the loan of your camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你借相机给我。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone is on loan, they have been borrowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book I wanted was out on loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要的书借出去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: paintings on loan from the Louvre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从卢浮宫借来的画
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cantona initially went on loan to Leeds United.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎通纳最初是借给利兹联队的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: borrow money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most home buyers take out a loan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 购房者大多贷款。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give back the money you borrowed, usually over a period of time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can repay the loan early without a penalty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前还贷不会被处罚金。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I hoped to persuade my bank manager to give us a loan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望能说服银行经理给我们放贷。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone a loan
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Banks are cautious about making new loans.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行对发放新贷很谨慎。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree to give the lender something if you do not pay back the loan on time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company asked for a £100,000 loan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司申请了10万英镑贷款。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money lent by a bank
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What is the interest you will pay on a bank loan?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的银行贷款要付多少利息？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a loan to buy a home or a car
money lent to a person, rather than a company
money lent to a business
money lent to a student to pay for university
to be paid back after a long/short time
on which you pay no interest
that says how much the loan will be, how much you will pay back each month etc

Sense.DEF: to lend someone something, especially money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you loan me $5?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借我5美元吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff’s loaned us his car for the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫已经把车借给我们在周末使用。

Sense.DEF: to lend something valuable to someone
Sense.TRAN: 把〔贵重物品〕出借给〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The National Library has loaned several manuscripts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家图书馆借出了几件手稿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two of the steam trains have been loaned to other railways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中两列蒸汽火车借给别的铁路公司了。

Sense.DEF: someone who lends money at very high rates of interest and will often use threats or violence to get the money back
a word taken into one language from another
to be unwilling to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah was loath to tell her mother what had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉不愿意告诉母亲所发生的事。

Sense.DEF: to hate someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He loathes their politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讨厌他们那一套政治。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I absolutely loathe shopping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我极其讨厌购物。

Sense.DEF: a very strong feeling of hatred

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her loathing for her first husband
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对第一个丈夫的憎恶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a loathing of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战争的深恶痛绝

Sense.EXAMPLE: The nightmare left her with a sense of fear and loathing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场梦魇留给她的是恐惧和厌恶。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant or cruel
Sense.TRAN: 极不愉快的﹐讨厌的﹔残忍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: that loathsome little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个讨厌的小男人

Sense.DEF: the plural of loaf
to throw something somewhere, especially over a wall, fence etc
Sense.TRAN: 高扔﹐高抛﹐高掷〔尤指越过墙﹑篱笆等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were lobbing pine cones into the neighbor’s yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们把松果扔进邻居的院子中。

Sense.DEF: to kick or hit a ball in a slow high curve, especially in a game of tennis or football
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指打网球或踢足球时〕将〔球〕挑高
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nadal lobbed the ball high over Murray’s head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳达尔将球挑过穆雷的头顶。

Sense.DEF: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共场所入口处的〕门廊﹐前厅﹐大厅
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hotel lobby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆大堂
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在入口大厅见。

Subsense.DEF: a hall in the British parliament where members of parliament and the public meet
one of the two passages in the British parliament where members go to vote for or against a bill
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英国议会中的〕投票走廊〔其一供投赞成票﹐另一供投反对票〕

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a group of people who try to persuade a government that a particular law or situation should be changed
Sense.TRAN: 〔力图使政府更改某项法律或改变某种局面的〕游说团体
Sense.EXAMPLE: the anti-foxhunting lobby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对猎狐的游说团体
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful environmental lobby group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有影响力的环保游说团体

Sense.DEF: an attempt to persuade a government to change a law, make a new law etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔力图说服政府更改法律﹑制定新法律等的〕游说
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mass lobby of Parliament by women’s organizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女团体对议会的集体游说

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed
Sense.TRAN: 游说〔政府或有政治权力的人更改法律或改变局面〕﹐进行疏通

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been lobbying our state representative to support the new health plan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直在游说我们的州议员支持新的医疗计划。

Sense.DEF: the soft piece of flesh at the bottom of your ear
a round part of an organ in your body, especially in your brain or lungs
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体器官的〕叶﹔〔尤指〕脑叶﹐肺叶

Sense.DEF: a medical operation to remove part of someone’s brain in order to treat their mental problems
a sea animal with eight legs, a shell, and two large claws
the flesh of a lobster, which is eaten
a trap shaped like a basket in which lobsters are caught
lo-cal food or drink does not contain many calories
relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: local hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地医院
Sense.EXAMPLE: local residents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本地居民

Sense.DEF: affecting or limited to one part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a local infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局部感染

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in the place where you are or the place that you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: We asked one of the locals to recommend a restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们请一位当地人推荐一家餐馆。

Sense.DEF: a pub near where you live, especially one where you often drink
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经常光顾的〕住处附近的小酒馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: I usually have a pint or two at my local on Friday nights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五晚上我通常在邻近的小酒馆里喝上一两品脱。

Sense.DEF: a bus, train etc that stops at all regular stopping places
Sense.TRAN: 〔沿线每站都停的〕普通公共汽车[列车等]

Sense.DEF: a branch of a trade union

Head.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Sense.DEF: the group of people responsible for the government of a particular area, town, or city in the UK
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国市﹑镇等的〕地方当局﹐地方政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: Central government is trying to stop local authorities overspending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央政府试图阻止地方政府过度开支。

Sense.DEF: a telephone call to a place near you that does not cost much money
additional details in a story or picture that give you a better idea of what a place is really like
Sense.TRAN: 〔小说或图画中使场面逼真的〕地方色彩﹐乡土色彩
Sense.EXAMPLE: His description of the smells from the market added a touch of local color.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对市场里各种气味的描述增加了一点地方色彩。

Head.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Sense.DEF: the group of people responsible for providing houses, schools, parks etc in a small area such as a town
Sense.TRAN: 〔负责为城镇等小地方提供住房﹑学校﹑公园等的〕地方政务委员会﹐地方议会

Sense.DEF: the place where something happens or where the action takes place in a book or a film
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或电影中某事发生的〕地点﹐现场
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who see the countryside as a locale for recreation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把乡间视为娱乐消遣之地的人

Head.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Sense.DEF: the government of cities, towns etc rather than of a whole country
the history of a particular area
a small area of a country, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: weather reports from several different localities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自几个不同地区的天气报告

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both sea fishing and fresh water angling are available in the locality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区既有海钓﹐又有淡水垂钓。

Sense.DEF: to find out exactly where something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mechanic is trying to localize the fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技工正在寻找故障所在。

Sense.DEF: to limit the effect that something has, or the size of area it covers
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物的影响〕限于局部﹐限制…的范围
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hoped to localize the fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望把战事控制在局部范围之内。

Sense.DEF: happening within a small area
Sense.EXAMPLE: localized flooding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局部地区的洪灾
Sense.EXAMPLE: a localized infection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局部感染

Sense.DEF: in or near the area where you are, or the area you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: I live locally, so it’s easy to get to the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就住在附近﹐所以上班很方便。

Sense.DEF: in particular small areas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the country will be dry, but there will be some rain locally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国大部分地区天气干燥﹐但局部地区有雨。

Sense.DEF: a newspaper that contains mainly local news
Sense.TRAN: 〔以刊载当地新闻为主的〕地方报纸

Sense.DEF: a newspaper that contains local, national, and international news
Sense.TRAN: 〔刊载本地﹑全国和国际新闻的〕地方报纸

Sense.DEF: a radio service that broadcasts programmes for a particular area of the country
Sense.TRAN: 地方广播电台﹐地区广播

Sense.DEF: a local newspaper
the time of day in a particular part of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll arrive in Boston at 4 o’clock local time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将于当地时间4点到达波士顿。

Sense.DEF: lo-carb food does not have a lot of carbohydrate in it
to find the exact position of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We couldn’t locate the source of the radio signal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无法确定无线电信号的来源。

Sense.DEF: to be in a particular position or place
Sense.TRAN: 位于某处/位于某处附近等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is located right in the center of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店就在市中心。

Sense.DEF: to put or build something in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Large retail chains are usually only prepared to locate stores in areas of high population density.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大型零售连锁店一般只愿意开在人口密集的地区。

Sense.DEF: to come to a place and start a business, company etc there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are offering incentives for companies to locate in our city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提供优惠条件﹐鼓励企业来本市落户。

Sense.DEF: a particular place, especially in relation to other areas, buildings etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指相对于其他地区﹑建筑物等的〕地点﹐位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: His apartment is in a really good location.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的公寓地段很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: its isolatedgeographical location
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它偏远的地理位置

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Location is often used when talking about buying, or selling property. In everyday English in other contexts, people usually say place.
F2NBox.TRAN: 谈论房地产买卖时常用location。 在日常英语的其他语境中﹐人们通常说place
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It can be stressful moving to a new place.

Sense.DEF: the position of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The map shows the precise locationof the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图上标出了车祸发生的确切地点。

Sense.DEF: a place away from a film studio where scenes are filmed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hard to find a suitable location for the desert scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要找合适的地方拍摄沙漠镜头很困难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the movie was shot on location in Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片大部分是在非洲的外景地拍摄的。

Sense.DEF: the act of finding the position of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the nouns location, place and spot in spoken and written English. 名词location, place和spot在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that place is much more common than location or spot in both spoken and written English. This is because place is the most general of the three words. Location is used to mean a particular place or position, especially in relation to other buildings, areas etc. Spot is used especially to mean a pleasant place where you spend time. 本图表显示﹐place在口语和书面语里都比location或spot常用得多﹐因为place是这三个词中意思最广泛的。 location用于指某个地方或位置﹐尤其是相对于其他建筑物﹑地区等而言。 spot尤用于指置身其中令人愉快的地方。

Sense.DEF: someone who eats only food that has been produced near to where they live
Sense.TRAN: 土食者﹐只吃土产食物的人

Sense.DEF: a lake or a part of the sea partly enclosed by land in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰的〕湖﹔〔部分伸入陆地的〕海湾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loch Ness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内斯湖

Sense.DEF: the plural of locus
to fasten something, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it, or to be fastened like this （
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you lock the car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把汽车锁好了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get this drawer to lock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没法把这个抽屉锁上。

Sense.DEF: to put something in a place and fasten the door, lid etc with a key

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lock the cat in the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把猫锁进厨房里。

Sense.DEF: to become fixed in one position and impossible to move, or to make something become fixed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wheels suddenly locked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子突然卡住不动了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He locked his hands around the younger man’s throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用双手卡住那个年轻人的喉咙。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A moment later they were locked in an embraceholding each other very tightly in a loving or friendly way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿﹐他们紧紧地拥抱在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Theireyes locked togetherthey could not look away from each otherfor an instant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们四目交投﹐对视了片刻。

Sense.DEF: if you are locked in a situation, you cannot get out of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two groups are locked in a vicious cycle of killing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个团伙陷入了互相厮杀的恶性循环。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is locked into a five-year contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司被一个五年期的合同套牢了。

Sense.DEF: to be involved in a long, serious argument or fight with someone
Sense.TRAN: 卷入斗争/战斗/争论等之中
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are now locked in a bitter custody battle over the three children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们现在陷入了一场苦战﹐争夺三个孩子的监护权。

Sense.DEF: if people lock arms, they join their arms tightly with the arms of the people on each side
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police locked arms to form a barrier against the protesters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察臂挽着臂组成一道人墙﹐阻挡抗议者。

Sense.DEF: to argue or fight with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band have now locked horns with their record company over the album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队眼下为专辑的事和他们的唱片公司吵得不可开交。

Sense.DEF: to put something in a safe place and lock the door, lid etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He locked his money away in the safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钱锁在保险柜里。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope they lock him away for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他们把他关上几年。

Sense.DEF: to keep yourself separate from other people by staying in your room, office etc
Sense.TRAN: 把自己关起来〔和别人隔开〕

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from leaving a room or building by locking the door
Sense.EXAMPLE: She locked herself in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己锁在屋里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They locked the director in his office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把董事锁在他自己的办公室里。

Sense.DEF: to do something so that a price, offer, agreement etc cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 锁定〔价格﹑报价﹑协议等〕﹐使…不变
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sell your stocks now to lock in some of the gains of recent months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在卖出你的股票以锁定这几个月来的部分收益。

Sense.DEF: to make the taste, liquid etc remain in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This method of cooking locks in the flavour of the meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用这种方法烹制可以保持肉的原味不变。

Sense.DEF: if a missile or satellite locks onto a target or signal, it finds it and follows it closely
Sense.TRAN: 〔导弹〕锁定〔目标〕﹔〔卫星〕锁定〔信号〕

Sense.DEF: to keep someone out of a place by locking the door

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I locked myself out of the house!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把自己关在门外了！

Sense.DEF: if employers lock workers out, they do not let them enter their place of work until they accept the employers’ conditions for settling a disagreement
Sense.TRAN: 不让〔工人〕进厂〔直到纠纷按雇主的条件解决〕

Sense.DEF: to make a building safe by locking the doors, especially at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll leave you to lock up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让你来锁门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to lock up the warehouse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了锁上仓库的门。

Sense.DEF: to put something in a safe place and lock the door, lid etc
to put someone in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rapists should be locked up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸犯应该被关进监狱。

Sense.DEF: if your money is locked up, you have put it into a business, investment etc and cannot easily move it or use it

PIC.HEADING: LOCKS 锁
PIC.PICCONTENT: a bike lock 自行车锁；combination lock 密码锁；padlock 挂锁；latch 门闩；bolt 插销；door-handle 门把手；mortise lock BrE【英】/deadbolt AmE【美】榫眼锁，插锁；Yale lock 耶尔锁

Sense.DEF: a thing that keeps a door, drawer etc fastened and is usually opened with a key or by moving a small metal bar
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, there isn’t a lock on the bathroom door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐浴室门上没有锁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key turned stiffly in the lock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这把钥匙开锁不灵活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bike lock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车锁

Subsense.DEF: kept safely in a box, cupboard etc that is locked
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dad keeps all his liquor under lock and key.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸把他所有的酒都锁了起来。

Subsense.DEF: kept in a place such as a prison

Sense.DEF: including every part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved the whole company, lock, stock, and barrel, to Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把公司整个都搬到了墨西哥。

Subsense.DEF: a small number of hairs on your head that grow and hang together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gently pushed a lock of hair from her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻地为她拂去遮住眼睛的一绺头发。

Subsense.DEF: someone’s hair
Subsense.EXAMPLE: long flowing locks
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飘逸的长发

Sense.DEF: a part of a canal or river that is closed off by gates so that the water level can be raised or lowered to move boats up or down a slope
a hold which wrestlers use to prevent their opponent from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: a head lock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夹头

Sense.DEF: the degree to which a vehicle’s front wheels can be turned in order to turn the vehicle
a playing position in the game of rugby
complete control of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pro football still has a lock on male viewers aged 18 to 34.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业足球赛的观众依然是以18到34岁的男性为主。

Sense.DEF: a time when prisoners are not allowed out of their rooms, usually after there has been violence in the prison
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常在发生犯人骚乱后对犯人实行的〕临时监禁

Sense.DEF: a time when all the doors in a building are locked in order to protect the people inside from danger
Sense.TRAN: 封锁〔建筑物以保护人员安全〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school went into lockdown after the shooting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪击事件后学校被封锁。

Sense.DEF: a small cupboard with a lock in a school, sports building, office etc, where you can leave clothes or possessions while you do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校﹑体育馆﹑办公室等供存放衣物等的〕锁柜﹐寄物柜

Sense.DEF: a very cold room used for storing food in a restaurant or factory
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆或工厂用于储存食物的〕冷藏间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meat locker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉类冷藏间

Sense.DEF: a room in a school, sports building etc where people change their clothes and leave them in lockers
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校﹑体育馆等的〕衣物间﹐更衣室

Sense.DEF: a piece of jewellery that you wear around your neck on a chain, with a small metal case in which you can put a picture, a piece of hair etc
Sense.TRAN: 纪念盒吊坠﹐盒式项链坠〔里面可存放照片﹑头发等〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to open and close the gates of a lock on a canal
a situation when a company does not allow workers to go back to work, especially in a factory, until they accept the employers’ conditions
Sense.TRAN: 闭厂〔公司在工人接受工作条件前不让其返回工作场所的情况〕

Sense.DEF: someone who makes and repairs locks
in exactly the same way or at the same rate
Sense.TRAN: 以同样方式﹔以同样速度

Sense.DEF: a small prison where a criminal can be kept for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 临时拘留所﹐临时羁押场所

Sense.DEF: a garage that you can rent to keep cars, goods etc in
crazy
movement or the ability to move
a railway engine
relating to movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in locomotive power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动力的增加

Sense.DEF: a plant that grows in America and makes animals ill if they eat it
Sense.TRAN: 疯草〔生长于美洲﹐动物食后会得病〕

Sense.DEF: a doctor or priest who does another doctor’s or priest’s work while they are on holiday, ill etc
the place where something is particularly known to exist, or which is the centre of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事物存在的〕地点﹔中心﹐核心

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Politburo was the locus of all power in the Soviet Union.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治局是苏联的权力核心。

Sense.DEF: an insect that lives mainly in Asia and Africa and flies in a very large group, eating and destroying crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swarm of locusts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群蝗虫

Sense.DEF: a style of speaking
a phrase, especially one used in a particular area or by a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔某领域或某群体使用的〕惯用语﹔行话

Sense.DEF: an amount of oremetal in its natural form found in a layer between stones
a principle or fact that guides someone’s actions
the pole star, used to guide ships at sea
a piece of iron that acts as a magnet
to make a formal or official complaint, protest etc
Sense.TRAN: 进行投诉/提出抗议/提出上诉等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lodged an appeal with the High Court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向高等法院提出上诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lodged a complaint against the doctor for negligence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们投诉医生失职。

Sense.GRAM: I always + adv/prep, T usually passive
Sense.DEF: to become firmly stuck somewhere, or to make something become stuck

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fishbone lodged in her throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼刺卡在她的喉咙里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bullet was lodged in his spine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹嵌在他的脊椎骨里。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with a place to stay for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a building used to lodge prisoners of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座关押战俘的建筑物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The refugees were lodged in old army barracks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民被安置在旧兵营里。

Sense.DEF: to put something important in an official place so that it is safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be sure to lodge a copy of the contract with your solicitor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要把合同的一份副本存放在你的律师那儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money was lodged in a Swiss bank account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱存在一个瑞士银行的账户里。

Sense.DEF: to pay to live in a room in someone’s house

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John lodged with a family in Bristol when he first started work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰刚开始工作时寄住在布里斯托尔的一户人家家里。

Sense.DEF: a small house on the land of a large country house, usually at the main entrance gate
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡村大宅院中通常位于大门口的〕小屋﹐侧屋

Sense.DEF: a room or small building at the entrance to a college, institution etc for someone whose job is to watch who enters and leaves
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学﹑机构等的〕门房﹐管理员室
Sense.EXAMPLE: the porter’s lodge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传达室

Sense.DEF: a house or hotel in the country or mountains where people can stay when they want to go hunting, shooting etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡村或山间供狩猎者等使用的〕小屋﹐小舍

Sense.DEF: a local meeting place for some organizations, or the group of people who belong to one of these organizations
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些会社的〕地方分会﹔地方分会集会处
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a member of a Masonic lodge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是共济会一地方分会的会员。

Sense.DEF: a beaver’s home
a traditional home of Native Americans, or the group of people that live in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔印第安人的〕棚屋﹔〔居住在棚屋里的〕印第安人住户

Sense.DEF: someone who pays rent for a room in someone’s house
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have decided totake in lodgersto help pay the mortgage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定收几个房客帮助偿还抵押贷款。

Sense.DEF: a place to stay
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s £90 a week for board and lodging meals and a room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食宿费每周90英镑。

Sense.DEF: a room in someone’s house which you live in and pay rent for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul found lodgings in the Marylebone Road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在玛丽勒本路找到了出租的房间。

Sense.DEF: a building where people can rent rooms to live or stay in
a room or space under the roof of a building, usually used for storing things in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our neighbours have just done aloft conversionchanged the loft into bedrooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的邻居刚刚完成阁楼改建。

Sense.DEF: a raised area in a barn used for keeping hay or other crops
Sense.TRAN: 〔谷仓内贮放干草或其他作物的〕厩楼
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hayloft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贮放干草的厩楼

Sense.DEF: a raised area above the main part of a room, usually used for sleeping
a space above a business, factory etc that was once used for storing goods, but has been changed into living space
Sense.TRAN: 〔由公司﹑工厂等楼上储物区改建而成用于居住的〕阁楼居室
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just bought a loft in Manhattan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚在曼哈顿买了一间改建的阁楼居室。

Sense.DEF: a set of cages used to keep pigeons in
the raised place in a church where the organ or choir is
to hit a ball very high in golf or cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球或板球中〕将〔球〕击高[吊高]

Sense.DEF: lofty mountains, buildings etc are very high and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在四季酒店﹐从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

Sense.DEF: lofty ideas, beliefs, attitudes etc show high standards or high moral qualities – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑信仰﹑态度等〕高尚的﹐崇高的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had set himself the lofty goal of reaching the world’s top five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给自己定下了一个伟大的目标﹐要进入世界排名前五位。

Sense.DEF: seeming to think you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has such a lofty manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她举止非常傲慢。

Sense.DEF: a thick piece of wood from a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a roaring log fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原木燃烧的熊熊大火

Sense.DEF: an official record of events, especially on a journey in a ship or plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件的〕正式记录﹔〔尤指〕航海日志﹔飞行日志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The captain alwayskeeps a log.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船长坚持记航海日志。

Sense.DEF: a logarithm

Crossrefto.REFLEX: it’s as easy as falling off a log

Sense.DEF: to make an official record of events, facts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: All phone calls are logged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有电话均予以记录。

Sense.DEF: to travel a particular distance or for a particular length of time, especially in a plane or ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指飞机或船只〕行驶﹐行进〔一定距离或时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pilot has logged 1,200 flying hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位飞行员已有1,200小时的飞行记录。

Sense.DEF: to cut down trees
to do the necessary actions on a computer system that will allow you to begin using it
Sense.TRAN: 登录﹐登入﹐进入〔计算机系统〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to log on to your home page.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要登录你的主页。

Sense.DEF: to stop using a computer system by giving it particular instructions
a soft dark red fruit like a large raspberry
Sense.TRAN: 罗甘莓〔似悬钩子的深红色果子〕

Sense.DEF: a number representing another number in a mathematical system so that complicated calculations can be done as simple addition
an official document containing details about a vehicle and the name of its owner
an official record of events, especially on a journey in a ship or plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件的〕正式记录﹔〔尤指〕航海日志﹔飞行日志

Sense.DEF: a small house made of logs
someone whose job is to cut down trees
if two people are at loggerheads, they disagree very strongly（
Sense.TRAN: 与某人）不和﹐发生严重分歧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is at loggerheads with many of his own party over the issue of taxation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在课税的问题上和自己党内的很多人争执不下。

Sense.DEF: an open area with a floor and a roof that is built on the side of a house on the ground floor
the work of cutting down trees in a forest
a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something
Sense.TRAN: 逻辑﹔〔做某事的〕道理﹐合理的想法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The logic behind this statement is faulty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种说法的逻辑是错误的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the logic of your argument?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的论点道理何在？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to understand his logic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的逻辑很容易理解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There isa certain logicin their choice of architect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对建筑师的选择是有一定道理的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Commercial logic has forced the two parts of the company closer together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于商业上的考虑﹐公司的这两个部门不得不更加紧密地合作起来。

Sense.DEF: a formal method of reasoning, in which ideas are based on previous ideas
a set of choices that a computer uses to solve a problem
seeming reasonable and sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近有住宅区﹐新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a logical conclusion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的结论

Sense.DEF: using a thinking process in which facts and ideas are connected in a correct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The detective has to discover the murderer by logical deduction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位侦探得通过逻辑推理来找出凶手。

Sense.DEF: someone who studies or is skilled in logic
another form of the suffix -ologist
relating to the logistics of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 后勤上的﹐安排协调方面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the logistical problems of implementing the proposals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实施这些建议的安排协调问题

Sense.DEF: the practical arrangements that are needed in order to make a plan that involves a lot of people and equipment successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔使计划成功的〕统筹安排﹐后勤（工作）﹔物流
Sense.EXAMPLE: the day-to-day logistics involved with mining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采矿所涉及的日常后勤工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the logistics of travelling with small children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带小孩子出行的具体安排

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of problems are preventing progress from being made
a tightly packed mass of floating logs on a river
Sense.TRAN: 〔河道中输送木材时的〕木材堵塞

Sense.DEF: a small design that is the official sign of a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或组织的〕标识﹐标志﹐徽标

Sense.DEF: the practice in the US Congress of helping a member to pass a bill, so that they will do the same for you later
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国国会议员的〕互投赞成票

Sense.DEF: the practice of praising or helping someone, so that they will do the same for you later
something that is written or spoken
Sense.EXAMPLE: a monologue a speech by one person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独白

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -ology
Sense.EXAMPLE: mineralogy the study of minerals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿物学

Sense.DEF: the part of your body below your waist and above your legs, which includes your sexual organs
a piece of meat from the lower part of an animal’s back
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast loin of pork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤猪腰肉

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth that men in some hot countries wear around their waist to cover their sexual organs
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些热带国家男子用以蔽体的〕缠腰布﹐遮羞布

Sense.DEF: to stand or wait somewhere, especially in a public place, without any clear reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: Five or six teenagers were loitering in front of the newsagent’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五六个青少年在报摊前面游荡。

Sense.DEF: to move or do something slowly, or to keep stopping when you should keep moving
used in emails, text messages etc to show that you think something is funny
Sense.TRAN: 大声笑〔用于电子邮件﹑手机短信等中表示认为某事很好笑〕

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a friendly email, text message, or letter to someone you know well
Sense.TRAN: 爱你的〔用于给熟知之人的电子邮件﹑手机短信或书信的结尾处〕

Sense.DEF: a girl who is too young to have sex legally, but who behaves in a sexually attractive way. This name comes from a character in the novel Lolita (1955) by Vladimir Nabokov. It is the story of a middleaged man who has very strong sexual feelings for a young girl.
Sense.TRAN: 洛丽塔式的少女﹐早熟的性感少女〔名字源自纳博科夫小说《洛丽塔》中的女主角〕

Sense.DEF: to sit or lie in a very lazy and relaxed way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lolled back in his chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懒洋洋地靠椅背坐着。

Sense.DEF: if your head or tongue lolls or if you loll your head, you allow it to hang in a relaxed uncontrolled way
a hard sweet made of boiled sugar on a stick
someone whose job is to help children cross a road safely on their way to school
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助学童过马路的〕交通安全员

Sense.DEF: to run with long awkward steps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog came lolloping up the path.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗沿着小路蹒跚地跑来。

Sense.DEF: frozen juice or ice cream on a stick
a hard sweet made of boiled sugar on a stick
money – used humorously
used to talk about the only person or thing in a place, or the only person or thing that does something
Sense.TRAN: 孤零零的﹔单独的﹐独自的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lone figure was standing at the bus stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公交车站上站着一个孤单的身影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was by no means a lone voice criticizing the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评政府的绝不止他一个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lone gunman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独行持枪歹徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lone survivor of a shipwreck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次海难的唯一幸存者

Sense.DEF: someone who looks after their children on their own
Sense.TRAN: 单身母亲/单身父亲/单亲等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lone-parent family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单亲家庭

Sense.DEF: someone who prefers to be alone
unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lonely old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个孤单的老人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you get lonely being on your own all day?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你整天独自一人不感到寂寞吗？
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use lonely to mean ‘without anyone else’. Use alone. 表示独自一人不要用lonely﹐要用alone: She is afraid to travel alone (NOT 不说 travel lonely). 她害怕一个人出行。

Sense.DEF: a lonely experience or situation makes you unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to
Sense.TRAN: 〔经历或情况〕在孤单中进行的﹐孤独的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lonely journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孤独的旅途

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He led a lonely life with few friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生活孤独﹐朋友很少。

Sense.DEF: people who are lonely
a lonely place is a long way from where people live and very few people go there

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 荒僻的地方/偏僻的道路/荒凉的场所等

Exponent.DEF: unhappy because you are alone or do not have any friends
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tammy felt very lonely when she first arrived in New York.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔米初到纽约时感到十分寂寞。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I get so lonesome here with no one to talk to.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里没人说话﹐非常孤独。

Exponent.DEF: lonely because your situation makes it difficult for you to meet people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People caring for sick relatives often feel very isolated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人在照顾患病亲属时常会感到十分孤单。

Exponent.DEF: feeling that you do not belong in a particular place or group
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In high school she felt somehow different and alienated from other students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 高中的时候她不知怎么总觉得自己不同于其他同学﹐和他们格格不入。

Exponent.DEF: unhappy because you are a long way from your home and the people who live there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I first went to Germany, I was very homesick.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚去德国时非常想家。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that you feel unhappy because someone is not there with you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I miss you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She misses her friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她思念朋友。

Sense.DEF: a club or an advertisement page of a newspaper that is used by people who want to meet someone that they can have a romantic relationship with
Sense.TRAN: 征友[求爱]俱乐部/专栏/广告

Sense.DEF: someone who prefers to be alone or who has no friends
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢独处的人﹔孤僻的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken’s always been a bit of a loner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯一直有点孤僻。

Sense.DEF: very unhappy because you are alone or have no friends
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth is lonesome without the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不在身边﹐贝丝很孤单。

Sense.DEF: a lonesome place is a long way from where people live and very few people go there
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lonesome spot near the canyon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠近峡谷的一个人烟稀少之地

Sense.DEF: alone
measuring a great length from one end to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张长桌子
Sense.EXAMPLE: the longest tunnel in the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最长的隧道
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stretched out hislong legs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸开两条长腿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: along lineof people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长长的一排队伍

Sense.DEF: continuing or travelling a great distance from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long distance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段长距离
Sense.EXAMPLE: Springfield isa long way from Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯普林菲尔德离芝加哥很远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz lives in Cheltenham, which isa long way away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹住在切尔滕纳姆﹐那地方很远。

GramExa.GLOSS: a journey etc over a large distance that takes a lot of time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 长途旅行/步行/飞行/驾驶等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a long walk to the shops from here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里去商店要走很远。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a large amount of time, or for a larger amount of time than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很长一段时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long history of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长久以来的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has along memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他记性很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been gone a long time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已离去很久了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been there for a long while.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好久没有去那里了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a long timeto get everything ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花了很长时间才把一切准备就绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dieda long time ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很久以前就过世了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a long silence before anybody spoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉默了很长时间才有人说话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s recovering from a long illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她病了很久﹐现正在康复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors oftenwork long hourswork for more time than is usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生经常要工作很长时间。

GramExa.GLOSS: a very long time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took me the longest time to figure out how to open the windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了很长时间才琢磨出怎么开这几扇窗。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 某一长度/距离/时间长度
Sense.DEF: used to talk or ask about a particular length, distance, or time
Sense.TRAN: 长〔用以谈论或询问长度﹑距离或时间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How long is your garden?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的花园有多长？

Sense.EXAMPLE: How long is the film?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影多长时间？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cable is not quitelong enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电缆不够长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bridge is 140 feet long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座桥长140英尺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The speech was twenty minutes long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 演说历时20分钟。

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of words, letters, names, or pages
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很长的小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: along list
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很长的清单
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a verylong name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字很长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He owes money to a list of peopleas long as your arma very long list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欠了很多人钱﹐债主名单排起来有很长一大串。

Sense.DEF: covering all of your arms or legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-sleevedshirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长袖衬衫

Sense.DEF: making you feel tired or bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been along day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一天好漫长。

Sense.DEF: a long vowel in a word is pronounced for a longer time than a short vowel with the same sound

Sense.LEXUNIT: how long is a piece of string?
Sense.DEF: used when there is no definite answer to a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How long will it take to finish the project?’ ‘How long is a piece of string?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这个项目要多长时间才能完成？” “很难说。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: the long and (the) short of it
Sense.DEF: used when you are telling someone the most important facts about something rather than all the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The long and the short of it is that we missed the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长话短说吧﹐我们没有赶上火车。

Sense.DEF: the power of someone or something that has authority, especially to catch and punish someone
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物的权力[权威]〔尤指逮捕和惩罚某人的权力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won’t escapethe long arm of the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法网恢恢﹐他插翅难逃。

Sense.DEF: a sad or disappointed expression on someone’s face
too old – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting a bit long in the tooth for this sort of thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这种事情﹐我太老了不合适。

Sense.DEF: likely to die or stop existing soon
having a lot of a quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasshort onpatience,but long ona sense of his own worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他耐心不足﹐但自信有余。

Sense.DEF: if there are long odds against something happening, it is very unlikely that it will happen
used when talking about what will happen at a later time or when something is finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: All our hard work willbe worth it in the long run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从长远来看﹐我们的一切努力都是值得的。

Sense.DEF: someone or something with very little chance of success
Sense.TRAN: 成功可能性不大的人[事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chelsea are a 20-1 long shot to win the championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切尔西队夺冠的赔率为1比20﹐希望渺茫。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say hello when you have not seen someone for a long time
to think about the effect that something will have in the future rather than what happens now
Sense.TRAN: 从长远考虑﹐从长计议（某事）

Sense.DEF: very much, far, or a great amount or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re stilla long way fromachieving our sales targets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离完成销售指标还有很长的路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Psychiatry hascome a long waydeveloped a lotsince the 1920s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自20世纪20年代以来﹐精神病学已有很大发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your contributions will go a long way towardshelping children in need will help to reach a goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的捐助对生活困难的孩子大有帮助。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when something is much better, quicker, cheaper etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was his best performance this year, by a long way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他今年最好的表现﹐远胜以往。

GramExa.GLOSS: not at all or not nearly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had not told Rory everything, not by a long shot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有全部告诉罗里﹐远远没有。

Sense.DEF: three or more days, including Saturday and Sunday, when you do not have to go to work or school

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a little (of sth) goes a long way
have a long way to go

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film was very long.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影非常长。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There has been a long period without rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经有很长时间没下雨了。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time, especially longer than you want or expect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Drivers face lengthy delays on all roads out of the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶者在所有出城的路上均会耽搁很长时间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police are going through the lengthy process of re-examining all the evidence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方已进入复核所有证据的漫长阶段。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He faces a lengthy prison sentence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正面临漫漫刑期。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time – used especially about disputes, campaigns, or shows
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指争执﹑运动或演出〕持续很长时间的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has been involved in a long-running dispute with his neighbour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与邻居陷入了长期纠纷。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The programme is one of the longest-running series on television.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目是历时最久的电视系列片之一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a long-running campaign to prevent the airport from being built
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在阻止兴建机场的一场长期运动

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time – used especially about effects or relationships
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stress can have long-lasting effects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力会产生长远影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: While at the school, she made many long-lasting friendships.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在学校的时候和许多人结下了长久的友谊。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time, especially an unusually long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指异乎寻常地〕持久的﹐拖延的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Despite protracted negotiations, they were unable to reach an agreement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管经过旷日持久的谈判﹐他们仍未能达成协议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The couple have been involved in a protracted battle for custody of their children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妇俩陷入了争夺孩子监护权的持久战。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time, especially longer than expected, or longer in a way that makes a situation worse
Exponent.TRAN: 持续很久的〔尤指超出预期或使情况恶化〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He returned to work after a prolonged absence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缺席很久之后才回去工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Studies have linked prolonged use of the drug to cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究发现长期服用该药与癌症相关。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a prolonged period of economic decline
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间的经济衰退

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time – used especially about visits, trips, breaks etc that last longer than was planned
Exponent.TRAN: 长时间的〔尤指访问﹑旅行﹑休息等时间超出预期〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an extended stay in hospital
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期住院
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took an extended break from work after his father died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲过世后﹐他拖了很久才去上班。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She didn’t like being away from home for extended periods.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢离家太久。

Exponent.DEF: strong enough or great enough to continue for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The negotiations were aimed at achieving a lasting peace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些谈判旨在取得持久和平。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This affair has done lasting damage to the President’s credibility.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该事件已对总统威信造成长久的损害。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book left a lasting impression on me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书给我留下了难以磨灭的印象。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a long time – used especially about memories, influences, or feelings of liking someone or something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指记忆﹑影响或对某人﹑某事物的喜爱〕持久的﹐持续的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of my most enduring memories is of going on holiday to France with my parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 久久留在我记忆中的一次经历是同父母一道去法国度假。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the enduring appeal of Conan Doyle’s stories
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯南·道尔小说经久不衰的魅力
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his enduring love for Ireland
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长期以来对爱尔兰的热爱

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a very long time and needing a lot of energy, patience, or determination
Exponent.TRAN: 马拉松式的〔需要大量时间﹑精力﹑耐心或意志力的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a marathon session of talks which continued until 3 am.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这轮马拉松式的会谈一直持续到凌晨3点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He arrived after a marathon journey across Europe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经过横跨欧洲的长途跋涉﹐终于抵达。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for too long – used about speeches, answers, explanations etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指讲话﹑回答﹑解释等〕冗长的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a very long-winded answer to a simple question
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一个简单问题的冗长回答
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gave a long-winded speech about the company’s vision for the future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就公司的未来前景做了一个冗长的演讲。

Exponent.DEF: very long and boring
Exponent.TRAN: 冗长乏味的﹐没完没了的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They faced an interminable wait in the departure lounge of the airport.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得在机场候机室里无休无止地等下去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The journey seemed interminable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅程仿佛永无尽头。

Exponent.DEF: used about a process that continues for much too long
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The news heightened expectations that the long-drawn-out investigation might be coming to a close.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一消息使人们更加相信旷日持久的调查可能即将结束。

Sense.DEF: for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you beenwaiting long?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是否等了很长时间？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reform of the law islong overdue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法律早就该修改了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: long established traditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史悠久的传统

Sense.DEF: used to ask and talk about particular amounts of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long will it take to get there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那里去要多长时间？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to keep going foras long as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能坚持多久就坚持多久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ittookme longerthan I thought it would.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用的时间比原先想的要长。

Sense.DEF: at a time that is a long time before or after a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This all happened long before you were born.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切在你出生以前早就发生了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He should have left her long ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早就应该离开她了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t long beforesoonLisa arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久莉萨就来了。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you known them for long?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识他们很久了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen her for so longthat I’ve forgotten what she looks like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很久没有见到她﹐都已经忘记她的样子了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that one thing can happen or be true only if another thing happens or is true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can go out to play as long as you stay in the backyard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以出去玩﹐只要不出后院。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that one thing will continue to happen or be true if another thing happens or is true at the same time
Subsense.TRAN: 只要﹐只有〔表示只有一件事发生或属实﹐另一件事才会同时发生或属实〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As long as we keep playing well, we’ll keep winning games.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要我们一直打得好﹐我们会一直赢下去。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about something continuing for the amount of time that you want, need, or is possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can stay foras long as youwant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想逗留多久就逗留多久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to stay awake foras long asshecould.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽量不让自己睡去﹐能醒就醒着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fruit should be left on the treeas long as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该让水果尽可能在树上多生长一些时间。

Sense.DEF: used when something used to happen or be true in the past but does not happen or is not true now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The extra workers won’t be needed any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将不再需要额外的工人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no longer a secret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这已经不是秘密了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say not any longer or not any more (BrE) / not anymore (AmE), rather than no longer , which sounds slightly formal or literary.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说not any longer或not any more (【英】)/ not anymore (【美】)﹐而不说 no longer ﹐因为后者略显正式或像文学语言
F2NBox.GOODEXA: He doesn’t live here any longer OR 或 any more .

Sense.DEF: soon or in a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before long a large crowd had gathered outside the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久大楼外面就聚集了一大群人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s likely that the law will be abolished before long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法律很有可能不久就会废除。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something will be ready, will be back, will happen etc soon
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事/这事不会很久
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait here – I won’t be long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这里等着﹐我马上就回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner won’t be long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚餐很快就准备好了。

Sense.DEF: during all of the day etc
Sense.TRAN: 整整一天/一年/一个夏天等

Sense.DEF: goodbye
used to show support for a person, idea, principle, or nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long live the King!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王万岁！

Sense.DEF: to want something very much, especially when it seems unlikely to happen soon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He longed to see her again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盼望再见到她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She longed for the chance to speak to him in private.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她渴望有机会和他私下交谈。

GramExa.PROPFORM: long for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She longed for him to return.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盼着他归来。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= longitude 经度

Sense.DEF: a long-awaited event, moment etc is one that you have been waiting a long time for
Sense.TRAN: 期待已久的﹐盼望已久的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-awaited news of his release from prison
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获释出狱这个盼望已久的消息

Sense.DEF: a large bow made from a long thin curved piece of wood, used in the past for hunting or fighting
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用于狩猎或打仗的〕长弓﹐大弓

Sense.DEF: travelling over a long distance

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 长途旅行/旅程/飞行/通勤等

Sense.DEF: a telephone call to a place that is far away
a method of dividing one large number by another
continuing for a longer time than is wanted or necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official enquiry was a long-drawn-out process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方的调查过程拖得很长。

Sense.DEF: a longed-for thing or event is one that you want very much
Sense.TRAN: 一心渴望的﹐期待已久的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the birth of her first longed-for child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盼望已久的第一个孩子的出生

Sense.DEF: the amount of time that someone or something lives

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the greater longevity of women compared with men
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性相对于男性更长的寿命
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The worms have a longevity of about two years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些虫子大约能活两年。

Sense.DEF: long life or the long time that something lasts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

Sense.DEF: the amount of time that something lasts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the longevity of an athlete’s career
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动员的职业寿命

Sense.DEF: if you write something in longhand, you write it by hand using complete words, rather than typing it or using special short forms of words
Sense.TRAN: 普通书写〔与打字或速记相对〕

Sense.DEF: a long-haul flight etc is over a very long distance
Sense.TRAN: 长途飞行/路线/旅程目的地等

Sense.DEF: a cow with long horns
a strong feeling of wanting something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked back with longing on the good old days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回首往事﹐怀念着过去的美好时光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His heart was filled with longing for Cynthia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心中对辛西娅充满渴望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a longing to throw herself into his arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一种扑入他怀抱的渴望。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows that you want someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thought longingly of returning to Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她日思夜想要回巴黎去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked longingly at the tray of cakes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼馋地望着一盘子蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: fairly long

the distance east or west of a particular
meridian imaginary line along the Earth’s surface from the North Pole to the South Pole
, measured in degrees
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town lies at longitude 12˚ east.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇位于东经12度。

Sense.DEF: relating to the development of something over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a longitudinal study of unemployed workers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对失业工人的纵观研究

Sense.DEF: going from top to bottom, not across
Sense.EXAMPLE: longitudinal stripes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竖直条纹

Sense.DEF: measured according to longitude
warm underwear with long legs
a sport in which each competitor tries to jump further than anyone else
continuing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The impact of divorce on children can be long-lasting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚对于孩子的影响会持续很长时间。

Sense.DEF: long-life products continue working longer than ordinary ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: long-life batteries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长效电池

Sense.DEF: long-life foods stay fresh longer than ordinary ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: long-life milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保鲜期长的牛奶

Sense.DEF: living or existing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ostriches are long-lived birds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸵鸟是长寿的鸟类。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the band’s long-lived appeal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个乐队经久不衰的魅力

Sense.DEF: lost or not seen for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 丢失很久的﹔失散很久的﹔长久未见的
Sense.EXAMPLE: long-lost treasures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗失已久的珍宝

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 久未见面的兄弟/表亲/朋友等

Sense.DEF:
an
lp
able to hit something that is a long way away
Sense.EXAMPLE: long-range nuclear missiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远程核导弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: He scored with a long-range shot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他远射得分。

Sense.DEF: relating to a time that continues far into the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long-range weather forecast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远期天气预报
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the long-range goal of the project
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目的长远目标

Sense.DEF: used to talk about something that has been continuing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-running saga
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫长的一连串事件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was involved in a long-running legal battle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在打一场旷日持久的官司。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 长期连播的节目/长期上演的音乐剧/长期播映的肥皂剧等

Sense.DEF: having a particular job or position for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-serving member of the committee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在委员会里供职多年的委员

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is to load and unload ships at a
dock
able to see objects or read things clearly only when they are far from your eyes
having continued or existed for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 长久持续的﹔长期存在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-standing member of the committee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会里的资深委员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long-standing feud between the two families
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家的世仇
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the long-standing problem of keeping costs down
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期存在的成本控制问题
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a long-standing arrangement with the bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和银行有长期协议。

Sense.DEF: relating to care or treatment over a long period of time

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 长期病人医院/病房/病床等
需要长期治疗的病人/住院病人

Sense.DEF: a long-stay car park is a place where people can leave their cars for a long period of time
patient in spite of problems or other people’s annoying behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: his long-suffering wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长期受苦的妻子

Sense.DEF: continuing for a long period of time, or relating to what will happen in the distant future
Sense.TRAN: 长期的﹐长远的﹔有长期打算的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-term future of the fishing industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔业的长远未来
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-term interests of the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的长远利益

GramExa.GLOSS: people who have not had a job for a long time

Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-term effects of alcohol on the body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精对人体的长期影响

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 长远的计划/战略/解决方案

Sense.DEF: having existed or continued to be a particular thing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long-time supporter of civil rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 始终不渝的民权支持者

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 老朋友/交往已久的情人等

Sense.DEF: radio broadcasting or receiving on waves of 1,000 metres or more in length
continuing to talk for too long or using too many words in a way that is boring
Sense.TRAN: 冗长乏味的﹐絮絮叨叨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speeches tend to be rather long-winded.
