Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽昂和罗恩是一见钟情。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were obviously very much in love.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他们深深相爱。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very much in love
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I married Dan because I was madly in love.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和丹结婚了﹐因为我爱得如痴如狂。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very much in love
real love
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She felt that she had finally found true love.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己终于找到了真爱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Romantic love was not always the reason for marriage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻并非总是出于浪漫的爱情。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: love for someone who does not love you
love that does not stop

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a tragic love story
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段爱情悲剧

Sense.DEF: a romantic sexual relationship, usually between two people who are not married to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指非夫妻间的〕性关系﹔风流韵事

Sense.DEF: a strong enjoyment of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某事物的〕强烈兴趣﹐热爱﹐酷爱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: America’s love affair with the automobile
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人对汽车的酷爱

Sense.DEF: two people who show by their behaviour that they love each other very much – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 恩爱情侣﹐热恋中的情人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
a small brightly coloured
parrot
a red mark on someone’s skin caused by someone else sucking it as a sexual act
Sense.TRAN: 爱的吮痕〔做爱时被对方在皮肤上吮出的红印痕〕

Sense.DEF: a child whose parents are not married – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 私生子〔尤用于报纸文章〕

Sense.DEF: feeling full of romantic love for someone
Sense.TRAN: 充满爱意的﹐情意绵绵的

Sense.DEF:
feeling full of love towards everyone, especially as a result of using the illegal drug
ecstasy
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指服用摇头丸后〕兴奋的﹐激情勃发的
Sense.EXAMPLE: loved-up clubbers having a ball
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到夜总会狂欢的极度亢奋的人

Sense.DEF: if you have a love-hate relationship with someone or something, sometimes you really like or love them, and sometimes you really dislike or hate them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her love-hate relationship with professional golf
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对职业高尔夫球爱恨交加的感情

Sense.DEF: the character in a movie, book, or play that the main character loves
Sense.TRAN: 恋爱角色〔电影﹑书籍或戏剧中主角的情人〕

Sense.DEF: without love

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 没有爱的婚姻/童年/关系等

Sense.DEF: a letter that someone writes to tell someone else how much they love them
the part of your life that involves your romantic and sexual relationships
sad because the person you love does not love you
Sense.TRAN: 失恋的﹐为情所困的﹐害相思病的

Sense.DEF: beautiful or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a lovely face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一张漂亮的脸蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a lovely house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么漂亮的房子啊！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look lovely in that dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那条连衣裙很漂亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a lovely little boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个可爱的小男孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a lovely day!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多好的天气啊！

Sense.DEF: very pleasant, enjoyable, or good
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快[高兴]的﹔美好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for a lovely evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你让我们度过了一个美好的夜晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a lovely cup of tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那杯茶很好喝。

Sense.DEF: friendly and pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard’s a lovely person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德是一个很亲切的人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not at all enjoyable or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The cat threw up all over the carpet!’ ‘Lovely!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “猫吐得整张地毯都是！” “太糟糕了！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve made a lovely mess in here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把这里弄得乱糟糟的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how good something is
Sense.TRAN: 非常暖和的/新鲜的/干净的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: This bread’s lovely and fresh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这面包新鲜极了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are pleased with something
Sense.TRAN: 好极了〔用于表示对某事满意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Push it right across. That’s it, lovely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它直推过去。 对﹐棒极了。

Sense.DEF: sexual activity, especially the act of having sex
a place where two people who are having a romantic relationship live or meet each other – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 爱巢〔情侣同居或幽会的地方﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s lover is the person they are having a sexual relationship with but who they are not married to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He killed his wife’s lover.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他杀了妻子的情人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicola and I were lovers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和尼古拉以前是情人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of young lovers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对年轻的情侣

Sense.DEF: someone who likes something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: lovers of the outdoors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 户外运动爱好者

Sense.DEF: a man who has a wife or girlfriend but has sex with someone else – used in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 爱情骗子﹐负心汉〔背着妻子或女友出轨的人﹔用于报纸文章〕

Sense.DEF:
a small
sofa
for two people
a seat in the shape of an S for two people, designed so that they can face each other
Sense.TRAN: 情人座〔两人可以面对面的S形双人座〕

Sense.DEF: spending all your time thinking about someone you love, especially someone who does not love you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovesick teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个害相思病的少年

Sense.DEF: a word used to address a woman or child, that many women think is offensive
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐宝贝〔对女人或孩子的称呼﹐很多女性认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is lovey-dovey is too romantic
Sense.TRAN: 情意绵绵的﹐过分多情的﹐缠绵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovey-dovey phone call
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个缠绵的电话

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you love someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the confidence he had gained from having a warm and loving family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为有一个温暖﹑充满爱的家庭而获得的自信

Sense.EXAMPLE: What that child needs is plenty of loving care .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子所需要的是大量的关爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very loving and affectionate with his sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很爱他的妹妹﹐和她很亲暱。

Sense.DEF: thinking that peace, having fun etc is very important
Sense.TRAN: 热爱和平的/喜爱玩乐的/爱家的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peace-loving nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热爱和平的国家

Sense.DEF: done with a lot of care and attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: the loving care with which the house has been restored
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修缮这幢房子所花的心血

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他微笑﹐眼神中充满爱意。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: the plane he had lovingly built
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精心打造的这架飞机

Subsense.DEF: small, or smaller than usual, in amount, level, or value

GramExa.EXAMPLE: families existing on very low incomes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入家庭

Subsense.EXAMPLE: In May, the price of cocoa fell to its lowest level since 1975-1976.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5月份﹐可可粉的价格降到了1975至1976年以来的最低水平。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Morale has been low since the latest round of job cuts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自最近一轮裁员以来﹐士气一直很低落。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In this sort of investment, the risks are fairly low.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种投资风险相当小。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: low temperatures
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低温
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the need for low-cost housing
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对廉价住房的需求
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low-security prison
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低度设防监狱

Subsense.DEF: having less than the usual amount of a substance or chemical
Subsense.EXAMPLE: food that is low in calories
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低热量食品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: low-alcohol beer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低度啤酒

Subsense.DEF: if a number, temperature, or level is in the low 20s, 30s etc, it is between 21 and 23, 31 and 33 etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔数字﹑温度或水平〕在20多一点/50多一点等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tonight, temperatures in most areas will be in the low 50s.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚大部分地区的气温将略高于50度。

Subsense.DEF: having a top that is not far above the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low wall
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堵矮墙
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a long low building
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋长而矮的建筑

Subsense.DEF: at a point that is not far above the ground or near the bottom of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: low clouds
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低垂的云
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The sun was low in the sky now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳此刻低悬在空中。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Store raw meat on the lowest shelf.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把生肉存放在最下面一格架子上。

Subsense.DEF: below the usual height
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low bridge
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矮桥
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low ceiling
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低矮的天花板
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The river is very low today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天河水水位很低。

Sense.DEF: bad, or below an acceptable or usual level or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their safety standards seem to be pretty low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的安全标准似乎相当低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cost-cutting has led to a lower quality of service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 削减成本导致服务质量降低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the children’s low achievement in school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在学校里不好的成绩

Sense.DEF: if you are low on something, or if your supply of something is low, there is not much of it left

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re running low on gas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的汽油不多了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stocks are getting low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库存即将告罄。

Subsense.DEF: not loud
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I heard a low moaning noise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到一声轻轻的呻吟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The volume is too low – turn it up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音量太低了——开响一点。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low whisper
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻声耳语

Subsense.DEF: not high
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low note
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个低音

Sense.DEF: a light that is low is not bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use low lighting to give the room a romantic atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用暗淡的灯光﹐给房间营造出一种浪漫的氛围。

Sense.DEF:
if you cook something over a low heat or in a low
oven
, you cook it using only a small amount of heat

a
battery
that is low does not have much power left in it

a low dress,
blouse
etc does not cover your neck and the top of your chest
Sense.TRAN: 〔连衣裙﹑衬衫等〕领口低的﹐低胸的

Sense.DEF: unhappy and without much hope for the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was feeling a bit low, so I did my best to cheer him up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情绪有点低落﹐所以我尽量想办法让他高兴起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry seems to be in rather low spirits today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里今天似乎情绪相当低落。

Sense.DEF: in or to a low position or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bent low over the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯身查看引擎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled her hat low down over her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把帽子拉低﹐盖住了眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the radio on low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把收音机音量调得很低。

Sense.DEF: near the ground or the bottom of something
Sense.TRAN: 高出地面不多地﹐不高地
Sense.EXAMPLE: That plane’s flying too low!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那架飞机飞得太低了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a hole low down in the hedge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠近树篱底部的地方有一个洞。

Sense.DEF: if you play or sing musical notes low, you play or sing them with deep notes
Sense.TRAN: 〔弹奏或唱歌时〕用低音调﹔低沉地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sing those bars an octave lower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个小节用低八度唱。

Sense.DEF: to become much less rich or important
Sense.TRAN: 变得远不如原来富有[重要]

Sense.DEF: a low price, level, or value

GramExa.PROPFORM: fall to/hit/reach etc a new low
GramExa.GLOSS: be worth less than ever before
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The euro has fallen to a new low against the dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧元对美元的汇率降到了新低。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Public confidence in the legal system is at an all-time low much lower or worse than ever before .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众对司法制度的信任度降到了前所未有的低点。

Sense.DEF: a very difficult time in someone’s personal or working life
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人生活或职业生涯中的〕低潮﹐低谷

GramExa.GLOSS: good times and bad times
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the highs and lows of an actor’s life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个演员一生中的起起落落

Subsense.DEF: the lowest point that the temperature reaches during a particular time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The overnight low will be 8˚C.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间最低气温为8摄氏度。

Subsense.DEF: an area of low pressure in the air
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a low moving in over the Pacific
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逼近太平洋上空的低气压区

Subsense.DEF: someone you think is completely unfair, cruel, immoral etc
Subsense.TRAN: 最不公正[残酷﹐不道德等]的人

Subsense.DEF: someone from a low social class – often used humorously
Subsense.TRAN: 社会地位低微的人〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if cattle low, they make a deep sound

lowbrow entertainment, newspapers, books etc are easy to understand and are not concerned with serious ideas about art,
culture
etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 文化层次不高的﹐庸俗的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
the part of the Church of England that believes in the importance of faith and studying the
bible
rather than in religious ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 低教会派〔英国国教一教派﹐认为信仰及对《圣经》的研习比宗教仪式重要〕
工人阶级的﹐劳工阶级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-class bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人酒吧

Sense.DEF: not good quality
a low-cut dress is shaped so that it shows a woman’s neck and the top of her chest
Sense.TRAN: 〔连衣裙〕低胸的﹐领口开得很低的

Sense.DEF: dishonest and unkind
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a low-down, dirty trick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么卑劣肮脏的勾当。

Sense.DEF: the most important facts about something
Sense.TRAN: （关于某事物/某人的）最重要情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ryan gave me the lowdown on the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞安把会议的主要内容告诉了我。

Sense.DEF: relating to products or services that are less expensive and of lower quality than other products of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-end desktop computers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低端的台式电脑

Sense.DEF: below something else, especially below something of the same type
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指位于同类物品中另一个的〕下面的﹐下方的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nina chewed her lower lip anxiously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜焦虑不安地咬着下唇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth went down to the lower deck lower level on a ship .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝到下层甲板去了。

GramExa.GLOSS: your legs

Sense.DEF: at or near the bottom of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lower slopes of the mountain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山麓的斜坡
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffers with pain in her lower back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她腰痛。

Sense.DEF: smaller in number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Temperatures will be lower over the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末气温会下降。

Sense.DEF: less important than something else of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lower levels of management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层中的较低级别

Sense.DEF: to reduce something in amount, degree, strength etc, or to become less
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think we should lower the price?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我们应该降价吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: After 20 minutes lower the temperature to 325˚.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20分钟后﹐把温度降到325度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: drugs to lower blood pressure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降血压药
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen lowered her voice made it quieter as they approached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走近时﹐海伦压低了嗓音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice lowered became quieter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声音轻了下来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone turns down the temperature or volume rather than lowers it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示将温度或音量调低时﹐人们一般用turn down﹐而不用lower
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the heating down ?

Sense.DEF: to move something down from higher up
Sense.EXAMPLE: Very gently, he lowered the dog onto the rug by the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻手轻脚地把狗放下﹐让它待在炉火边的小地毯上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flags were lowered to half-mast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了半旗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg watched as the coffin was lowered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格看着灵柩放下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lowered himself carefully down from the top of the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心翼翼地从墙头上下来。

Sense.DEF: to look down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christina blushed and lowered her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜脸一红﹐垂下了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that makes people respect you less
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t lower myself to speak to her after what she’s done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做了那样的事以后﹐我不会自降身份和她说话。

Sense.DEF: to make something not as nice as it was
Sense.EXAMPLE: They thought an influx of students would lower the tone of the neighborhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为大量学生住进来会破坏这街区的格调。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trust you to lower the tone of the conversation include rude jokes etc in what you say !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定会降低谈话的格调！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He leaned forward and spoke in a lowered voice.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯过身去﹐压低声音说话。

Sense.DEF: when the sky or the weather lowers, it becomes dark because there is going to be a storm
Sense.TRAN: 〔暴风雨前的天〕变昏暗﹔〔天气〕变恶劣
Sense.EXAMPLE: lowering clouds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴沉沉的云

Sense.DEF: to look threatening or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The other driver lowered at us as we passed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个司机在我们经过的时候对我们拉下了脸。

Sense.DEF: letters in their small forms, such as a, b, c etc
the social class that has less money, power, or education than anyone else. This is now considered offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 下层阶级﹐劳工阶级〔现在被认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF:
a group of elected representatives who make laws in a country, for example the
house of commons
in Britain or the
house of representatives
in the US

an offensive expression for
working class
people considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 下层社会〔指劳工阶级﹐具冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: the classes of a school in Britain that are for younger students, usually aged
Sense.TRAN: 11-13 〔英国的〕低年级班〔学生年龄一般为11到13岁〕

Sense.DEF: the biggest possible number of people, including people who are very easily influenced or are willing to accept low standards
Sense.TRAN: 〔容易受影响或愿意接受低水准的〕社会大众
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television quiz shows often seem to target the lowest common denominator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视问答节目似乎常常以社会大众为目标受众。

Sense.DEF:
the smallest number that the bottom numbers of a group of
fraction s
can be divided into exactly
containing or using only a small amount of fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-fat yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低脂酸奶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-fat diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低脂饮食

Sense.DEF: flying close to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-flying aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低空飞行的飞机

Sense.DEF:
one of a vehicle’s
gear s
that you use when you are driving at a slow speed
not very good in quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: inexpensive low-grade paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价劣等纸

Sense.DEF: a low-grade medical condition is not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-grade fever
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低烧

Sense.DEF: not intended to attract a lot of attention to an event, subject, or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want the funeral to be as low-key as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望葬礼办得尽量低调。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-key military operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次低调的军事行动

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is lower than the land around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Scottish lowlands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰低地

Sense.DEF: close to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-level bombing attacks on military targets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对军事目标发动的低空轰炸袭击

Sense.DEF: relating to people who are not in powerful positions or jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: routine, low-level, clerical tasks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低级的日常文书事务

Sense.DEF: at a low degree or strength
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-level tension headache
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻度头痛

Sense.DEF: a low-level computer language is used to give instructions to a computer and is similar to the language that the computer operates in
the life and behaviour of people who are involved in criminal or immoral activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novel about low life in Chicago in the 1930s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描写20世纪30年代芝加哥下层社会生活的小说

Sense.DEF: someone who is involved in crime or who is bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete turned out to be a real lowlife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特原来是个十足的恶棍。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Charlie may be lowlife, but he isn’t stupid.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利也许很坏﹐但是他并不笨。

Sense.DEF: a dark colour that can be used to change the natural colour of some of your hair
low in rank, importance, or social class – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 低下的﹐低级的﹔卑微的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a lowly assistant gardener.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个初级的助理园艺师。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Lowly is never an adverb. Low is used as an adverb as well as an adjective. lowly不是副词﹐low则既是形容词又是副词: A helicopter flew low over their heads. 一架直升机从他们头顶低飞而过。

Sense.DEF: low-lying land is not far above the level of the sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地〕高出海面不多的﹐低洼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vast areas of low-lying land have been flooded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片的低洼地都被淹了。

Sense.DEF: not needing a lot of care or attention
Sense.TRAN: 低维护成本的﹐不需经常保养的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-maintenance garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不大需要花功夫照料的花园

Sense.DEF: providing or earning only a small amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: As part-time, low-paid workers, the women earned very little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为低薪的兼职工人﹐这些妇女挣得很少。

Sense.DEF: a low-pitched musical note or sound is deep
Sense.EXAMPLE: the low-pitched hum of the generator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发电机低沉的嗡嗡声

Sense.DEF: a roof that is not steep
the worst moment of a situation or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The low point in my life was when I was hit by a drunk driver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这一生中最倒霉的时刻是被一个醉酒驾车的司机撞了。

Sense.DEF: a condition of the air over a large area that affects the weather
to not go to places or be careful not to do anything that will attract attention to yourself or your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not the sort of politician to keep a low profile for long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不是那种能长期保持低调的政客。

Sense.DEF: not receiving or wanting any attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US took a very low-profile role in the talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在会谈中采取了非常低调的姿态。

Sense.DEF: designed to be lower than other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-profile tyres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低断面轮胎

Sense.DEF: not expensive or not good quality – used to show disapproval

a low-rise building does not have many
storey s
likely to be safe or without problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: low-risk investments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低风险投资

Sense.DEF: the time of year when fewer people are on holiday and there is less business for hotels etc, and prices are usually lower than normal
low and closer to the ground than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low-slung sports car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低车身跑车

Sense.DEF:
unhappy or
depressed
Sense.TRAN: 闷闷不乐的﹐没精打采的﹐情绪消沉的

Sense.DEF: not using the most modern machines or methods in business or industry
Sense.TRAN: 〔商业或工业〕低技术的﹐技术简单的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made low-tech, budget space movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍摄低技术﹑低成本的太空电影。

Sense.DEF: the time when sea water is at its lowest level
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can walk across to the island at low tide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮落的时候你可以走到岛上去。

Sense.DEF: the time when the water in a river or the sea is at its lowest level
a mark showing the lowest level reached by a river or other area of water

salmon
that has been treated with smoke in order to preserve it
always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The army has remained loyal to the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队依然效忠政府。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a loyal supporter of the team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队的忠实支持者
Sense.EXAMPLE: her many years of loyal service to the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在公司多年的忠诚服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: loyal customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠实客户

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He has always loyally defended the president.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向忠实地捍卫总统。

Sense.DEF: someone who continues to support a government or country, especially during a period of change
Sense.TRAN: 忠诚的人〔尤指在变革时期继续支持政府或国家的人〕

Sense.DEF: someone from Northern Ireland who believes that Northern Ireland should remain part of the United Kingdom, and not become part of the Republic of Ireland
the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Elizabeth understood her husband’s loyalty to his sister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白理解丈夫对他姐姐的一片忠心。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of support for someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the rural areas, family and tribal loyalties continue to be important.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在乡村地区﹐对家庭和部落的忠心依然很重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the agony of divided loyalties loyalty to two different or opposing people for the children in a divorce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚过程中孩子两面都要依顺的痛苦

Sense.DEF:
a card given by a shop,
supermarket
, etc to its regular customers allowing them to have advantages such as lower prices, money back on goods etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑超级市场等发给老顾客以享优惠的〕忠诚卡﹐积分卡

Sense.DEF: a small flat sweet, especially one that contains medicine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指含有药物的〕糖片﹐糖锭﹐药糖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cough lozenge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 止咳糖

Sense.DEF: a shape similar to a square, with two angles of less than 90˚ opposite each other and two angles of more than 90˚ opposite each other
a record that turns 33 times per minute, and usually plays for between 20 and 25 minutes on each side

a type of liquid
fuel
that is burned to produce heat or power
a flat white square with a red letter L on it, that must be attached to the car of someone who is learning to drive in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 红L字牌﹐学车牌〔在英国学习驾驶时必须将此牌挂在车上〕

Sense.DEF:
a special type of
petrol
that does not contain
lead
and is meant to be used in older cars
an illegal drug that makes you see things as more beautiful, strange, frightening etc than usual, or makes you see things that do not exist
Sense.TRAN: 麦角酰二乙胺〔一种迷幻药〕
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= lieutenant 陆军中尉﹔海军上尉﹔空军中尉﹔〔美国警察的〕警督
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= limited, used in the names of companies or businesses有限（责任）公司〔用于公司或企业名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: M. Dixon & Son Ltd
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄克逊父子有限公司

Sense.DEF: a substance such as oil that you put on surfaces that rub together, especially parts of a machine, in order to make them move smoothly and easily
to put a lubricant on something in order to make it move more smoothly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lubricate all moving parts with grease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给所有活动部件加润滑油。

Sense.DEF: to help things to happen without any problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vic’s working day is lubricated by endless cups of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克上班的时候要靠不断地喝咖啡才能把工作干好。

Sense.DEF: too interested in sex, in a way that seems unpleasant or unacceptable
expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand
Sense.TRAN: 表达清楚的﹐易于理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

Sense.DEF: able to understand and think clearly, used especially about someone who is not always able to do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指总是迷迷糊糊的人〕神志清醒的﹐头脑清晰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her more lucid moments the old lady would talk about her past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在头脑较清醒的时候﹐老太太会谈起往事。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was lucidly aware of political realities.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对政治现实有清醒的认识。

Sense.DEF: the Devil
good things that happen to you by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not having much luck today, are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天运气不太好﹐是不是？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had good luck with his roses this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年他种玫瑰的运气不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an incredible piece of luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是令人难以置信的好运气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was only by luck that they managed to avoid hitting the rocks near the shore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是侥幸才没有撞上岸边的岩石。

Sense.DEF: the bad things that happen to someone by chance, not because of something they did
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had nothing but bad luck since I moved to this town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搬到这个镇上以后就只有倒霉。

Sense.DEF: when good or bad things happen to people by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roulette is a game of luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮盘赌是个靠运气的游戏。

Sense.LEXUNIT: with (any) luck/with a bit of luck
Sense.DEF: if things happen in the way that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a bit of luck, you might get a flight tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是运气好的话﹐你可以搭上明天的航班。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you hope they will be successful in something they are going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wished me luck in the exam, then left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她祝我考试好运﹐然后就走了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you hope they will be successful in something they are going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good luck with the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝这个项目好运。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not mind what someone does because it does not affect you
Sense.TRAN: 祝某人好运〔用于表示不介意某人所做的事﹐因为不会影响到自己〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I say, good luck to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说﹐祝他好运。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they have succeeded in doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh, there you are. Any luck?’ ‘No, I didn’t catch a single fish.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢﹐是你呀。运气怎么样？” “不好﹐我一条鱼都没有钓到。”

Sense.DEF: to be able to do or get something, especially when you did not expect to
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re in luck – it’s stopped snowing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你运气真好——雪停了。

Sense.DEF: to be prevented from getting or doing something by bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team were out of luck again at Scarborough on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六球队在斯卡伯勒一战再次不走运。

Sense.DEF: to do something because you think it might bring you good luck
Sense.TRAN: 为带来好运而做某事﹐为求吉利而做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She crossed her fingers for luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她交叉手指祈求好运。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not surprised something bad has happened to you, because you are usually unlucky
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t get to the phone in time. Just my luck!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没来得及接那个电话﹐我就是不走运！

Sense.DEF: used to say you are disappointed because something good that you hoped would happen did not happen
Sense.TRAN: 没这样的运气〔表示失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you Sunday off?’ ‘No such luck.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你星期天休息吗？” “哪有这样的好事啊。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope someone will be more successful the next time they try to do something
used to say that something happened by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: As luck would have it, my best friend is the most wonderful cook in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碰巧﹐我最要好的朋友就是世界上最棒的厨师。

Sense.DEF: to do something because you hope you will be successful, even though you know you may not be
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war my father went to Canada to try his luck at farming there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐我父亲去加拿大经营农场试试运气。

Sense.DEF: to have no money because you have had a lot of bad luck over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: When someone is down on their luck, friends are very difficult to find.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人穷困潦倒的时候很难找到朋友。

Sense.DEF: the result of chance rather than something you can control

Sense.LEXUNIT: some people have all the luck
Sense.DEF: used to say that you wish you had what someone else has
used to express sympathy when something unpleasant has happened to someone
used to say that you expect something bad to happen to someone because bad things often do happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 就凭某人的运气﹐知道某人的运气〔用于表示料想某人身上会有坏事发生﹐因为此人经常不走运〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: With my luck, I’d lose if I backed the only horse in a one horse race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这运气﹐就算只有一匹马参赛﹐我把赌注押在它身上也会输掉。

Sense.DEF: unfortunately
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would your boyfriend like a drink?’ ‘He’s not my boyfriend, worse luck!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你男朋友要喝一杯吗？” “可惜他不是我男朋友！”

Sense.DEF: if luck is on someone’s side, things go well for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luck was on my side; all the traffic lights were green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很走运﹐一路全是绿灯。

Sense.DEF: used when you take, add, or do something for no particular reason, or in order to say that you hope good things happen

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1, 2, & 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These birds are said to bring good luck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说这些鸟能带来好运。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His bad luck continued.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的噩运还没完。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: chance, and not skill or effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She managed to catch hold of the rope by sheer luck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能抓住绳子纯属侥幸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sheer good luck, not influenced by anything you did
good luck that happens when you first try something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a bit of bad luck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点走背运。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 有更多的运气/缺少点运气
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I hope you have more luck in the next competition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你在下一场比赛中运气更好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not be lucky or successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d been looking for a job for weeks, but had had no luck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找工作好几周了﹐却一点也不走运。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe my luck as my number was called out!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的号码竟被叫到了﹐简直不敢相信我这么走运！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they continue having good luck
they stop having good luck
something good that happens by chance
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What a piece of luck that he arrived when he did!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他恰好赶到﹐真够运气的！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a series of good or bad things
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The team has had a run of bad luck lately, losing their last five games.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来该队噩运不断﹐已经连败五场。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that depends on chance
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Winning is a matter of luck.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜是运气问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an amount of luck that is involved in something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is always an element of luck when hiring someone for a job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 录用员工时总是有点运气的成分。

Sense.DEF: to be lucky
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yeah, we really lucked out and got a parking space right in front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是啊﹐我们真走运﹐正好在前面有一个停车位。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is good that something happened or was done because if it had not, the situation would be unpleasant or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily the museum was not damaged by the earthquake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好﹐博物馆没有在地震中遭到破坏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Luckily for them, he braked in time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很走运﹐他及时刹车了。

Sense.DEF: having no luck in something you are trying to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事而〕运气不好的﹐不幸的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in the desert like so many other luckless explorers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和其他许多不幸的探险者一样﹐也死在沙漠中。

Sense.DEF: having good luck

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were lucky to survive the fire which destroyed their home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的家毁于大火﹐但是他们得以幸存。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: those of us lucky enough to own our own homes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当中有幸拥有自己住房的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll be lucky if I get any of my money back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是能拿回一点钱就算我运气好了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was tremendously lucky that I didn’t die in the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我万分幸运﹐没有在事故中送命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been very lucky with the weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很幸运﹐天气一直很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Count yourself lucky you’ve got a husband like Jack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该觉得自己很幸运﹐有杰克这么一个丈夫。

GramExa.GLOSS: be lucky on a particular occasion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You might get lucky and find a bargain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说不定你运气好﹐能淘到便宜货。

Sense.DEF: resulting from good luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A middle-aged woman had a lucky escape when a tree crashed down onto her car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵树砸在一位中年女性的车上﹐她却有幸躲过一劫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s lucky that no one was hurt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸的是没有人受伤。

Sense.DEF: bringing good luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lucky charm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉祥符

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is fortunate to be able to do something
Sense.TRAN: 你/我等真幸运〔指某人有幸能做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘My husband’s a rich man, and devoted to me.’ ‘Lucky you.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我丈夫很有钱﹐对我又忠心。” “你真幸运啊。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something good and often unexpected will happen to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to win. I just know it’s our lucky day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会赢的﹐我就知道今天我们运气好。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what they want probably will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 但愿你走运〔用于告诉某人他们所希望的事可能不会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘£50 should be enough.’ ‘You’ll be lucky!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “50 英镑应该够了。” “但愿你走运！”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what they want is not likely to happen, especially because it is unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 我/你哪有这种运气！〔用于告诉某人其要求不大可能得到满足﹐尤因该要求不合理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You want three weeks holiday? You should be so lucky!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要三个星期的假期？想得倒美！

Exponent.DEF: happening because of good luck, or bringing you good luck
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lucky guess
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 侥幸猜中
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Seven is considered a lucky number.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 七被视为幸运数字。

Exponent.DEF: happening because of good luck. Fortunate is more formal than lucky.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was extremely fortunate that there was no one in the building when the bomb went off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 万幸的是﹐炸弹爆炸时大楼内空无一人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m in the fortunate position of doing a job I love.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运﹐在做一份自己喜爱的工作。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that there would have been problems if something had not happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a good thing that you brought an umbrella with you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好你带了一把伞。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a good job I’m here to help.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏有我在可以帮忙。

Exponent.DEF: extremely lucky in a way that is almost unbelievable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor gave her a month to live but she made a miraculous recovery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生认为她只能再活一个月﹐可她却奇迹般地康复了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was miraculous that no one was seriously injured in the accident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人在事故中受重伤﹐真是不可思议。

Exponent.DEF: happening because of good luck
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fortuitous decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个偶然决定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fortuitous coincidence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次机缘巧合
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was fortuitous that no one else was hurt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是没有其他人受伤。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens by chance, not because of skill or good judgement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The goal was a fluke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个进球纯属侥幸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: By a fluke, he managed to get the question right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他碰巧答对了这个问题。

Sense.DEF: a game in which you put your hand into a container filled with small objects, and choose one without looking
a situation in which what happens depends on chance
Sense.TRAN: 由运气[机遇]来决定的情况

Sense.DEF: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 〔职业或活动〕可赚大钱的﹔获利多的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He inherited a lucrative business from his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从父亲那里继承了一家赚大钱的公司。

Sense.DEF: money or wealth – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏钱﹐不义之财〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is opposed to using modern machines and methods
Sense.TRAN: 反对机械化自动化的人﹐反对技术进步的人

Sense.DEF: completely unreasonable, stupid, or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 荒唐的﹐愚蠢荒谬的﹐可笑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is ludicrous to suggest that I was driving under the influence of alcohol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我酒后驾车﹐这真是太荒唐了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court granted him the ludicrous sum of £100 in damages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院裁定他获得区区100英镑损害赔偿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a ludicrous idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法很荒唐。

Sense.DEF:
a game played with
counter s small flat round objects
on a board
to pull or carry something heavy with difficulty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a huge book, not something you’d like to lug around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一本厚重的书﹐不是你想搬来搬去的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She began to lug her suitcase up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始把她的行李箱拖上楼。

Sense.DEF: a part of something that sticks out and can be used as a handle or a support
an ear
a rough, stupid, or awkward person
Sense.TRAN: 粗人﹔笨蛋﹔笨手笨脚的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: You big lug!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个大笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: a vehicle with blades instead of wheels on which you slide down a track made of ice as a sport
the cases, bags etc that you carry when you are travelling
Sense.EXAMPLE: They searched his luggage for illegal drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们搜查他的行李看是否藏有毒品。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Luggage is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it. You can refer to one or more piece ( s ) /item ( s ) of luggage.
F2NBox.TRAN: luggage 是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐须接单数动词。 表示一件或多件行李时﹐可用 piece ( s ) /item ( s ) of luggage
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All my luggage was ready.

Sense.DEF: a shelf in a train, bus etc for putting luggage on
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车﹑公共汽车等内的〕行李架

Sense.DEF: a special frame on top of a car that you tie luggage on
a small boat with one or more sails
an ear
very sad and serious – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 悲伤的﹐忧郁的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his lugubrious tear-stained face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那张忧伤﹑泪痕斑斑的脸

Sense.DEF:
a small
worm
that lives in sand by the sea, often used to catch fish
food, liquid etc that is lukewarm is slightly warm and often not as hot or cold as it should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sipped some lukewarm coffee from her mug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抿了几口杯子里温热的咖啡。

Sense.DEF: not showing much interest or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: His idea got only a lukewarm response from the committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的想法只得到了委员会冷淡的反应。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel calm or as if they want to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 使平静下来﹔使昏昏欲睡
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hum of the tyres on the road lulled her to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一路上滚滚的车轮声使她昏昏欲睡。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel safe and confident so that they are completely surprised when something bad happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police lulled me into believing that they did not suspect us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察诱使我以为他们没有怀疑我们。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Earthquakes here are rare and this has lulled people into a false sense of security made people think they were safe when they were not .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里很少发生地震﹐这使人们产生了一种虚假的安全感。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when there is less activity or less noise than usual
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或噪声的〕暂停﹐暂时平静期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brief lull in the conversation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话中短暂的沉寂
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lull in the fighting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗的间歇期

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when things are calm, that is followed by a lot of activity, noise, or trouble
a slow quiet song sung to children to make them go to sleep
pain in the lower part of the back
relating to the lower part of the back
Sense.EXAMPLE: pain in the lumbar region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腰部疼痛

Sense.DEF: to move in a slow awkward way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lumbered along slowly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们笨拙地慢慢前行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A blue bus lumbered past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆蓝色公共汽车慢吞吞地驶过。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a job or responsibility that they do not want
Sense.TRAN: 迫使担负〔不愿意承担的工作或责任〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A career was less easy once I was lumbered with a husband and children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦我有了丈夫和孩子的拖累﹐想在事业上有所发展就不那么容易了。

Sense.DEF: to cut down trees in a large area and prepare them to be sold
pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths
large objects that are no longer useful or wanted
someone whose job is cutting down trees for wood
someone in the business of cutting down large areas of trees in order to sell them for wood
a building where trees are cut up to make wood
a room where old furniture, broken machines etc are kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔堆放旧家具﹑破机器等的〕杂物间

Sense.DEF: a place where wood is kept before it is sold
someone who is very famous or highly respected for their skill at doing something or their knowledge of a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: luminaries of Parisian society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎社会的名流

Sense.DEF: a soft shining light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moonlight gave everything a strange luminescence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光给万物洒上一层奇异的柔光。

Sense.DEF: shining in the dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: luminous paint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发光涂料
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her large dark eyes were almost luminous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那双黑色的大眼睛几乎是亮闪闪的。

Sense.DEF: very brightly coloured, especially in green, pink, or yellow
Sense.TRAN: 色彩鲜艳的〔尤指绿色﹑粉红色或黄色〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: luminous green socks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翠绿色的短袜

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strain the custard to remove lumps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滤去牛奶蛋糊里的面块。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Melt a lump of butter in your frying pan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把一块黄油放入煎锅里化开。

Sense.DEF: a small hard swollen area that sticks out from someone’s skin or grows in their body, usually because of an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should never ignore a breast lump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不能忽视乳房肿块。

Sense.DEF: a small square block of sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: One lump or two?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一块方糖还是两块？

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you want to cry
Sense.TRAN: 某人喉咙哽住﹐某人哽咽欲泣
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lump in her throat as she gazed at the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她凝视着孩子﹐哽咽欲哭。

Sense.DEF: to accept the bad things that happen and not let them affect you
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to experts, the company took its lumps but is on the road to profitability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据专家说﹐该公司咬紧牙关撑了过去﹐现在已经开始赢利了。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is stupid or
clumsy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a big fat lump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个傻大个儿。

Sense.DEF: to accept a situation or decision you do not like because you cannot change it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been told: take the lower interest rate, or lump it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人告诉他们﹐要么接受更低的利率﹐要么就这样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the law so you can like it or lump it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是法律﹐不管你喜不喜欢都得接受。

Sense.DEF: to put two or more different people or things together and consider them as a single group, sometimes wrongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t lump the symptoms together and blame them all on stress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能把这些症状混为一谈﹐通通归结为压力太大的缘故。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The danger is that people who pay their bills on time will be lumped in with those that don’t.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 存在的风险是﹐按时付账单的人和不按时付账单的人会被混为一谈。

Sense.DEF:
an operation in which a
tumour
is removed from someone’s body, especially from a woman’s breast

relating to the poorest and least educated people from the
working class
Sense.TRAN: 〔工人阶级中的部分人〕极度贫困无知的

Sense.DEF: large, heavy, and lumpy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body felt lumpen and awkward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到身体臃肿笨重。

Sense.DEF: heavy and awkward
an amount of money given in a single payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you retire you’ll get a lump sum of £80,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你退休的时候﹐可以一次性得到8万英镑。

Sense.DEF: covered with or containing small solid pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lumpy mattress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不平整的床垫

Sense.DEF: a situation or behaviour that is completely crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be sheer lunacy to turn down a job offer like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拒绝那样的工作简直是发疯了。

Sense.DEF: mental illness
relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon
Sense.EXAMPLE: studies of the lunar surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对月球表面的研究
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lunar eclipse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月食

Sense.DEF:
a period of 28 or 29 days between one
new moon
and the next
someone who behaves in a crazy or very stupid way – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 疯狂的人﹐愚笨的人〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This hotel is run by a lunatic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经营这家宾馆的人真是个疯子！

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who is mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 精神错乱的人﹐疯子〔极具冒犯性的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dangerous lunatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的精神病人

Sense.DEF: the small group of people in a political group or organization who have the most extreme opinions or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治团体或组织中的〕极端分子

Sense.DEF: a hospital where people who are mentally ill are cared for. This word is now considered to be offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 精神病院〔该词现在被认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a meal eaten in the middle of the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s for lunch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午饭吃什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid he’s at lunch until two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去吃午饭了﹐恐怕得到两点钟才回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A dozen senators met over lunch with the Chinese ambassador.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几名参议员在午餐会上和中国大使会面。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s no (such thing as a) free lunch
Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot get anything without working for it or paying for it
Sense.TRAN: 天底下没有免费的午餐〔用于表示不付出就得不到任何东西〕

Sense.DEF: behaving or talking in a strange or crazy way

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you had lunch?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你吃过午饭了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What time do you usually eat lunch?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你通常几点吃午餐？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I usually have sandwiches for lunch.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午饭通常吃三明治。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay for someone else’s lunch when you go to a restaurant
have lunch at a restaurant
come to someone’s house for lunch
stop doing something in order to eat lunch
a small lunch
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After a light lunch, he would take a nap each afternoon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天下午﹐他吃过简单的午饭后都会小睡一会儿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: food such as sandwiches that you take to school etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most of the children had brought packed lunches.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数孩子都带了盒装午餐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lunch during which you also do business
a lunch provided by a school
a hot lunch eaten on Sunday
a time when you stop working to eat lunch
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We took a half hour lunch break.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们午餐时休息了半个钟头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the time when people stop working to eat lunch
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I try to go out for a walk during my lunch hour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量在午餐时间出去走走。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you meet someone for lunch

Sense.DEF: to eat lunch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I will be lunching with a client.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要和一位客户一起用午餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lunched on bread and olives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午饭吃了面包和橄榄。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We lunched at Maxim’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在马克西姆餐厅吃了午餐。

Sense.DEF: a box in which food is carried to school, work etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于带饭上学﹑上班等的〕午餐盒﹐饭盒

Sense.DEF: the time in the middle of the day when people at work or at school stop working to eat lunch
a place that serves simple meals for lunch, or a small restaurant that is only open at lunchtime
lunch
meat that has been cooked, then pressed down, and is often sold in a can
in Britain, a special ticket that can be used to pay for meals usually given to you by your employer
Sense.TRAN: 午餐券〔英国一些雇主发给员工的餐券〕

Sense.DEF: the period of time in the middle of the day when people stop working in order to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did the shopping during my lunch hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我趁午餐时间去买了点东西。

Sense.DEF: a large room in a school or office where people can eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校或办公场所的〕餐厅﹐食堂

Sense.DEF:
the time in the middle of the day when people usually eat their
lunch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people prefer to eat their main meal at lunchtime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人更喜欢把午餐当成一天里最主要的一餐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a lunchtime drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午餐饮料

Sense.DEF: one of the two organs in your body that you breathe with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking can cause lung cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟会引起肺癌。

Sense.DEF: to make a sudden strong movement towards someone or something, especially to attack them
Sense.TRAN: 猛扑﹐猛冲〔尤指袭击某人或某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The goats lunged at each other with their horns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两只山羊互相用角顶对方。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: John lunged forward and grabbed him by the throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰扑上去掐住了他的喉咙。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Brad made a lunge towards his opponent, but missed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德向对手猛冲过去﹐但是扑了个空。

Sense.DEF: the amount of air, smoke etc that you breathe in at one time
Sense.TRAN: 一大口〔指一次吸入的空气﹑烟等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Polly took in a lungful of crisp cool air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉吸了一大口清新凉爽的空气。

Sense.DEF: one of several diseases that affect the skin and joints
to walk or move suddenly in an uncontrolled or unsteady way
Sense.TRAN: 突然不稳地行走[移动]﹐蹒跚而行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam hit the gas and the car lurched forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆踩下油门﹐汽车猛地向前冲去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lurched to his feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地站了起来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that your heart or stomach seems to move suddenly because you feel shocked, frightened etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因震惊﹑惊恐等而〕感到心猛地一跳/胃里猛地翻腾了一下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Virginia’s heart lurched painfully in her chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗吉尼娅胸口一阵疼痛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lurch from one crisis/extreme etc to another
Sense.DEF: to seem to have no plan and no control over what you are doing
Sense.TRAN: 感到束手无策﹐无法控制局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The industry lurches from crisis to crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行业危机不断。

Sense.DEF: a sudden movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train gave a violent lurch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车突然剧烈地晃了一下。

Sense.DEF: to leave someone at a time when you should stay and help them
to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People may be lured into buying tickets by clever advertising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们可能会受巧妙广告的诱惑去买票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computer games are luring youngsters away from their lessons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑游戏诱惑着青少年﹐分散了他们的学习注意力。

Sense.DEF: to attract customers, workers, money etc from another company or place
Sense.TRAN: 吸引〔其他公司或地方的顾客﹑工人﹑资金等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bank launched an advertising campaign to lure back its traditional customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行展开了一场广告宣传活动﹐要把传统客户吸引回去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s very difficult to lure talent away from Silicon Valley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要吸引人才离开硅谷是很困难的。

Sense.DEF: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the lure of easy money
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松赚钱的诱惑
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malc wasn’t mature enough to resist the lure of drink and drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔茨还不够成熟﹐抵挡不住酒和毒品的诱惑。

Sense.DEF: an object used to attract animals or fish so that they can be caught
a description, story etc that is lurid is deliberately shocking and involves sex or violence
Sense.TRAN: 耸人听闻的﹐可怕的〔指描述﹑故事等有性或暴力的内容〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: lurid headlines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骇人听闻的标题
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told me in lurid detail what would happen to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把我将会遇到的可怕事情详详细细地告诉了我。

Sense.DEF: too brightly coloured
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lurid orange dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件俗气的橘黄色连衣裙

Sense.DEF: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t see the figure lurking behind the bushes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有看到躲在树丛后的那个身影。

Sense.DEF: if something such as danger, a feeling etc lurks somewhere, it exists, but you may not see it or know about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

Sense.DEF:
if you lurk in a
chat room
on the Internet, you read what other people are writing to each other, but you do not write any messages yourself
Sense.TRAN: 隐身〔指在网上聊天室里只看帖而不回复或不发帖〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think it’s sort of creepy how people lurk in chat rooms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得人们在聊天室里隐身不语有点可怕。

Sense.DEF: extremely good to eat or drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a luscious and fragrant dessert wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘甜芳香的餐后葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: very sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: her luscious body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那性感迷人的身体

Sense.DEF: plants that are lush grow many leaves and look healthy and strong
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物〕茂盛的﹐繁茂的﹐郁郁葱葱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lush green mountainous island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草木茂盛苍翠﹑山峦起伏的岛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fields were lush with grass and flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田野里花草繁茂。

Sense.DEF: very beautiful, comfortable, and expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: lush carpets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华丽的地毯

Sense.DEF: lush music has a lot of pleasant-sounding instruments or voices together
Sense.EXAMPLE: lush vocal harmonies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悦耳的和声

Sense.DEF: very attractive or nice – used especially by young people
Sense.TRAN: 漂亮的﹔吸引人的〔尤为年轻人所用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks so lush in this pic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这张照片里真帅！

Sense.DEF:
an
alcoholic
very strong sexual desire, especially when it does not include love
Sense.EXAMPLE: My feelings for Lauren were pure lust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对劳伦的感觉纯粹是肉欲。

Sense.DEF: a very strong desire to have something, usually power or money – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的欲望〔通常指对权力或金钱的欲望﹐含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hitler’s lust for power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希特勒对权力的强烈欲望

Sense.DEF: a strong determination to enjoy life as much as possible – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 享受生活的欲望〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the happy-go-lucky lust for life so typical of southern Italy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利南方人典型的无忧无虑享受生活的态度

Sense.DEF: to be strongly sexually attracted to someone, and think about having sex with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had secretly lusted after him for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她暗恋他多年了。

Sense.DEF: to want something very much, especially something that you do not really need
Sense.TRAN: 对某物〕有强烈欲望﹐贪恋〔尤指并不真正需要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a car to lust after.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一辆人人都渴望拥有的汽车。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
lustre
feeling or showing strong sexual desire
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ignored his lustful glances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有理会他色迷迷的眼神。

Sense.DEF: an attractive shiny appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her thick, black hair shone with lustre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那一头乌黑浓密的秀发闪动着光泽。

Sense.DEF: the quality that makes something interesting or exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’ll be a celebrity guest to add lustre to the occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将有一位贵宾为这一庆典增光添彩。

Sense.DEF: shining in a soft gentle way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was beautifully dark and lustrous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的秀发乌黑光亮。

Sense.DEF: strong and healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lusty cry of a new-born baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿响亮的哭声
Sense.EXAMPLE: her strong, lusty young husband
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那位年富力强的丈夫

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument like a
guitar
with a round body, played with the fingers or a
plectrum small piece of plastic, metal etc
, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 琉特琴〔旧时一种类似吉他的拨弦乐器﹐琴身为圆形〕

Sense.DEF:
an informal way of spelling
love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, luv, don’t cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐亲爱的﹐别哭了。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
lovey
an actor who behaves to other people in a very friendly way that is not sincere
growing strongly and thickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: luxuriant black hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓密的黑发
Sense.EXAMPLE: luxuriant vegetation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茂盛的草木

Sense.DEF: beautiful and pleasant to watch or listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: the film’s luxuriant visuals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片华美的视觉效果

Sense.DEF: to relax and enjoy something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ran a hot bath and luxuriated in it for half an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放了一缸热水﹐舒舒服服地泡了半个小时。

Sense.DEF: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a luxurious 30-room villa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

Sense.DEF: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stole to keep her boyfriend in luxury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她靠行窃让男友享受奢侈的生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was leading a life of luxury in Australia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在澳大利亚过着豪华舒适的生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: expensive and large
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 豪华的酒店/汽车/宅邸等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stayed in a five-star luxury hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们住在一家五星级的豪华酒店里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress is lambswool – pure luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼服是用羔羊毛制作的——绝对奢华。

Sense.DEF: something expensive that you do not need, but you buy for pleasure and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: luxuries like chocolate and perfume
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力﹑香水之类的奢侈品

Sense.DEF: to have something that is very pleasant or convenient, that you are not always able to have
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the first time in three years, they actually had the luxury of a whole day together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年来他们第一次有这样难得的机会﹐可以一整天都在一起。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= long wave 长波

Sense.DEF: in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She smiled happily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开心地笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was walking slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在慢慢行走。

Sense.DEF: considered in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politically speaking it was a rather unwise remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从政治上来讲﹐这是很不明智的一句话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a financially sound proposal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财务上可行的建议

Sense.DEF: happening at regular periods of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an hourly check
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时一次的检查
Sense.EXAMPLE: They visit monthly once every month .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每个月来探望一次。

Sense.DEF: like a particular thing in manner, nature, or appearance
Sense.TRAN: 举止像…的﹔有…特质[外貌]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: with queenly grace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以女王般的优雅风度
Sense.EXAMPLE: a motherly woman
Sense.GLOSS: showing the love, kindness etc of a mother
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有母爱的女人

Sense.DEF: a building used for public meetings, concerts, speeches etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔举行公众会议﹑音乐会﹑演讲等的〕演讲厅﹐音乐厅﹐会堂

Sense.DEF: a small round fruit with a rough pink-brown shell outside and sweet white flesh inside
a gate with a roof leading into the area surrounding a church
Sense.TRAN: 停柩门〔通向教堂墓地有顶盖的大门〕

Sense.DEF: a material that stretches, used especially for making sports clothes that fit tightly
Sense.TRAN: 莱卡〔弹性材料﹐尤用于制作紧身运动服〕

Sense.DEF:
the present participle of
lie

a serious illness that is caused by a bite from a
tick 1 2
Sense.TRAN: 莱姆病〔由蜱叮咬引起的一种严重疾病〕

Sense.DEF: a clear liquid that is formed in your body and passes into your blood system to fight against infection

a small rounded
swelling
in your body through which lymph passes before entering your blood system

if a crowd of people lynches someone, they kill them, especially by
hang ing
them, without a
trial

a group of people that kills someone by
hang ing
them, without a legal
trial

another spelling of
linchpin
a large wild cat that has a short tail and lives in forests
a musical instrument with strings across a U-shaped frame, played with the fingers, especially in ancient Greece
Sense.TRAN: 里拉琴〔尤指古希腊时期的一种弦乐器﹐琴身为U字形〕

Sense.DEF:
expressing strong personal emotions such as love, in a way that is similar to music in its sounds and
rhythm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wordsworth was one of the greatest lyric poets of his time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华兹华斯是他那个时代最伟大的抒情诗人之一。

Sense.DEF: the words of a song
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wrote some great music, but the lyrics weren’t that good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他创作过一些不错的曲子﹐但歌词不是很好。

Sense.DEF: a poem, usually a short one, written in a lyric style
beautifully expressed in words, poetry, or music
Sense.EXAMPLE: lyrical love poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抒情爱情诗

Sense.DEF: to talk about and praise something in a very eager way
Sense.EXAMPLE: One fisherman waxed lyrical about the variety of fish in the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个渔夫兴高采烈地谈论河里各种各样的鱼。

Sense.DEF: in relation to the words of a song
Sense.EXAMPLE: The album is musically unexciting but lyrically superb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑的音乐平淡无奇﹐歌词却很出色。

Sense.DEF: with beautiful language or music
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lyrically described the countryside around his home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以抒情的笔调描绘了住宅周围的乡村景致。

Sense.DEF: gentle or romantic emotion, expressed in writing or music
Sense.TRAN: 〔写作或音乐的〕抒情风格﹐抒情性
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lyricism of Tennyson’s poetry is magnificent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丁尼生的诗歌非常抒情。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes the words for songs
